description:
* A GUARANTEED Life Transforming Journey!
* India is changing so Quickly -- Come Before it's Westernized!
* Venture Safely with An experienced Western Buddhist Teacher & Local Sherpa as your Guides

My name is Angela Hryniuk. Some call me 'The teacher of teachers.' I first fell in love with India in 1996 on my first Pilgrimage and for the past 20 years, my love affair with the "Holy Motherland" continues and deepens.

I have been blessed to take part in 6 Pilgrimages to India, leading three of my own groups sharing the vast spiritual richness and facilitating life-transforming experiences. 

To achieve some of my results as a Buddhist/Spiritual teacher, I have worked and studied with many great Spiritual "Giants", both in India and around the world. Including...

-- His Holiness, the 14th Dalai Lama (private retreat 2015)
-- Kalu Rinpoche, the Dalai Lama's tutor
-- Lati Rinpoche, another of the Dalai Lama's tutors
-- Sayadaw U Lakanaw, Burmese Master lama
-- Dadi Janki, Brahma Kumaris Head 

This  upcoming 14 day journey is one of Interfaith - you do not need to be a Buddhist, or of any particular spiritual tradition to be utterly amazed and transformed by this experience. Knowing how to meditate though is a plus.

To View the FULL ITENERARY - Watch the VIDEO at the link below -- And Find out MORE - visit the website:

 http://bit.ly/pilgrimagetoindia 

Pilgrim, Diane Siewert, Los Angeles, CA wrote:
             “Don't think twice about going on this journey!  It's one of the best things I've ever done for myself! Where you're at spiritually, doesn't matter.  
                 Our itinerary covered much ground but was well paced and included little gems off the beaten path (both spiritually and otherwise) that added to the trip's depth and wonderment.
                 The accommodations, food and travel were well planned and good quality.
                Go with an open heart, soul and mind and let the spirituality of India happen. India will seep into your being and will change you in subtle ways.  You will be so grateful that you pushed your fears aside and said, yes, to the journey!” 

We will venture to the heart and soul of India, to be blessed with experiences that few people seldom have in their entire life.

We will meet Tibetan lamas, nuns and monks in their monasteries and homes. Hindu sadhus on the banks of the Ganges.

We will safely venture down windy alleyways and cobblestoned streets in the Himlayan mountains. 

We will even eat in a kitchen that serves over 100,000 FREE MEALS a day.

I hope you will consider joining me this year, it is truly a transformative journey.

Pilgrim, Dr. Haley Jones, Canberra ACT wrote:
  “ Fantastic! Just do it!  
    None of your fears come true, and the insights, sounds and memories are beyond what you can even imagine!
    We travelled very comfortably with two amazing guides in Vikas and Angela.
    I’m still feeling the benefits two years later and I’m sure I’ll be unraveling for years to come how the country and my experiences changed me.”
                       
WHEN: November 27th, 2017 - December 10th, 2017

WHERE: The tour starts and ends in New Delhi. From there we will travel throughout the North of India, into the Himalayas and then visit some of the holiest cities: Amritsar, Varanasi, Bodh Gaya. Tour includes...

- Dalai Lama Temple, Tibetan Children's Village (Dharmsala)
- The Golden Temple, Amritsar
- Varansi & Sarnath -  Boatride on Ganges at Sunrise
- Bodhgaya & Mahakala Caves (Where the Buddha became Enlightened)
- Meditating on Rajgir Mountain
- The Taj Mahal at Dawn
- Drinking delicious and authentic Chai
- Dining with locals in their home
- Shopping for the finest silk and essential oils... and more

To View the FULL ITENERARY - Watch the VIDEO at the link below -- And Find out MORE - visit the website:

 http://bit.ly/pilgrimagetoindia 

Or Contact me directly for a FREE CONSULTATION: angela | angelahryniuk ! com

description:
Trails to Chandrashila via Chopta and Tungnath will show you the major and tallest peaks of Western and Eastern Uttarakhand.  It is a blessed feeling watching the peaks from the top of Chandrashila summit and some of these peaks are Nanda Devi at 7,817 meters, Trishul at 7,120 meters, Kedarnath at 6,831 meters, Bandarpunch at 6,316 meters and Chaukhamba at 7,138 meters. Chandrashila trek is journeyed all throughout the year and is considered as one of the moderate treks in the Indian Himalayan region that is located in Uttarakhand. Tungnath is always the starting point of the Chanadrashila summit trek and it is the highest Shiva Temple in the world, located at a height of 3,680 meters. It is believed that Tungnath is more than 1000 years old. 
Mainly Chandrashila trek goes through the enchanting Deorital Lake and then to a stunning valley and peaks proceeding to the vast forest greenery.

Total Trekking Distance:  30 kms
•	Maximum Altitude: 12,000 ft
•	Package Cost : Rs 11000

Note: Avail Early Bird Discount of 5%, offer valid till 30 Nov.

Night - 28 Dec : Journey start at 10 PM from Noida

Day 1 – 29 Dec
Drive from Noida to Sari Village (16hrs/440 km)
Trek from Sari to Deoria Tal (1-2 hrs/3 km)
Altitude: 7850 feet
This would be an overnight drive till Rishikesh and post that 7hrs ride till sari with en route stop for meals and short breaks. By afternoon, reach Sari, a small and calm village marketplace that is the starting point of your trek. Over there you will be briefed by the trek leader on all do’s and don’ts regarding the trek. Trek starts 3 PM and will reach Deoria Tal by 4:30 PM. It would be a spectacular view watching the reflection of the sunset in beautiful Deoria Tal.

Day 2 – 30 Dec
Deoria Tal to Chopta (7-8 hrs/14 km)
Altitude: 8800 feet
This is the big day of Tungnath Chandrashila Trek as we have to attain an elevation of 1000 feet. Further, you have to negotiate treacherous pathways cutting through the dense forest. This 14 km distance from Deoria Tal to Chopta takes close to 8 hours.
The trek begins with steady ascent followed by a rapid descent. There are 2-3 water points en route, which you find right before Rohini Bugyal, Akash Kamini Waterfall, and Bhrujgali.

Day 3 – 31 Dec
Trek from Chopta to Chandrashila via Tungnath & then back to Chopta (7-8 hrs)
Altitude: 12100 feet
This would be an adventures day of the trek. Chopta Tungnath trek is one of the highlights of this circuit as trek route passes through 1000-year-old Shiva temple, this temple is located in Tungnath Range and happens to be the highest Shiva Temple in the world. Sharp ascent and steep climb lead you to Chandrashila Peak located 8 km from Chopta; time taken is close to 5 hours. Most of the today’s trek would be covered in thick snow.
The downhill journey is relatively less time consuming and smoother. It will take you about 2-3 hours to climb down to the Chopta campsite.

Day 4 – 01 Jan 2018
Chopta - Noida (16hrs)
Time to head back to Noida after having a great breakfast. By late midnight we would reach Noida, with bunch of memories of one of the most thrilling treks of this region

Inclusions
•	Stay : Guest House/Homestay/ Campsites
•	All meals while on the trek and journey (Veg and Non-Veg)
•	Activity : Trekking/Camping
•	Transportation from Noida to Sari and return journey
•	Equipments during the trek (Sleeping Bags, Mattress, tents, Kitchen and Utensils)
•	Goody bag comprising of dry fruits, biscuits, chocolates to have while on trek
•	Permits
•	First Aid and Medical Kits
•	Qualified, experienced professional trek leader, guide and supporting staff
•	Quality camping arrangements
•	Porter/mule charges for carrying camping equipment & rations
•	Forest entry charges, permits & camping fee
•	Service Tax

Things To Carry
•	Windproof jacket, Warm and thick Fleece / Full-sleeve Woollen sweater
•	Thermal inner wear (upper and lower)
•	Woollen cap, Woollen gloves, Woollen socks and regular socks (3-4 pairs)
•	Scarf/muffler (optional)
•	Comfortable Trekking/Hiking shoes
•	Lightweight floaters/sandals/slippers
•	Raincoat / Poncho
•	Small lightweight towel
•	Sturdy Water bottle, Avoid empty Bisleri bottles
•	Cap / Hat, Sunglasses
•	Walking stick / Trekking pole
•	Sunscreen Lotion, Lip Balm
•	Torch / Flashlight (with extra batteries)
•	Personal medications
•	Personal toiletries

Advisory
•	Climatic conditions in the high altitudes vary from the plains; take adequate time to get acclimatized to high altitudes
•	Pay heed to the guidelines given by trek leader or instructor in order to enjoy a safe and sound trekking experience
•	Consumption of alcohol or any other intoxicating products are prohibited during this trek
•	Avoid trekking during the nights
•	The trek takes place through eco-friendly zone; do not encourage littering the local sites or campsites
•	For proper blood circulation, avoid wearing thick socks or more than one pair of socks
•	Instead of denim jeans, wear track pants
•	Avoid carrying snacks and junk food
•	Do not use disposable plastic water bottles, plastic-wrapped items
•	Always carry a couple of pairs of thermal innerwear
•	Wear waterproof jackets and gloves
•	Always pack light and carry only the essentials
•	It is mandatory to carry your identification proof

Cancellation Policy
•	Cancellations made within 5 days of the trek, full cost shall be charged.
•	Cancellations made within 15 days of the trek, 50% of the cost shall be charged.
•	Cancellations made within 30 days of the trek, 25% of the cost shall be charged.
•	In case of unforeseen weather conditions or government restrictions, certain activities may be canceled and in such cases, the operator will try his best to provide an alternate feasible activity. However, no refund will be provided for the same.

Refund Policy
•	The applicable refund amount will be processed within 10 business days
address: Dare2Gear, Noida, Noida, India

Last date - 25th Nov.Once an unexplored place, now a destination where India’s largest water carnival is held.Close to Khandwa district in Madhya Pradesh, lies an island in the backwaters of Indira Sagar Dam on River Narmada. Hanuwantiya Island, once an unexplored and unknown place, has now turned into an adventure hub with the support of MP Tourism. Derived from local village name with same name, MP Tourism found Hanuwantiya suitable for water tourism activity. This is the story behind the makeover of Hanuwantiya from an untouched island to an adventure addition in Madhya Pradesh tourism packages.Nestled in this Hanuwantiya Island is Jal Mahotsav - a striking contrast of adventure with serenity, of excitement with relaxation. An extravaganza to rekindle the spirit of adventure within oneself, India’s one of its kind water festival is all set to rule the hearts of all the adventure lovers once again! Well, if you aren’t an adventure buff, you shouldn’t be disappointed since the place unwinds surprises for everyone. Those in search of relaxation and a break from routine life can treat themselves to the comfort of a luxury tent, sit back and feel the cool breeze relax every nerve of your mind and body. The water festival has now made the culturally rich Madhya Pradesh known for its adventure tourism too. It gives one more reason to the people to tour to Madhya Pradesh. Along with celebrating the spirit of adventure, the festival also celebrates the spirit of MP. The absolute brilliance of the local artisans and craftspeople, melodious folk music and performances and lip smacking cuisine - all these precisely describes and defines what “The Heart Of India” truly stands for.So, book your adventure tourism with this Madhya Pradesh Tourism Package and set out on an adventurous tour to Madhya Pradesh.Contact - 9687001057 / sudhakar | allevents ! in

description:
Find answers to life's unresolved questions and repetitive patterns. Heal unexplained, irrational fears or phobias, self-beliefs or habits, or recurring ailments or those with no medical cure or reason.

Past Life Regression Therapy (PLRT) is much like a deep guided meditation, wherein you relax and allow your consciousness to access the memories from the subconscious mind, which holds the answers to life questions. Once we release the residual energy and unhealthy beliefs from those lifetimes, we feel lighter here, in this lifetime.

It can be an excellent tool for self-discovery, to clarify life-purpose, relationship conflicts, career goals etc. Know the growth trajectory your soul is on across lifetimes. The wisdom you gain from those lifetimes can be then incorporated into your present choices. Come, experience it for yourself.

Age Regression can help in healing the traumas, triggers and unhealthy belief systems of this life time. Emotional healing can help you come out of the bad memories of the past an live a happy life.

Healing session is guided and carefully monitored by the facilitator where you can connect with your soul, aura and chakras, So that the negative energies and foreign bodies can be cleansed and cleared.


Priyanka Bhargava

Spiritual Life coach, Therapist and Healer

Priyanka is a Past Life Regression Therapist, Hypnotherapist, Healer and Channel. Certified Angel Healer and Core-Somatic Integration Therapist. She has also learned Neuro-linguistic programming (NLP), EMDR, and EFT and other healing techniques. She also deals with the cases of foreign body attachments and does energy and space clearance.

She holds a degree in management. Has worked with a Management institute as an Assistant professor, had her own event management company before she was driven to the spiritual Healing modalities to help people heal. She runs private healing practice, and often travels to take healing sessions and workshops on Chakra healing, Past life Regression Therapy, Akashic Library, Life between Lives, Shadow work and Inner child healing in various cities, including, Delhi, Mumbai and Rishikesh.

Specific modality: Past life Regression therapy and Inner Child Healing
Other modalities: Family tree (Pitra Dosh) healing, Chakra healing, Psychic healing, Angel healing and Angel card reading.

description:
All India Bank Officer’s Confederation (AIBOC), National Alliance of People’s Movements (NAPM) and New Trade Union Initiative (NTUI) are happy to invite you to the public meeting   “Last battle to save PSBs” on the 29th November 2017 in Constitution Club, New Delhi, between 6 and 8 pm.
 
Attempts to privatise the public sector banks has been ongoing since the economic reforms. The current crisis with the rising NPAs in the banking sector is being used as another opportunity to overhaul the banking system. With years of propaganda of an inefficient public sector, a climate of disinvestment is only perfect to liquidate any public sector financial institution! Hence what we are facing today is not just an NPA crisis is a conscious effort to reverse the nationalisation of banks and to end public sector.
 
The combination of merging small banks to create a few ‘lending giants’ along with the introduction of payment banks is a perfect way to end brick and mortar branches. The proposals of ‘haircuts’(a fancy term for write-offs,) the policy of demonetisation, evergreening of loans, selling bad loans at a pittance to asset reconstruction companies are all measures that would further weaken the public sector banks.  A slew of legislation on banking sector, in the form of, the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC), 2016, the Banking Regulation (Amendment) Ordinance, 2017 and the Financial Resolution and Deposit Insurance (FRDI) Bill, 2017 were introduced in haste and without a debate in order to make the PSBs weak and subservient. Particularly the FRDI puts most of the PSBs under the threat of being liquidated.
 
Banks apart, the entire public sector is facing disinvestment, privatisation, and selling of assets and resources in the name of cutting losses. It is important for all progressive sections of the society, cutting across political affiliations to come together in building a rock-solid resistance. 
 
To highlight the threat that the FRDI bill poses to public sector and to contextualise the threat faced by public sector banks in general, we are planning to hold a public meeting on the topic “Last battle to save PSBs” on the 29th November 2017 in constitution club.  We would be grateful if you could participate in the meeting.

In Solidarity,
Com. Thomas Franco, General Secretary, AIBOC
Com. Gautam Mody, General Secretary, NTUI
Sathi Madhuresh Kumar, National Convenor, NAPM
address: Constitution Club Of India, Rafi Marg, New Delhi, India

organizer.name: NAPM - National Alliance of People's Movements

description:
http://zorbathebuddha.org/events/osho-wrg/?event

OSHO Satsang – A White Robe Gathering

Osho White Robe Gatherings are a combination of dance, celebration and silence. It is a unique opportunity to immerse in the teachings of Osho through his discourse.

Osho had a saying about White Robe gatherings -“That which cannot be said has to be experienced. This is a great experience of getting into the inner space. Something is experienced in this gathering which no one has been able to define. It’s the peak of all day of work, meditation or groups.”

The gathering starts with some pre-work activities, to help participants settle down, leave behind the chaos of the city and check in to the here and now. From there, everybody is invited to participate and dance with totality, better so we are able to sit silently afterwards in the ambience of intermittent music. Following the sitting, a short discourse by Osho commences in which we absorb and internalise Osho’s words.

Do come freshly showered with no perfume. White robes will be provided for the evening at the venue for you to change into for the gathering.

Facilitator : Prem Bhakti, Ashwin Bharti & Swami Dhyaan Sangeetam

Bhakti has been trained as a leader of social meditations from the Osho Humaniversity in Netherlands. She has been a meditation leader and yoga instructor with Zorba the Buddha for almost 2 years. Bhakti is a certified clinical hypnotherapist since 1997; she has received yoga initiation and training from renowned institutions like Bihar School of Yoga, Sivananda Yoga Center and Kaivalyadham. As a life coach she has been instrumental in supporting and guiding people in their journey towards self-discovery.

Ashwin Bharti became a disciple of Osho in 1977 and is an ambassador of Osho’s vision. From being a successful businessman, he became a philanthropist and started helping himself & others in their spiritual journey. Being a channel for Osho’s energy, Ashwin created Zorba the Buddha, one of the world’s largest open faith spiritual centre and cultural hub. Over the years, he has received transmissions from various teachers in Sufism, Tantra, Zen, Shamanism, Pulsing, Osho therapies & meditations, bodywork, biodanza, contact improvisation, art and music. Today, Ashwin continues to live his vision of bringing people to meditation as well as celebration, and has been facilitating Osho meditations for more than a decade.

Swami Dhyaan Sangeetam is a student of compassion, meditation, and musical celebration. His previous lifetime as a high-flying corporate employee led him to suffer a heart attack at the age of 29. Following that event, he began responding to a spiritual calling, traveling extensively and expanding his life through meditation practices and supporting others in their own growth, freedom, and discovery of their spiritual being through his music.
Founder of the Djembe Fola United, his Rainbow and Drum circles are truly unique and potent in awakening the spirit of celebration and potential for inner healing. For the past couple years, his gifted passion for percussion and community resonance has been inviting people from all walks of life to experience and express love & consciousness. His journey of self-discovery led him to the Osho International Festival held at Zorba the Buddha in 2016, where he felt deep resonance with Osho’s work. He has been with the Zorba community since then, as a Sanyasi and resident facilitator, conducting morning and evening meditations and offering his exuberant energy and wisdom to all those who walk in. He considers himself gifted and fortunate to be able to support and assist people on their life journey towards optimal health, enlightenment, and ultimate freedom.

Date & Timing : 1st, 8th, 22nd, 29th Nov, 2017 (5.45 PM – 7.30 PM)

(Every Wednesday)

description:
Aambra Foundation in association with India International Centre cordially invites you to She Speaks Edition 5.0: 'Tagging & Typecasting Women'

Labelling or tagging and typecasting women is a convenient method used by men as well as women to abuse, defame and slander girls and women. It often results in the victims building an invincible wall around themselves. These victims then hesitate in speaking up or just give in to the pressure or demands of the oppressor.

The Discussion Panel includes: Urvashi Butalia (renowned Author and Feminist), Ms Garima Gupta (IAS, Principal Secretary, Higher Education), Dr Bulbul Dhar James (Academician and Human Rights Activist), Dr Amrinder Kaur Bajaj (renowned Author and MD), Dr Allana Golmei (renowned Social Activist). The Panel will be moderated by Vinita Bakshi (Founder, Aambra Foundation & She Speaks).

In this edition, we will also interact with our Special Guests: Swati Chaturvedi (Author), Dr Amna Mirza (Academician), Sandip Sen (Writer), and Dr Geeta Chaudhary (Psychologist); and hold a Gender Sensitization Quiz which will be open to all.

A short film on the topic will be screened, with video clips from eminent film personalities including Imitaz Ali & Ida Thresa Myklebos.

We begin at 5.30 pm on Wednesday, November 29, 2017.

description:
Art Alive Gallery presents ‘Art NOW 17’ a group exhibition portraying the contemporary Indian art trends. This show is the second in the series of ‘Art NOW’, following the success of its first show held at the Jehangir Art Gallery, Mumbai last year.

ART NOW! is about art today. The show portrays the current art practices and how they have evolved over the last few years. The exhibition will showcase the works of some distinguished artists that are the faces of Indian art, along with the works of some bright emerging artists who are evolving their distinctive styles. Contemporary art is reaching out to a larger audience and globally evolving. The artists have been experimenting with newer mediums and are responding to the environment around them. The artworks highlight the signature style of each artist, depicting the current cultural and global influences on Indian art, thus creating a deeper interest in art today.

Queer Ink (QI), a social enterprise, has a mandate to collate, develop and promotes Indian LBGTHQIA+/queer lives and stories on multiple platforms. QI has published several books and produced short films (documentaries and fiction.) The latest venture is to host a queer online film festival in 2018.

Our next five-year mission to crowd-source (ideas, expertise and funds) authentic stories to produce quality books and films.

About Shobhna S Kumar

Shobhna is an accidental social entrepreneur, learning on-the-job the roles and responsibilities of e-retailer, publisher, producer, promoter and distributor of books and films. Shobhna is keen on facilitating processes that nurture emerging LGBTHQIA+/Queer story-tellers.

description:
It’s time for women to head out – for a bit of wellness, a bit of sightseeing and a bit of girly fun. At the Kunzum Yoga Getaway in Shekhawati in Rajasthan, India.

Hop aboard the Kunzum Travel Truck for what promises to be a trip where you unwind and come back with strong takeaways. You will be in the hands of experts in this field to ensure it’s an enriching outing.

ACTIVITIES / ITINERARY
DAY 1
6:00 a.m.: Leave Delhi / Gurgaon for Shekhawati.
10:00 a.m.: Brunch on the way
1:00 p.m.: Reach our destination
1:00 p.m. – 3:00 p.m.: Check-in, freshen up, lunch and rest.
3:00 p.m. – 5:00 p.m.: Option to explore a bit of Surajgarh and have tea.
5:00 p.m.: Preksha Meditation
6:00 p.m.: Bhakti Yog with mantras explained and end with kirtan
8:00 p.m.: Fun dinner. Ladies will be encouraged to entertain others with travel stories, songs, music, anecdotes from their lives and more.

DAY 2
5:00 a.m.: Shath Karma Yoga – Jal Neti
6:00 a.m.: Hatha yog class (Asanas+Pranayam)
8:00 a.m.: Breakfast
10:00 a.m.: Asana alignment and discussion
11:00 a.m. – 4:00 p.m.: Sightseeing in Shekhawati region with lunch on the way
5:00 p.m.: Chakra Meditation
6:00 p.m.: Bhakti Yog + Kirtan
8:00 p.m.: Cook-Out where participants learn and cook with local chefs and share the dinner.

DAY 3
6:00 a.m.: Shath Karma Yoga-Jal Neti
7:00 a.m.: Power Yoga Flow
9:00 a.m.: Breakfast
11:00 a.m.: Yoga session+discussion
2:00 p.m.: Lunch
3:00 p.m.: Leave Shekhawati
9:00 p.m.: Reach Delhi / Gurgaon

DAY 4
Wake up feeling good!!

WHO IS THIS FOR?
Ladies with all levels of fitness and knowledge of yoga including beginners. Mentors will ensure they give personalized attention to all participants so they may benefit from the retreat.

YOUR MENTORS
* ASHISH SINGH: Very popular with his students, Ashish is strongly grounded and knowledgeable about yoga, meditation and general wellness. He has believed in being disciplined and passionate about sports and fitness since childhood, putting in hours of practice daily as a habit. He has students of all age groups from 10 years to 85 years. He says, “My students have taught me perseverance and patience, which I feel that any true professional should adopt and develop the art to manage people from all walks of life. The suppleness in managing relationships with my clients has helped me to be popular among young and old.”

* MANISHA AHLAWAT: Founder and the driving force behind the all-women fitness chain, Vivafit India, Manisha is a strong proponent of fitness for women. A believer in exercise and diet being a daily routine, she truly knows how to inspire and motivate other women to lead healthier lives.

ABOUT SHEKHAWATI
The Shekhawati region is a collection of towns and villages in Rajasthan, and about a five hours drive from Delhi. These towns are known for their old havelis (bungalows) with frescos, historical monuments and bazaars. The region is the ancestral home of many a Marwari and Bania families, known for their sharp business acumen, who invested in the art and architecture in the area.

ESSENTIAL TRIP INFORMATION
* Dates: December 1 – 3, 2017
* Accommodation: Surajgarh Fort or Mandawa Haveli or an equivalent high quality heritage property.
* Travel: In the Kunzum Travel Truck, a 9-seater luxury van. The distance of about 250 kms from Delhi will be covered in about six hours.

DRIVE / RIDE ALONG IN YOUR OWN CAR OR BIKE: Want to be a part of the trip but prefer to come in your own vehicle? Sure, no problem. Ask for rates for the same.

COST

INCLUSIONS

description:
MASTER ARTIST: Manish Halder

DESCRIPTION: 
Shadow play which is also known as shadow puppetry is an ancient form of storytelling and entertainment which uses flat articulated cut-out figures (shadow puppets) which are held between a source of light and a translucent screen or scrim.
Shadow play is popular in various cultures; currently there are more than 20 countries known to have shadow show troupes. Shadow play is an old tradition and it has a long history in Southeast Asia; especially in Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand and Cambodia. It is also considered as an ancient art in other parts of Asia such as in China, India and Nepal. It is also known in the West from Turkey, Greece to France. It is a popular form of entertainment for both children and adults in many countries around the world.
Manish is a renowned theatre artist with expertise in puppetry, lighting design and story making

WHO CAN JOIN: Children, Media students, Creative Story Makers

FEE: 5000/- material and lunch included

description:
Nisha Jaiswal, a miniature painter from Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh who has been painting for over three decades has a self developed and a unique miniature art form. She paints in 2 disciplines: coloured peacocks with water colours and black and white Hindu deities made with rotring ink .

It's a collection of 21  paintings some of which date back to the early 1980s. The paintings are a testament of the artist's perseverance and patience as each painting requires the artist to hold her breath and takes about six months to a year or sometimes even longer to finish one. Critics says there're nuances of thanka and madhubani folk art on her work. 

She's held several successful exhibitions in Delhi (at Indian Council for Cultural Relations, India Habitat Centre) as well as other cities, where her paintings have been received well from the members of the art fraternity, critics as well as general art lovers and members of the press. 

Genre: Miniatures
Who Can Attend: Art Enthusiast
What will be Taught: miniature style with details and compositions. 
Fee: 5000/- per person inclusive of Lunch and Materials

India is witnessing a new Era wherein young generation is aspired to become entrepreneurs. There are many avenues like Start-up India Mission to accelerate the mission but many Start-ups struggle to get the right kind of direction and mentoring to show them the path to move forward. 
“Unnat Bharat Abhiyan” which has been working extensively in the field of rural technologies and promoting rural entrepreneurship is organizing this meet along with its outreach partner “Swadeshi Start-up” (An initiative of Swadeshi Jagran Manch) to bring together all stake holders from Govt., Academics, Industry, entrepreneurs, Incubators, Angel Investors and VCs. 
The idea is to have a holistic prospective on sustainable development models and how young aspirant entrepreneurs can be the change agents in India.
The program will witness idea-sharing by young entrepreneurs and about 10 will be selected by Swadeshi Start-up for hand holding and linking to mentoring & fund raising for their Start-up.

description:
a Workshop for Parents of Persons with Special Needs 

The stressors for parents associated with supporting a child with special needs are at times daunting. This workshop will focus on providing parents with strategies for emotional identification and regulation. Participants will engage in a creative process intended at fostering greater resilience and adaptability in coping with the emotional challenges. 

This Two part workshop will first take the parents through an internal journey where they will identify their emotions regarding their special needs children. 

They will then be taken through the three A's of Theraputic Management
Acknowledge 
Accept
Adapt 
my emotions  ( anger , sadness, guilt , etc ) to breathe easy 

Methodology- Experiential and interactive

PART 1 OF THE WORKSHOP
Learning Objectives for this workshop will support participants as they:

1.	Identify at least two frameworks for understanding emotions and incorporate that knowledge into their personal and professional reflections as demonstrated through artistic exploration and group discussions.
2.	Differentiate between the complexities of emotions and sensations of feelings and apply that understanding to their personal and professional experience.  
3.	Engage in a creative exploration into the complexities of emotions through guided artmaking and discussion.
4.	Reframe emotions associated with adversity and trauma.
5.	Demonstrate awareness and compassion in reference to the helplessness and paralysis some individuals face when emotions overwhelm them.
6.	Integrate frameworks for understanding emotions into their professional therapeutic settings.  

PART 2 OF THE WORKSHOP
Content Plan/ Objectives

Step 1- Understand our Children- the ‘Psychology’ behind why our child gets angry/disruptive [what drives their behaviour]- See Table A
Step 2- Understanding Ourselves- As Parents HOW do we influence this Disruptive Emotional Cycle?
Step 3- Understanding my Emotions -Identifying Triggers, Red Flags/Cues and manifestations
Step 4- Breathe Easy [Anger/Stress] Management-  Strategies that Work
Step 5-Create a personalized Coping ‘Parental Action Plan’
 
About the Facilitators

Dr Kelvin Ramirez
Kelvin A. Ramirez, Ph.D., ATR-BC, LCAT, is a Licensed Board Certified Creative Arts Therapist with years of experience incorporating art therapy within educational systems to enhance student’s personal and academic growth. Currently, Dr. Ramirez serves as Assistant Professor of Expressive Art Therapy at Lesley University, Cambridge, MA. Internationally, Dr. Ramirez collaborates and develops programs with educators, clinicians, and community leaders in Nicaragua, the Dominican Republic, Haiti and India. Dr. Ramirez has written a chapter in Kerr (2015) Multicultural Family Art Therapy on identity formation and cultural isolation and produced two documentary films Art Therapy: The Movie and Love in the Making.

Aparna Samuel Balasundaram
Aparna is committed to helping people reach their full potential so they might lead flourishing lives.  Her professional and personal belief is that taking focused action is the only way to create meaningful change in our lives. She is the founder of three services that translates this passion into reality. 
AN AWARD WINNING CLINICAL PSYCHOTHERAPIST WITH 21 YEARS OF INTERNATIONAL EXPERIENCE IN THE FIELD OF HUMAN DEVELOPMENT, PARENT COACHING, CORPORATE TRAINING AND LIFE SKILLS EDUCATION (INCLUDES 10 YEARS IN THE USA). 
Her educational qualifications include premier national and international institutes [NYU, TISS and NIMHANS]. She is the recipient of New York University’s ‘Deans Award’ for academic excellence and the Press-Ganey Award for Clinical Expertise with Children and Adults, USA  
While in the USA, her professional responsibilities included being the Director of the Psychology and Social Services Department and delivering Life Skills learning services to the organization 
She is the FOUNDER of three organizations that helps people reach their full potential so they might lead flourishing lives - LIFE SKILLS EXPERTS, A FLOURISHING ME AND WORK SKILLS EXPERTS


Shaloo Sharma  
Shaloo is an experienced Educator with around 21 years of experience, most of which has been dedicated to to Art and teaching, and Using Art Therapy to work with persons with varied ability She is a Bachelor of Fine Arts , an advanced Diploma Holder in Graphic Design, a Masters in Applied Psychology and a B Ed in Special Needs. For ten years, she was the Head of Pallavanjali, a learning center for special needs individuals from 1 to 30 years of age and has developed the curriculum in three separate ideologies to cater to individuals at different junctures of their learning curve.  
She is the Founder Director of EVOLUER SOLUTIONS , a consultancy that works towards Inclusion, promoting best practices in the field of Special Needs , and designs and delivers Outbound Camps , Customized Services and Trainings related to Adapted PE and Various Art Forms.
She is on the Advisory Board of the Autism Society of India (ASI).  She has represented India at International Conference across the world.
She is a trained Instrumental Enrichment Practitioner, a certified Drama for Autism and a Music as therapy practitioner. She is also Certified as a Facilitator for Drum Circle by the Village Music Circle. 
Well-travelled she  has facilitated many workshops globally on how to use Art as Therapy

India's golden triangle is a tourist circuit which connects the national capital Delhi, Agra and Jaipur. The Golden Triangle is so called because of the triangular shape formed by the locations of New Delhi, Agra and Rajasthan on a map. The trips usually start in Delhi moving south to the site of Taj Mahal at Agra, then west, to the desert landscapes of Rajasthan. And then turn back to Delhi.

“Tour de Golden Triangle” 
Delhi >Agra>Jaipur>Delhi
(750Km in 3Days) - Cycle Ride

It will be a semi-supported ride with One/Two Backup Cars and one Tempo (for Cycles).

Finisher Medal will be given to all successful participants who will complete the ride in speculated time . However, participation certificate will be given to all RIDERS.

description:
Wetlands improve water retention capability of the soil, allowing water to slowly percolate down to the underlying rocks and reaching water table vegetation also has a major role in improving soil structure and nutritional status. This walk is to highlight the importance of water not just for humans but also for wildlife. The walk will lead to Bhardwaj Lake, originally deep mining quarry pits that have filled with water and provide a safe and secluded resting spot for migratory birds. For this we take a ride in the forest from CEC-Delhi to Bhardwaj Lake.

Field interactions on local aquatic ecology, ecosystems & organisms will add value to this day walk. Be sure to bring along a note pad and pencil, a camera or binoculars if you have one and goodies to share with your friends. Add value to your weekend walks with us.
Activities Includes- Road Trip to Lake, Bird Watching and description on floral diversity In Asola
(Warning: Please do not feed or taunt the resident fauna or try to take a dip in the lakes for your own safety.) Please dress in dull colored clothing, carry drinking water bottles and wear shoes suitable for walking in thorny scrub forest.
Date: 3rd December 2017 , Time: 7.30 a.m. to 11.00 a.m.
Fee: 500/-

Programme Details:

What does being a Woman mean to you beyond the 'roles' you play in life?
Have your empowered yourself in the space of self - care? 
Are you living the life of your dreams in every facet of your life? 
Do you sometimes think you would like to do more in life?
Do you wish you could do more in less time and less stress?

If you want to find an answer to any of these questions then its time for you tap into the art and science of energy leadership and natural strengths.

AbhiBindu in partnership with The Collaborators UK Ltd presents TITLE/ Empower Your Feminine Energy - facilitated by Reena Dayal, an International Coach, Mentor and Author based in London and specialising in in Women diversity and the personal development techniques.

About Reena Dayal:

Reena has been involved on Women Empowerment issues internationally in roles such as the global implementation lead on the Diversity agenda for 26 countries and current coaching clientele of women from different strata of life in various countries. She is also a pro bono mentor for the Cherie Blair Foundation for Women and The Aspire Foundation.

Born in Jamshedpur and graduated from Lady Sriram College, New Delhi and XLRI, Jamshedpur, Reena is an accomplished Energy Leadership Master Practitioner and Gallup certified Strengths coach. 

Her work entails helping Women reframe their lives by exploring new ways of thinking and re-focusing their efforts to manage a better work life balance and life-integration. Her clients have found working with her helps fulfil their innermost dreams and professional aspirations.  

As a workshop facilitator Reena has run over 300 training programmes and workshops in her career and brings in a mix of storytelling, interactive exercises, deep self reflections and peer to peer learning. Her straightforward and intuitive style elicits deep engagement and practical ideas of how one can change the way they lead your life from that day onwards.
event_name: Empowering Your Feminine Energy with Reena Dayal
address: AbhiBindu : The Meeting Point, Sultanpur, Mandi Road, Mehrauli, New Delhi, India

description:
DCP Weekend Photowalks is an innovative concept, the flagship product of DCP Expeditions. It started in 2013 with an objective to help Mumbaikars know the wild side of Mumbai better, we identified 52 locations, which still have greenery in and around Mumbai, where 52 weekend photo walks would be conducted covering the entire year. These weekend photo walks kept running irrespective of the count of the participants. This unique concept was appreciated and acknowledged across the nation. We received immense appreciation in exchange of putting our heart and soul for it. Today the concept has got immensely popular and parallel photo walks keep happening in multiple cities and towns all across the nation at a time and also beyond the country borders. The popularity of the walks have grown so much that today you just need to Google ‘Weekend Photo Walks’ and you know everything about DCP. These walks are conducted free of cost in nature trails identified in and around the cities. These weekend photo walks are conducted by DCP covering the entire year. These walks keep running irrespective of the count of the participants. You are free to join in any of the walks but yes we would be looking for a compulsory prior registration at least 48 hours in advance notification. 

These weekend photo walks act not only as an avenue for the budding wildlife photography enthusiasts to explore and refine their photography skills but also is an excellent medium for documentation of the biodiversity in and around the city life. Data collected during the photo walks by the DCPians are subjected to authentication by the experts and constitute a significant contribution to DCP Explorer’s expanding countrywide data base of biodiversity documentation, which can prove to be extremely helpful for the scientific community in the long run. 

Since we have to obtain entry permissions and / or abide by local regulations, it is essential for us to receive your prior registration. Please do not forget to register yourself by clicking the button ‘Register for workshop’ on right upper corner of the page here (Click on the link below). We may find it difficult to manage the if you come without a prior registration.

Things to carry

Your camera (Any camera of any make is fine)
Carry fully charged batteries for your camera / flash
Carry backup memory cards in case you run short of space
This involves considerable walking, physical fitness is essential
Carry your personal medications if you are on Medic*tion
Carry a water bottle, hat and some dry snacks / chocolates
Carry Odomos to keep you protected from mosquito bites
Carry a pair of good binoculars 
Wear dull colored clothes, avoid bright colors
Smoking during the walk is strictly prohibited

description:
Wetlands improve water retention capability of the soil, allowing water to slowly percolate down to the underlying rocks and reaching water table vegetation also has a major role in improving soil structure and nutritional status. This walk is to highlight the importance of water not just for humans but also for wildlife. The walk will lead to Bhardwaj Lake, originally deep mining quarry pits that have filled with water and provide a safe and secluded resting spot for migratory birds. For this we take a ride in the forest from CEC-Delhi to Bhardwaj Lake.

Field interactions on local aquatic ecology, ecosystems & organisms will add value to this day walk. Be sure to bring along a note pad and pencil, a camera or binoculars if you have one and goodies to share with your friends. Add value to your weekend walks with us.
Activities Includes- Road Trip to Lake, Bird Watching and description on floral diversity In Asola
(Warning: Please do not feed or taunt the resident fauna or try to take a dip in the lakes for your own safety.) Please dress in dull colored clothing, carry drinking water bottles and wear shoes suitable for walking in thorny scrub forest.
Date: 9th December 2017 , Time: 7.30 a.m. to 11.00 a.m.
Fee: 500/- 
For Registration Contact: Education Officer on 8800741864

description:
The Piano Man and Lock & Key present GIANTS OF JAZZ- DELHI
--------------------------------
Featured artist for the evening : 
LUCIA
--------------------------------
Sentirenla Lucia is a vocalist from Nagaland, India who has found her forte in R&B, Neo-soul and Jazz-Fusion music. After receiving a scholarship to study at Berklee College of Music, Lucia relocated to Boston, Massachusetts and graduated with a degree in Vocal Performance.    
 
Lucia’s performance experience has ranged from recording jingles for radio and television for national spots in India, to singing with artists such as Tata Vega, Joey Blake, Rhiannon and Larry Watson. Lucia has also recorded with John Blackwell while she was with the Prince Ensemble.     
   
Lucia was a founding member of Artistes Unlimited, a 60-member choir and charitable trust that promotes the performing arts in New Delhi, India. In 2009 she was part of Bill Banfield’s Jazz, R&B band ‘Jazz Urbane’ and performed with them at Sculler’s and the BeanTown Jazz Festival. 

In 2012 she founded Phoenix Anthology with the purpose of bringing diversity in music and to give musicians in Nagaland the opportunity to experiment with different genres of music. Lucia has performed with Semper Soul as their lead vocalist and also the lead vocalist for the Boston based GB band 51-Soul. She also appears with a’capella groups Sung Deep and The Singing Tribe.     
   
In addition to being an active performer, she has also worked with Zumix, a Boston non-profit organization that was honored by the White House as a 2011 recipient of the National Arts and Humanities Youth Program Award, as a teaching artist.    
 
She also worked and taught the Prep Academy students of City Music (Berklee College of Music). Lucia enjoys working with students to develop their vocal and performance techniques individually, teaching students how to sing background vocals, and instructing student a’capella groups.
address: The Piano Man Jazz Club, 7/22, Ground Floor, B-6, Safdarjung Enclave Market, New Delhi, India

Her songs and her instrumental pieces are a synthesis of all her human and musical experiences. Gaia Mobilji manages to mix sounds from all over the world.
Alternating between accordion,  synth ,calabrian lyra and using loop station  to reproduce atmospheres , she conquers the public through the happy marriage between a profound musical training , and the driving passion of popular music.

description:
As part of the Japan Festival
The Japan Foundation, New Delhi 
presents

GOYOKAI 
Nihon Buyo (Traditional Japanese Dance) 
with 
Kathak and Indian Classical Music

on 8th December, Friday 
at 7 pm
in Kamani Auditorium, Copernicus Marg

Minosuke Nishikawa (Japanese traditional dancer)
Juraku Hanayagi (Japanese traditional dancer)
Motoi Hanayagi (Japanese traditional dancer)
Rankoh Fujima (Japanese traditional dancer)
Tomogoro Yamamura (Japanese traditional dancer)
Shinjuro Katada (Japanese traditional musician)
Haruhisa Hosei (Japanese traditional musician)
Fateh Ali Khan (Sitar)
Amaan Ali Khan (Tabla)
Sangita Chatterjee & troupe (Kathak dancers)

Goyokai is a group of celebrated Japanese traditional
dancers. The group consists of five dancers from
different schools and family lineages of the Japanese
traditional dance, nihon buyou, who are taking
a lead in furthering Japanese traditional dance.
Representing the quintessence of classical Japanese
dance, their performances vary, from the pieces
derived from kabuki, their original work and the
elegant zashikimai, the dance traditionally intended
to be performed only in tatami rooms.
The artists have worked together to create new
performance pieces since 2016. 

The pieces being perfomed are: 
‘Sambaso’ (a rhythmical dance piece representing a prayer
for a good harvest)
‘Hagoromo’ (a dramatic dancepiece about the relationship between a fisherman and a heavenly maiden) and 
‘Ramayana’

Entry is free with no prior registration or RSVP required.
Kindly choose "Going" or "Interested" for more updates!
event_name: Goyokai - Nihon Buyo (Traditional Japanese Dance) with Kathak
address: Kamani Auditorium, New Delhi, India

description:
Becoming the Phoenix—Evolution of the Soul and Living without Regret

“I flew straight out of heaven, a mad bird full of secrets. I came into being as I came into being. I grew as I grew. I changed as I change. My mind is fire, my soul fire. The cobra wakes and spits fire in my eyes. I rise through ochre smoke into black air enclosed in a shower of stars. I am what I have made. I am the seed of every god, beautiful as evening, hard as light. I am the last four days of yesterday, four screams from the edges of earth – beauty, terror, truth, madness – the Phoenix on his pyre.”*

Shamanic Vision proudly presents a Three Day, non-residential retreat about New Beginnings that will change your Life forever: Becoming a Phoenix.

Day One shines Light on Our Shadow Selves, where we find Light in the Darkness. Beneath the social mask we wear every day, we have a hidden shadow side: an impulsive, wounded, sad, or isolated part that we generally try to ignore. This hidden side is called The Shadow and it can be a source of emotional richness and vitality, and acknowledging it can be a pathway to healing and living a truthful, authentic life. Here, you will begin delving into the depths of you, building an interactive, lifelong connection with your Soul and your Shadow. Gain profound understanding and awareness in a safe and loving environment. Look beyond the Shadow and find the treasure that hides behind it.

Day Two is about your Inner Child(ren). Learn the “How to” of Inner Child work while you connect with, and resolve, Inner Child issues.

Day Three is The Day of the Phoenix. Experience and understand the kind of psychological and emotional closure needed before and during death. Based on Shamanic tradition, you will learn the specific steps that bring reconciliation and healing both to the loved ones and to the person dying. Fly away with the message of the Greatest Journey–we can come to the end of a life with grace, entering the journey beyond death to in a peaceful manner, full of Light.

Who should attend this powerful, hands-on workshop?

    Healers of all modalities…
    Shamanic Practitioners of all levels…
    Those seeking answers to who they are…
    Those seeking answers to why are the way they are …
    Those frightened by the behavior…
    Those fearful of Death…
    Those fearful of Living…
    Those who are ready to Change…
    Those who want to both live and leave this Life without regret

For more information and registration details, please visit us at:

description:
SHAKTIPAT - ENERGY TRANSMISSION EVENT

It is a process by which a Liberated spiritual teacher with an already awakened Kundalini acts as a vehicle for the transmission of Grace of the cosmic spiritual Kundalini energy into the spiritual aspirant. This powerful energy activates the “sleeping” Shakti Kundalini energy, which is stored just below the first chakra. This is not the only way that Kundalini can be awakened, but it is powerful, effective, and considered by many to be the most direct and safe method.

It is also, historically, a traditional way. Kundalini Shaktipat transmission is referred to in the Torah’s Old Testament in Deuteronomy 34:9 in the passage, “And Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had laid his hand upon him.” In Kabbalah, an accurate term for Shaktipat is S’micha m’shefa or Haniha. In the New Testament, Shaktipat Kundalini transmission is referred to in John 20:22, which says that Jesus “blew upon them and said to them: ‘Receive Holy Spirit." In the Yogic traditions, Shaktipat is a well recognized approach for awakening the Kundalini. It is described in the yogic texts as an initiation that activates an inner unfolding of awareness that leads to higher states of consciousness.

THE EVENT

This will be a 7 day intensive course. Kundalini arohan, Cleansing of all 7 chakras during the coming Solstice. The distant transmission will take place 24 x 7 for a week and the final will be given on the day of summer solstice.

There is a small donation involved as a prerequisite since this is a 7 day course , given with an open heart , it will generate an intent from your side to receive with earnestness, and complete the cycle of exchange. If interested you can send according to your means and better judgment or contact me if for some reason you are unable to fulfill this request, there are modes other than the monetary, such as selfless service to others and spreading knowledge.

description: Rajasthan Banjara trip- New year special- 23rd Dec to 1st Jan 2018****Please note: The dates of this trip are 23rd Dec to 1st Jan and you need to apply for only 4 leaves to join us on this trip****Banjaras originated centuries ago in the Jodhpur and Jaisalmer desert areas of Rajasthan. These are gypsies who wander from one place to another, leading a life on their own terms and conditions. This New year’s 2018 trip is about Banjaras. We will be the nomads, travelling from one destination to another, experiencing the rustic life, visiting centuries old forts, meeting other travellers. We will sing and dance around the bonfire, come up close and personal with original Banjara tribe, ride camels, sleep under the stars, in the camps, on desert, havelis, huts and backpackers hostels and hotels.This trip is not about luxury or comfort but it’s a unique experience. A journey full of adventure, fun and wilderness.Start & End Location: Jaipur- Hotel Maya NiwasTravel Style: YOLODuration: 9 Nights / 10 DaysDates: 23rd Dec 2017 to 01st Jan 2018Group Size: 4 to 15Age Criteria: 18 - 45Price: 24500/- (Excluding Train/Flight costs)For more information: Email: funtrips | roamingclan ! com Call us at: +91 7073276500, +91 9820762026, +91 7073526520, +91 9731587004Whatsapp: +91 7073276500, +91 9820762026To Book:  http://roamingclan.com/rajasthanCheck into our Facebook event page:  https://www.facebook.com/events/135123547209564/Included:Shared AccommodationsLocal transportationAll Breakfasts4 Dinners + 2 Evening SnacksCamel Safari (Jaisalmer)Village and Rustic life experienceHuts, camps, desert, backpackers hostels, hotels, havelis stayVisit to haunted villagesCamping in sand dunesWild desert safariUnlimited FunExcludedFlights or other transportation to/from JaipurAirport/Train station pick-up and dropMeals not mentionedMonument Entrance FeesZip lining costAnything not mentioned in inclusionsBrief ItineraryDay 1: Jaipur - Explore the pink cityDay 2: Ajmer & Pushkar - Ajmer Sharif Dargah, Bhrama Temple and relax by the Holy lake of PushkarDay 3: Jodhpur - Welcome to the Blue CityDay 4: Jodhpur - Zipline through the Mehangarh fort in Jodhpur, Umed Bhavan palaceDay 5: Jaisalmer - Stay in village huts,  chill with gypsies, Eat finger licking daal bati churma (Rajasthan authentic food)Day 6:  Desert Safari - Kuldhara haunted village, Khaba fort, watch sunset on Camel safari, bonfire and camping in sand dunes, sleep under the starsDay 7: Jaisalmer city visit - Golden fort, Patwon ki Haveli, 12th century Jain temples, Gadisar talab adventure boating Day 8: Kuchaman- Stay in a Haveli, bonfire, music, games and some #roamertimeDay 9: Jaipur -  Amer fort, Nahar Garh Fort, New year’s party at the hostel rooftopDay 10: Until we meet again!!

description:
◆A conversation, somewhere in a little cafe over chai and insomnia◆

'This seems implausible, also crazy.'

'But what if we can make this happen?'

'Would people like to witness something like this? 
I am not very sure.'

'Yes, they would!
We would want to, right?'

'We would absolutely love to!'

'Then let's make it happen!'

'But we might also get some flak for this?'

'That's absolutely okay. We will try to counter hate with love.'

'Okay then.
Let's do this!'

"Sarhaden rok na paengi kabhi rishton ko
lafzon par na kabhi koi bhi pahra nikla."

'Kiska hai ye?
Bohot accha hai!'

'Pata nahin kiska hai par haan bohot accha hai.'

And bas, yun hi, an idea was born. 
Of lifting borders without lifting a finger, only our shared voices. 
To present our stories in poems wrapped in envelopes of love. 

Not ours and theirs, just ours - because that’s all we are. 
There is no other. 

The Rhyme Republic 
presents 
'Sarhadain Saraab Hon.'

●A poetry event which will feature some absolutely wonderful poets from Pakistan, who have written poems and ghazals of love and longing that they want us to hear, and their poetry will be portrayed on a big screen here, in the heart of Delhi. 

●Performing alongside will be some of the most beautiful, soulful artists from Delhi, live for your poetic pleasure.

●But here's the thing you need to listen to carefully, Toh gaur farmayen!
All this, while an identical event takes place in Karachi, at exactly the same time, where some of the most captivating poets and shayars from Hindustan get to recite their songs and poems of love and longing to the beautiful people of Karachi. 
(Their videos filmed and sent to Karachi, after the screening of the entries we receive here. )

●An interactive feedback session will follow, where people from across the border get to actually talk to each other, give feedback on each other's poetry, one - on - one (imagine); 
via video conferencing.

●And the best part,
We write anonymous (or not anonymous) postcards to the lovely people sarhad paar, and all of us will also be receiving an anonymous postcard later, sarhad paar se hi. 
(Write poems, a story you haven't told anyone, a story on partition that you have witnessed or that has been handed down across generations, just beautiful words, anything.)

THERE WILL BE LIMITED SEATING, STRICTLY ON FIRST COME FIRST SERVE BASIS.
(There are very limited seats so be there before time, because gates will be closed as soon as the venue is full.) 

All this will unfurl at the most beautiful place for poetry and creative expression in Central Delhi, Innov8 Co-working place in Connaught Place. 
Be there on 17th December 2017. 
5:00pm - 8:00pm. 

◆ HOW TO GET FEATURED◆
16 SLOTS AVAILABLE.
(No hate speech. No slurs/abuses)
Please send in your entries *LOVE, LONGING, PAIN AND BORDERS *
preferred^ but we would like to hear if you have something else to share too, no hard and fast rules regarding the theme.
SEND YOUR ENTRIES in a text format at - rhymerepublicindia | gmail ! com
(LANGUAGE NO BAR)

(अपनी नज़्में, ग़ज़लें, कविताएं, शायरी, कहानियों को rhymerepublicindia | gmail ! com पर भेजें, किसी भी भाषा में )

(Send your queries via mail or DM)
Address - Regal Building, 69, Hanuman Road Area, Connaught Place, New Delhi.
Time - 5pm - 8pm.

Would you join us in spreading love and poetry across the borders? 

Tum aao gulshan-e-lahore se chaman-bardosh 
ham aaen subh-e-banaras ki raushni le kar 
himaliya ki havaon ki tazgi le kar 
phir is ke baad ye puchhen ki kaun dushman hai.
- Ali Sardar Jafri

#Markitiers has always believed in doing something different and unique and as an intiative in that step we, in association with Events mosaic present before you our next meet "Dream Big-Build bigger". People often say that, "one can get the best from the best" and in an attempt to give all our people the best knowledge about the real estate community we have brought all the real estate professionals under one roof. 
Yes, you have read it right, all the professionals( Builders, architects and brokers, finance company, real estate lawyers, real estate bloggers, etc) will be there to teach you the mantra of the real estate world. 
They will also dicuss about the marketing, business and operations, and various new opportunities evolving in respective field. The meet will also aim at integrating all the professionals into one big community and thus resulting in development of a happy and healthy relationship.
We wish to provide a direct platform for interaction  between the potential buyers and sellers thereby building a real estate community .

The meet will address the following issues:
1. New trends in real estate world( impact of government policies like demonetisation, GST Tax rates).
2. Various other existing trends in the real estate .
3. Career opportunities in the real estate world.
4. Interaction with the best i.e. the real estate professionals and understanding the various opportunities,risk and the dynamic environment in which they operate.
5. The Era of Real Estate( How did it get established, which reforms took place during that period, the Regulatory Act for the real estate world).
6.The GST Implication 
7.Session on digital marketing 

The event structure will be as follow:
● Informal interaction 
● panel discussions
● 1 hr discussion with all the stakeholders( stalls and other people)
● Entertainment sessions 
● Real estate session on Digital Marketing ( Go Digital) and RERA training sessions .
●Discussion on Bit- coins ( risk involved, return expected)
● Coffee with the real estate professionals 
● Dinner

With a vision to integrate all the professionals of the concerned industry into a small family, we will conduct many informal and formal discussion rounds to promote and accomplish our mission and vision.

The meet is open for all the passionate, aspiring  and established real estate professionals.

We are looking forward to host you all and clear all your doubts relating to the concerned field by indulging into meaningful and productive discussions.

Come All, Explore and enhance your knowledge.

description:
Trip Date: 23rd to 28th Dec'2017
Package Cost: INR 19,500 Per Person
Destination Covered: Port Blair, Havelock Island, Neil Island, Baratang 

Detailed Itinerary: 

DAY 1: ARRIVAL IN PORT BLAIR
On stepping out in the beautiful Port Blair Airport, you will be received and escorted to your hotel. After your comfortable check-in, you will be guided on a casual visit to Carbyn’s Cove Beach, the coconut- palm fringed beach and the Science Centre, a refreshing museum which encounters the science. In the evening, you will attend the exciting moving Light and Sound Show at Cellular J*il, where the saga of the heroic freedom struggle is brought alive about the happenings in the J*il prior to the independence.

DAY 2: PORT BLAIR – NEIL ISLAND
Check out from the hotel and board a ferry to Neil Island, upon reaching the island you will be transferred to your respective resort. Rest and then proceed to Bharatpur Beach and Sitapur Beach and Laxmanpur beach Firstly we cover, Bharatpur Beach. The closest white sand beach to Neil dock, Bharatpur beach. The reef here is still unexplored and travelers can avail snorkeling, glass bottom boats rides and Jet Ski rides here. Then, visit to Sitapur beach which is a perfect picturesque beach for travelers. We also visit Laxmanpur beach. Known as the sunset point at Neil Island, Laxmanpur beach is a vast open white sand beach. Post completion we drop you back to your hotel.

DAY 3: NEIL ISLAND – HAVELOCK
Today we depart from Neil to Havelock Island. Proceed to selected hotel to relax. After lunch enjoy visit Kala Pathar Beach and later on in evening visit the famous Radhanagar Beach. Radhanagar Beach has been consistently rated as one of the best beach in Asia. Watch a mesmerizing sunset on this beach before returning back to your hotel to relax and unwind.

DAY 4: TREKKING AND SCUBA IN HAVELOCK – PORT BLAIR
Elepahnta Beach is the most visited snorkeling destination in Havelock Island. Around 30 Minutes by boat, Elephant Beach flaunts one among the best reefs in Havelock Island. The great thing is that the reef here starts at a depth of less than a meter. Upon reaching Elephant beach, we rest and relax. Later, our guide takes you to snorkel underwater where you explore the amazing reef in Elephant beach. Later we return back from Elephant beach to the Havelock dock in a boat. Board a ferry back to Port Blair for overnight stay.

DAY 5: PORT BLAIR – BARATANG ISLAND
You will have an early morning departure to Baratang (110 Kms by road from Port Blair) a three hours drive. The travel would involve crossing the grand Andaman Trunk road, covered with creeks and dense forests on both the side. On the way, we will get an enchanting chance of seeing the habitations of one of the world’s Primitive tribes “The Jarawas”.
You will then cross the deep back water by vehicle ferry boats. Then it will be much more exited through the mangrove creeks. Journey by boat leading to the Lime stone Caves.

DAY :6 TRIP TERMINATES
After breakfast, checkout from hotel. Departure from Port Blair with Happy moments.

Inclusion:
Breakfast & Dinner
Ferry charges included
All sightseeing by AC Vehicle.
Stay on Double Sharing in AC Rooms
Snorkeling at Havelock Island

Exclusion:
Airfare
Any other meal, alcoholic or Non alcoholic beverages.
Anything else which is not mentioned above
Any Camera Tickets
Any other water sport activities.

Note: Minimum 6 members require for this trip.
