description: Water ParkSplash's provides to all guests high standard services. A visit will convince you that it's a unique water park for fun and adventure for all ages and everybody. The quality and safety of the treated water is of paramount importance to a visitor attraction like this. The safety and enj of our visitors is of utmost importance and we need to ensure they enjoy themselves in an aquatic environment that has water treated to the highest standards. The result is radically different water park. It has an array of rides for children, youngsters and young at heart Designed by World renowned company known for high safety standards. The Park is famous for clean & clear water, technologically safe and a good base for making your visits historic monuments. It Consist of more than 25 rides, allowing thrill seekers of all ages to experience one adrenaline rush after another without leaving the water. For the not so brave and the laid back, Splash offer hours of relaxation. It's the perfect place to unwind, sit back and have a great time. Play in the spray of a waterfall. Relax on a floating journey down the lazy river. Rocket down the waterslides. Splash around in the bubble pool. Get wet, relax and have fun!Amusement ParkSplash's provides to all guests high standard services. A visit will convince you that it's a unique Amusement park for fun and adventure for all ages and everybody. The quality and safety of the treated rides is of paramount importance to a visitor attraction like this. The safety and enjoyment of our visitors is of utmost importance and we need to ensure they enjoy themselves in an aquatic environment that has rides treated to the highest standards. The result is radically different amusement park. It has an array of rides for children, youngsters and young at heart Designed by World renowned company known for high safety standards. The Park is famous for adventurous rides, technologically safe and a good base for making your visits historic monuments. It Consist of more than 10 rides, allowing thrill seekers of all ages to experience one adrenaline rush after another without leaving the rides. For the not so brave and the laid back, Splash offer hours of relaxation. It's the perfect place to unwind, sit back and have a great time. Get wet, relax and have fun!RESTAURANTAdequately fueled by hours of high voltage activity in the water, under the sun and at the indoor games, Splash offers a great meal at their restaurant With numerous delicious dishes, your dining choices are as varied as your moods. Just feel the ambience, note the different service, indulge in the tempting menu and relish the taste of the food, fun and life. We make sure! that the way to our guest's heart is through many routes, food being one of them! your dining choices are as varied as your moods. You'll dine at candlelit tables for two or with new friends at tables for four or more. At The SPLASH, dining is a symphonic fusion of culinary art and warm, personal service that makes every meal an unforgettable experience. Start the morning with piping hot coffee and a lavish breakfast buffet. Lunch is a sumptuous selection that is as endless and varied as your imagination. In addition, there are anytime snacks cooked fresh to order at our grills. Our restaurant enable you to dine according to your timetable, not some preset agenda, because you're on vacation, not on someone else's schedule. We provide a distinctive gourmet experience with its own menu and ambiance. And they'll take you around the world, around the clock if you wish.

description:
The Piano Man and Lock & Key present GIANTS OF JAZZ- DELHI
------------------------------------
Featured artist for the evening : 
CRUISE CONTROL ON TRIO (CCO3)
ArtistsinTune Management
------------------------------------
A crossover project between jazz and classical music formed by Martin van Hees - classical guitarist & composer, Aktas Erdogan - classical/jazz guitarist & composer & Nello Biasini - percussion.  

Three soloists, talented musicians, members of different ensembles and line ups bring together sounds from the East, the West, and the Southern Cultures into their music. Apart from arrangements on jazz standards, the trio is performing their own original compositions influenced by classical, jazz, world and pop music.  

----------------
The Musicians : 
----------------

Martin van Hees : Classical guitarist & Composer 

Martin Van Hees’ playing can be characterized by an outstanding musical expression and brilliant sound. He graduated in 2014 under Professor Zoran Dukic from the Royal Conservatorium in The Hague, with excellence & distinction for his contribution to contemporary music. Parallel to his solo career, Martin is part of chamber ensembles, contemporary music ensembles and theatre/dance productions. He has performed in India (solo tour 2014), Thailand, Switzerland, Italy, Belgium, Greece (solo tour 2016) and the Netherlands. He received several prizes at International and National guitar competitions. Besides his repertoire Martin composes his own music mostly for the guitar with sentimental - melancholic melodies, occasionally developed into jazzy sounds.   

Aktas Erdogan : Classical/jazz guitarist & Composer 

Aktas Erdogan is a virtuoso young guitarist with background in both classical and jazz scene. He graduated in 2014 under Professor Enno Voorhorst from the Royal Conservatorium in The Hague. He also attended the jazz department for one year in Brussels Conservatoire with Fabien Degryse. Aktas has participated in various competitions and performed in different festivals in the Netherlands and Turkey. Parallel to his solo career as a classical guitarist, Aktas performs with various jazz formations, including his own quartet. Among his compositions is “Anne Gunaa” dedicated to his imprisoned journalist mother (2015), premiered by great artists; Erik Ineke, John Ruocco, Emrah Oguzturk, Abel Marcel and Steve Willem Zwannikand. Later on this piece is played on behalf of other imprisoned journalists in order to call attention of international community. 

Nello Biasini : Percussionist 

Nello Biasini is a drummer, educator and music producer. He holds two Bachelor 's Degrees with excellence - in Pop drums from Codarts University (The Netherlands) and Jazz drums from Conservatoire "A.Casella" (Italy). This year he finalizes his Master’s Degree in Studio Drumming under the guidance of Hans Eijkenaar and Martijn Vink at Codarts Uviversity (Rotterdam). Nello is performing with different line ups such as GreyHeads, Codarts Funk Big Band, Netherlands Students Jazz Orchest, Dichter Dichterbij, Aktas Erdogan quartet, Cruise Control On trio and more. During his carreer he has been involved in different styles of music; jazz, jazz funk, hip hop, electro funk, rap, cumbia, soul pop, trip hop and folk.
event_name: Giants of Jazz - Delhi : Cruise Control On Trio

Minimum age of entry is 25.

Dress code – Strictly Enforced.

Rights of Admission Reserved.

Arnej

The talent is undeniable, for without a musical upbringing, Arnej managed to carve his own unique style into the ever-growing genre of Electronic Dance Music. Captivating the listener with his trademark melodramatic themes, toying with their senses almost effortlessly, his music bridges the aural with the emotional into a transcendental experience.

A true perfectionist at heart, a trait he proudly carries on his sleeve. Every avenue he takes is paved with utmost attention to detail, which has not gone unnoticed by peers and fans alike. This recognition couldn't come higher than being named his favorite producer by the world's #1 DJ in DJ Mag. This search of musical perfection came to one eventual conclusion, the extension of his Arnej brand. Arnej Music the record label.

Whether performing in front of crowds of 200 or 20,000, In a remarkably short period of time Arnej managed to set a name for himself amongst the DJ elite. The summation of his rise came also as one of his most humbling moments, when he was nominated as the best breakthrough DJ at the 26th annual IDMAs during the Winter Music Conference. Backed up by the fact that he's the 2nd highest DJ Mag ranked Trance DJ on the Western Hemisphere, is a testament of his work ethic and devotion to his craft. 


NDS & Blue

One of the most talented dance music producers in India at the moment, with releases on top international labels and a lot more in process. Their tracks have been supported by Armin Van Buuren on ASOT, Above & Beyond on Anjunabeats WorldWide and Group Therapy Radio, Paul Van Dyk on Vonyc Sessions and Markus Schulz on Global DJ Broadcast.

“I’ve been a fan of electronic music since the beginning” says Siddharth of NDS and Blue fame. It was a long way when we started off but always had a clear goal and picture in our mind of where we want to reach with the potential and calibre we have. We are very happy and confident to be where we are as a Duo. We have achieved far more than what we had expected through the love and support of our fans! So whenever we enter the studio we just have one adage in mind that is to give something unique and special to the people who have an ear for electronic music.

It was when they were pursuing their higher studies in Delhi the passion for music struck them. They always had a quench for music. To start off the duo played at the local clubs just to try their luck with the city and to know how people are responding to their music as basic amateurs. After this the duo started with their monthly podcasts and their own night s called “Aftermidnight” which again was a big hit among the audience and they claimed their way to success. They not only had their piece of fame locally, nationally but also internationally which was a stupendous deal for the duo. It was aired on some of the finest radios of the world, including ‘Radio 1190 Colarado’.

This also embarked the starting of the duo playing local acts at some of the finest clubs and residences. 
They started recording their tunes with some eminent International artists. The duo also during this while performed some exceptional opening set for some mainstream artists like Bobina, Myon and Shane 54, Tritonal, Alex Morph, Cosmic Gate,Matt Darey,Nari & Milani , Dash Berlin, Nervo, Porter Robinson, Hard Rock Sofa, Shogun, Dimitri Vegas & Like Mike, Hardwell etc.

Their tracks Alpha and Contra have created a strong brunt on the playlists. Alpha entered in the Beatport Top 100 Trance standing at the #65 position and also played in Anjunabeats Worldwide 332 and Contra having more than 15,000 downloads all over India.
Also performed at Sunburn Arena with one of the most reknowned artists in the world and Sunburn Campus in multiple city colleges in front of thousands of young kids filled with energy.
The influence of phenomenal Duo Nds&Blue is very much evident and the tracks they have produced have remained memorable in the mind of the people. The duo says: “Having played live as much as we have these past three years, it’s probably made us a bit more high-octane, a bit more adrenaline-filled, but because of that we probably also need to counter it more and make ourselves more better in the eyes and heart of the audience.

Magnolia Sessions

Magnolia Sessions: is a weekly EDM podcast with over 5,000 listeners globally and growing. Conceptualized in early 2013, Magnolia Sessions is Arjun Talwar and Karanvir Singh – one being a banker and the other being a music producer and the rest is well, a podcast. Besides their love for physical proximity, Talwar and Singh share a deep passion for electronic music and have managed to find expression with Magnolia Sessions. Arjun believes it’s soulful, positive and that the feel of EDM is unparalleled, while Karanvir thinks it to be the easiest medium to transfer energy and emotions from one person to another

North & South: is Karanvir Singh’s alias. Under this banner, he has produced original tracks like “Freedom” and “Empire” and remixed many favorites like “Longest Road” and “Spectrum”. North & South is primarily high energy beats and big room sounds – he takes over towards the last segment of the gig to ensure that the “bounce factor” is never missing

description:
मित्रों, पूर्वांचल मोर्चा पूर्वांचल के लोगों के लिए एक हेल्प-लाइन आरंभ कर रहा है|

आज़ादी के बाद ऐसा कोई दशक नहीं रहा जब पूर्वांचल का विकास प्रश्न न बना हो| उत्तर प्रदेश का यह पूर्वी अंचल अपनी ‘आंचलिक विशेषताओं के कारण जितना प्रसिद्ध है, दुर्भाग्य से उतना ही उपेक्षित भी| राजनीतिक रूप से उत्तर प्रदेश देश का सर्वाधिक महत्वपूर्ण राज्य है या यूं कहें कि यह केंद्र के ‘केंद्र में रहता है| भारत के पूर्व प्रधानमंत्री पंडित जवाहरलाल नेहरु, लाल बहादुर शास्त्री, इंदिरा गांधी, चौधरी चरण सिंह, राजीव गाँधी, वी.पी.सिंह, चंद्रशेखर, और अटल बिहारी वाजपेयी सबका संसदीय क्षेत्र उत्तर प्रदेश में ही रहा और वर्तमान प्रधानमंत्री श्री नरेंद्र मोदी जी का संसदीय क्षेत्र भी संभावित पूर्वांचल की राजधानी वाराणसी ही है| लेकिन बावजूद इसके इस राज्य में विकास की वह गति नहीं दिखाई दी जो होनी चाहिए थी|

अब प्रधानमंत्री नरेन्द्र मोदी की बनारस सीट भी इस फेहरिस्त में शामिल हो चुकी है| बनारस समेत पूरा पूर्वी उत्तर प्रदेश नरेन्द्र मोदी से विकास की उम्मीद लगाए बैठा है| यदि उत्तर प्रदेश की आर्थिक स्थिति पर नज़र डालें तो पूर्वांचल इसके अत्यधिक पिछड़े इलाकों में आता है| विदेशी तो दूर यहाँ देशी पूँजी निवेश भी बमुश्किल दिखलाई पड़ता है| कमोबेश सभी सत्ताधारी दल औद्योगिक विकास के नाम पर कामगारों को झुनझुना थमाते आए हैं जिस कारण शेष उत्तर प्रदेश की तुलना में यहाँ पलायन की दर अधिक है| 

पूर्वांचल मोर्चा का इस हेल्प लाइन को स्थापित करने का मुख्य उद्देश्य है पूर्वांचल के लोगों को उच्चतम सुविधा उपलब्ध कराना| उनकी समस्याओं को सुनना और उनका समाधान करना| इस हेल्प लाइन द्वारा पूर्वांचल के लोग अपनी समस्याओं को नि:संकोच और सहजता से कह सकेंगे| उनको अपनी समस्याओं का समाधान इस हेल्प-लाइन के माध्यम से मिलेगा फिर चाहे वो रोज़गार हो, औद्योगिक इकाई की स्थापना हो या फिर यात्रा संबंधित समस्या हो| 

इस हेल्प लाइन के द्वारा पूर्वांचल के लोगों को हर क्षेत्र में सहयोग देने का प्रयास होगा| उदाहरण के तौर पर नीचे लिखे कुछ क्षेत्र हैं जहाँ पूर्वांचल के लोगों को सहायता की आवश्यकता महसूस होती है पर उन्हे समझ में नही आता क़ि किससे चर्चा करें:

१- रोज़गार संबंधित समस्याएँ
२- दिल्ली में स्थापना और जीवन-यापन संबंधित समस्याएँ
३- शिक्षा संबंधित समस्याएँ
४- क़ानूनी जानकारी संबंधित समस्याएँ
५- दिल्ली नगर निगम संबंधित समस्याएँ
६- औद्योगिक इकाई की स्थापना संबंधित समस्याएँ
७- स्वरोज़गार स्थापित करने से जुड़ी समस्याएँ
८- स्वास्थ संबंधित समस्याएँ
९- प्रलेखन संबंधित समस्याएँ
१०-यात्रा संबंधित समस्याएँ
११- प्रशासनिक कार्यों से जुड़ी समस्याएँ...............................

इस हेल्प-लाइन के माध्यम से हम पूर्वांचल के लोगों की इन विषयों से जुड़ी समस्याओं के अलावा हर प्रकार की बड़ी-छोटी समस्याओं के निदान का प्रयास करेंगे|

description:
Let us make our Country Clean.

The father of the nation, Mahatma Gandhi had said that, “Sanitation is more important than Independence” during his time before the independence of India. He was well aware of the bad and unclean situation of the India. He had emphasized the people of India a lot about the cleanliness and sanitation as well as its implementation in the daily lives. However, it was not so effective and failed because of the incomplete participation of people. After many years of independence of India, a most effective campaign of cleanliness is launched to call people for their active participation and complete the mission of cleanliness.

The President of India, Shri Pranab Mukherjee has said in June 2014 while addressing the Parliament that, “For ensuring hygiene, waste management and sanitation across the nation a Swachh Bharat Mission will be launched. This will be our tribute to Mahatma Gandhi on his 150th birth anniversary to be celebrated in the year 2019”. In order to fulfill the vision of Mahatma Gandhi and make India an ideal country all over the world, the Prime Minister of India has initiated a campaign called Swachh Bharat Abhiyaan on the birthday of Mahatma Gandhi (2nd of October 2014). This campaign has the target of completion of mission till 2019 means 150th birthday anniversary of the Mahatma Gandhi.

Through this campaign the government of India would solve the sanitation problems by enhancing the waste management techniques. Clean India movement is completely associated with the economic strength of the country. The birth date of the Mahatma Gandhi is targeted in both, the launch and completion of the mission. The basic goals behind launching the Swachh Bharat Mission are to make the country full of sanitation facilities as well as eliminate all the unhealthy practices of people in daily routines. The first cleanliness drive in India was started on 25th of September in 2014 and first initiated by the Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi by cleaning the road.

The completion of this mission would indirectly draw the attention of business investors in India, enhance the GDP growth, draw tourists attention from all over the world, bring variety of sources of employment, reduce health costs, reduce death rate, and reduce lethal disease rate and many more. Clean India would bring more tourists and enhance its economical condition. The Prime Minister of India has requested to every Indian to devote their 100 hours per year for the cleanliness in India which is very sufficient to make this country a clean country by 2019. 
                         
                              Need of Clean India Club
•	It is to implement the proper waste management through the scientific processes, hygienic disposal, reuse, and recycling of the municipal solid wastes.
•	It is to bring behavioral changes among Indian people regarding maintenance of personal hygiene and practice of healthy sanitation methods.
•	It is to create global awareness among common public living in rural areas and link it to the public health.
•	It is to support working bodies to design, execute and operate the waste disposal systems locally.
•	It is to bring private-sector participation to develop sanitary facilities all through the India.
•	It is to make India a clean and green India.
•	It is necessary to improve the quality of life of people in rural areas.
•	It is to bring sustainable sanitation practices by motivating communities and Panchayati Raj Institutions through the awareness programmes like health education.
•	It is to bring the dream of Bapu to really come true.

description:
Mountains are Calling, and I must Heed.......


The Great Himalayan Trance – A Cycle Ride from New Delhi, India to Kathmandu Nepal, the Gateway to Everest, Birthplace if Buddha by Delhi Randonneurs on the 26th of January 2018. A first of its kind in India.

A Resplendent ride crossing over the Border and spread across 2 countries, barring the first 300 Kms, the majority of the ride is in pristine untouched Nepal …majorly passing through Bardia National Park, Valmiki Tiger Reserve and Chitwan National Park.
Albeit the suggested Bike is an MTB but is doable pretty much on a Road bike…..let’s not forget we are riding from Delhi to Kathmandu…the Jewel in the Mighty Himalayas.

The Ride commences on the night of 25th & 26th of January 2018, and with 5 days of riding (NO Night Riding) we shall disembark in Kathmandu.

Day 4 is the when we start with Gradual climbs closer to  Butwal

Day 1 Ride approx. 300 Kms
Day 2 Ride approx. 260 Kms
Day 3 Ride approx. 230 Kms
Day 4 Ride approx. 190 Kms (Gradual Climb)
Day 5 Ride approx. 70   Kms (Major Climbs)

Total Distance approx. 1050 Kms …Elevation Gain 8500Meters.

What is included in the cost? 

We shall be providing 2 Support Vehicles to carry your luggage (1 cabin sized per rider), to be accessed only at designated points and Night halts, Overnight accommodation, breakfast and dinner at the following places:

Night 1 – Hotel India ( around 300 Kms Mark)
Night 2 – Hotel in Nepal ( Kohalpur)
Night 3 – Hotel in Nepal,Butwal
Night 4 –Hotel in Nepal. Hetauda 
Night 5 – Hotel in Dakshinkali, Kathmandu ,


Apart from this you shall be provided hydration and refreshments at designated points during the ride, and the coveted Finisher’s medal with a bagful of wonderful memories.

We reach Kathmandu on 30th, and Party.
You either free to go back home on 31st or take the Everest Express flight ( https://www.yetiairlines.com/destination/everest-express) and do the 1-hour flight over Mt Everest or call your family over to spend the weekend. 



Who can participate?

Entry to this ride is by invitation only, and we have capped the total number of riders to 25. 

Eligibility Criteria - finisher of any of the following or equivalent

LEL
G2G
TFN
TOA
TOT
PBP
An SR title in the last 2 seasons
1200Kms Brevet
Recommendation by DR board.

Send us an email to chiromitra | indiaendurance ! com or asitava ! bose | gmail ! com and we shall get back to you with the registration details, if selected.

description:
Course "New frontiers in algal omics"

Organisers: Pannaga Pavan Jutur and Shireesh Srivastava (ICGEB New Delhi, India)
Co-organiser: Shashi Kumar Rhode (ICGEB New Delhi, India)
 
Contact: jppavan | icgeb ! res ! in, shireeshi | cgeb ! res ! in
Deadline for receipt of applications at ICGEB New Delhi: 30 July 2018
CALL FOR APPLICATIONS NOW OPEN
 http://www.icgeb.org/course-application-india-algal-omics-2018.html

The ICGEB aims at strengthening the research capability of its Members through a comprehensive training programme and approach to promoting biotechnology internationally. The active participation of ICGEB Member States nationals in the ICGEB Meetings and Courses is therefore highly encouraged. For more information on the terms of participation and funding opportunities for this event please access the meeting website or contact the local organiser directly.

The course will provide theoretical and practical training on advance analytical instrumentation i.e., mass spectrometry based omics techniques and genome scale modeling to identify metabolic pathways and to engineer algal cell factories for biofuel production. The course defines a basic workflow to design an experiment i.e., nutrient deprivation triggers lipid production followed by over view of analytical procedures such as GC-MS, LC-MS and to evaluate the metabolic pathways involved in production of biofuel precursors. Understanding metabolic networks will provide an efficient framework to describe cellular metabolism in algae and can be important tool in metabolic engineering, and strain optimization. Genome-scale models integrated with omics data, such as transcriptional profiling, allows development of a meaningful systemic representation of metabolism that could improve the production of triacylglycerols (TAGs) and other biochemicals.

Topics
Omics-based approach to evaluate algal cell factories, Integration of multi-omics data and reconstruction of metabolic regulatory pathways, Data analysis and annotation of algal omics research, Genome scale modeling of algal cell factories.

description:
ArchiMate® 3.0 Course - Foundation and Practitioner (Level 1 and Level 2)

 https://architecture-center.com/archimate-3?ti=13051&location=Delhi,%20India&date=28/NOV/2018&price=1250%20GBP

ArchiMate® is an international standard established by The Open Group®. The standard describes the graphical language for enterprise architecture modelling.

This training course is intended to enable the learners to develop the skills and knowledge required to perform effective Enterprise Architecture modelling using the ArchiMate® 3.0 language.

During the training course participants learn about the structure of the language, as well as its concepts, principles and assumptions. The training focuses to great extent on practical exercises consisting in analyzing and creating models compatible with the ArchiMate® 3 standard.

During this course you will learn how to:
- prepare to ArchiMate examination and become ArchiMate Certified
- model notation specially invented to develop enterprise architectures
- adopt the approach that will accelerate your architecture practice

Training overview:
1. Course introduction
2. Foundations of Enterprise Architecture and the ArchiMate® language
3. Enterprise Architecture modelling using ArchiMate® 3.0
4. The business layer
5. The application layer
6. The technology layer
7. Modelling relationships
8. Modelling cross-layer dependencies
9. ArchiMate® viewpoints
10. The motivation extension
11. The implementation and migration extension
12. Language extension mechanisms
13. Certified tool support for the ArchiMate® language
14. Using the ArchiMate® language with other frameworks and languages
15. Course summary

Training materials are based on ArchiMate® 3.0 Courseware and have been accredited by The Open Group®.
event_name: ArchiMate® 3 Training Course in Delhi, India on 28 November 2018

The ICGEB aims at strengthening the research capability of its Members through a comprehensive training programme and approach to promoting biotechnology internationally. The active participation of ICGEB Member States nationals in the ICGEB Meetings and Courses is therefore highly encouraged. For more information on the terms of participation and funding opportunities for this event please access the meeting website or contact the local organiser directly.

The meeting will congregate scientists working in the fields of photobiology and stress biology for deliberations on the molecular strategies for enhancing yields in present era of climate change with an emphasis on the role of miRNAs. It will also provide opportunities for junior scientists and graduate students to present their work and exchange ideas with leaders in the field.

Topics

Photosynthesis and photomorphogenesis, stress biology, small RNA regulators, improvement in photosynthetic capacity under stress environments

Preliminary programme

11 October

12 October

description:
Realise your dream of travelling to Divine Mother India next September 17 - 26, 2018. 

You will be escorted to the heart of Spiritual India without having to organise any of the details or worry about how to stay safe or navigate the challenge of travelling in India. 

This is heartfelt Yoga & Travel for women who desire to re-connect with their spiritual side by getting away and immersing themselves in something wonderful. 

A sacred women’s pilgrimage that takes you to Delhi, Agra, Varanasi and Bodhgaya with notable highlights being the Taj Mahal, the holy Ganges River and the Bodhi Tree under which the Buddha attained enlightenment. 

You are invited on a transformational journey that will deepen your appreciation of the ancient art form of Yoga and it’s sacred roots in Spiritual India. 

Can you imagine travelling to India and not having to worry about all of the nitty gritty? 

I mean not worrying about things like staying safe and having to plan all of the details? 

Having someone else make sure you’re not going to get ripped off or end up as part of a tourist scam! 

I bet you’ve heard all sorts of stories about India being unsafe to travel alone – especially for women! 

That’s why with me as your guide it will be easy to experience the wonders of India without any of the belly ache! 

I’m proud to say that I’ve never done India with a backpack and I’ve had profound insights into the true nature of yoga that exists there. 

Yoga that is about daily ritual, devotion and a deep dedication to making EVERY day sacred. 

Divine Mother India is a truly unique place that holds a special place in my heart that I wish to share with you. 

You will be taken to some of India’s most holy and revered pilgrimage places with grace and flow. 

We will be travelling in style with boutique and luxury accommodation as well as private cars and coaches and flights instead of trains! 

India doesn’t have to be hard and it certainly doesn’t have to be on a shoestring. 

Join me for a 10 day immersion into a truly unique spiritual tradition without any of the headaches. 

You will be held in a sacred container of other women, just like you, who wish to experience India in a tailored, private group experience. 

The type of India that I’m talking about is for women who know what they want and appreciate life’s comforts. 

Are the Divine Mother's sweet whispers calling your name?

ITINERARY AT A GLANCE
DAY 1   Arrival day in Delhi with afternoon Yoga, Opening Circle & Welcome Dinner
DAY 2   Morning Yoga/Meditation, afternoon market & temple visit
DAY 3   Morning Yoga/Meditation & sunset at the Taj Mahal
DAY 4   Morning Yoga/Meditation & fly to India’s holiest city Varanasi
DAY 5   Morning Yoga/Meditation, blessing ceremony & evening river cruise 
DAY 6   Morning Yoga/Meditation, sacred Buddhist pilgrimage site Sarnath & Hindu temples
DAY 7   Sunrise Meditation, a walking tour of old Varanasi & traditional silk weaving
DAY 8   Morning Yoga/Meditation & drive to Buddhist holy city Bodhgaya
DAY 9   Morning Yoga/Meditation, visit the Mahabodhi Temple & Farewell Dinner
DAY 10 Early morning Meditation with the monks, Closing Circle & flight back to Delhi

Places are limited please visit www.belindaodea.com for more information.
event_name: Women's Yoga Holiday North India September 17 - 26, 2018
address: New Delhi, India

organizer.name: Yoga, Travel & Wellness with Belinda O'Dea

description:
ArchiMate® 3.0 Course - Foundation and Practitioner (Level 1 and Level 2)

 https://architecture-center.com/archimate-3?ti=12925&location=Delhi,%20India&date=05/SEP/2018&price=1250%20GBP

ArchiMate® is an international standard established by The Open Group®. The standard describes the graphical language for enterprise architecture modelling.

This training course is intended to enable the learners to develop the skills and knowledge required to perform effective Enterprise Architecture modelling using the ArchiMate® 3.0 language.

During the training course participants learn about the structure of the language, as well as its concepts, principles and assumptions. The training focuses to great extent on practical exercises consisting in analyzing and creating models compatible with the ArchiMate® 3 standard.

During this course you will learn how to:
- prepare to ArchiMate examination and become ArchiMate Certified
- model notation specially invented to develop enterprise architectures
- adopt the approach that will accelerate your architecture practice

Training overview:
1. Course introduction
2. Foundations of Enterprise Architecture and the ArchiMate® language
3. Enterprise Architecture modelling using ArchiMate® 3.0
4. The business layer
5. The application layer
6. The technology layer
7. Modelling relationships
8. Modelling cross-layer dependencies
9. ArchiMate® viewpoints
10. The motivation extension
11. The implementation and migration extension
12. Language extension mechanisms
13. Certified tool support for the ArchiMate® language
14. Using the ArchiMate® language with other frameworks and languages
15. Course summary

Training materials are based on ArchiMate® 3.0 Courseware and have been accredited by The Open Group®.
event_name: ArchiMate® 3 Training Course in Delhi, India on 5 September 2018
address: New Delhi, India

Уважаемые предприниматели! Приглашаем Вас принять участие в выставке в сфере металлургии и горнорудной промышленности. Участие российских компаний в мероприятии может способствовать развитию российско-индийского сотрудничества в сфере металлургии и добывающей промышленности, в том числе участию в программах модернизации металлургических предприятий Индии, получению эксклюзивных заказов и т.д.
Центр развития экспорта в рамках организации участия приморских представителей малого и среднего бизнеса в выставочных мероприятиях, а также в международных бизнес-миссиях, берет на себя часть затрат. В них входит:
- оплата стенда и оформления стенда (коллективного или индивидуального) на выставках,
- поиск потенциальных зарубежных партнеров для В2В переговоров на бизнес-миссиях,
- аренда помещения для проведения переговоров,
- услуги переводчиков,
- внутренний трансфер участников на территории принимающей стороны,
- подготовка промоматериалов компаний,
- прочие организационные расходы за рубежом.
Предприниматели самостоятельно оплачивают билеты до места проведения мероприятия, а также свое проживание в гостинице.

description:
The AAS-in-Asia conferences have been conceptualised with an aim to give our members and others interested in Asian Studies, who are unable to attend the Annual Conferences held in North America, an opportunity to participate in panel sessions and network with colleagues in a more intimate setting. Although smaller in magnitude, these conferences include the same exciting features as the Annual Conference including sessions, keynote speakers, book exhibits and receptions. Each year, AAS-in-Asia conferences are a joint production between the Association for Asian Studies and a local host university and committee.

On behalf of the Association for Asian Studies (AAS) and Ashoka University, India, we are pleased to invite you to submit proposals for organized panels and roundtables to be presented at the fifth AAS-in-Asia Conference being, held between 5th and 8th of July 2018 at the India Habitat Centre, New Delhi, India.

The Program Committee for the AAS-in-Asia conference seeks proposals pertaining to all regions of Asia, on subjects covering a wide range of scholarly disciplines and professional fields under the theme - Asia in Motion: Geographies and Genealogies. Derived from the Greco-Roman conception of the world, the concept of Asia has a perverse genealogy as Europe’s other. Asians, thus, have experienced 'Asia' in ephemeral, uneven, and fleeting modes. At its heart lie the limits of inherited geographical categories. Nevertheless, the concept of Asia retains notable power in the political imagination. It serves as a critique of geography as a historical category and of the Asian nation-states that are today asserting themselves politically, economically, and geographically by invoking older and mythic forms of Asian culture and genealogies. We invite proposals that interrogate received ideas of Asia and conceive of new spatial and temporal imaginings, and that explore, understand, and reassert those Asia's that exist beyond conventional political geographies.

Delhi, the venue of the AAS-in-Asia, is an opportune place to pose these questions. As being on the margins of Asia, the subcontinent has always confounded the geographic and genealogical imagination of Asia. Panels are welcomed from scholars in disciplines across the field of Asian studies, wherever they may be based academically, and are especially encouraged from scholars representing academic communities that are relatively underrepresented in international meetings. One of the goals of this AAS-in-Asia conference is to foster lines of dialogue and scholarly communication that cross the ordinary (often nation-specific) boundaries of academic networks. 

Please note: The program committee will strongly favor and give preference to proposals that include participants from two or more countries, whether the panel focuses on a single nation or culture or focuses on some comparative dimension. The program discourages panel proposals from a group of scholars coming from the same institution. Generally speaking, panels with diverse (gender, academic rank, national origin, disciplinary approach) participation will be favored over narrowly constructed panels. Panels that address topics of broad relevance will also be preferred.

We are happy to announce the following sessions that will be held during the conference:
1) Keynote speaker: James C. Scott, Professor, Yale University
2) Special Roundtables: 
Forgotten Geographies: A Journal of Asian Studies Roundtable 
Organizer - Jeff Wasserstrom (University of California, Irvine) Editor 
Forgotten Genealogies: A History and Theory Roundtable 
Organizer - William Pinch (Wesleyan University) Editor 
3) Workshop for South Asian Archivists and Librarians
Organizer- American Institute of Indian Studies and Ashoka Archives of Contemporary India

Call for Proposals opens: August 31st, 2017 at 5:00 pm EST.
Deadline for proposal submissions: November 15th, 2017 at 5:00 pm EST.

Regards,
Program Commitee for AAS-in-Asia 2018
address: India Habitat Centre, Lodhi Road, New Delhi, India

description: After a Great Success of TechnoXian’17 at IG Stadium, New Delhi (India), further registrations for World Level Championship Event TechnoXian 2018 have started now. We’d like to invite you to participate in such a grand event. You may send across your team to represent your school/college/club. IntroductionTechnoXian is the world’s largest robotics championship event series of World Robotics Championship (WRC) in affiliation with Ministry of Science & Technology, Govt. of India and All India Council for Robotics & Automation (AICRA).  It  accumulate students from all over the world together to be a part of the biggest world level robotics championship and commemorate with knowledge and create an unmatched ambience and aura of learning with fun under the expert guidance of research personnel who have proved their worth in the field of academics and industry. TechnoXian’18 Focus:o    Will be organized at Indira Gandhi Stadium, New Delhi (India) on 16th – 17th June’18o    5000+ teams from all over the world.o    INR 1.10 Cr. worth Awards allocated for entire series of IRL and WRC.o    Certification from “All India Council for Robotics & Automation (AICRA)” and “Ministry of Science & Technology, government of India” to all.o    Engaging more than 4.5 million students and developing network to share technical knowledge.Competitions in WRC’18: A team of maximum 5 participants can register themselves for one or more than one following WRC competitions..1.       Fastest Line Follower(FLF): The challenge of the competition is to make a robot that can move on black lines on a white background and reach the finish as soon as possible. Visit:  https://www.technoxian.com/fastest-line-follower/2.       Robo Race: Design a robot either wired or wireless within the specified dimensions that can operated manually and can travel through all turns of the track. The robot that will complete the specified task in least time will be the winner. Visit:  https://www.technoxian.com/robo-race/3.       Robo Soccer: Design and build two remote controlled robots (striker and goal keeper). The team with maximum goals at the completion of the match will emerge as the winner. Visit:  https://www.technoxian.com/robosoccer/4.       MicroMouse: the contestant or team of contestants design and build small self­-controlled robots (MicroMouse) to negotiate a maze in the shortest possible time. Visit:  https://www.technoxian.com/micromouse/5.       Robo War: competitors bring their robots ready to battle and are pitted against their competitors’ robots in one-on-one matches where the aim is to push the opponent’s robot off the arena. Visit:  https://www.technoxian.com/robowar/6.       QuadCopter Challenge: Build your QuadCopter to travel from source to destination crossing various interruptions, hurdles, etc., along the path of journey. Visit:  https://www.technoxian.com/quadcopters/7.       RC Craft Challenge: Build your RC Plane, which can take off, and land on the ground and has ability to do maneuvers. Visit:  https://www.technoxian.com/rc-craft-challenge/8.       Water Rocket: Scoring maximum hang time of the rocket will be considered winner. Visit:  https://www.technoxian.com/water-rocket/9.       Innovation Challenge: Innovator’s team has to submit a great idea and project that will change the future of robotics and useful to nature or human being. Visit:  https://www.technoxian.com/innovation-contest/ Competitions in IRL’18:Institutes and academic center may also represent for International Robotics League’18. Following are the competitions in IRL category.1)       Jr. Robo Race Challenge: This challenge is open only for schools. A team of 10 -15 participants would represent their school and compete with others. Visit:  http://www.technoxian.com/junior-robotics-competition/2)       Sr. Robo Race Challenge: This challenge is open for all education institutions including colleges. A team of 10 -15 participants would represent their institute and compete with other institutes. Eligible participants should be doing engineering graduation or post-graduation. Visit:  http://www.technoxian.com/senior-robotics-competition/
address: Indira Gandhi Arena, I.P. Estate, Near Raj Ghat, Grand Trunk Road, New Delhi, Delhi 110002, New Delhi, India

श्री सद्गुरू महाराज की जय ?

सभी सत्संगी सज्जनवृंद माताओं एवं बहनों को जानकारी देते हुए, अपार ख़ुशी हो रही है। *कि तिथी 28 मई 2018 Monday को प्रातः स्मरणीय अनंत श्री विभूषित परमाराध्य सन्त सद्गुरु महर्षि मेँहीँ परमहंस जी महाराज कि जयन्ती हर वर्ष की तरह इस वर्ष भी बहुत धुम धाम से मना रहे हैं* ।

इस परम पावन अवसर पर पूज्य गुरुदेव की जयन्ती को सफल बनाने हेतु, परम पूज्य सद्गुरू महर्षि मेँहीँ परमसंस जी महाराज के शिष्य, संतमत के युवा प्रचारक साधु स्वामी श्री सत्यप्रकाश जी महाराज, कुप्पाघाट भागलपुर आश्रम से दिल्ली आश्रम में पधार रहे हैं

*कार्यक्रम :- प्रातः 6 बजे से स्तुति विनती ग्रंथपाठ तथा प्रवचन 11 बजे तक, 11.30 बजे से सामूहिक भण्डारा पुनः अपराह्णक़ालीन 2 बजे से भजन कीर्तन सत्संग व प्रवचन 5 बजे तक*

*सभी सत्संग प्रेमियों,धर्मावलंबियों से सादर निवेदन है कि आप सब सादर आमंत्रित हैं, इस पुण्य अवसर पर अधिक से अधिक संख्या में सम्मिलित होकर दर्शन व प्रवचन का लाभ उठावें। एवं सभी सत्संगियों से आग्रह है। कि अपने सभी सत्संगियों अौर मित्रों को भी सूचना दे, ताकि 9 मई 2017 को होने वाले जयन्ती का लाभ से वंचित न रह सके, आप अपनी भागीदारी देकर सन्त महात्माओं का दर्शन व प्रवचन से लाभ उठायें!

*भण्डारा के बाद सभी कार्यकारिणी सदस्यों का मीटिंग भी है सभी कार्यकारिणी सदस्यों से विशेष आग्रह है की मीटिंग में अवस्य भाग लेकर अपना योगदान दें!*

description:
MASTER ARTIST: Shilp Guru Lalita Vakil
DESCRIPTION
Chamba Rumaal is one of the rarest Craft forms that use SATIN stitch, the uniqueness of this stitching is that it creates exact motif on both sides of the fabric, and it is impossible to determine the right side of the fabric if the selvedge is not considered. This Craft has championed its innovative techniques to reversible garments as it is the only embroidery form in the world that looks mirrored from both side and exactly same. Today it is practised by handful in the valleys of Chamba, a region in Himachal Pradesh. This craft originated, developed and flourished in the erstwhile state of Chamba in the 17 – 18 century AD. A translation of Pahari miniature paintings were embedded in fabrics through Kashidakari (embroidery), a celebrated feminine craft tradition of Himachal Pradesh, India. Learn from the legend who has given her 45-years in up-liftment of this Craft...and perhaps the only one in the world to receive the highest honour in form of Presidential Medal in this Craft. Witness History, recreate future...
WHO CAN JOIN: Textile Enthusiast
FEE: 5000/- including (material and lunch)

description:
MASTER ARTIST: Errol Pires Nelson

DESCRIPTION
Ply-split braiding is a technique where one twisted cord (“splitter”) passes through another twisted cord or cords splitting the plies of the latter cords (“splittee” cords). This is unlike weaving or many forms of braiding where cloth is formed by threads interlacing in an over-under sequence. Pattern is formed by cord color, and splitting order.In 1974 and 1975, two graduate students from UCLA conducted field research in Rajasthan and Gujarat in north-western India. They were introduced to Ishwar Singh, a master girth maker, who spent several weeks with them demonstrating the construction of the girths. Their 1982 publication, "The Ply-Split Camel Girths of West India" [2] was the first to document the entire traditional process, including spinning, plying, cordmaking, and three structures of ply-splitting. These are SCOT, mentioned above, as well as plain oblique twining (POT) and two-layered oblique interlacing (TLOI). The designs showed prominence in the market and were even used to decorate camels for wedding processions.

WHO CAN JOIN: Art and Textile Enthusiast

FEE: 5000/- including(material and lunch)

description:
Introduction:

Namo Gange Trust is organizing “Arogya Sangoshthi” as part of 3rd India International Yoga, Health & Wellness Exhibition, “The Yogshala Expo 2018” to be held from 4th to 6th May 2018 for encouraging the understanding of Yoga & Ayurveda as an incorporated approach in supporting protection of health, wellness, mental illness, pain management and all-encompassing prosperity in human being’s life.

In today’s hectic and busy lifestyle, where people battle with their physical and physiological worries in their lives, Yoga & Ayurveda comes as a remedy to ease the physical and mental pain and anxiety. In view of all-encompassing standards of harmony, health and fitness inside body and nature, as one’s all time wish from life, Yoga & Ayurveda basic stances fulfill such grants and change the way of life from being frustrated all time into a lifestyle of peace and harmony. It is an extraordinary answer to remain fit, as well as a great option for treatment. Various Diseases like asthma, diabetes, circulatory strain, joint pain, ailments as serious as cancers have found an extraordinary treatment in Yoga & Ayurveda.

Likewise, given the current testing condition, the act of Yoga & Ayurveda offers great procedures for ground breaking associations to make it friendly inside different groups and accomplish ideal results in the working environment. 

This event of celebration is not only restricted to India but will also make its footprints at global level as well.

Yoga Sangoshthi is scheduled for 4th May whereas Ayurveda Sangoshthi will be organized on 5th May after the post lunch at Pragati Maidan, New Delhi India. It will be composed on a premise to spread the consciousness on the advantages of Yoga & Ayurveda.

Arogya Sangoshthi Objectives:

• Featuring distinguished speakers from India and all over the world, who will present their research findings and training methodologies demonstrating the benefits of Yoga & Ayurveda towards Wellness and Mindfulness
• One day of Plenary and Breakout Sessions on Yoga Therapy, Yoga Asana and Guided Meditation
• Round up Panel Discussions at evening with Q & A
• Opportunity to mingle with Speakers, Researchers and Yoga & Ayurveda Teachers Informally
• To update the learning on emerging trends of research in Yoga & Ayurveda in cure of diseases.
• To Understand the Role of system of activity of Yoga & Ayurveda medications in diseases.
• To empower organizations and associations involved in Yoga & Ayurveda to attempt quality research in this industry
• To propel youth professionals & experts to take up subjective research work in these disciplines

Arogya Sangoshthi Participants: 

• Yoga & Ayurveda Practitioners 
• Yoga & Ayurveda Researchers
• Yoga & Ayurveda Therapists
• Yoga, Ayurveda & Naturopathy Physicians
• Yoga, Ayurveda & Rehabilitation Consultants
• Ayurveda Doctors\Physicians & Surgeons
• Dialectologists 
• Endocrinologists
• Physio psychologists 
• Public Health Professionals
• Health Educationists 
• Nutritionists 
• Students from Yoga, Ayurveda, Unani, Homeopathy & Siddha Colleges

Proposed Topics in Arogya Sangoshthi: 

1. Yoga, Ayurveda and Physiological research updates 
2. Yoga, Ayurveda and Clinical research updates
3. Importance of Philosophic-literary research in Yoga & Ayurveda 
4. New areas of Research in Yoga & Ayurveda 
5. Yoga, Ayurveda and Fundamental research 
6. Emerging areas of Research in Ayurveda and Yoga
7. Specialization in Yoga & Ayurveda practice

description:
MASTER ARTIST: NAtional Awardee Mahamaya Sikdar
DESCRIPTION
Meet Master Craftmen, National Awardee and President Awardee Mahamaya Sikdar. She got trained in Kantha embroidery under the shadow of her grandmother and mother who were equally talented masters of Kantha embroidery. Today 300 artisans get trained under her. Kantha embroidery is derived from 'Katha'-which represents the most iconic stories of West Bengal, this rare craft also has sanskrit connotation that means ‘rags’, which reflects the fact that Kantha embroidery is made up of discarded garments or textiles or perhaps the best example of oldest sustainable & recyled craft of the world! It is when mothers had to prepare little bedding for their newly born, they could only think of fabric that is worn, used and not starched. This way they introduced a soft fabric to newly born taking care of fresh skin and warmth of love. These fabrics needed to be prepared and stitched together in a way that it brings out a design. This embroidery or stitching together of fabrics was Kantha- also known as Katha(story)
WHO CAN JOIN: Textile Enthusiasts
FEE: 5000/- including (material and lunch)
address: Craft Village, 19B, Shivji Marg, Westend Green Farms, Rangpuri, New Delhi, India

description:
Transportation geotechnics provide key knowledge to building sustainable pavement and railroad track infrastructure. With recent major investments expected in road construction and high speed railways in India and many other countries, transportation geotechnics is becoming increasingly important. With an urgent need to develop this sector, we would like to welcome you to International Symposium on Geotechnics of Transportation Infrastructure (ISGTI 2018). The symposium will provide platform for exchange of ideas and information on new trends and practises followed in pavement design, railroad track, bridges, metro and other allied fields. Engineers and professionals working in these fields are welcome to publish their work in this symposium held for the first time in India and update them with the latest advances in this field. 

Indian Geotechnical Society (IGS), in association with Delhi chapter of Indian Geotechnical Society, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT Delhi) and TC202 of International Society for Soil Mechanics and Geotechnical Engineering (ISSMGE), will host the symposium at IIT Delhi, New Delhi on April 07-08, 2018. Over 200 delegates from India and abroad are expected to participate and deliberate on latest developments. The symposium is being organized by an Organizing Committee guided by a Symposium Advisory Committee as well as TC202 (Technical Committee on Transport Geotechnics) of ISSMGE. The theme of the Symposium is "Transportation Geotechnics for Infrastructure Development".

For more details click on...www.isgti2018.org
event_name: ISGTI Symposium on Geotechnics of Transportation Infrastructure
address: IIT Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi, India

description:
Realise your dream of travelling to Divine Mother India next April 2 – 11, 2018. 

You will be escorted to the heart of Spiritual India without having to organise any of the details or worry about how to stay safe or navigate the challenge of travelling in India. 

This is heartfelt Yoga & Travel for women who desire to re-connect with their spiritual side by getting away and immersing themselves in something wonderful. 

A sacred women’s pilgrimage that takes you to Delhi, Agra, Varanasi and Bodhgaya with notable highlights being the Taj Mahal, the holy Ganges River and the Bodhi Tree under which the Buddha attained enlightenment. 

You are invited on a transformational journey that will deepen your appreciation of the ancient art form of Yoga and it’s sacred roots in Spiritual India. 

Can you imagine travelling to India and not having to worry about all of the nitty gritty? 

I mean not worrying about things like staying safe and having to plan all of the details? 

Having someone else make sure you’re not going to get ripped off or end up as part of a tourist scam! 

I bet you’ve heard all sorts of stories about India being unsafe to travel alone – especially for women! 

That’s why with me as your guide it will be easy to experience the wonders of India without any of the belly ache! 

I’m proud to say that I’ve never done India with a backpack and I’ve had profound insights into the true nature of yoga that exists there. 

Yoga that is about daily ritual, devotion and a deep dedication to making EVERY day sacred. 

Divine Mother India is a truly unique place that holds a special place in my heart that I wish to share with you. 

You will be taken to some of India’s most holy and revered pilgrimage places with grace and flow. 

We will be travelling in style with boutique and luxury accommodation as well as private cars and coaches and flights instead of trains! 

India doesn’t have to be hard and it certainly doesn’t have to be on a shoestring. 

Join me for a 10 day immersion into a truly unique spiritual tradition without any of the headaches. 

You will be held in a sacred container of other women, just like you, who wish to experience India in a tailored, private group experience. 

The type of India that I’m talking about is for women who know what they want and appreciate life’s comforts. 

Are the Divine Mother's sweet whispers calling your name?

ITINERARY AT A GLANCE
DAY 1   Arrival day in Delhi with afternoon Yoga, Opening Circle & Welcome Dinner
DAY 2   Morning Yoga/Meditation, afternoon market & temple visit
DAY 3   Morning Yoga/Meditation & sunset at the Taj Mahal
DAY 4   Morning Yoga/Meditation & fly to India’s holiest city Varanasi
DAY 5   Morning Yoga/Meditation, blessing ceremony & evening river cruise 
DAY 6   Morning Yoga/Meditation, sacred Buddhist pilgrimage site Sarnath & Hindu temples
DAY 7   Sunrise Meditation, a walking tour of old Varanasi & traditional silk weaving
DAY 8   Morning Yoga/Meditation & drive to Buddhist holy city Bodhgaya
DAY 9   Morning Yoga/Meditation, visit the Mahabodhi Temple & Farewell Dinner
DAY 10 Early morning Meditation with the monks, Closing Circle & flight back to Delhi

Places are limited please visit www.belindaodea.com for more information.
event_name: Women's Yoga Holiday North India April 2 - 11, 2018
address: New Delhi, India

description:
The workshop is oriented towards exploring the possibilities of the way we think about materials and design. Here we will design a form or material that is reactive as well as responsive in nature.

It will explore the notions of adaptability and interactivity in architecture & design and aims to expand beyond the use of the computer and digital fabrication into robotics, electronics and physical computing platforms. Sensing and Interactive technologies in architecture and design aims to highlight process of design and through that what can be achieved with the help of integration of technologies in it. The workshop goes into establishing physical and digital connections leveraging operational flexibility and fluidity using Grasshopper.

The workshop will strive to highlight intelligence in systems and pose the problem of multiple contradicting parameters in digital design. The workshop will focus in creating physical interactive prototypes responding to certain parameters or information. Grasshopper and plugin Firefly paired with Arduino Board's computing platform will be introduced to participants as possible tools for experimentation.



STRUCTURE 
Participant will get to experiment upon sensors and actuators with the help of Arduino board and visual programming in Grasshopper. A 3D form created using Rhinoceros and Grasshopper will be used to emulate the data taken from sensors. Each topic will be presented with both theoretical introduction and practical application. In the afternoon of the second day, participants will split into groups to develop their own projects, with direct supervision by the tutors, and towards their last day evening presentation.
The workshop technical tutorials will include: 
-	Grasshopper Visual Interface
-	Use of sensors in making interactive structures
-	Use of actuators
-	Reading and translation of digital signals using Arduino
-	Programming Arduino boards through visual programming
-	Use of emulator to emulate Arduino boards.
-	Understanding Microprocessor and Microcontroller
-	Open sound control
-	Lists & Data Management, Manipulation, Visualization on Arduino
-	Creating interactive façade using visual programming in grasshopper



TOOLS
All the participants should have following tools installed on their workstations: 
-	Rhinoceros SR12 or Higher (30 day Trial version can be downloaded from  https://www.rhino3d.com/download)
-	Grasshopper for Rhino
-	Firefly for Grasshopper 
-	Arduino IDE
-	Lunchbox  for Grasshopper
-	AutoCAD 
-	Adobe Suite



REQUIREMENTS 
-	Participants should bring their own computer with above mentioned software installed. More details will be sent to the registered participants.
-	Intermediate knowledge of 3D modelling acquired on Rhino. Basic knowledge of Grasshopper would be a plus
-	In order to experiment on your own Arduino kit an extra amount of Rs. 2700 for Arduino kit has to be paid. After the workshop take home the Kit along with some more goodies from SPARRO. 
-	Link to the respective software for download will be sent to the registered participants separately.
-	Enthusiasm at Cloud-9



Other workshops in this series:
Algorithms and Parametric Fabrications in Design V1.03
 http://imojo.in/9r4hs9
Scripting & Logic in Design & Architecture V2.03
 http://imojo.in/8ofbi9

Genomics of Rare Genetic Diseases is a one-day online conference organised on the eve of rare disease day. The aim of the conference is to bring together clinicians and researchers working in the area of genomics and rare diseases to exchange their views, ideas and share their thoughts towards enabling quick translation of genomic technologies to the benefit of patients. The conference would highlight developments in the area of genomics with special emphasis on diagnosis and research on rare genetic diseases. 

Who can attend the conference ?
The conference is aimed at providing an overview of the advancements in the area of genomics in Rare Genetic Diseases. Typical audience includes Practicing Doctors, Medical Students, Researchers and undergraduate students in the area of Life sciences, genetics and biotechnology.

description:
MASTER ARTIST: BHAJJU SHYAM (internationally acclaimed)
DESCRIPTION: 
The Gonds, are the largest Adivasi Community in India and are Dravidian's whose origin can be traced to the pre-Aryan era. They are mainly found in Madhya Pradesh and its surrounding States. The word Gond comes from Kond, which means green mountains in the dravidian idiom. This would be perhaps the first ever craft form that has truly inspired the contemporary life and art & design world through a representation using the tribal art form. It is in true sense, what an Indian Tribal Artist Can Teach to the world about discovering life and its elements through creative jouney and interpretation of things in urban city life. World Famous Bhajju Shyam has been the master of Gond Art, and the man behind famous "The London Jungle Book". The workshop would bring in true sense a connect between contemporary inspiration, insights, imagination into most meaningful forms of gond art which also teaches the life management skills to the world through it's age old naratives that describe every part of life in incredible pictorial forms. 
WHO CAN JOIN: ART ENTHUSIASTS
FEE: 5000/- including (material and lunch)
address: Craft Village, 19B, Shivji Marg, Westend Green Farms, Rangpuri, New Delhi, India

description:
La palabra yoga, en Hindi pronunciado como “Yog”, se deriva de la palabra sánscrita yuj que significa unir o unirse. El yoga es una ciencia antigua y el arte hindú. La práctica del yoga integra el cuerpo, mente y alma. Los antiguos sabios establecieron cuatro maneras con las que el practicante de yoga se puede lograr samadhi o salvación espiritual. La meta del yoga es lograr el camino del conocimiento, el camino de la acción, el camino del desinterés y el camino de la introspección.

Día 1: 27/2/18martes, Llegada a Delhi:
Representante de TRAVEL ASTU lo recibirá en el aeropuerto de Nueva Delhi y  llevara  al hotel.DELHI, en el sentido físico y alegórico es la entrada a la India y tiene poder de convertir sus visitantes en residentes.  Tiene dos partes Delhi, Nueva que es la ciudad moderna de siglo 21 y Delhi vieja, la ciudad amurallada. Según el tiempo disponible un tour de templo de Akshardham. La noche en Delhi.
Día 2: 28/2/2018 miércoles , Delhi:
Tras el desayuno relajado el tour con un experto de la ciudad. El recorrido comienza con una visita al Raj Ghat, un sencillo cenotafio de Mahatma Gandhi; recorrido pasara por el Fuerte Rojo con visita desde afuera y seguirá hasta la mezquita Jama, una de las mezquitas más grandes de Asia. El magnífico Fuerte Rojo, con vistas al rio Yamuna fue construido durante los años 1638-48 cuando el impero Mughal estaba en su apogeo. Disfrute el paseo de bici Rickshaw conducido por hombre en la calle de Delhi Vieja. Después de visitar la Delhi antigua, usted será conducido a Nueva Delhi, que refleja el legado de los británicos que dejaron el tiempo atrás. La división entre la Nueva y Vieja Delhi es la división entre las capitales de los británicos y los mogoles, respectivamente. Nueva Delhi es una verdadera ciudad cosmopolita en su carácter siempre llena de vida. Imperial Delhi incluye el Qutub Minar, el minarete más alto de la India, la imponente Puerta de la India, el edificio del Parlamento, Rastrapathi Bhawan, la residencia del presidente. La noche en Delhi.
Día 3: 1/3/2018 jueves, Delhi – Haridwar: Por el tren de madrugada: Haridwar – Rishikesh: Por carretera 1 hora:
Traslado a la estación para tomar el tren a Haridwar y desde ahí el coche le llevara a Rishikesh. Desayuno en el tren. Llegada en Rishikesh. El programa de cultura. 
Día 4: 2/3/2018viernes, Rishikesh: 
Rishikesh es conocida como la capital internacional del Yoga. Por la mañana los  rituales y ceremonia de arti de Ganges i. Más tarde Asanas de  Yogas (Gita Ayenger Yoga). Después del desayuno, asistir  la Ceremonia Inaugural. Luego una pausa por  almuerzo.  Sesiones de yoga. Arti de  Ganges y Puja en la noche después de eventos culturales. Noche en Rishikesh

Día 5: 3/3/2018, Sábado, Rishikesh: 
Sesión de meditación en el Ganges. Asana Yoga (Krishnamacharya Yoga) Vuelve para desayuno. Sesiones de Yoga y conferencias de vedanta. Conferencia Ayurveda (yogui Acharya quimicas). Almuerzo. Sesiones de yoga (en diferentes ubicaciones) Astanga Yoga (Sri Louise). Ganga Aarti y Puja. Eventos culturales.

Día 6: 4/3/2018, Domingo, Rishikesh:
Sesión de meditación en el Ganges. Asana Yoga (Kriya Yoga). Desayuno. Sesiones de yoga y Vedanta conferencias. Nadi Vijan y Yoga de alivio del dolor (Dr. Lakshi N Joshi). Almuerzo. Sesiones de yoga (diferentes ubicaciones). Clase de Asana (swami Poornapragnananda). Eventos culturales.

Día 7: 5/3/2018, Lunes , Rishikesh:
Sesión de meditación en el Ganges. Asanas de yoga para personas avanzadas (Kundalini Yoga). Desayuno. Sesiones de yoga (diferentes ubicaciones). Almuerzo. Sesiones de yoga (diferentes ubicaciones). Eventos culturales.

Día 8: 6/3/2018, Martes , Rishikesh:
Sesión de meditación en el Ganges. Sesión de asana. Desayuno. Compartir su experiencia. Almuerzo. Sesión de fotos. Resultados contenido de yoga & recuerdos. Eventos culturales

Día 9: 7/3/2018, Miércoles , Rishikesh – Haridwar: Por carretera 1 hora: Haridwar – Delhi: Por el tren: Delhi – Agra: Por carretera 3-4 horas: 

Traslado en el coche a Haridwar. Desde ahí el tren a Delhi. Desayuno en el tren. Llegada a Delhi. 
Viaje hacia Agra. Llegada  a Agra y Check in al hotel. Agra: Dos grandes monarcas mogoles, Akbar y Shah Jahan, transformaron el pequeño pueblo de Agra a la capital del reino Mughal – dando el nombre de Dar-ul-Khilafat {asiento del Emperador}. Hoy el día un visitante a Agra se encuentra atrapado en un mundo de edificios que contrastan de piedra arenisca roja y mármol blanco, galeras estrechas y pintorescas calesas, y la irresistible atracción que la ciudad favorita de los mogoles todavía conserva. No es sorprendente que Agra moderna  todavía refleja su herencia de los mogoles. Por la tarde caminata en el jardín de Mehtab. 
Noche en Agra.

Día 10: 8/3/2018, Jueves , Agra:

La visita de amanecer de Taj Mahal. Taj Mahal(El Taj Mahal cerrado a los Viernes) - No hay mucho que decir sobre esta maravilla arquitectónica que siempre es el alma de razón-de-ser para toda visita turística a Agra. Construido por Shah Jahan, el Taj Mahal es un monumento de mármol blanco con su hermosa esposa Mumtaz Mahal. Este monumento tardó 22 años para ser completado y fue diseñada y planeada por el arquitecto persa, Ustad Isa. Aparte de su equilibrio de impresionante diseño y perfecta simetría, el Taj Mahal también se destaca especialmente por sus elegantes cúpulas, pantallas de madera tallada y algunos de los mejores trabajos de incrustaciones jamás hayan visto.

Vuelve para desayunar en el hotel.
Agra Fort – Construido por el famoso emperador Akbar en 1565 AD, el fuerte es predominantemente de piedra arenisca roja. Dentro del fuerte se la Mezquita Perla foto perfecta, que es una importante atracción turística. Se encuentra en la curva del río Yamuna, casi en el corazón de la ciudad. Akbar lo construyó como su ciudadela a través de los años 1563-73 en el mejor estilo arquitectónico. Se caracteriza por sus imponentes puertas y paredes de piedra arenisca roja y un foso. Tras fuerte de Agra visitaremos BABY TAJ o ITMAD-UD-ULLAH – los interiores de los cuales se consideran mejores que el Taj. Una de las más bellas tumbas mogol, tumba del Itmad-Ud-árabe fue construido por Nur Jahan, la emperatriz de Jahangir, para su padre en 1628. La tumba es un lugar de descanso de la poderosa personalidad en corte mogol, Itmad-Ud-árabe, cuya vida es muy interesante. La noche en Agra

Día 11: 9/3/2018, Viernes, Agra – Abhaneri – Jaipur: Por la carretera 265kms/5horas

El desayuno en el hotel. Salida hacia Jaipur visitando pueblo de Abhaneri. Llegada y Check in en el hotel. 
Jaipur es la capital del estado de Rajasthan, un romántico reino de resplandecientes palacios, grandes fortalezas y reales maharajás que se halla en el desierto occidental y forma un paisaje único en toda la India. Pertenecientes a la orgullosa casta de los guerreros CHATRÍAS y ferozmente independientes, los príncipes de Rajput provocaban pavor a sus enemigos. No obstante, muchos de ellos se dieron cuenta de que para mantener su riqueza y autoridad en la vecindad, era conveniente proclamar lealtad al poder central. De este modo, se pudieron disfrutar de una posición privilegiada bajo el mandato de los emperadores mogoles, así como también durante el periodo del Raj Británico que persiguió. Esta tarde, visita el Templo de Birla para aprender más sobre la fascinante vida religiosa de Jaipur. La estructura de mármol, construida en 1985, acoge estatuas ornamentales una de Lakshmi (diosa de la riqueza y la belleza) y Narayan vestidos con llamativas ropas, lo que representa una visión hindú de lujo celestial. Grabados en el templo y en los pilares que soportan los cubiertos pasillos incluyen imágenes del panteón hindú, así como Jesús, la Santísima Virgen María y San Francisco de Asís. La visita coincidirá con la ceremonia AARTI, que consiste en lámparas de aceite se encienden y agitan, con el fin de despertar e invocar a la deidad. 
Noche en Jaipur

Día 12: 10/3/2018, Sábado, Jaipur:

Tras desayuno el ascenso por el elefante hacia el fuerte Amber. Amber Fort Palace - Ámbar es el clásico de Jaipur. Su construcción fue iniciada por Man Singh I en 1592, y completada por su descendiente Jai Singh I. Sus formidables exteriores esconden un paraíso interior donde una hermosa fusión de estilos hindúes Mughal y encuentra su máxima expresión. Por la tarde visitas turísticas de Jaipur visitando. City Palace- Una deliciosa mezcla de Mughal y la arquitectura tradicional de Rajasthan, el palacio de la ciudad se extiende sobre una séptima parte de la zona de la ciudad amurallada. Alberga el Chandra Mahal, Shri Govind Dev Templo y el Museo del Palacio de la Ciudad. Jantar Mantar - Esta es la mayor y mejor conservado de los cinco observatorios construido por Jai Singh II en diferentes partes del país. Este observatorio consta de instrumentos de tamaño extraordinario y todavía en uso. Hawa Mahal - La fachada ornamental de este "Palacio de los Vientos" es un emblema de la ciudad de Jaipur. Es una estructura de cinco pisos, de piedra arenisca de color rosa con incrustaciones de yeso fino enrejado y balcones elaborados. El palacio cuenta con 953 nichos y ventanas. Construido en 1799 por Pratap Singh, el Taj era una tribuna real para las mujeres del palacio. Clase de Saree con una chica Hindu. Noche en Jaipur.
Día 13: 11/3/2018, Domingo, Jaipur – Delhi: Por la carretera 260kms/6horas

El desayuno en el hotel. Disfrute la mañana  libre. El viaje en el coche a  Delhi y se pueden visitar los mercados cercanos para disfrutar de las compras de última hora. Según la hora de salida internacional traslado al aeropuerto para tomar el vuelo de regreso con dulces recuerdos de la India.

description:
After a successful launch in the International Year of Sustainable Tourism Development in March 2017, Ibex Expeditions has pledged to promote Antarctica as a Destination, but to do it responsibly and get all participants to become Ambassadors of the movement by creating awareness.

Being inspired by Robert Swan's 2041 initiative, we too are trying to do our bit and this will be taken forward under an initiative called #Antarcticamatters .One of our Knights, Rajiv Luthra has promised pro bono support through his Law firm Luthra Law Offices until the Antarctica Treaty is renegotiated in 2048.

SKAL, PATA, UNWTO, WTTC & ESOI sent Ibex letters of support to Ibex Expeditions for the Antarctica initiative. 

Responsible citizens from different walks of life who undertook the journey which was led by explorer and mountaineer, Mandip Singh Soin, took a pledge to protect Antarctica,by holding a bottle of melted ice of Antarctica,in the presence of Jonathan Shackleton, cousin of the famous Antarctic explorer Sir Ernest Shackleton.

2018 AntarcticaMatters journey will be led by an Ibex Explorer in Residence, Himali Singh Soin in February - March 2018. 

The route will flow through the most scenic bays and channels of the Antarctica Peninsula with Zodiac boat based closeups of penguin rookeries, seal wallows, bird colonies and whale feeding areas as well as sites of historic and scientific interest.

Please join us and help spread awareness to friends and family about this pristine part of planet Earth. Special discounts are being offered by Ibex Expeditions.
address: Ibex Expeditions - Adventure, Safari & Luxury travel, DLF Prime Towers, Okhla, Phase 1, New Delhi, India

description:
About the Event
The two day interactive sessions of the conference will provide an international platform to all the Yoga aspirants, Yoga experts, to come together, for sharing their views and experience with the masses for the betterment of the society and the globe as well. At the same time the researchers and scholars will get an avenue to present their research findings before audience from across the globe. There will be some technical and experiential sessions on Yoga and Holistic Health as well. 

Sub-theme of the Conference: 
1.	Yoga and its Spiritual approach
2.	Psychological approach of Yoga
3.	Yoga in relation to Indian culture and heritage
4.	Yoga and Moral Values
5.	Yoga and value based education 
6.	Yoga and lifestyle management 
7.	Therapeutic application of Yoga
8.	Social transformation through Yoga
9.	Global peace and harmony through Yoga 

Submission of paper
Participants are requested to submit their research papers on either of the above mentioned sub-themes to indianassociationofyoga | gmail ! com 

Important dates
Last date for Abstracts submission (up to 300 words): Dec 31, 2017.
Last date for submission of full paper*(up to 2500 words): Jan 31,2018.

* Quality papers will be published in International Journal of Yoga and Allied Sciences (UGC listed Journal)

Registration
The registration form can be filled online and the registration fee can be deposited online as well. Please go through the link given below: www.indianassociationofyoga.org/events. If you have any query you may write to indianassociationofyoga

description:
Capture the most coveted Lathmaar Holi of Barsana through your lens with the most affordable guided photo tour customized just for the needs of a photographer. Travel and learn through fellow photographers who share the same passion along with your photo mentor. We will assist you at every step of your tour to make it the most memorable and exciting tour you have ever been on, along with the photographs which you will cherish for a lifetime. 

Tour Duration: 2 Nights and 3 Days
Tour Cost: Rs. 13,000/- (Inclusive of Taxes)

Inclusions:
1. Travel Cost from Delhi – Barsana – Vrindavan – Nandgaon – Delhi in AC coach
2. Two night stay in comfortable AC rooms in Vrindavan on twin sharing basis (Rs. 3,000 extra for Single stay)
3. Breakfast and Dinner (All days – Veg Meal only)
4. Guidance and tips on camera and gear protection and street photography.
5. Service Tax

Exclusions:
1. Any personal cost
2. Lunch Cost
3. Any other cost not mentioned in the inclusions

For Reservation Call: 
Surajit +91 704 253 2235

Tour Itinerary:
Day 0: (Date will be finalized on mutual consent) – 
Preparation Day
Location: Delhi
Meetup with group members. Initial tour briefing & camera protection tips.

Day 1: (24-02-2017) – D Day
Location: Starting from Delhi – Barsana

We will hit the road early in the morning starting at 4:30 AM from Delhi to Barsana from Delhi in AC coach. Will have breakfast in Moti Mahal/ Sagar Ratna, Kosi and will proceed to Barsana to capture the holi. 

After initial briefing we will explore the colorful lanes and temples of barsana along with capturing the shots of lathmaar holi of Barsana. Our photo mentor will be with you to assist.

In the evening return to the hotel in Vrindavan and take rest in Comfortable AC room. Photo review session among group for the day.

Day 2: (25-03-2016)
Location: Vridavan – Nandgaon-Delhi

We will start from Vrindavan to Nand Gaon early morning. Will catch the holi celebration at Baldeo Temple, Nandgaon.

In the evening return to the hotel in Vrindavan and take rest in Comfortable AC room. Photo review session among group for the day.

Day 3: (26-03-2016)
Location: Vridavan – Delhi

We will explore the colorful lanes and temples of Vridavan to capture the holi pics. We will cover holi at Banke Bihari Temple. Our photo mentor will be with you to assist.


Gulal - 2018 Holi Photo Tour Contest: All participating team members will be eligible to submit photos for the contest. And the best Picture of the tour will be awarded.

Cancellation Policy: 
1. 40% of the booking amount will be reimbursed if cancellation is made before 30th January, 2018
2. No refund if cancelling after 30th January, 2018

PS: 
1. Participation is on first come first serve basis
2. All participation fees is to be deposited in advanced to confirm your seat
3. All participants will have to fill and sign an indemnity form before the departure of the tour.
4. If you are allergic to dust and particles or have any acute medical condition then please seek a medical practitioners advice before participating in the tour.
5. Intake of Alcohol or substance of similar nature are not allowed during the tour.

For Reservation Call: 
Surajit +91 7042532235

Or mail us at
info | fullshutter ! com
event_name: Gulal 2018- Explore Lathmar Holi through your lenses
address: Fullshutter, 408,Jaina Tower-2, Janakpuri Dist. Center, Janakpuri, New Delhi, India

description:
The Bir-Billing is a popular yet unexplored site for paragliding. It falls under the Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh. 
The paragliding launch site is in the meadow at Billing (14 kms north of Bir) at an elevation of 240 meters, while the landing site & major tourist accommodations are in the village of chowgan (also spelled Chaugan) on the southern edge of Bir.

Limited Seats so please please book early.

Women with no experience of paragliding need not worry about anything as trained instructors will help you with this lifetime experience of flying in the sky.

includes : AC VOVLO BUS FARE (ROUND-TRIP  Delhi-Delhi), Paragliding fee, all meals, all transfers from baijnath to baijnath, all sightseeing, permits , all accommodation - camping with bonfire, assistance with Bus bookings & certified outdoor leader from Team Jugni throughout the trip

description: Program Overview: All of us are born with our own unique abilities and talents.  However, as we move through life, our brilliance is overshadowed by other people, circumstances, and experiences. Eventually, we learn to bury those “gifts” and forget that we too have something unique to offer to the world. So we settle for who we think we are, instead of striving for who we were born to be. Discover Your Brilliance is a reminder that each one of us has the capability of becoming the genius we were born to be, transforming everything as a result—from your finances to your relationships, to your health. By learning to use the tools and techniques of this course, you will break through the barriers that keep you dis-empowered and feeling like your life does not contribute to anything. With this one weekend (2-day) course, you will be able to create lasting changes, reawaken your greatness, and discover your brilliance.What You Will Learn: Release all the blocks that have been keeping you stuckActivate Your “Magical Brain” to get more of what you want in life Live the secret of all of the world leaders, Top CEOs, and sportsmen that make them who they areFeel a renewed sense of confidence, hope, and powerDiscover your true purpose and passion to unleash the prosperity you desireWorkshop Content :Building Unshakable Confidence: The Secret Key To Unlimited Confidence  Banish Self-Doubt And Limiting Beliefs Forever  Express Yourself Without Worrying What Others ThinkUnleash The Power Of Your Mind: Learn any skill in the world with the practice model Move easily through resistance, difficulties, and obstacles Develop the Ultimate Attitude of the top leadersDeveloping Lifelong Relationships:Build lasting relationships to achieve even more success Effortlessly connect with anyone with a personality different from yoursPositively influence and motivate people around youExpanding Your Vision: Discover your unique gifts which you can offer to the world Make your dreams a reality Live with a greater sense of purposeWho Should Attend?Designed for anyone who wants to maximize their innate potential and live with greater clarity in their life. This is ideal for you if you are going through a transition and are unsure how to proceed. If you are feeling stuck and want a sense of purpose or next step in life.Methodology : Amandeep’s training philosophy is based on using experiential learning techniques. “Learning by doing”.  His charismatic and experiential based dynamic training style has earned him a global following of students, managers, and mentees.
