description:
Theme: Environmental Remediation & Rejuvenation
The evolution of human settlements into environmental anti-matter over the last century and a half has furbished a new face for the contemporary urban environment. Critical changes have been made to the urban biosphere and its local ecology. The urban environment reflects such superimpositions by reactions in the physiological environment.
Exercises of Environmental Remediation & Rejuvenation have become the need of the hour to protect, preserve and improve urban life and ensure a long and sustainable life to the future citizens.
A seminar on Environmental Remediation & Rejuvenation aims to establish the importance of Participatory Planning, Cross Legislative Management and Inter-Sectoral Convergence while approaching such a problem, and to come up with focused macro scale toolkits to make the process comprehensive, democratic and equitable, so as to improve the environmental sustainability and quality of urban life.

To register click on:  https://goo.gl/WxnsqC

description:
Khajuraho Dance Festival and Temple Tour
22nd - 25th February, 2018
 
Khajuraho is known for its stunning temples, architecture and a profusion of sculptures that are amongst the greatest masterpieces of Indian art. This stunning blend of architecture and art led to it being declared as one of the UNESCO World Heritage Sites in India.

Built by the Chandela dynasty, the temples were built to portray the four aims/goals of Hindu life- Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha.

The Khajuraho Festival of Dances is celebrated during the king of all seasons, spring. The most colorful and brilliant classical dance forms of India, showing the rich cultural traditions across of the country, are performed with the temples of Khajuraho acting as the most beautiful backdrop to the stage to create an artistic symphony.

We will embark on a tour of the ancient temples and explore the beautiful scenery and the rich diversity of the flora and fauna that Raneh falls and Panna Tiger reserve have to offer and end every night with the mesmerizing dance performances the festival will have to offer.

Itinerary:

Day 1 (22nd February, Thursday):
Reach Khajuraho by early morning and check in to a 5 star hotel.
8:00 am: Breakfast at Hotel.
1:30 pm to 2:30 pm: Lunch at Hotel.
3:30 pm: Half Day Temple tour.
7:00 pm: Attend the Festival of Dance.
10:00 pm: Dinner at Hotel.

Day 2 (23rd February, Friday):
8:00 am: Breakfast.
9:00 am: Day tour to Raneh Falls and Ken Gharial Sanctuary.
2:00 pm: Lunch at Hotel.
3:30 pm: Half Day Temple Tour.
7:00 pm: Attend festival of Dance.
10:00 pm: Dinner at Hotel.

Day 3 (24th February, Saturday):
8:00 am: Breakfast.
9:00 am: Day tour to Panna Tiger Reserve and Pandava Falls.
2:00 pm: Lunch at Hotel.
3:30 pm: Visit Old Village Khajuraho.
7:00 pm: Attend festival of Dance.
10:00 pm: Dinner at Hotel.

Day 4 (25th February, Sunday):
8:00 am: Breakfast.
12:00 pm: Check out from Hotel followed by Lunch
2:00 pm: Panna City for Temple Tour.
5:30 pm: Reach train station to catch train back to Delhi.

Retreat Cost:
Rs. 19,500/- per person on twin sharing basis plus GST.
If you book before the 18th of November we will offer you an additional discount of Rs. 2000.

Travel:
From Delhi to Khajuraho, we will travel by Train. We will be booking the tickets for you. Fares will be as per actuals.

For Queries Call: Rushil 9899900055, Annu Bala 8595155420 or reply to this mail.
event_name: Khajuraho Dance Festival and Temple Tour
address: Soulcentric, W-126, Ground Floor,  Greater Kailash II, New Delhi, India

description:
VIAJE DIVINO A INDIA
                               FEBRERO 20-MARZO 6
                                               2018

Sukha Yoga Studio trae a ustedes este viaje mistico a India en el cual integra las experiencias del Yoga, la meditacion, la aventura y el cuidado de la salud emocional y fisica con el unico objetivo de dar a la persona una orientación de vida y el sentido de su propia felicidad reestableciendo nuestro estado natural de equilibrio .

ACERCA DEL VIAJE!
Por 14 dias descubriremos la magia y el misticismo de India, su folklor, sus costumbres, su gastronomia, su cultura, su gente y su historia de miles de años oculta en sus templos y recintos sagrados.
Un viaje regenerativo para el espiritu y el cuerpo, lleno de fascinantes experiencias en el que practicaremos Yoga con Manoj Singh, nuestro yogi e instructor y nativo de la India.
Tendras la oportunidad de consulta personalizada ayurvedica con Govinda Pramodini. Visitaremos templos, bailaremos con sonidos sagrados (kirtan), celebraremos Holi, visitaremos mercados locales y mas! 

CIUDADES A VISITAR
*Delhi-Capital cosmopolita de la India
*Vrindavan-Enigmatica ciudad donde su corazon es la    espiritualidad y testigo de los pasatiempos del Sri krishna
*Agra-Hospedera de el monumental Taj Mahal
*Barsana-Festiva ciudad donde celebraremos Holi 
*Govardhana-Lugar donde millones de personas hacen peregrinaje
*Jaipur-Conocida como la ciudad Rosa por sus espectaculares palacios
*Rishikesh-Ciudad a las faldas de los Himalayas conocida como la capital mundial del Yoga

INCLUYE
Transportacion con AC del earopuerto-Hotel, Hotel-locaciones
Reservaciones de Hotel
Desayunos y Cenas
Clases de Yoga
Consultas Ayurvedicas personalizadas
Kirtans 
visitas a Templos
Guias con traducciones al espanol

INVERSION
$30,000 pesos mexicanos
*Separa tu lugar con tan solo $5,000 y paga mensualidades.

CONTACTO
Escribenos a Sukha Yoga o por email 

For Information in English

Manoj Singh
Instructor de Yoga

manojthakurmtr007 | gmail ! com

Para informacion en espanol e ingles

description:
These are some of the really POOR children who underwent heart surgery at Saket City ( now Max-Smart) hospital .
They are aided by A mission called "Gift of Life" !
This is jointly funded by Rotary International, Max Foundation and Health Education And Research Trust (H.E.A.R.T.)

We are planning to do a Fund raiser Charity Show on Sunday 18 Feb 2018 at Satya Sai Auditorium , Lodhi Road New Delhi.

We seek your help in making this a successful event so that we can fund more children born with Heart defects.
It is estimated that 50000 children are born EACH year in India with Congenital Heart Defects. Is uncorrected , 50% die within 2years of life and 40% in later childhood & adolescence.  10% who have the resources do get operated at Charitable & Philanthropic hospitals and survive to become NORMAL HEALTHY CITIZENS !!!

  A recent Rotary camp in Patna has collected and wait listed 180 poor children who need free heart surgery.
♡ Is it their fault if they are born with heart disease ❓
♡ Is heart surgery in India only available for the Rich ❓
♡ Why don't Insurance companies reimburse their healthcare ❓
♡Are they not our responsibility ❓ 

We need to answer these questions on 1⃣8⃣ February which have called     "The Little ?Hearts Day" !

This is a tribute to my father Mr G.S.Mani, who died due to a late complication of Congenital Heart Disease.

Thanks & Regards
Ganesh Mani
Chairman, Cardiac Surgery.
Max Smart Super Specialty Hospital, Saket, New Delhi
address: Sri Sathya Sai Auditorium, New Delhi, India

description:

Categories and sequence of events is as follows :-

Sequence of events:-

Half Iron ( only 50 slots) :-

Swim 1.9Kms
Cycle 90 Kms
Run -21 Kms

Triathlon (Olympic) ( only 30 Slots)

Swim 1500 Meters
Cycle- 40Kms
Run- 10 Kms

Triathlon “Sprint”:

Swim –800m
Cycle – 20km
Run – 5km


If swimming is your weak spot, no sweat we have “Duathlon” for you

Run -5K

Run - 10Km

Run 5K
Cycle 10K
Run 5K

Reporting time –430 am

The swim part will start in waves and slots will be allotted as first come first serve.
There is no transition time

Aid station: There would be water points at 3 Kilometers

There could be some Minor adjustments in distances and cut off timings depending on exact weather conditions a few days prior to the event if the Event Director finds the need.

Regards and see you all at the start line

description:
International Conference on “Sustainable Technologies for Intelligent Water Management” during February 16-19, 2018.

The Department of Water resources Development and Management (DWDM), Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee (India) in collaboration with Indian Water Resources Society (IWRS) is planning to organize an International Conference on “Sustainable Technologies for Intelligent Water Management” during February 16-19, 2018.

The scope of this conference is quite wide and includes any combination of theoretical/ conceptual/applied/analytical/computational and/or experimental/field approaches used for furtherance of the understanding in various facets involving intelligent hydro-informatics, river basin water management for urban and rural area, irrigation, hydropower, environment, health, disaster, governance, coastal management, capacity building, and so on. For detailed information about the conference please visit the website  https://www.iitr.ac.in/stiwm/. 

A copy of the brochure is attached. For more information please contact Dr. Ashish Pandey, Associate Professor and Organizing Secretary, DWDM at phone number +91-9412070399 and email address at ashisfwt | iitr ! ac ! in or stiwm | iitr ! ac ! in.

	Participation from hydro-informatics, river basin water management for urban and rural area, irrigation, hydropower, environment, health, disaster, governance, coastal management, capacity building is welcome from Mongolia. Abstracts of papers are invited latest by November 15, 2017 which can be sent directly to Dr. Ashish Pandey at ashsfwt | iitr ! ac ! in.  

*****

description: World Sustainable Development Summit (WSDS), is a platform to accelerate action towards sustainable development and climate change. The Summit is held under the aegis of the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change with support from the Ministry of External Affairs, Government of India and is an epitome of Track 2 diplomacy. This year's theme is partnerships for a resilient planet. The Summit brings together senior political representatives, leading policy makers, researchers and business leaders around the world to deliberate and create solutions towards a sustainable future. WSDS 2016 was inaugurated by the Hon’ble President of India, Shri Pranab Mukherjee.

description:
Each year the Access Masters Tour gives thousands of prospective students the unique chance to meet Admissions Directors of prestigious Masters programmes from around the world.
A Masters degree can offer young professionals many opportunities for personal, academic, and career development. The professional skills gained at an international university or business school are extremely valuable to potential employers and the experience of studying abroad can be life-changing. Therefore, selecting the right Masters programme is of utmost importance!
Every event on the Access Masters Tour combines two main formats to guide candidates in their search for the best Masters programme – Open Fair and One-to-One and Duo meetings. By registering, you will gain access to the full programme of the event.
The Open Fair gives prospective students the chance to meet school representatives at their stands without any prior appointment, but after registration for the event. Masters programmes presented during this part of the event cover a wide range of fields including: Engineering, Finance and Accounting, Humanities, Information Technology, International Relations, Law and Legal Studies, Management, Marketing, Mathematics, Medicine and Nursing, Science, Social Sciences.
The One-to-One and Duo meetings are dedicated to candidates specifically interested in business programmes in Management, Marketing, and Finance. Prospective students who register for the event will be scheduled for 20-minute meetings with admissions directors and school representatives. The meeting slots are carefully assigned by the Access Masters team prior to the event so that candidates get to meet the business schools that match their interests and requirements.
Additional benefits:
- Get advice and support for your Masters preparation
- Obtain GMAT, GRE, TOEFL, IELTS, and scholarship information
- Have the possibility to win a free ISIC card
- Take part in the draw to win a free campus visit
Register online free of charge prior to the event in order to be able to meet with universities’ and business school representatives.
[Registrations will be open soon]

address: New Delhi, India
Nangloi metro station, Nangloi (Delhi Metro), New Delhi, India

description:
Chcielibyśmy zaprosić was wszystkich do Indii na wycieczkę do tradycyjnych Indii północnych - proponujemy wyjątkowy sposób podróżowania - z Hindusami

Data podróży: 13 Luty 2018 - 2 Marzec 2018 (Max 12 uczestników) 

"Jeśli istnieje jakieś miejsce na ziemi, gdzie zadomowiły się wszystkie sny i marzenia człowieka, są to Indie” (Romain Rolland) 

 Tym razem mamy kolejny cel poza naszymi trzema głównymi - podróż, joga i kuchnia indyjska. Będziemy się bawić największym hinduskim festiwalu kolorów - "Holi" wraz z lokalnymi mieszkańcami.

Pierwszy tydzień: 

Nowe Delhi - stolica Indii, jeden z największych marketów z przyprawami, największa hinduska świątynia na świecie

Amritsar - Złota świątynia oraz granica Wagah (granica między Indiami a Pakistanem)

Rishikesh - światowa stolica jogi, masaż ciała

Varanasi - Miasto między życiem a śmiercią, piękne wieczorne modlitwy w świątyni Kashhi Vishvanath usytuowanej na brzegu rzeki Ganges

Drugi tydzień:

Taj Mahal - symbol miłości, jeden z siedmiu cudów świata

Jarpur - Różowe miasto Indii, wizyta w wiosce słoni, Pałac Wiatrów, Fort Amber

Puskhar - Miejsce jedynej świątyni Boga Bharama, najważniejszego Boga hinduizmu, twórcy świata, market z pięknymi rękodziełami 

Trzeci tydzień:

Udaipur - Miasto rzek z pięknymi zachodami i wschodami słońca

Święto Holi - festiwal kolorów z mieszkańcami

Nowe Delhi - ostatni przystanek, zakupy i zabawy oraz ostatnie pożegnanie z Atrangi India

SCZEGÓŁY POBYTU:

Miejsca noclegowe będą w 2/3/4-gwiazdkowych hotelach, po dwie osoby w pokoju,

klimatyzacja i prywatne pokoje z Wi-Fi

Szansa na pobyt w Ashram

Za wpłatą przed trminem do 10 grudnia 2017 - 949 €

description:
You may have been to Ladakh in summer or even in winter. But have you ever imagined of being to the Spiti Valley in winter? Imagine the landscape! Those tiny villages, mighty mountains, snow covered grounds, frozen Spiti River-all painted with just one color, white..! Imagine staying with locals when they are under hibernation. Imagine the ghost of mountains; Snow Leopard appears to hunt…

This is how IndianTerrains is going to start the year. Make all these imaginations come true.
Let’s step on an earth that is still unknown to the other world..!

WHAT TO EXPECT?
• A 4×4 SUV to travel
• Heated Room
• Freshly cooked hot food
• Sighting wild life including Snow Leopard. (Please don’t take it as a promise)
• Experience real local life of Spitians.
• Driving on snow covered road
• Freezing Cold

WHAT NOT TO EXPECT?
• Electricity at some places
• Mobile Network
• Fancy Food
• Luxury Stay

EXPEDITION COST: 27,500/- PP

INCLUSIONS
• All transfers from Simla to Simla
• 9D/8N Accommodation (Hotel/Home Stay)
• Breakfast & Dinner
• All permits and permissions required
• Professional Guide

EXCLUSIONS
• Personal expenses like phone bills, laundry etc.
• Expenses incurred due to anything beyond our control like natural calamities, landslides etc.

GENERAL RULES
1. Registration will be done on first come first serve basis.
2. “Indian Terrains” reserves the right to amend/alter the program.
3. Due care is taken for the safety of the participants but organizer will not be responsible for any mishap/accident/injury/illness etc.
4. If the participant does not attend/complete the expedition or to consume benefits included in the price, he/she will have no right to claim a refund.

For detailed Itinerary & Photos  http://www.indianterrains.com/calender/the-ghost-trail/

For registrations contact: Vinod Verma +91 9313080096
or write us at vinod | indianterrains ! com

description:
Sports Authority of India & Physical Education Foundation of India are jointly organizing 4th National Conference on Physical Education& Sports with the theme “VISION AND MISSION OLYMPICS 2020 (SAY YES TO "MEDAL")”

This conference will feature many enlightening sessions. Young investigators will have the opportunity to exchange the current knowledge with senior professionals in the field of physical education, health, fitness and exercise science. 

The Main aim is to bring together leading Academicians, Sports Scientists, Researchers and Scholars to exchange and share their experiences related to various aspects of Physical Education, Sports and Sports Sciences and discuss ways and means to enhance the standard of sports in the country.
We look forward to welcoming you in Delhi at this conference which should be a very special and memorable experience for all the participants.

SUB-THEMES:
1. Village Sports: A Golden Opportunity to build comprehensive module 
2. Case Studies on outstanding sportspersons of the country 
3. Quality Physical Education 
4. Quantitative Approaches in Physical Education 
5. Performance Analysis Approaches in the field of Physical Education and Sports Sciences
6. CSR: Mileage in Sports Developments
7. Sponsorship Approaches in Sports 
8. Malpractices in Physical Education and Sports Sciences 
9. Role of Sports Science in enhancing sports performance.
10. Talent Identification-Procedure and process of nurturing.
11. Health, Fitness and Wellness and their process of development.
12. Adapted Physical Education
13. Science of Sports Coaching
14. Sports Tourism
15. Physical Inactivity: Risk factors for Global Mortality

OPEN TO:
Physical Education Professionals, Coaches, Sports Persons, Sports Scientists, Sports Nutritionists, Sports Physiotherapists, Sports Administrators, Policy Makers, Research Scholars and Students pursuing relevant courses.

CALL FOR PAPERS:
Delegates interested in presenting research paper of theoretical/applied nature are invited to submit an abstract of 250 words. The paper should include keywords/phrases and also provide their full address with e-mail id. 
(Organizing Committee will publish the proceeding of the conference with ISBN Number and the same will be provided to all the delegates)

REGISTRATION:
Student Delegate/Research Scholar - Rs.1000/-
PEFI Members 	- Rs.1500/-
Professional Delegate - Rs.2000/-
Foreign Delegate - US $200/-

	Registration fee includes conference kit, lunch and high tea.
	All the delegates will be entitled to receive a complimentary copy of the International Journal of Physical Education, Health & Sports Sciences, published by PEFI.  
	The fee should be payable through demand draft, drawn in favor of “Physical Education Foundation of India” payable at New Delhi along with the filled in registration form.
	The last date of submission of form is 15th January 2018, However, on the spot registration will be entertained on a payment of Rs. 200/- in addition to registration fee.

IMPORTANT DATES:
	Registration  begins					: October ,1st  2017	
	Last Date of Abstract Submission			: December, 15th 2017
	Notification of Abstract Acceptance			: December, 20th 2017
	Paper Submission                        			: January, 10th 2018
	Last date of Registration					: January,15th 2018

ABOUT PEFI:
Physical Education Foundation of India is a registered, non-governmental organization established in the year 2008 with the aim to promote Physical Education & Sports at grass root level in India. PEFI is the organization of young, energetic & dynamic Physical Educationists who have the vision to make this noble profession as one of the premier one. With an objective to develop the understanding of Physical Education across India PEFI proposes:- 
	To develop Physical Education and match our standard with Physical Education methodology of  developed countries
	To work for the RIGHTS of Physical Education professionals & update their knowledge by conducting various conferences on the latest research finding in the field of Physical Education & Sport so as to create more job opportunities.
	To spread public awareness about physical education & sports by organizing Symposiums, Seminars, Health & Sports Run, Carnivals & Wellness and Health-related Events.

description:
Unsurprisingly, in the middle of the Delhi summer, our thoughts are wandering to beautiful wintery Gulmarg. We haven't been since the winter of '15, so after a break of two years, we wanted to put this back on the calendar, and organise a super trip up from Delhi.

This is the opposite of staying at fancy places like Khyber - our goal is to go for as long as possible (a couple of us are planning to spend a full six weeks up), and we want to keep it cheap and fun. So expect to share a room, make friends, and be a part of our Delhi group.

We will be staying near the gondola, which is where all of the fun places to hang out are concentrated, there used to be a lively after-ski scene at Gulmarg! It's great fun to be out all day, work super hard, and then get to chill by a fire with a hot toddy (or a beer) and meet people.

We expect acco to run about Rs 2,300 per person per night for sharing, and Rs 4,600 for a room to yourself; this includes breakfast and dinner. Gear and guides will run about Rs 1,500 per day. So plan your trip accordingly! Flights are super cheap, < 5k roundtrip from Delhi, plus an additional Rs 2,500 or so for taxi rides from SXR to Gulmarg.

If you're interested, accept this invite, we'll keep posting updates here, and email us at team | delhirock ! com with questions and your dates!
address: Delhi Rock, Premises Nanaksar Gurudwara, opp M-39, GK2, New Delhi, India

description:
Smiti Malik is the vocalist of Delhi-based band Kitchensink. She has trained in Hindustani as well as Western vocal styles and draws inspiration as a singer and song-writer from Jazz and Blues as well as Contemporary Folk music. Also a session musician, she has shared the stage with artists like The Aditya Balani Group and Nishad Pandey, and is one half of 'Chayan and Smiti', an all-acoustic set up that she shares with vocalist and songwriter Chayan Adhikari.

Adhir Ghosh is a session-guitarist, composer and music teacher. He plays full-time with two bands - Five8 (Funk/Rock) and Kitchensink (Jazz/R&B); and has also performed with Artists Unlimited, The Yellow Brick Project, Classic Collective, MAP, Vasundhara Vee and others, which has gained him the reputation of being one of first-call guitarists in the city. He is also a music educator and teaches both privately and at Global Music Institute, one of the premier music institutes in Delhi.
event_name: La Bodega Presents Live Jazz with Smiti & Adhir
address: La Bodega, 29 B, Middle Lane, Khan Market 1st Floor, New Delhi, India

description:
3. - 24. februar 2018.

Tag med på et 21 dages rejseeventyr i det virkelige Indien. Rejs på landets egne betingelser og få Indien helt ind under huden!

Rejselederen fører med sikker hånd vores lille gruppe ad støvede landeveje, dybt ind i Indien. Så tæt på at du ikke kan lade være med at røre og smage.

På ryggen har vi vores ejendele, og for vores fødder ligger Indien. Varmt og venligt. Åbent og uimodståeligt.

Vi veksler mellem at rejse ad en fastlagt rute, og frit at udforske afsidesliggende egne. Hver for sig og i fællesskab.

Vi rejser langsomt, så der er rigelig tid til at komme i dybden, og få et levende og vedkommende forhold til dette mageløse land.

EN ANDERLEDES GRUPPEREJSE:
I rejsens første periode rejser vi ad en fastlagt rute, og har arrangeret indlogering og transport. Derefter viser rejselederen os bort fra alfarvej, gruppen beslutter i fællesskab hvorhen vi skal.
Max. 10 deltagere.

Ved bestilling før 1. November sparer du 1.500 kroner :)

Læs mere om turen på vores website.

description:
Drive through the land of Royalty, HIGHLIGHTS:

‣ Self driven compact SUVs, we get you the car and manage the fuel*
‣ A lifetime drive on some of the most well maintained highways in the country
‣ Flexible daily itinerary, you decide your daily plan as a team, only departures are fixed
‣ Forget being a tourist, sleep under the stars, experience amazing sunsets, walk through the heritage lanes
‣ Experience street food and local cuisines, go for the unexplored, travel like a local
‣ Learn the basics of photography from our expert team. Try your hands on landscape, street, architecture, portrait and astro photography
‣ A test of your road trip and leadership skills, challenge yourself

*Self driven cars, 4 people in 1 car. Passengers take turns to drive or as per mutual understanding. Package cost includes car rental and fuel prices at discounted rates

PACKAGE RATES:
Package 1 (With Car and Fue)l: Rs. 58,999 (Incl. 18% GST)
Package 2 (Bring your own car): Rs. 49,560 (Incl. 18% GST)

FOR BOOKINGS (Fill up the form below and we will contact you):
 https://goo.gl/forms/uI00t2fw10564EYR2

PLEASE FILL UP THE FORM BELOW, we will be shortlisting people who will be a part of this ONE OF A KIND EXCLUSIVE EXPERIENCE.   https://goo.gl/forms/uI00t2fw10564EYR2

ABOUT US:
This road trip is being organized by Wheel Wanderers and will be led and guided by Abhishek Khanna.

About Wheel Wanderers: 
We are the fastest growing Adventure Travel Company of India. We have a specialized team to serve you in all the terrains as we have knowledgeable and well experienced local guides to help you with directions and make you feel comfortable with the surroundings. We organize treks, motorbiking trips and adventure trips in the Himalayas. We provide LIFE Experiences. www.wheelwanderers.com

About Abhishek Khanna:
Abhishek is a professional photographer based in Delhi NCR. He is a seasoned traveller who has done multiple road trips across India, specially the long routes. When traveling, Abhishek likes to explore the unseen side of the city, bringing out a different perspective of the place. Rajasthan holds a special place in his heart and last season he spent 40 days covering the beautiful state by road. He will be leading this entire road trip in partnership with Wheel Wanderers. www.abhishekhanna.com

description:
Trip Date: 26th Jan to 31st Jan'2018
Package Cost: INR 19,500 Per Person
Destination Covered: Port Blair, Havelock Island, Neil Island, Baratang 

Detailed Itinerary: 

DAY 1: ARRIVAL IN PORT BLAIR
On stepping out in the beautiful Port Blair Airport, you will be received and escorted to your hotel. After your comfortable check-in, you will be guided on a casual visit to Carbyn’s Cove Beach, the coconut- palm fringed beach and the Science Centre, a refreshing museum which encounters the science. In the evening, you will attend the exciting moving Light and Sound Show at Cellular J*il, where the saga of the heroic freedom struggle is brought alive about the happenings in the J*il prior to the independence.

DAY 2: PORT BLAIR – NEIL ISLAND
Check out from the hotel and board a ferry to Neil Island, upon reaching the island you will be transferred to your respective resort. Rest and then proceed to Bharatpur Beach and Sitapur Beach and Laxmanpur beach Firstly we cover, Bharatpur Beach. The closest white sand beach to Neil dock, Bharatpur beach. The reef here is still unexplored and travelers can avail snorkeling, glass bottom boats rides and Jet Ski rides here. Then, visit to Sitapur beach which is a perfect picturesque beach for travelers. We also visit Laxmanpur beach. Known as the sunset point at Neil Island, Laxmanpur beach is a vast open white sand beach. Post completion we drop you back to your hotel.

DAY 3: NEIL ISLAND – HAVELOCK
Today we depart from Neil to Havelock Island. Proceed to selected hotel to relax. After lunch enjoy visit Kala Pathar Beach and later on in evening visit the famous Radhanagar Beach. Radhanagar Beach has been consistently rated as one of the best beach in Asia. Watch a mesmerizing sunset on this beach before returning back to your hotel to relax and unwind.

DAY 4: TREKKING AND SCUBA IN HAVELOCK – PORT BLAIR
Elepahnta Beach is the most visited snorkeling destination in Havelock Island. Around 30 Minutes by boat, Elephant Beach flaunts one among the best reefs in Havelock Island. The great thing is that the reef here starts at a depth of less than a meter. Upon reaching Elephant beach, we rest and relax. Later, our guide takes you to snorkel underwater where you explore the amazing reef in Elephant beach. Later we return back from Elephant beach to the Havelock dock in a boat. Board a ferry back to Port Blair for overnight stay.

DAY 5: PORT BLAIR – BARATANG ISLAND
You will have an early morning departure to Baratang (110 Kms by road from Port Blair) a three hours drive. The travel would involve crossing the grand Andaman Trunk road, covered with creeks and dense forests on both the side. On the way, we will get an enchanting chance of seeing the habitations of one of the world’s Primitive tribes “The Jarawas”.
You will then cross the deep back water by vehicle ferry boats. Then it will be much more exited through the mangrove creeks. Journey by boat leading to the Lime stone Caves.

DAY :6 TRIP TERMINATES
After breakfast, checkout from hotel. Departure from Port Blair with Happy moments.

Inclusion:
Breakfast & Dinner
Ferry charges included
All sightseeing by AC Vehicle.
Stay on Double Sharing in AC Rooms
Snorkeling at Havelock Island

Exclusion:
Airfare
Any other meal, alcoholic or Non alcoholic beverages.
Anything else which is not mentioned above
Any Camera Tickets
Any other water sport activities.

Note: Minimum 6 members require for this trip.

description:
Brevet Indo-Nepal Trance Border

As Ernest Hemingway said “It is by riding a bicycle that you learn the contours of a country best, since you have to sweat up the hills and coast down them.”

A 1400 Kms Brevet approaved by ACP France and under the Aegis of AIR  for the very first time in India from New Delhi, India to 300 Kms short of Kathmandu,the Gateway to Everest, Birthplace of Buddha and back by Delhi Randonneurs on the 26th of January 2018. with support from Ratna Shreshta , President Of Cycling Club Of Dhulikhel, Nepal and his cycling team.

Crossing the borders of Nepal into unknown, undiscovered roads & territory, language and culture which may throw up plenty of obstacles!!! 
But who cares??? As long as it can raise the spirits and evoke a sense of trance and achievement on the Himalayas. It may not be easy but it will be worth every moment traversing through the unknown territories cutting across the dense wooded National Parks of Bardia and Banke on endless straight roads, the numerous gushing streams on the mountains which transforms into lazily meandering wide rivers on the plains, several uphill switchbacks to stunning descents. 
116 Hrs of exhilarating experience with warm smiling people full of curiosity while riding through small rural towns and villages from India to Nepal. 
A Resplendent Brevet crossing over the Border and spread across 2 countries, barring the first 300 Kms, the majority of the ride is in pristine untouched Nepal …majorly passing through Bardia National Park, Valmiki Tiger Reserve and Chitwan National Park.
Albeit the suggested Bike is an MTB but is doable pretty much on a Road bike….. 
The Ride commences on the night of 25th & 26th of January 2018, 
You shall be provided hydration and refreshments at designated points during the ride, and a coveted Finisher’s medal from DR club with a bagful of wonderful memories. Off course the official Audax will arrive after homologations but would take time.

Gates Officially Open now

Who can participate?
Anyone with AIR membership can participate but we recommend the following Eligibility Criteria – 
Finisher of any of the following or equivalent
G2G
TFN
DC
TOA
TOT
An SR title in the last 2 seasons
1000Kms Brevet

Please Register your ride on Audax site at - http://www.audaxindia.org/event-e-1806

Payment Details – Payment link will be sent privately to each registered rider after their profile is vetted.
Pls fill up the form   https://goo.gl/forms/b7IIvOlGirbu62Zi1
Indian/Nepalese Riders- Need to carry Government Photo Id’s and a few copies of that
Foreign Riders need to carry Passport and a valid Nepalese Visa to cross over .Visa can be obtained on arrivals at Border Immigration check points.
Indian Currency is valid in Nepal and conversion rate is 100 INR= 160 NR
Nepal is a very cyclist friendly country with cycle repair shops every 25-20 Kms and is also very easy on fining accommodation during the ride.
We would be riding the first 330 kms in India and enter Nepal via Mahendarnagar Border/Babbasa.
Route-
Delhi-Muradabad-Barielly-Banbasa-Border-Mahendernagar( Nepal)- Barida National Park-Kohalpur Back same way.

Night 1 Marshal Car/Drop bags would be available at 350Kms any clean Hotel –TBA
Night 2 Marshal Car/Drop Bags would be available at 700Kms Turn Back Point at  https://goo.gl/maps/6U5LVHaVXJ32  Hotel Rapti East–West Highway Lamahi,Nepal
Night 3 Again Same as Night 1

Interested?  Pls fill the form  here   https://goo.gl/forms/b7IIvOlGirbu62Zi1

description:
ArchiMate® 3.0 Course - Foundation and Practitioner (Level 1 and Level 2)

 https://architecture-center.com/archimate-3?ti=12393&location=Delhi,%20India&date=24/JAN/2018&price=1250%20GBP

ArchiMate® is an international standard established by The Open Group®. The standard describes the graphical language for enterprise architecture modelling.

This training course is intended to enable the learners to develop the skills and knowledge required to perform effective Enterprise Architecture modelling using the ArchiMate® 3.0 language.

During the training course participants learn about the structure of the language, as well as its concepts, principles and assumptions. The training focuses to great extent on practical exercises consisting in analyzing and creating models compatible with the ArchiMate® 3 standard.

During this course you will learn how to:
- prepare to ArchiMate examination and become ArchiMate Certified
- model notation specially invented to develop enterprise architectures
- adopt the approach that will accelerate your architecture practice

Training overview:
1. Course introduction
2. Foundations of Enterprise Architecture and the ArchiMate® language
3. Enterprise Architecture modelling using ArchiMate® 3.0
4. The business layer
5. The application layer
6. The technology layer
7. Modelling relationships
8. Modelling cross-layer dependencies
9. ArchiMate® viewpoints
10. The motivation extension
11. The implementation and migration extension
12. Language extension mechanisms
13. Certified tool support for the ArchiMate® language
14. Using the ArchiMate® language with other frameworks and languages
15. Course summary

Training materials are based on ArchiMate® 3.0 Courseware and have been accredited by The Open Group®.

description:
IIIT Delhi gets it that the most important thing for a band is to make their energy and presence felt. You want to make the crowd jump, rock to the tunes and sing along fervently. You want everyone to feel the music reach our soul. Bring out your riffs, shred off your solos, blast your rhythm and make the spectators ecstatic. The stage is all yours; now it’s on you to amaze Delhi with your performance and win the hearts of the people!

Event Heads:

Atieve Wadhwa (9810683550)
Radhika Ghosal (8860827741)
Shwetank Shrey (9709898267)
Varun Ramanathan (8800648545)

Event Structure:

The event will take place in two rounds - online and live. All participating bands will submit an audio/video recording of their performance. This submission will be scored by a team of musicians, on different aspects of the performance. The top 5 will be invited for performing live at Odyssey ‘18, where their performance’s evaluation will be a combination of audience reaction and the scores awarded by a panel of experienced judges. The band that amazes everybody with the best live performance that day will win a chance to open for the star at Nirvana Night @ Odyssey ‘18.

Rules:

--() All bands must register on the registration form given on the Facebook Page and/or website to be eligible for participation.

--() In the first round (online), all participating bands are expected to submit an audio/video submission of their performance of a song - either a cover of an existing song or an original song. The submission should be no shorter than 5 minutes and no longer than 15 minutes.

--() In the second round (live), selected bands will be expected to perform an original composition. The band will get 30 minutes inclusive of setup and teardown.

--() Repetition of any song in either of the rounds will lead to disqualification. Precisely, the song submitted for the online round will not be allowed for the live performance (if at all the band is selected). So if a band has only a single original song, then they are expected to perform that in the live round. 

--() The decision of the organising team and the judges will be final.
address: Odyssey, IIIT Delhi, Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology,  Okhla Industrial Estate, Phase III, (Near Govindpuri Metro Station), New Delhi, India

.
General Rules and Regulations:
1) Encore is IIITD's Cultural Fest, Odyssey's solo-singing competition.
2) There will be two categories. Indian and Western. Both are separate sub-events, rules about which will be shared later.
3) Participants can be from different colleges/schools but should be current students.
4) Teams per college/school: Unlimited
5) Team Size: 1
6) Time Limit: 3 to 5 minutes. Negative points for exceeding the time limit.
7) Every team is allowed to be a part of only one sub-event.
8) There are a total of 2 rounds: Prelims and Final.
Prelims will be online while the Final round will be at our college.
Teams selected only on the basis of the Prelims will qualify for Finals. (Further rules will be announced later.) 
9) A single hand instrument or background karaoke music is allowed, although it should be notified beforehand.
10) The karaoke file should be shared with us via email, 3 days prior to the day of the event.
11) Obscenity of any kind will not be tolerated and will lead to immediate disqualification.
12) The decision of the judges and organizers will be final and binding.

For further Information, feel free to contact:
Surabhi S. Nath 9910592923
Medha Sharma 9650000842
Mayank Jain 9711568658
Hrithvik Chandel
address: Odyssey, IIIT Delhi, Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology,  Okhla Industrial Estate, Phase III, (Near Govindpuri Metro Station), New Delhi, India

description: Speedcubing is a competition which requires you to solve a given cube as fast as you can. We here at IIITD are organizing this event in our hugely awaited cultural fest, Odyssey '18. This event is for all those people who think they have some skills in solving the cube and wants to showcase that while competeting with other cubers all around Delhi. Not only that but we also motivate anyone who knows about cubing to take part in this event. You will surely win if you have some skills otherwise you will get some exposure to speedcubing which will definitely give you a learning experience.
address: Odyssey, IIIT Delhi, Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology,  Okhla Industrial Estate, Phase III, (Near Govindpuri Metro Station), New Delhi, India

description:
“Dancing is the loftiest, the most moving, the most beautiful of the arts, because it is no mere translation or abstraction from life; it is life itself.”- Havelock Ellis

IIITD invites all dance enthusiasts out there to dance their heart out. Wear your dancing shoes and join us this Odyssey at the Solo Dance event Verve. Whatever your interest be - jazz, hip hop, contemporary, classical, bollywood or any other form, showcase your hidden talent and passion for dance. Put forward a short solo performance in the preliminary round to secure your spot in the semi-finals. And get ready for a Face Off in the final round. Registrations opening soon. Link for the website (2017):  http://odyssey.iiitd.edu.in/

Rules and Regulations:
1) Participation is open to all.
2) Any props/costumes if to be used should be arranged by the participants.Further any transporting or lodging costs must be taken care by the participant. Use of fire or any other inflammable object is restricted and accounts for negative marking.
3) All those selected for semi-finals will be required to carry a valid identity card to the campus on the day of the event.
4) The semifinalists must send their song track for semi-finals 2 days before the final event and also bring the same in a pen drive/CD on the day of the final event.
5) Participants will be shortlisted for the finals: FACE OFF ROUND according to their performance in semi-finals.
6) The decision of the judges will be final and binding in all conditions.
7) The organisers reserve the right to change the rules as they deem fit and change is unavoidable.
8) Organisers have the right to disqualify any team if they break any rule.
9) Time Limit: 3 to 5 minutes. Negative points for exceeding the time limit.'
10) Age Limit: 16-25 years
11) Teams per college: Unlimited

description:
Ham sa Ashram
info | yogavital ! com ! ar

Este encuentro es organizado por la Unión Internacional de Docentes de Yoga Vital U.I.D.Y.V. y es exclusivo para docentes de Yoga Vital. Todos los maestros y formadores de la escuela ofrecen un taller teórico-práctico, especialmente diseñado para esta oportunidad. El objetivo es mantener actualizados y favorecer el crecimiento profesional y espiritual de los docentes de Yoga Vital.

This meeting is organized by the International Federation of Teachers of Yoga Vital UIDYV and it is exclusively for Vital Yoga teachers. All teachers and school trainers offer a theoretical and practical workshop, designed especially for this occasion. The goal is to keep up to date and facilitate the professional and spiritual growth of Vital Yoga teachers.
Te esperamos.

Cada encuentro para docentes de ayer yoga vital es distinto y único no te lo pierdas, la temática propuesta es solo un ejemplo, para saber los temas correspondiente a este año consulta con tu coordinador. 
Each meeting for teachers of vital yoga is different and unique not miss it, the proposed theme just example, to know the consultation issues with your coordinator.

Compartir experiencias únicas con tus amigos

Meditación Vital
Técnicas especiales del ayer yoga vital para equilibrar nuestra mente, manejar las emociones y expandir la conciencia. Meditaciones del yoga vital para despertar la divinidad.

Yoga Vital en Duplas
Relacionado a trabajar con compañeros, generando retos en el campo de las asanas, pranayama y relajación. Consiste en practicar Yoga Vital junto a un compañero que no necesariamente debe tener un vínculo afectivo estrecho con nosotros, con quien estemos complementados y sincronizados para hacer asanas. De esta manera aprendemos del otro, y de nosotros mismos con mayor precisión y fuerza para las asanas, nos permite ver dónde nos equivocamos y fortalecer los puntos que estamos realizando bien. Es un trabajo en equipo en el más amplio sentido de la palabra.

Yoga Vital en Nidra ¨Sueño¨
Con un recorrido del cuerpo a través de la mente generando un trabajo de reprogramación y de aprendizaje. Nidra significa "Sueño profundo" no “soñar”. Soñar y no-Soñar no son lo mismo.
Técnica del yoga vital para despertar el estado de sueño conciente, no el estado de sueño profundo, refiriéndonos a la conciencia en el sueño.

Mantras del Yoga Vital
Fórmulas de sonido, canciones para el espíritu. aprendemos a desarrollar el deja del mantra de la tradición natha siddhas. 

Mándala y Yantra
Simbología, forma de los trazos del universo
Una realización geométrica de la divinidad envuelta en lo sagrado. Para despertar nuestra conciencia y nuestro punto de concentración a los atributos de la divinidad representada en los formas geométricas, los yantra del yoga vital.

Las leyendas de los yoguis inmortales 
Relatos, leyendas de los natha siddhas

Hidromasaje
El más maravilloso hidromasaje natural para soltar toda la tensión física, mental y emocional que vamos acumulando durante el año.
El agua de este río posee una carga energética muy especial, además de gran cantidad de minerales beneficiosos para el organismo.
The most wonderful natural to release all the physical, mental and emotional stress that we accumulate during bath.
The water from this river has a very special energy charge, plus lots of beneficial minerals for the body.	

Fangoterapia
Desde la antigüedad se conocen los efectos terapéuticos del contacto de ciertas arcillas con la piel. La fangoterapia no solo tiene importantes efectos desintoxicantes sinó que también tiene importantes beneficios a nivel de la estética. En este maravilloso lugar tenemos la opción de tomar la arcilla directamente de la madre tierra para colocarla sobre la piel. 
Since ancient times the therapeutic effects of contact with skin certain clays are known. The mud is not only important detoxifying effects it but also has significant benefits in terms of aesthetics. In this wonderful place we have the option of taking the clay directly from mother earth to put on the skin.

Magníficas caminatas por la sierras

Contaremos con la presencia de Maestros y Formadores de Ayur Yoga Vital International School

Lugar a realizarse: “Ham Sa Ashram”, en las sierras de los Comenchingones, prov de Córdoba; cerca de las localidades de Alpa Corral (35 km), y Río de los Sauces (17 km). Hay colectivos directo a Elena 37 km (Cordoba) de varios lugares del país. Desde Elena ofrecemos un transporte especialmente que los deja directamente en el lugar, son aproximadamente 37km. Saliendo el martes a la mañana, entre las 7 a.m. a 8:30 a.m. y regresando el viernes por la mañana. El transporte no está incluido en el precio, en el caso de necesitarlo, confirmar a que hora llega su colectivo a Elena y a que hora partes. 
"Ham Sa Ashram" in the mountains of Comenchingones, province of Cordoba; near the towns of Alpa Corral (35 km), and Rio de los Sauces (17 km). There is direct collective Elena 37 km (Cordoba) of various parts of the country. From Elena offer transport especially that leaves directly on the site, are about 37km. Departure on Thuesday morning, between 7:00 a.m. to 8:30 a.m. and returning on Friday morning. Transportation is not included in the price, in case of need, to confirm their collective time comes to Elena as part time.

description:
With the changes in social and political conditions, social entrepreneurship is now beginning to take shape in India very firmly. Individuals with innovative solutions to society's most pressing social problems have stepped forward to make a CHANGE. Both youngsters and experienced folk are no more afraid to try it as genuine career opportunity.

No matter how good their idea is or how much support government or external factors provide, they struggle with a lot of issues - Funding, Skilled man power, Centralized focus and lack of structure. If you’re one of these new social entrepreneurs or have already ventured into social entrepreneurship or if you are planning to do so, Join us for January 2018 Edition of SSDEL to learn from the experts about their experience, challenges that they faced and how did they overcome it.

description:
The Chadar Trek is a winter-trail in Zanskar region of Ladakh starting from Nimoo, in the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir.
Walls of this river valley are near vertical cliffs up to 600 m high and the Zanskar River (a tributary of the Indus) is only 5 m wide in places contributing to a natural phenomena which form a thick walkable sheet of ice upon the Zanskar river.
As the motorable road to Zanskar via Kargil close in winters of Ladakh, Chadar becomes the only way to commute to Zanskar from Leh for locals.

This approx 120 kms walk upon an always in construction ice sheet on a fast flowing river in temperatures ranging from -10 to -30 degrees Celsius is a lifetime adventure in every means.

If you like to challenge yourself then there are not many other things so accessible of this level. Even if you are a beginner or a first timer, we will make you do it with the right preparation and support.

For day by day details and registration tickets visit following link or call/whatsapp +919717110658/+917795256357/+918989571440
Or mail to camping | hmra ! in

 http://hmra.in/adventure/chadar-trek-ladakh-walk-upon-frozen-river-batch-1/
event_name: Chadar Trek | Ladakh - A walk upon the frozen river Batch 1

description:
Total Duration – 8 Nights / 9 Days (Ex Leh)
Maximum Altitude – 3303 m/ 10900 ft
Grade – Challenging
Best Season – January to February
Accommodation – Hotel/Guesthouse in Leh; Organized Campsite
Food – On trek – All meals included
Distance – 45 KM.


Short Itinerary: 90 Kms Trek 
Day 1: Fly to Leh - Altitude 11,400 ft. Stay in Hotel. 
Day 2: Drive to Tilad Do via Chilling - 11,400 to 10,390 ft. - Drive 65 kms - Stay in tent 
Day 3: Tilad Do to Shingra Koma - 10,390 - 10,550 ft. - Trek 10 KMs - Stay in tent 
Day 4: Shingra Koma to Tibb Cave - 10,550 - 10,760 ft. - Trek 15 KMs - Stay in tent 
Day 5: Tibb cave to Naerak camp - 10,760 - 11,150 ft. - Trek 12.5 KMs - Stay in tent 
Day 6: Naerak to Tibb Cave - 11,150 - 10,760 ft. - Trek 12.5 KMs - Stay in tent 
Day 7: Tibb Cave to Shingra Koma - 10,760 to 10,550 ft. - Trek 15 KMs - Stay in tent 
Day 8: Shingra Koma to Tilad Do, drive to Leh - 10,550 - 11400 ft. - Trek 10 KMs, Drive 65 KMs - Stay in Hotel 
Day 9: Return from Leh  
=====================================
Tariff:
Fixed Departure Dates: 6th, 8th, 13th, 15th, 20th, 22nd, 27th, 29th JAN 2018 &
3rd, 5th FEB 2018
INR: 20,500/- + 5% G.S.T. Extra 

Departure Dates: as per your requirement - customized date for your group in January-2018. Please let us know prior so that we can keep the date as the fixed departure date.

**NOTICE: According to Government of Jammu & Kashmir, Office of District Magistrate, Leh it has been decided to impose fees & restrictions on a number of tourist undertaking the Chadar trek. It was decided unanimously that for the ensuing season fees for foreign trekkers Rs. 2500/trip & for domestic trekkers Rs. 2000/ trip shall be enforced. So please participant you need to pay this separately on your reporting day.
if there is any change in local government tax, it will be borne by clients only. The company does not hold any responsibility or liability for that.
 ===================================
Price Includes:
•	Local transport during Trek
•	Highly Advanced and qualified Guide
•	Skilled Local Guide who has ample knowledge of the route
•	Vegetarian meals on the trek (Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner)
•	Cooks/Helper and other requisite staff.
•	Porters/mules for carrying common equipment (like rations/tents/utensils/)
•	Equipment’s – Tents on sharing basis / Sleeping bags / Sleeping Mattress/ Sleeping bag Inner
•	While on trek all meals will be provided. Meals will be freshly prepared and will be a mix of Indian, Chinese & Continental.
•	Basic First aid Kit with portal oxygen.
•	Insurance up to 1 lack is covered individually during route only.

Price Excludes:
•	G.S.T@5%.
•	Forest permits and camping charges extra as applicable - approx 2000/- plus 
•	Food in hotel/guesthouse won’t be included i.e for 1st and last day
•	Personal Porters for carrying trekker’s backpacks
•	Personal trekking equipment – like trekking poles or sleeping bag liners
•	Personal insurance or cost of emergency evacuation
•	Purchases of personal natures (like mineral water bottles/bottled or canned beverages/chocolates/dry fruits etc)
•	Food to/from the trailhead.

Additional Information:
•	Additional Night at Hotel in Leh @ Rs.1800 Per Person/Night on Twin Sharing Basis without meals.
•	Sightseeing/Taxi can be arranged from our travel desk at the Base Camp Leh on actual as per the rate of Leh Transport & Taxi Union.
•	Oxygen cylinders and first aid will be there during the trek. Rescue and medical team will be available on call in case of any emergencies.
•	Tented accommodation will be provided on twin/triple sharing basis while on the trek.
•	Single Room and Tent available at Rs. 8500 /- extra
=======================================
For Bookings Please call/Whatsapp
Deepankar: (+91) 9971214881
address: GioTrip.com, A-26, Paryavaran Complex, Ignou Road, New Delhi, India

description:
"The land of dreams and romance, of fabulous wealth and fabulous poverty, of splendour and rags, of palaces and hovels, of famine and pestilence, of genii and giants and Aladdin lamps, of tigers and elephants, the cobra and the jungle, the country of hundred nations and a hundred tongues, of a thousand religions and two million gods, cradle of the human race, birthplace of human speech, mother of history, grandmother of legend, great-grandmother of traditions, whose yesterday’s bear date with the modering antiquities. 
This is indeed India!"

Mark Twain couldn't resist her charms and we intend to turn it up a level.

With that in mind, we invite you all to the second edition of Maatribhoomi - The Open India Quiz.  An all-in-one quirky Bharat Darshan package awaits you this January with piping hot questions. And since we're in the capital, it'd be beneficial here if you knew kiska baap kaun hai....

Being in Delhi we've kept rules to a minimum so as long as you come in teams of 3 or less, everything's cool.

Further details to be announced soon. Follow this event page for more.

description:
Are you interested in gaining Parametric competency to push your design skills to the next level?Are you ready to learn a very exciting and powerful tool that will take your ideas and concepts to a whole new realm?

The two-day introductory workshop to parametric design with interactive digital simulation in Design, integrated within the algorithmic modelling. It will allow to investigate new formal solutions optimized for the architecture and design. It will also include a lecture and presentations on the subject of complexity in natural systems and how to incorporate it as a design tool.

The recent development of sophisticated computational design tools has instigated new ways of integrating computation in the design process; both within architecture and engineering disciplines. The new set of digital tools has infiltrated a bottom up system to open the design space towards a high level of complexity. The integration of these tools allowed the architect to generate and control complex information derived from a manifold of sources. Consequently, a more complex architectural order emerged as a reflection of sophisticated adaptive structures. 

The workshop will explore algorithmic strategies and the main techniques of form finding using the basic and intermediate level tools in Rhinoceros. The techniques will be applied at different scales, from architecture (surface modelling) to product level design. The model will further explore the fabrication methodologies in architecture and design.



STRUCTURE 
Program has been structured to teach participants the use of Rhino and associated plugins that help in achieving parametric fabrications, with a real design exercise. Participants will learn how to build and manage parametric data structures (from basic simple lists to complex data Structures) and to develop data driven geometry and envelops. This will help them in understanding and taking the data visualization to next level.
The workshop technical tutorials will include: 
-	Software interface
-	Components
-	NURBS and polygon meshes, Polygonal modelling in Rhinoceros
-	Lists & Data Management, Manipulation, Visualization
-	Geometry generation from data stream
-	Basic exercises (Attractor field, Surface subdivision, Morphing
-	Application of the learned techniques in a parametric design exercise.
-	Fabrication tools and plugins to realize your parametric designs.



TOOLS
All the participants should have following tools installed on their workstations: 
-	Rhinoceros SR12 or Higher (30 day Trial version can be downloaded from  https://www.rhino3d.com/download)
-	PanellingTools for Rhino ( https://wiki.mcneel.com/labs/panelingtools)
-	T Splines for Rhino ( http://www.tsplines.com/latestversion)
-	AutoCAD 
-	Adobe Suite



REQUIREMENTS 
-	There are no prerequisites, anyone from the design background or an enthusiast in the field of design are invited for this workshop.
-	Participants should bring their own computer with above mentioned software installed. More details will be sent to the registered participants.



A total of 20 seats available on first come basis.
For queries mail us at contact | sparro ! xyz

Other workshops in this series:
Scripting & Logic in Design & Architecture V2.03
 http://imojo.in/8ofbi9
Sensing & Interactive Technologies in Design V3.03
 http://imojo.in/ecn00q

description:
Oiseaux, Tigre et Dauphin du Gange
Du 13 au 28 janvier 2018 (16 jours).
Des contreforts de l’Himalaya au Taj Mahal.
L’Inde, un des plus grand pays du monde et un des plus peuplé abrite une très grande diversité de paysages et d’espèces. Organisé sur la base des anciennes provinces et États princiers qui existaient pendant le Raj britannique, le pays est composé de 29 états. Ce voyage dans le sous-continent Indien vous propose de découvrir les richesses naturelles du nord du pays. Nous débuterons notre périple dans l’état de l’Uttarakhand avec le Parc National de Corbett réputé pour ses Tigres du Bengale et ses oiseaux. Nous prendrons ensuite de l’altitude dans les contreforts de l’Himalaya riches en oiseaux montagnards. Notre route continuera dans l’Uttar Pradesh afin de découvrir les trésors de la rivière Chambal avec son rare et menacé Dauphin du Gange, la visite du Taj Mahal dans l’historique ville d’Agra s’imposera tout naturellement. C’est enfin dans le Rajasthan que nous ponctuerons notre beau voyage avec l’exploration du Parc National de Keolado appelé aussi Bharatpur connu par les ornithologues du monde entier pour sa richesse ornithologique, puis le Parc National de Ranthambore pour terminer dans une ambiance plus chaude des forêts tropicales sèches, plaines semi-arides et brousses au pays du Tigre du Bengale.
event_name: Séjour Inde du Nord - Oiseaux, Tigres et Dauphins du Gange
address: Inde Du Nord, New Delhi

description:
Hello Awaras, We are going on a 10day-10k backpacking trip across 3 states of Northeast in January 2018. We will be exploring entire Meghalaya, travel through the heart of Assam and end our journey at Roing-Mayodia of Arunachal Pradesh, the last major township of NE frontier of India. The plan is to meet local experts at all these places and understand the culture and traditions. Enjoy the local cuisines of these places, go on treks with us, camp under the stars and stay at tea gardens for a night. Understand Buddhism in Arunachal Pradesh, explore wildlife and Bihu dance in Assam and enjoy the snow clad mountains of Mayodia. We will cover the following places of NE-
Meghalaya-Umiam Lake, Shillong, Cherapunjee, Dawki, Mawlyngnong.
Assam-Kaziranga,Tea gardens,Majuli,Sibsagar.
Arunachal Pradesh- Roing and Mayodia Pass crossing Dhola-Sadia bridge.
The detailed route, more places and the related experiences/things to do will be updated in later posts. Just like our earlier BTA trips, this is also a not for profit trip for us and we will be sharing the cost equally among all the travelers.We will also be shooting a travel documentary of our journey.Join us on the biggest journey of BTA as we explore the hidden paradise of NE. Be Crazy, be wild. BeTheAWARA.

PC-Haren Gogoi and Ritubrata Sarma.
address: The Awara, A-99 Paryavaran Complex, New Delhi, India

description:
Brace yourselves and unlock your knowledge at the speed of thought. Here is your chance to finally show ‘em what you know as the Finance and Investment Cell, St. Stephen's College is back with its business quiz, Finatic, as part of National Finance Festival, Das Capital 2018. 

It promises to be bigger and better this year and is open to school students and undergraduates. Participate in teams of two (cross-college teams and lone wolves allowed). 

STRUCTURE: The quiz will be held in two rounds, prelims (online and offline), and finals. 

PRELIMS
1. Online Prelims 
Date: 4 January 2018
One connect will be given each day for 4 days with each question going into grand connect. The top team will qualify for the offline finals. Stay tuned to our blog:  http://finatictheblog.blogspot.in/
2. Offline Prelims 
Date: 12 January 2018
Participants will answer written offline questions. Top scoring teams will qualify for the final round. 

FINALS
Date: 12 January 2018 
Venue: St. Stephen's College, Delhi University
Rules will be explained on the day of the event. 

Register at:  http://tinyurl.com/finatic-dc18

In case of queries, contact:
Kashika Bansal: +91-9205371705
Pragati Rastogi: +91-9538767691
address: St. Stephen's College, Delhi, Delhi University, New Delhi, India

description:
National Street Food Festival is a vibrant representation of the myriad tastes of the country, complete with the exclusive delicacies and food-items belonging to the streets of Indian states. Around 500 best street food vendors from across the country travel to Delhi offering lip-smacking, delicious food, snacks, main courses food items, desserts and various kinds of food preparations and a host of several other ingredients to its visitors. 

In its 9th edition now, National Street Food Festival will be organised from 12th to 14th January, 2018 at Jawahar Lal Nehru Stadium, New Delhi.
address: Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, Lodhi Road, New Delhi, India

description:
This workshop is the backbone to enrich the creative skills of students and help them with all their queries in mind. It will immensely help in transforming first-hand knowledge from professionals to beginners. 

Let’s explore some best practices in designing and developing Android apps. This is where you’ll learn to rise above most other developers in the industry. If you want to learn more about Android performance, start here because performance matters. The course will cover the following topics in-detail for your better understanding.

> Class Hierarchies
> Centralisation of code (Base Classes)
> Memory Management
> Screen Sizes and densities
> File Structure (package names)

description:
Conference Theme : Digital Outreach and Future of Marketing Practices

Highlighting the country's potential in IT sector, Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has trusted in the youth which has the power to innovate and go for Design in India. PM Modi has stressed that the government would now work to make Digital India a way of life and governance in the country that would also help bridge the existing gap between the rich and the poor. 
To Make India digitally powered society and knowledge economy is the key objective of Digital India. Digital marketing caters to the needs of one of the most imperative segment of the nation which precisely comprises the entire country itself i.e. customer. It paves way for innovative structures of product development and delivery at most competitive prices. Information provided by digital marketing addresses the needs of knowledge society that is founded on pillars of freedom of expression, universal access to information and knowledge and respect for cultural and linguistic diversity. It empowers the customers who are well aware of their rights and duties and are capable enough to immune themselves against various mal practices. At the same time, digital marketing offers a massive platform to government undertakings to help them create awareness about assorted e-goods and services made available (Government E-market place, MEGHRAJ, E-basta ect.) for citizens while maintaining transparency. 

This topic of discussion undertaken by the conference shall bring frontward numerous insights in apprehending the impact of digital marketing in the light of Digital India creation.

description:
The world is increasingly becoming a jungle. Rape, Sexual Harassment in Streets, Violence at home –
such news has become commonplace today. MenEngage Delhi has been working with young people in
colleges and in the community building a greater consciousness around gender discrimination and
violence against women and how we can all become part of efforts to remove these stains from our
society. Today women have become more confident and empowered they are in a workplace and in the
public space. Men have not been easy partners in this change – sometimes they even resent it. Gender
Bender is an effort to change this and start discussions with the youth of today on how they can become
partners in the change towards a new World of Equality.

description:
Chadar Trek - Adventure Trek over Snow and ice covered River. 

The chadar trek is performed on a frozen river called the “Zanskar River”,during the summer this river doesn’t disappoint its enthusiastic tourist as it becomes a perfect location for river rafting expedition and during the winters it transforms into an ice sheet where the famous Chadar trek is performed. The frozen Zanskar river served and still serves as the traditional and only way of connect between Leh and Zanskar for the locals in the harsh winter months of Ladakh. It’s being used by the locals for centuries.

Short Itinerary 
Day 1: Arrival at Leh
Day 2: Drive to Chilling roadhead and trek to Tilad Do camp 3100m
Day 3: Trek to Gyalpo camp 3170m
Day 4: Trek to Dib Cave 3225m
Day 5: Trek to Naerak Camp 3390m.
Day 6: Trek to Dib Cave 3225m
Day 7: Trek to Gyalpo 3225m
Day 8: Drive back to Leh from Tilad Do

Details -  http://bit.ly/2gTXzBf

Contact - +91-9210638305, +91-9210903503
address: travel d'globe, New Delhi, India

description:
Kochani, jakiś czas temu moja przyjaciółka Beata, która od 20 lat zajmuje się organizowaniem wycieczek do Indii, zaproponowała mi, że zorganizuje wycieczkę do Indii tylko dla mnie i dla osób zainteresowanych duchowością. Przystałam na ten pomysł. Miałam zamiar pomóc moim znajomym w zdjęciu różnych przysiąg karmicznych (czyli coś w co dusza zainwestowała w poprzednich życiach a nadal się za nią ciągnie - to np. problemy w znalezieniu sobie partnera związane z przysięgą dwóch połówek), i innych obciążeń pochodzących z inkarnacji w Indiach. (Poprzednio podczas pobytu w Indiach robiłam to dla dwóch najbliższych mi osób i okazało się to bardzo mocne i skutkujące dużymi zmianami w ich życiu). 
Po niedługim czasie na mojej drodze stanęła Ula, która również wie jak wielką warość ma praca z biopolem człowieka jak i obciążeniami karmicznymi w miejscach mocy. Takie miejsca gdzie energia jaka bije z ziemii mocniej nazywane są czakramami (w Polsce jednym z słynniejszych jest Wawel). Ludzie od zawsze w takich miejscach stawiali świątynie z uwagi na okoliczność, że wszelkie działania, wypowiadane słowa jak i modlitwy zyskują większą moc. (Stąd mówi się, że gdy stolicą Polski był Kraków to nasz kraj był potęgą - czyli czakram wspierał królów w osiąganiu ich celów). Ula postanowiła mi pomóc i dołączyła do całego przedwsięzięcia. 
Po niedługim czasie w Anglii znalazł nas uczeń mistrza duchowego z Indii Gurdyala Sighna. Mistrz bardzo był zainteresowany poznaniem mnie jak i Urszuli - My nie mniej jesteśmy nim zainteresowane ;) . Tak zrodził się pomysł na jednodniowe spotkanie z Nim w New Delhi. Podczas tego spotkania posłuchamy jego wykładu, można będzie  zadać mu każde pytanie. Dodatkowo można zabrać ze sobą zdjęcie konkretnej osoby i dać swoją intencję dodtyczącą tej osoby - mistrz za pomocą modlitwy wstawienniczej jest w stanie pomóc w powrocie do zdrowia, poprawie relacji itd. Gurdyal nie bierze za to opłat - można dać pieniądze według swojego uznania. 
Po spotkaniu będziemy mieli czas wolny na zakupy na pobliskim targu - tu polecam pomoc Beaty. Sama kupuje tam maści dla całej rodziny, kosmetyki, pamiątki. Ceny wahają się pomiędzy 1-6 zł za takie pamiątki jak i kosmetyki. 
Następnie jedziemy do miejscowości Agra, w której zwiedzimy Taj Machal oraz czerwony fort. Następne miasto to Jaipur, po zwiedzaniu którego polecimy na reajskie wyspy Goa. Tam zaznamy kilkudniowego odpoczynku na złociście piaszczystych plażach w otoczeniu palm (nadmienię, że w Polsce będzie wtedy ok - 18 stopni Celsjusza.. Jeśli będzie taka prośba i Wasza wola możemy również popracować z Wami podczas zachodów słońca. Wszystko jest dla nas kwestią otwartą :) Z chęcią użyję moich dłoni by oczyścić Wam biopole czy uleczyć Wasze traumy w ciele. Urszula również służy pomocą w zależności od Waszej potrzeby serca.
Z Goa pojedziemy razem z miejscową ludnością sypialnianym pociągiem do Bombaju. (Osobiście kocham podróżowanie z hindusami. Są oni niezwykle zaciekawieni nami i naszą kulturą i należą do bardzo kontaktowych narodów). W Bombaju można będzie pojeździć po mieście z miejscowymi taksówkarzami (ok 6-10 zł za dwie godziny), spróbować miejscowej kuchni (ceny między 4-15 zł), no i to co mnie najbardziej cieszy zrobić zakupy :). Sama zawsze przywożę sobie kaszmirowe husty, tym razem prawdopodobnie będzie z nami Jaspal to i pomoże nam uzyskać cenę jak dla miejscowych - bo ostatnio podobno mocno przepłaciłam ;)  
W świątyniach polecam zakupić kadzidła robione przez mnichów - mają niezwykłą moc oczyszczania pomieszczeń. 
Wyjazd trwa 13 dni. Będzie to wyjątkowy czas dla Nas wszystkich. Zapraszamy szczególnie singli, osoby chętne poznania innej kultury,  odpoczynku połączonego ze zwiedzaniem i rozwojem duchowym. Jedziemy tam dla Was, z miłości do Was. Non profit. 
Zapisy i informacje u Beaty nr watssap : 48 606 107 157

description:
The event will be your one chance to have a heart to heart with a stranger from the LGBTQIA+ spectrum who wants to share their story with you.

Pre-register right away on the ticket link in order to receive the registration form when we're ready!

Write to IndianAcesFTW | gmail ! com for collaboration proposals. 

About Indian Aces:
Indian Aces is a self/non-funded award winning collective of asexual folk from or in India. Started in 2014 and relaunched in early 2016, the community has grown by leaps and bounds. 
It serves as an online community platform, generating awareness and receiving new members into their secret group on facebook. 
Members also participate and represent in various LGBTQIA+ events and platforms that have so far been devoid of representation from the asexual community in India. 
We organize meetups for community members all over the country and have been able to do a few internationally too. 
We conduct independent research on the subject, and conduct workshops for professionals and allies and aces to understand Sexuality and Asexuality.
address: Delhi, New Delhi, India

An introduction to the key elements of forensic psychology, including causes of criminal behaviour, different types of crime, psychology and the courtroom, offender profiling, and the management and treatment of offenders.

>>>Who is this course for

No previous knowledge or experience is necessary, only an interest in criminal psychology.

>>>What does this course cover
This course will examine the roles and responsibilities of forensic psychologists in police work, criminal investigation, eyewitness identification, mental defenses and competency issues, sexual abuse issues, juvenile forensics and death penalty cases.

description:
Ladies, Time to Pack n Fly!!!

With desert on one side and sea on another, Rann of Kutch is a place which happens to be on every traveller’s bucket list. And that is why Pack n Fly have introduced it for all women out there.

The package consists of a carnival of music and dance combined with historical palaces, tribal villages, temples, natural palaces and full moon night under the white desert. The stay at Rann Utsav Gujarat features tent city, paramotoring, ATV, rifle shooting, star gazing, pool table, archery, chess board, trekking, clubhouse, spa center, conference and meditation hall, camel cart excursion.

The list doesn’t end here; the package is curated to satiate every type of traveller. There is bird watching at Nalsarovar bird sanctuary, sight-seeing at Modhera Sun Temple and Ancient Harappan sites to feast eyes.

description:
How can we live the life we want, with authenticity, love and care?
How can we navigate the challenges of daily living while staying in integrity?
How can we overcome the fear and shame that get in our way of embracing love and truth?

We invite you to a one-and-a-half day event by Miki Kashtan on 'Living by Choice: Committing to Courage, Truth, and Love'

FACILITATED BY: Miki Kashtan - internationally renowned teacher of NVC and a practical visionary pursuing a world that works for all, based on principles, tools, and systems that support true collaboration without compromising efficiency. Miki co-founded Bay Area Nonviolent Communication and the Center for Efficient Collaboration, and has taught and consulted with individuals and organizations on five continents. She is the author of Reweaving Our Human Fabric and blogs at The Fearless Heart. Find out more about her and her work at Miki Kashtan & The Fearless Heart or head over to her website www.thefearlessheart.org.

REGISTRATION
To register, please click on or copy paste the link:  https://goo.gl/MtZdt6

CONTACT
 For any questions and concerns, please email us (newdelhipracticegroup | gmail ! com) or call us (+91 9313064344 / 9560345731 / 9810344789) 
You could also leave us a message on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/newdelhipracticegroup/

EVENT DETAILS:
Date:               3rd January, 3 pm-8 pm (includes dinner) 
                        4th January, 10 am-6 pm (includes lunch)
Venue:            D-333, Defence Colony, New Delhi

CONTRIBUTION: 
In the spirit of gift culture, this would be a consciously chosen amount that is based on your desire to contribute to the person offering the event and care for your own resources. We urge to give the maximum amount that would allow you to attend without challenging your pockets or your hearts. 
As a guideline, if participants were to contribute Rs. 3800 each, it would cover costs, and allow us to give the trainer an honorarium. And because we know that some people may not be able to give this amount, we are trusting that some people would have the willingness and capacity to give a lot more than Rs. 3800.

ABOUT THE EVENT: 
(In Miki's words)
Gandhi spoke about applying nonviolence in thought, word, and action. I have found that applying nonviolence becomes progressively more difficult the closer it is to thought. Many more people can refrain from physically violent acts than from using the language of judgments, threats, or demands. Similarly, many more people can train their language than can train their mind and heart to hold the commitment to live through the powerful combination of compassion, fierceness, and courage, with an uncompromising willingness to stand for truth. 

Nonviolent Communication (NVC), a process created by Marshall Rosenberg in the 1960s, is designed to do just that: to help us integrate as far as possible our commitment to nonviolence all the way into the deepest structures of our thoughts; to speak in ways that carry this commitment forward into all of our relationships; and to apply this consciousness in all our actions, including our participation in the collective enterprise called social structures.

As a contribution to this commitment, this event focuses on what nonviolence means in everyday life. As much as we want to take on the global challenges of our times and move toward transformation, unless we learn, in parallel and at the same time, how to live differently within ourselves and with each other, we run the risk of recreating the very structures we want to transform. 

Embracing nonviolence as a deep practice is something many of us find daunting, precisely because we have all internalized the structures of thought, word, and action that have brought us to where we are. To move from where we are to what we want to embrace, we will need to overcome the fear and shame that get in our way of embracing love and truth as core principles of being; to welcome conflict and challenge as a path towards greater wholeness; to examine our assumptions about ourselves and others; and to move closer to the dream of Rumi’s field, where we can live beyond thoughts of right-doing and wrong-doing.

When I was experimenting with how to support myself and others in doing this, I stumbled upon the possibility of creating a list of seventeen core commitments that can support our path by providing antidotes to the obstacles that keep us separate, desperate, and powerless. The commitments serve as a compass, a reminder, a scaffolding that can hold us in living by choice. These help us navigate the challenging struggles of everyday living so we can come to more and more integrity in how we live our lives, moving closer and closer to being aligned with our core values of nonviolence, and at the same time finding more and more gentleness toward ourselves when we don’t. 

The design of our time together is likely to include some combination of the following:

•	Focusing deeply on some of the commitments (based on what the group brings)
•	Experiential activities about how to lean on the commitments for greater choice
•	Daily practices for ongoing integration of this framework
•	Explorations of how to create enough support for the emerging shifts
•	Looking at an 18th commitment that’s being considered in addition 

REGISTRATION
To register, please click on or copy paste the link:  https://goo.gl/MtZdt6

You could also leave us a message on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/newdelhipracticegroup/
