description:
Itinerary:

Day No: 0
Delhi to Dehradun

Day No: 1
Dehradun – Pantwari – Nag Tibba Base camp ( 85 Km Drive & 8 Km Trek)
Drive to Pantwari village via Mussoorie, Kampty Fall.
· Reach Pantwari village and start first day trek to Nag Tibba Temple.
· Upon arrival at Nag Tibba, and overnight stay in camping

Day No: 2
Nag tibba Summit – Pantwari – Dehradun ( 3 Km to Summit, 8 Km Descent)
· Early morning after breakfast, start trek to Nag Tibba Top (3084 mtr)
· Reach nag Tibba top, and witness the stunning views of the Himalayan peaks like swargarohini, bandarpoonchh, kedarnath, Gangotri and etc.


Note:-
Fee for the trek- Rs.3999 (Per person).
(Includes all costs of the trek from Dehradun to Dehradun)
Please note: The breakfast during transit from Dehradun to Panthwari & Delhi to Pantwari is not included in the trek fee, vice a versa.
From Delhi to Delhi- Rs.5499 (Per Person)
(Includes all costs of the trek from Delhi to Delhi)

Booking:
The last day to book your slot is 27th DECEMBER 2017, after which, no bookings will be permitted. T&C Apply. (As per bookings)
Payment
You have to make the payment in our bank account mentioned below:
BANK NAME- BANK OF BARODA
ACCOUNT NAME- SHIVAM GUPTA
ACCOUNT NUMBER- 56190100000334
IFSC CODE- BARB0BHOLAN  {Fifth character is zero}

Contact no. 9711240513

Indiantramp17 | gmail ! com

The panorama of the Himalayan snow peaks of Garhwal and Himachal offers views of some of the famous peaks from here including the Bandarpoonch, Swargarohini, Srikanth and Black peak. Enjoy the magnificent views of Gujjar or shepherds dotting the envrons from the Nag Tibba Top.
Nag Tibba trek route is a circular trek where the finish point is different from the start point and at no time there is an overlap of trail. On your way down you will go through a completely contrasting landscape having a dense mixed forest of Oak, Rhododendron, Cider and Alpine. Adding to the beauty of the trek is the opportunity to visit a couple of quaint villages which are extremely scenically situated amidst thick Deodar forests. Icing on the top would surely be the opportunity to dunk one’s feet into a cold and inviting stream at the end of the trek.
Another great attraction of this trip is the camping experience. There are beautiful meadows and thick jungles along the trail offering numerous scenic camping locations. Nag Tibba trekking is suitable for people of all age groups having reasonable fitness levels who seek adventure.

description:
Trip Date: 30th Dec to 04th Jan'2018
Package Cost: INR 19,500 Per Person
Destination Covered: Port Blair, Havelock Island, Neil Island, Baratang 

Detailed Itinerary: 

DAY 1: ARRIVAL IN PORT BLAIR
On stepping out in the beautiful Port Blair Airport, you will be received and escorted to your hotel. After your comfortable check-in, you will be guided on a casual visit to Carbyn’s Cove Beach, the coconut- palm fringed beach and the Science Centre, a refreshing museum which encounters the science. In the evening, you will attend the exciting moving Light and Sound Show at Cellular J*il, where the saga of the heroic freedom struggle is brought alive about the happenings in the J*il prior to the independence.

DAY 2: PORT BLAIR – NEIL ISLAND
Check out from the hotel and board a ferry to Neil Island, upon reaching the island you will be transferred to your respective resort. Rest and then proceed to Bharatpur Beach and Sitapur Beach and Laxmanpur beach Firstly we cover, Bharatpur Beach. The closest white sand beach to Neil dock, Bharatpur beach. The reef here is still unexplored and travelers can avail snorkeling, glass bottom boats rides and Jet Ski rides here. Then, visit to Sitapur beach which is a perfect picturesque beach for travelers. We also visit Laxmanpur beach. Known as the sunset point at Neil Island, Laxmanpur beach is a vast open white sand beach. Post completion we drop you back to your hotel.

DAY 3: NEIL ISLAND – HAVELOCK
Today we depart from Neil to Havelock Island. Proceed to selected hotel to relax. After lunch enjoy visit Kala Pathar Beach and later on in evening visit the famous Radhanagar Beach. Radhanagar Beach has been consistently rated as one of the best beach in Asia. Watch a mesmerizing sunset on this beach before returning back to your hotel to relax and unwind.

DAY 4: TREKKING AND SCUBA IN HAVELOCK – PORT BLAIR
Elepahnta Beach is the most visited snorkeling destination in Havelock Island. Around 30 Minutes by boat, Elephant Beach flaunts one among the best reefs in Havelock Island. The great thing is that the reef here starts at a depth of less than a meter. Upon reaching Elephant beach, we rest and relax. Later, our guide takes you to snorkel underwater where you explore the amazing reef in Elephant beach. Later we return back from Elephant beach to the Havelock dock in a boat. Board a ferry back to Port Blair for overnight stay.

DAY 5: PORT BLAIR – BARATANG ISLAND
You will have an early morning departure to Baratang (110 Kms by road from Port Blair) a three hours drive. The travel would involve crossing the grand Andaman Trunk road, covered with creeks and dense forests on both the side. On the way, we will get an enchanting chance of seeing the habitations of one of the world’s Primitive tribes “The Jarawas”.
You will then cross the deep back water by vehicle ferry boats. Then it will be much more exited through the mangrove creeks. Journey by boat leading to the Lime stone Caves.

DAY :6 TRIP TERMINATES
After breakfast, checkout from hotel. Departure from Port Blair with Happy moments.

Inclusion:
Breakfast & Dinner
Ferry charges included
All sightseeing by AC Vehicle.
Stay on Double Sharing in AC Rooms
Snorkeling at Havelock Island

Exclusion:
Airfare
Any other meal, alcoholic or Non alcoholic beverages.
Anything else which is not mentioned above
Any Camera Tickets
Any other water sport activities.

Note: Minimum 6 members require for this trip.

description:
If it’s New Year’s Eve, it is time to do something special. Kunzum has curated just what you may want for this year. In the artistic and historical region of Shekhawati in Rajasthan.

You will stay in the stunning Surajgarh Fort surrounded by beautiful landscapes, a fort on a hill, an ancient stepwell, and vibrant villages. Activities will include art, pottery, bangle-making and kite-flying for not only children but adults too. And loads of food, drinks and music over bonfires under chilly, starry nights.

ACTIVITIES / ITINERARY
DECEMBER 30
7:00 a.m.: Leave Delhi / Gurgaon for Shekhawati in the Kunzum Travel Truck or in your personal transport
10:00 a.m.: Brunch on the way
1:00 p.m.: Reach Surajgarh Fort
1:00 p.m. – 3:00 p.m.: Check-in, freshen up and lunch
3:00 p.m. – 6:00 p.m.: Option to explore a bit of Surajgarh and to go to nearby fort for sundowner. You can also interact with a potter, bangle-makers, kite makers and artists specializing in Shekhawati art.
7:00 – 11:00 p.m.: Bonfire dinner with entertainment by local Rajasthani singers at the local stepwell or in Surajgarh Fort itself.

DECEMBER 31
7:00 a.m. – 8:00 a.m.: Breakfast for those going for tour of Shekhawati. Others may have breakfast at leisure.
8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.: Full day guided sightseeing tour of Shekhawati region known for its bazaars, havelis with frescos and exquisite woodwork, stepwells, temples, forts and other historical buildings. [This is optional at an extra charge]. Those not going may spend day at leisure or explore on their own. They can also interact with a potter, bangle-makers, kite makers and artists specializing in Shekhawati art.
1:00 p.m. – 2:00 p.m.: Lunch for those at Surajgarh Fort
4:30 p.m. – 5:30 p.m.: Go for sundowner if you missed it on previous day and / or walk around villages and fields in the vicinity
7:00 – 11:00 p.m.: New Year Eve bonfire dinner with entertainment by a local DJ

JANUARY 1
HAPPY NEW YEAR!!! Have breakfast at leisure, opt to explore Shekhawati and return when one wants to.

ABOUT SHEKHAWATI
The Shekhawati region is a collection of towns and villages in Rajasthan, and about a five hours drive from Delhi. These towns are known for their old havelis (bungalows) with frescos, historical monuments and bazaars. The region is the ancestral home of many a Marwari and Bania families, known for their sharp business acumen, who invested in the art and architecture in the area.

ESSENTIAL TRIP INFORMATION
* Dates: December  30, 2017- January 1, 2018 (2 Nights / 3 Days)
* Accommodation: Surajgarh Fort
* Travel: In the Kunzum Travel Truck, a 9-seater luxury van. The distance of about 250kms from Delhi will be covered in about six hours. Option to go in your own vehicles.

COST
* Deluxe Room: Rs. 24,000
* Suite Room: Rs. 26,000
* Early Bird Discount: Rs. 2,000 if booked by September 30, 2017
* Club Kunzum Member Rate: Deluxe Room – Rs. 23,000 / Suite Room – Rs. 25,000
* Children under 5: No extra charge if sharing bed with adults.
* Anyone over 5 years age sharing room with extra bed: Rs. 9,000 per person

INCLUSIONS
* Accommodation for two adults for 2 Nights / 3 Days at Surajgarh Fort. Extra persons sharing room given above.
* Meals: Breakfast x 2, Lunch x 2, Dinner x 2 for two people
* Non Alcoholic Welcome Drinks on arrival
* Dinner over bonfire and Rajasthani music on Dec 30
* Dinner over bonfire and music by local DJ on Dec 31
* Complimentary Tea / Coffee maker in the room
* Interactions with local bangle makers, potters and kite makers
* 2 Bottles of Mineral Water per room per day
* Use of swimming pool
* All taxes 

EXCLUSIONS
* Full day sightseeing tour of different towns of Shekhawati in the luxury Kunzum Travel Truck at Rs. 2,000 per person (subject to a minimum of 6 people). Children to be charged the same if they occupy a seat. Lunch will have to be paid for directly by guests on this day if they are having during the tour. Guests would be recommended suitable places and they may pay directly.
* Interaction and lessons by artist specializing in Shekhawati art: Rs. 1,000 per person including children (subject to minimum 4 guests)
* Camel Cart Ride: Rs. 400 per person including children. Each cart will take 5-6 people.
* Transport from Delhi and back in the luxury Kunzum Travel Truck: Rs. 2,000 per person (subject to a minimum of 6 people). Children to be charged the same if they occupy a seat.
* Alcoholic beverages, additional bottled water / soft drinks, laundry, shopping and any other expenses of personal nature.
* Additional tea / coffee / snacks ordered in hotel.

FOR QUERIES, CALL A KUNZUM TRAVEL CURATOR
* Address: Kunzum Travel Café, T-49, HauzKhas Village, New Delhi 110016, India
* Mobile: +91.9650702777 / +91.9650701365 / +91.9650701387
* Landline: +91.11.498 44444
* Email: wetravel | kunzum ! com
* Web:  http://kunzum.com

description:
If it’s New Year’s Eve, it is time to do something special. Kunzum has curated just what you may want for this year. In the artistic and historical region of Shekhawati in Rajasthan.

You will stay in the stunning Surajgarh Fort surrounded by beautiful landscapes, a fort on a hill, an ancient stepwell, and vibrant villages. Activities will include art, pottery, bangle-making and kite-flying for not only children but adults too. And loads of food, drinks and music over bonfires under chilly, starry nights.

ACTIVITIES / ITINERARY
DECEMBER 30
7:00 a.m.: Leave Delhi / Gurgaon for Shekhawati in the Kunzum Travel Truck or in your personal transport
10:00 a.m.: Brunch on the way
1:00 p.m.: Reach Surajgarh Fort
1:00 p.m. – 3:00 p.m.: Check-in, freshen up and lunch
3:00 p.m. – 6:00 p.m.: Option to explore a bit of Surajgarh and to go to nearby fort for sundowner. You can also interact with a potter, bangle-makers, kite makers and artists specializing in Shekhawati art.
7:00 – 11:00 p.m.: Bonfire dinner with entertainment by local Rajasthani singers at the local stepwell or in Surajgarh Fort itself.

DECEMBER 31
7:00 a.m. – 8:00 a.m.: Breakfast for those going for tour of Shekhawati. Others may have breakfast at leisure.
8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.: Full day guided sightseeing tour of Shekhawati region known for its bazaars, havelis with frescos and exquisite woodwork, stepwells, temples, forts and other historical buildings. [This is optional at an extra charge]. Those not going may spend day at leisure or explore on their own. They can also interact with a potter, bangle-makers, kite makers and artists specializing in Shekhawati art.
1:00 p.m. – 2:00 p.m.: Lunch for those at Surajgarh Fort
4:30 p.m. – 5:30 p.m.: Go for sundowner if you missed it on previous day and / or walk around villages and fields in the vicinity
7:00 – 11:00 p.m.: New Year Eve bonfire dinner with entertainment by a local DJ

JANUARY 1
HAPPY NEW YEAR!!! Have breakfast at leisure, opt to explore Shekhawati and return when one wants to.

ABOUT SHEKHAWATI
The Shekhawati region is a collection of towns and villages in Rajasthan, and about a five hours drive from Delhi. These towns are known for their old havelis (bungalows) with frescos, historical monuments and bazaars. The region is the ancestral home of many a Marwari and Bania families, known for their sharp business acumen, who invested in the art and architecture in the area.

ESSENTIAL TRIP INFORMATION
* Dates: December  30, 2017- January 1, 2018 (2 Nights / 3 Days)
* Accommodation: Surajgarh Fort
* Travel: In the Kunzum Travel Truck, a 9-seater luxury van. The distance of about 250kms from Delhi will be covered in about six hours. Option to go in your own vehicles.

COST
* Deluxe Room: Rs. 24,000
* Suite Room: Rs. 26,000
* Early Bird Discount: Rs. 2,000 if booked by September 30, 2017
* Club Kunzum Member Rate: Deluxe Room – Rs. 23,000 / Suite Room – Rs. 25,000
* Children under 5: No extra charge if sharing bed with adults.
* Anyone over 5 years age sharing room with extra bed: Rs. 9,000 per person

INCLUSIONS
* Accommodation for two adults for 2 Nights / 3 Days at Surajgarh Fort. Extra persons sharing room given above.
* Meals: Breakfast x 2, Lunch x 2, Dinner x 2 for two people
* Non Alcoholic Welcome Drinks on arrival
* Dinner over bonfire and Rajasthani music on Dec 30
* Dinner over bonfire and music by local DJ on Dec 31
* Complimentary Tea / Coffee maker in the room
* Interactions with local bangle makers, potters and kite makers
* 2 Bottles of Mineral Water per room per day
* Use of swimming pool
* All taxes 

EXCLUSIONS
* Full day sightseeing tour of different towns of Shekhawati in the luxury Kunzum Travel Truck at Rs. 2,000 per person (subject to a minimum of 6 people). Children to be charged the same if they occupy a seat. Lunch will have to be paid for directly by guests on this day if they are having during the tour. Guests would be recommended suitable places and they may pay directly.

* Transport from Delhi and back in the luxury Kunzum Travel Truck: Rs. 2,000 per person (subject to a minimum of 6 people). Children to be charged the same if they occupy a seat.
* Alcoholic beverages, additional bottled water / soft drinks, laundry, shopping and any other expenses of personal nature.

description:
• What we'll do
Ganga is not just a river, it a source of spirituality, the source of life and source of Indian culture. Let's celebrate our new year on a bank of this mystical river. We are going to stay in a forest camp about 40 minutes trek from Lakshman Jhula. Yes, we will also do a new year eve party with music and dance. Yes, we will also go for White Water Rafting (Please, it is never too cold for Rafting, we do it more in winters)!

We will walk around the town, explore cafes, Beatles Ashram, stories of the town, waterfall trek, spiritual talks, evening Ganga aarti and more. Celebrate the new year with nature, peace, and Maa Ganga. We do it every year like this! Come Join Us.

• What to bring
Transport from Delhi, Food, Stay in Camps, walks, and White Water Rafting in included in the plan. All you need to bring is a bag full of clothes, your daily needs, and happiness. We have limited seat of 12 people, so you need to book soon.

Please do remember we have limited seat of 12 people, as we are Travelers and not Tourists and we do not believe in taking Big Groups, we always want to keep things personalized. So, contact us soon.

description:
DESTINATION - BUNDI
A Royal forest alongside a magical Lake, a Historical fort, and a tent pitched at the zenith of it all, to witness the first Sun of this coming New year, slowing shaping into New hopes and dreams – Hold on tight as we trail across Rajasthan’s beaming beauty this New Year’s Eve. 

Day 0 (29th Dec, Fri) – Get together at Kashmere Gate metro exit 7 and join your Tour Leader and the group in AC tempo Traveler that will start at 9PM for Bundi. Enjoy the ride or just sleep tight to wake up in Rajasthan by 7AM next morning.

Day 1(30th Dec, Sat) – Check-in to your Hotel and Freshen up. Have breakfast, loose the lethargy and start the city walk with your Tour Guide. Set on foot to explore the centuries old Taragarh Fort, Raniji Ki baoli, Dhabhai Kund and sit by the grand Jait Sagar Lake. Have Lunch on the way and leave with the group to witness the sunset from Dargah Sahib. On foot traverse the Art of this bustling Golden town of a numerous Lakes. Hereon, reach your Hotel, have dinner in the garden and retire in your rooms for the night. 

Day 2(31st Dec, Sun) – Rise and shine as we trek to the neighboring hill to reach the Historical Cenotaphs surrounding Bundi. Have breakfast on the way and proceed to a beautiful Hidden waterfall cascading into a natural pool. Fancy a swim or two and head back to the city. Check out from hotel and leave for Dugari Forest, 45KMS from Bundi, our location for New Year Jungle Party. The road to the ancient Dugari Fort and forest runs beside the Dugari Lake. Enjoy the New Year eve in the Jungle with Music, bonfire and Rajasthani cuisine.  As the night encompasses, retire in your camps or just stay up chilling. 

Day 3(1st Jan, Mon) – See the first Sun of New year atop Dugari fort, an absolute spectacle where the Lake, the winter mist, the numerous trees and Sun come along in harmony. Retreat back to Bundi for breakfast and Check out from the Hotel. Leave for Delhi by 11AM stopping by villages and hamlets. Reach Delhi by 10PM on Monday, the 1st January. 

Inclusions
Transport – Delhi to Bundi and back in AC Tempo Traveller 
Meals – 30th (B/L/D), 31st (B/L/D), 1st 1(B) 
Activities – New Year’s Eve Jungle Party + Bonfire + Jungle camping + Beverage & Food, Food walk, Village walk and exploration, Waterfall hunt, Lake and Forts.
Accommodation – Twin and Triple sharing 1N Hotel & 1N Jungle camp+sleeping bags 

PRICE - 7499/- call/whatsapp 8744090952 or 9501299206 for enquiry

description:
Please join us in South Jersey for Pinsomnia 2017 on December 29th, 2017 for pinball, fun, pinball, food, and pinball! (Did I mention pinball?)

The format for the main event will be a group knockout. You will play in groups of four, where the bottom two players get strikes each round.  Games are ramdonmized on balanced settings, groups are determined by swiss standings.  In case of groups of three, only the bottom player gets a strike. The main event starts at 8 PM and continues until there is a champion, with the top four getting trophies and cash prizes! The side tournament starts an hour earlier. 

The side tournament will be on one game, and will be based on a player's 3 best scores during a qualifying period. Then for the Finals, a single elimination bracket of the top 8 players will determine a champion. 

$25 entry fee for main tournament, which also includes one entry in the side tournament.  You can pay at the door. Additional entries for the side tournament are $3 for one game, and $5 for two. 50% of the proceeds from the side tournament will go to the Atlantic City Rescue Mission, the rest will be paid out to the top four finishers.

Payouts for the top four finishers in both the main and side events will be approximately 40%, 30%, 20% and 10%.

Final decisions will be made by the tournament directors and will be based on the official IFPA / PAPA ruleset.

Quick summary:

Doors open at 6:30 PM.

Side tournament.

48 player limit. 

Cash prizes.

Points toward players' world pinball rankings. 

Refreshments included.

Head to Head pinball machine on site. 

Email Mark at pinsomnia | outlook ! com for more info!

description: Hi,Greetings from Travel Triangle !!Thank you for showing interest in "Mcleodganj-Triund Trekking Escape" with Travel Triangle..!!Starting @ 6999/- Call us@98216-98620 Mcleodganj-Triund Trekking EscapeDELHI - MCLEODGANJ - TRIUND - DELHITrip Duration: 2 Nights and 3 days29th December- 2nd January 2018Description:McLeod Ganj is a village in the suburbs of Dharamshala, in Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh, India. It has an average elevation of 2,082 meters (6,831 feet). It is situated in the lap of Dhauladhar Range, a branch of the southern outer Himalayas. The village is named after Lord David McLeod, the English lieutenant governor of Punjab, who founded it in 1848 as a retreat from the heat of the plains.Nature lovers and newlyweds love this hill station as it is considered a treasure trove of romance and scenic beauty.The Scenery will leave you completely breathless and you won't stop saying words like incredible, awesome, amazing.Travelogue: Here's a travelogue of one of traveller who shared his beautiful journey with us. description:
Kasol Trip
New Year, 2017 Celebration with Himachal Hills Festival 
About Himachal Hills Festival – Camping & Music Festival
 
Himachal Hills Festival Dec, 2017 going to be organized at Chalal, Kasol marking end of year 2017 with mix of great music, live concert, drinks & beverages, food –local & Israeli, exciting game stall and spending nights in comfortable & cosy tents in the amidst environs. This event presented by Summer Hills Festival.
 
 
Departure from: Delhi & Chandigarh
Trip Date: 29 Dec, 2017 – 2 June, 2017
Seats: 250
 
Trip Inclusions:
✓ Both side travel via AC deluxe bus
✓ 2 nights & 3 days stay camps near the festival venue (~ 300m)
✓ 2 breakfast at the campsite during the trip
✓ 2 Meal Coupons to enjoy the cusine of Himachal Hills Festival, Dec 2017
✓ Stay in comfortable camps with mats or mattress, blanket or sleeping bag near Parvati River
✓ Camps double sharing basis. 
✓ Neat & clean location near the river
✓ Sanitary arrangement at the camp site. 
✓ For safety- seperate zone for couples & girls.
✓ Entry to festival venue with passes or entry band.
✓ Nature walk of Kasol: towards Chalal, Rasol etc.
✓ Trip manager during the trip.
✓ Adventure actitvities like rappelling, mountain climbing etc. (chargeable & optional)
✓ Barbeque & Hookah at campsite (optional & chargeable)
Detailed Itinerary

Day 1: Departure from Delhi
OPTION 1: From Delhi
• Report to Vidhan Sabha Metro Station at round 6:00 PM
• Roll call and boarding the bus for Kasol (Distance 570 kms from Delhi, travel time is more than 15hours).
• Departure time of bus at 6:30 PM
• Overnight travel in the bus.
 
OPTION 2: From Chandigarh
• Boarding Bus from Chandigarh around 11:00 PM
• Departure of 11:30 PM
• Overnight journey in the bus.

Day 2:
• Arrival to Kasol in the morning.
• Camps allocation & Camps check-in and rest for a while after long journey.
• At 2 pm, Entry to venue of Himachal Hills Festival: Enjoy the festival with full of music, live concert, delicious food stall, exciting games stall till late night.
• After enjoying the festival, back to camps and give relaxation to your legs & overnight stay in camps.

Day 3:
• Wake up, Refresh & have yummy breakfast with tea at Campsite.
• Enjoy the adventure activities set by Himachal Hills Festival, enjoy the nature walk to chalal, Rasol market & cafe, visit to Manikaran.
• At 2 pm, Entry Himachal Hills Festival Dec, 2017 - enjoy the new year celebration with unlimited load of fun at festival venue.
• Overnight stay in camps.
Day 4:
• Wake up, Refresh & have yummy breakfast with tea at campsite.
• Free to exlpore Kasol with independent activities till evening.
• Can visit to Tosh or Malana- experience the snow covered peak or snowfall. - By evening depart from Kasol.
• Overnight journey from Kasol to Delhi.
Day 5:
• Back to Delhi by early morning with relax mood and sweet memories.
 
 
Trip Cost (INR): 7,000/- per person (double Sharing)
​​   7500/- per person (Single Sharing)
*In case someone need package without travel, then 2000/- get deducted from above cost.
 
Booking amount:
• INR 3000/- per person for booking and rest at the time of boarding bus and after that you will get advance booking receipt via mail from as confirmation.
Payment mode:
1) Bank transfer
2) Offline (Direct to office)
 
Cost Excludes:
• Lunch
• Anything else that is not mentioned in the inclusions
• Any meals other than those specified in programme
• Expenses of personal nature such as tips, telephone calls, laundry, Medic*tion etc
• Any other item not specified in 'cost includes'
• Any Monument entry fees/Camera Fees.
• Any other Adventure activity.
TERMS & CONDITIONS:
• All bookings are strictly subject to availability and confirmation by payment of Non-refundable Advance.
• Management shall not take responsibility of a missing items from Resort or its premises, hence requested not to travel with too much ornaments, jewellery, cash and other etc.
• In case if going out of Resort please deposit valuables in safety locker with the security of our Hotel Manager.
• All our packages are ‘group packages’ and same services/items are applicable for each person in the group.
• Total cost will not be affected if there is any reduction in the number of persons.
• Any meal, activity or service not availed by the client will not be adjusted in the package cost and non-refundable under any circumstances.
• We entertain only those persons at the campsite for whom the booking has been made. No additional persons will be entertained under any circumstances.
 
CANCELLATION POLICY:
• No refund shall be made under any circumstances.
• Booking Amount is Non-Refundable
Trip organized & managed by Go Green Holidays:
For Booking Contact :- +91-99944-70419, +91-9500529297.
Gmail:- gogreentravelss | gmail ! com

description:
Every year, Thousand of little angels staying in orphan castles and shelters wish upon the star, decorating their very special Christmas Tree, with a hope that Santa will come and drop their presents under the tree.

But not all those innocent wishes come true. 
This Christmas, we the children of the Lord have pledged to answer all those tiny prayers by becoming Santa for little brothers and sisters and we believe that we are not alone, for you are with us :)

In this charismatic festival of giving, together, let’s keep the spirit of Christmas alive with by getting down through the chimneys of these orphanages assuring the children receive the magical gifts they prayed for. 
Contribute with a gift of your choice, anything that fits your budget and you find suitable to make them smile this Christmas.

HELP US BRING A SMILE TO A CHILD'S FACE,
BE A SANTA FOR SOMEONE.

Date: December 25, 2017
Venue: Delhi-NCR

ABOUT THOUSAND THOUGHTS 

Thousand Thoughts is project initiated and managed by Enlightened Souls Foundation, a Non-Profit Organization that works towards the goal of sustainability, and promote mental health.
Our Mission is to work towards the goal of sustainability, with an approach to eliminate negative beliefs and help an individual realize his greatest potential, using the tools of Neuro-Linguistic Programming that produce harmonious results for humankind and mother earth.
address: Saket, Pvr Anupam Saket Road, New Delhi, India

description:
CHRISTMAS GOODIES ? 
It’s a time to wish Christmas and new year. The new year is about to start and exchanging of gift is a MUST. 
Why thinking so much? 
HOMEMADE CHOCOLATES are the best options.

description:
The First Bike Ride is always one of the most memorable....

Shimla features a subtropical highland climate (Cwb) under the Köppen climate classification. The climate in Shimla is predominantly cool during winters and moderately warm during summer.[24] Temperatures typically range from −4 °C (25 °F) to 31 °C (88 °F) over the course of a year.[25]

The average temperature during summer is between 19 and 28 °C (66 and 82 °F), and between −1 and 10 °C (30 and 50 °F) in winter. Monthly precipitation varies between 15 millimetres (0.59 in) in November and 434 millimetres (17.1 in) in August. It is typically around 45 millimetres (1.8 in) per month during winter and spring, and around 175 millimetres (6.9 in) in June as the monsoon approaches.

The average total annual precipitation is 1,575 millimetres (62 in), which is much less than most other hill stations but still much heavier than on the plains. Snowfall in the region, which historically has taken place in the month of December, has lately (over the last fifteen years) been happening in January or early February every year.[26]

The maximum snowfall received in recent times was 38.6 centimetres (15.2 in) on 18 January 2013. On two consecutive days (17 and 18 January 2013), the town received 63.6 centimetres (25.0 in) of snow

Main Places
Jakhu Ropeway[58] connects Jakhu temple to the ridge ground and is the first ropeway in Shimla.
Tattapani is a beautiful location on the bank of Lake satluj just 45 kilometers (28 mi) from Shimla. On a trip from Shimla one cross Mashobra and Naldhera. Tattapani is famous for its mineral rich hot springs. Covering an area of 1square km, these sulphur springs are believed to have medicinal value, providing relief from ailments like joint pain, fatigue, stress relief, improve blood circulation, reduces fat and skin diseases. One can also enjoy river rafting and boating in Sutlej lake. The hot spring health care center at Tattapani is famous for its well managed hot springs together with ayurveda, naturopathy and yoga, which give an ambiance of a resort with its lake view rooms and organic Indian restaurant.
The Mall: The Mall is the main shopping street of Shimla. It has many restaurants, clubs, banks, bars, post offices and tourist offices. The Gaiety Theatre is situated there.
Christ Church: Situated on the Ridge, Christ Church is the second oldest church in Northern India. Inside there are stained glass windows which represent faith, hope, charity, fortitude, patience and humility.
Jakhoo: 2 km from Shimla, at a height of 8,000 ft, Jakhu Hill is the highest peak and has views of the town and of the snow-covered Himalayas. At the top of the hill is an old temple of Lord Hanuman, which is the home of monkeys. A 108 feet (33 metre) statue of Lord Hanuman, a Hindu deity, at 8,500 feet (2,591 metres) above sea level, is the statue standing at the highest altitude among several other masterpieces in the world, overtaking the Christ Redeemer in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.[59]
Jutogh: Located 8 km from the city centre, this army cantonment is near Totu, an important suburb of Shimla city.
Shimla State Museum: The museum, which was opened in 1974, has tried to protect hill-out and the cultural wealth of the state. There is a collection of miniature Pahari paintings, sculptures, bronzes wood-carvings and also costumes, textiles and jewellery of the region.
Indian Institute of Advanced Study: This institute is housed at the former Viceregal Lodge, built in 1884–88.
Summer Hill: The township of Summer Hill is at a height of 6,500 ft on the Shimla-Kalka railway line. Mahatma Gandhi lived in these quiet surroundings during his visits to Shimla. Himachal Pradesh University is situated here.
Annandale: Developed as the racecourse of Shimla, Annandale is 2–4 km from the Ridge at a height of 6,117 ft. It is now used by the Indian Army.
Tara Devi: 11 km from the Shimla bus-stand. Tara Devi Hill has a temple dedicated to the goddess of stars on top of the hill. There is a military Dairy Town here as well as the headquarters of Bharat Scouts and Guides.
Sankat Mochan: A famous Lord Hanuman temple is located here.
Junga: Junga is nearest Tehsil, 26 km from Shimla. Its original name (with diacritics) is "Jūnga", and it is a former royal retreat of the princely state of Keonthal. It is known as the Keonthal Estate.
Anand Vilas: Midway between Shimla and Junga. "Sarva Dharma Mandir", Temple of all faiths, is a spiritual group dedicated to Mother Nature. Thousands of visitors and devotees come here every year. There is an "Art is Values" school with pupils from all over India. Classes are provided free of cost.
Totu: A major developing suburb of Shimla on NH-88. Houses Jutogh railway station & HimFed under Govt. of Himachal Pradesh.
Mashobra: 13 km from Shimla, site of the annual Sipi fair in June.
Kufri: 16 km from Shimla at a height of 8,600 ft, Kufri is the local winter sports centre, and has a small zoo.
Chharabra: 13 km from Shimla on route to Kufri.
Naldehra: 22 km from Shimla, with a nine-hole Naldehra Golf Club. The annual Sipi fair in June is held in Naldehra.
Chail: Chail was built as summer retreat by the Maharaja of Patiala during the British Raj, it is known for its cricket pitch, the highest in the world.
Sanjauli: The main suburb of Shimla.
Rashtrapati Niwas
Lakkar Bazar[60]

If you want happiness for a day, go fishing.
If you want happiness for a year, inherit a fortune.
If you want happiness for a lifetime, help somebody” 

– Chinese Proverb

Brawn Riders Delhi support the initiative taken by Aman Biradari’s Dil Se program. Dil Se is a campaign for children who live and work on streets. 

The Dil Se Campaign was launched in June 2005, with the objective of developing a scaleable intervention model that upholds the dignity and inclusive rights of the urban poor, specifically for children who live and work on the streets. Dil Se is not about short-term solutions; it is about building capacity in all sectors of society to help ensure that the most vulnerable urban street children have nutritious food, protection, health care, and proper education. Led by Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (SSA) Delhi, Government of Delhi, the Dil Se Campaign is a joint endeavor with the Center for Equity Studies (CES) and Aman Biradari.

The Program

On 24 December 2017, we will all gather at our starting point, BRD DHABHA, KATWARIA SARAI near IIFT BHAWAN and move towards the Ummeed Aman Ghar to celebrate Christmas with the children.

A unique 1 day workshop specially designed for beginner and photography enthusiasts to express themselves creatively using photography. An easy to follow and practice workshop that will help you use your camera beyond its auto-mode functions to let you express yourself creatively. A picture is what you saw and therefore, you should be the one deciding on how to capture it, not the camera.

Workshop Outline

Know your camera and what it can do for you
Use different lighting situations to create drama in photos
Learn principles of composition and framing
What and how do you click pictures to create the ‘WOW’ effect!
No need of an expensive camera, any digital camera would do

Workshop USP

This photography workshop is unique in many ways

Unique One day workshop on Saturdays
Important concepts explained in a more practical manner
Combination of indoor and outdoor classes for hands on experience
Small group to ensure individual attention to each participant
Certificate of participation

description:
Each participant in the phlebotomy course will have three hours of phlebotomy theory; and three hours of clinical and will demonstrate three successful finger punctures and three successful vein accesses for blood draw. 

Prerequisite: Must be an LVN, RN, PA, MA, ERMT, Paramedic, or Phlebotomist with eligibility verification, to register. Students will be required to show license/certification at the time of registration.

(Only LVNs receive CEU’s, certified through the Board of Vocational Nursing & Psychiatric Technicians)

This course does not teach you blood withdrawl, it is a a refresher course for those with prior blood withdrawl experience.

3 hrs. – Theory includes blood withdrawal Methods, appropriate method Selection, Safety measures and possible withdrawal site preparation and complications.
 
3 hrs. - Clinical includes Preparation of equipment, Safety factors, choice of artery withdrawal, Choice of blood withdrawal device, Techniques of venipuncture, arterial, Skin puncture practice and Universal precautions for infection control.

3 Needle Sticks- Students will be provided with 3 needle sticks for practice. 

Instructor: Patricia Karnstedt (Phlebotomy 6 CEU credits; BVNPT Provider).

When: Saturday, December 23, 2017
Time: 9:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. 
Location: Antelope Valley College, APL 119
Fee: $75

Register with Corporate & Community Services for these courses by calling us at (661) 722-6300 ext. 6584

Enroll early, space is limited!
Registration deadline is 1 week prior to class start date. If minimum is met by registration date, then registration will continue to be accepted until day of class (if feasible).

Upon request three days before the event, reasonable accommodation will be provided to facilitate the participation of covered individuals with disabilities. Call (661) 722-6360 (voice/relay).
address: Antelope Valley College APL 119, New Delhi

description:
Christmas is a time to make merry – and Kunzum has put together something special in the artistic and historical region of Shekhawati in Rajasthan.

You will stay in the stunning Surajgarh Fort surrounded by beautiful landscapes, a fort on a hill, an ancient stepwell, and vibrant villages. Activities will include art, pottery, bangle-making and kite-flying for not only children but adults too. And loads of food, drinks and music over bonfires under chilly, starry nights.

ACTIVITIES / ITINERARY
DECEMBER 23
7:00 a.m.: Leave Delhi / Gurgaon for Shekhawati in the Kunzum Travel Truck or in your personal transport
10:00 a.m.: Brunch on the way
1:00 p.m.: Reach Surajgarh Fort
1:00 p.m. – 3:00 p.m.: Check-in, freshen up and lunch
3:00 p.m. – 6:00 p.m.: Option to explore a bit of Surajgarh and to go to nearby fort for sundowner. You can also interact with a potter, bangle-makers, kite makers and artists specializing in Shekhawati art.
7:00 – 11:00 p.m.: Bonfire dinner with entertainment by local Rajasthani singers at the local stepwell or in Surajgarh Fort itself.

DECEMBER 24
7:00 a.m. – 8:00 a.m.: Breakfast for those going for tour of Shekhawati. Others may have breakfast at leisure.
8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.: Full day guided sightseeing tour of Shekhawati region known for its bazaars, havelis with frescos and exquisite woodwork, stepwells, temples, forts and other historical buildings. [This is optional at an extra charge]. Those not going may spend day at leisure or explore on their own. They can also interact with a potter, bangle-makers, kite makers and artists specializing in Shekhawati art.
1:00 p.m. – 2:00 p.m.: Lunch for those at Surajgarh Fort
4:30 p.m. – 5:30 p.m.: Go for sundowner if you missed it on previous day and / or walk around villages and fields in the vicinity
7:00 – 11:00 p.m.: Bonfire dinner with entertainment by a local DJ

DECEMBER 25
Have breakfast at leisure, opt to explore Shekhawati and return when one wants to.

DAY 4
Start making plans for the New Year’s eve.

ABOUT SHEKHAWATI
The Shekhawati region is a collection of towns and villages in Rajasthan, and about a five hours drive from Delhi. These towns are known for their old havelis (bungalows) with frescos, historical monuments and bazaars. The region is the ancestral home of many a Marwari and Bania families, known for their sharp business acumen, who invested in the art and architecture in the area.

ESSENTIAL TRIP INFORMATION
* Dates: December 23 – 25, 2017 (2 Nights / 3 Days)
* Accommodation: Surajgarh Fort
* Travel: In the Kunzum Travel Truck, a 9-seater luxury van. The distance of about 250kms from Delhi will be covered in about six hours. Option to go in your own vehicles.

COST
* Deluxe Room: Rs. 20,000
* Suite Room: Rs. 22,000
* Early Bird Discount: Rs. 2,000 if booked by September 30, 2017
* Club Kunzum Member Rate: Deluxe Room – Rs. 19,000 / Suite Room – Rs. 21,000
* Children under 5: No extra charge if sharing bed with adults.
* Anyone over 5 years age sharing room with extra bed: Rs. 9,000 per person

INCLUSIONS
* Accommodation for two adults for 2 Nights / 3 Days at Surajgarh Fort. Extra persons sharing room given above.
* Meals: Breakfast x 2, Lunch x 2, Dinner x 2 for two people
* Non Alcoholic Welcome Drinks on arrival
* Dinner over bonfire and Rajasthani music on Dec 23
* Dinner over bonfire and music by local DJ on Dec 24
* Complimentary Tea / Coffee maker in the room
* Interactions with local bangle makers, potters and kite makers
* 2 Bottles of Mineral Water per room per day
* Use of swimming pool
* All taxes

EXCLUSIONS
* Full day sightseeing tour of different towns of Shekhawati in the luxury Kunzum Travel Truck at Rs. 2,000 per person (subject to a minimum of 6 people). Children to be charged the same if they occupy a seat. Lunch will have to be paid for directly by guests on this day if they are having during the tour. Guests would be recommended suitable places and they may pay directly.
* Interaction and lessons by artist specializing in Shekhawati art: Rs. 1,000 per person including children (subject to minimum 4 guests)
* Camel Cart Ride: Rs. 400 per person including children. Each cart will take 5-6 people.
* Transport from Delhi and back in the luxury Kunzum Travel Truck:Rs. 2,000 per person (subject to a minimum of 6 people). Children to be charged the same if they occupy a seat.
* Alcoholic beverages, additional bottled water / soft drinks, laundry, shopping and any other expenses of personal nature.
* Additional tea / coffee / snacks ordered in hotel.

FOR QUERIES, CALL A KUNZUM TRAVEL CURATOR
* Address: Kunzum Travel Café, T-49, HauzKhas Village, New Delhi 110016, India
* Mobile: +91.9650702777 / +91.9650701365 / +91.9650701387
* Landline: +91.11.498 44444
* Email: wetravel | kunzum ! com
* Web:  http://kunzum.com
* Availability: 11:00 a.m. – 6:00 p.m. daily

BOOKING
You can block a seat by paying an advance of at least Rs. 10,000 as follows with the balance to be paid before trip starts.

* Cash
* Cheque favouring ‘Kunzum’
* Online:  https://goo.gl/7hsasd
* Bank transfer (request for account information)

GENERAL TERMS
* Cancellation: Refund of 50% to be given if cancelled at least 45 days before departure date. No refunds will be possible otherwise but you are free to transfer your booking to anyone else.

description:
Let’s go to Jordan

Float in the Dead Sea. Snorkel in the Red Sea. Explore the lost city of Petra. Camp in the Wadi Rum desert. Go atop Mount Nebo where Moses was granted a view of the promised land he could never enter. Explore the famed monuments of Amman.

All this and more awaits in Jordan in a signature tour curated by Ajay Jain. From December 23 – 30, 2017.

OVERVIEW: 8 DAYS / 7 NIGHTS
History, adventure, wellness, food, people, landscapes, road drives, culture – all these await you on the Kunzum journey to Jordan. Your trip curators and guides will ensure you have a memorable holiday to be cherished for life. With quality accommodation and meals to give you the comforts you seek.

HIGHLIGHTS (SCROLL FOR DETAILED ITINERARY)
* Dead Sea
* The holy city of Madaba, Mount Nebo and Kerak Castle.
* Petra – one of the wonders of the world.
* Aqaba – Snorkel far into the Red Sea.
* Amman – the capital with its attractions like Jerash, the Citadel, amphitheatre
* Shop for authentic crafts and in both local and modern markets.

STAND-OUT FEATURES OF TRIP
* Trip leader – Ajay Jain: One of the foremost travel writers, Ajay Jain will be leading the trip personally if he is available – he has made two trips to Jordan himself to come up with the best itinerary possible. An equally competent trip leader will replace him if he cannot make it.
* Interact with locals including Bedouins: There will be ample opportunities to spend time with the tribes of Jordan especially at Wadi Rum and Petra. Go up close and see their habitats, crafts, foods, dressing, family life and more!!
* Sumptuous meals at local restaurants!! Eat like the locals – with them!!! Enough for vegetarians too.
* Shop for authentic crafts – away from tourist traps!! We believe in Responsible Tourism – this includes meeting and buying from traditional artisans without middlemen, away from tourist traps.

HOTELS
We will be staying in the following hotels or equivalent:
* Dead Sea: Dead Sea Spa Hotel
* Petra: Petra Panorama
* Wadi Rum: Sun City Camp
* Aqaba: Days Inn
* Amman: Imperial Palace

PRICING

THE ITINERARY

DAY 1: DEAD SEA
Land in Amman and transfer to the Dead Sea – the lowest point on Earth. Float in the waters – yes, you cannot sink. And feel the natural spa features of the water, mud and the atmosphere. Overnight at the Dead Sea.

DAY 2: MADABA, MT. NEBO, KERAK CASTLE AND PETRA
Option to spend more time in the Dead Sea followed by an early breakfast. Head to Madaba, a city best known for the famous 6th century Mosaic map of Jerusalem and the Holy Land and for its spectacular Byzantine and Umayyad mosaics. And what a day it will be to be in Madaba – On Christmas Eve. Proceed to Mt. Nebo, a city mentioned in the Bible as the place where Moses was granted a view of the promised land that he would never enter. Stop at Kerak Castle, a Crusaders’ Castle built on a triangular plateau dating back to the 12th century.

Proceed to Petra – one of the wonders of the world. Overnight in Petra.

DAY 3: PETRA BY DAY… AND NIGHT!!
If there is a man-made wonder on this planet, it is the Nabataean city of Petra going back 2000 years – lost to the world before being rediscovered in 1812. The journey into Petra starts through the Siq, a very narrow gorge, about one kilometre in length, flanked on both sides by towering rock walls that reach a height of 70 metres. At the end of the Siq is the Treasury (the Khaznah) with its massive façade carved into the solid rock face – this is the defining image of Jordan made famous by the movie, Raiders of the Lost Ark. The rose-red city of Petra lies beyond, with its endless tombs and temples, its huge theatre and fascinating high places. Petra will keep you absorbed all day.

For those wishing to, they may opt to visit Petra by night too at an additional fee of USD 35. Overnight in Petra.

DAY 4: LITTLE PETRA – WADI RUM
There is the big Petra, and then there is the Little Petra. Spend some time in the morning there before proceeding to the Wadi Rum desert where the famous Lawrence of Arabia once lived and fought against the Turks. Marvel at the maze of monolithic rockscapes rising upto 1,750 metres from the desert floor – this was the setting of the recent Hollywood flick, The Martian. A 2-hour jeep safari will show you around. After enjoying the stunning sunsets, sit around a fire enjoying a Zarb Dinner – it is cooked lamb meat, chicken and vegetables with herbs buried in a big underground pit with hot coals beneath the desert sand. Overnight luxury camping in Wadi Rum under the starry skies.

DAY 5: AQABA
After breakfast, we head to Aqaba – a spectacular resort town on the Red Sea. We head for a cruise far into the waters for snorkeling and lunch on the boat if weather permits at an extra charge. Enjoy the rest of the day exploring the town and for some tax-free shopping. Overnight in Aqaba.

DAY 6: AMMAN
After a leisurely morning, we do a tour of Aqaba. Drive to capital Amman after that. You will get free time in town to explore its bazaars. Overnight in Amman.

DAY 7: AMMAN & JERASH
You will realize why Amman is a destination in itself. We will tour museums, the Citadel, the amphitheater, the souks and the modern part of town. We then proceed to Jerash, a wonder in its own right – it is ranked amongst ten great Roman cities of the Decapolis League. It boasts an unbroken chain of human occupation dating back more than 6,500 years; it lies on a plain surrounded by hilly wooded areas and fertile basins. Overnight in Amman.

DAY 8: DEPARTURE FROM JORDAN

description:
Voice - Sanjeeta Bhattacharya 

Sanjeeta Bhattacharya is a Delhi based vocalist who recently graduated from the prestigious Berklee College of Music, Boston. She  began her journey learning Hindustani Classical music for 8 years while simultaneously exploring sounds from the world over including jazz, RnB, bossa nova and even flamenco, during her time in college. She won numerous state and national level inter school western music competitions as a solo performer. 

Keys: Rythem Bansal 

Rythem Bansal is a professional Pianist and music Educator based in New Delhi. He has been studying his instrument for six years, and earned his Trinity Guildhall Grade 8 Certification in his third year. Following that, he has studied several diverse forms of music, such as jazz, funk, pop, and latin. During this time, he was an active part of his school's music society, winning them numerous competitions. He is a former student of legendary Delhi pianist John Raphael and international virtuoso Utsav Lal, and has studied extensively under Canadian jazz pianist Jacob Damelin.

He finds himself drawn to jazz music due to its emphasis on improvisation, which he believes allows musicians to be more creative and expressive. It's his belief that playing jazz is important to musicians of any genre, as it opens up their aural abilities and encourages them to develop musical maturity.

On arrival in Dalhousie check in hotel, Day is free for personal activities those interested in shopping can by woolen shawls. Tibetan Handicraft Centre, has Tibetan carpets. Himachal Handloom Industry Emporium on Thandi Sarak has a good selection of shawls. The Tibetan Handicraft Centre Showroom, on the road running parallel to Garam Sarak, has carpets and bags.
 
In evening get ready for DJ party from 7 Pm – 10 Pm, Dinner & Overnight stay at Hotel.
 
Day 03:- Dhainkund Trekking – Khajjiar – Picnic Lunch – Bon Fire Night
 
Today finish your breakfast by 10 Am. We start our full day sightseeing tour of Dhainkhund and Khajjiar.
  
 
Dhainkund Trekking & Khajjiar (Mini Swiss) with Picnic Lunch. 
 
This full day activity is full of fun, amazing landscape and offers you the chance to explore the real Dalhousie or “Pure Dalhousie”. The Dainkund – Jot full day trek offers an unique and guided way to explore the real nature and beauty of Dalhousie from the breathtaking landscape, We require volunteers for group picnic lunch in which we prepare Maggie. Later by 4 pm we leave for Khajjiar.
One of the 160 places in the world that bear tropical resemblance to Switzerland.

ABOUT TOUR 
Departure Date: 22 Dec - 25 Dec 2017 (Late Night 22  Dec - 25 Dec 2017)
Pick up point: Kaushambi Metro Station
Event Type: Adventure ( Trekking & Photography)
Location: #Munsiyari #Trekking #Photography #Landscape #Birding 

Seats: 12

Entry per person:-   Will update soon!

Itinerary:

1st day: FRIDAY [ 22 Dec 2017]

Rap up your daily job fast today, time to take a break. Reach our group departure point by 10:00 P.M. Meet and greet with every member from different verticles. Late Night departure from Delhi to Pithoragarh. Overnight journey in SUV/Bus/traveller/ Similar.

2nd day: SATURDAY [ 23 Dec 2017] - MUNSIYARI 

- Early morning arrival and check-in to Hotel/ Camp and Homestay. Rest in for an hour followed by breakfast. 
-Local sightseeing of Munsiyari and Nearby places of interest. 
- Sit along the cliffside with breathtaking views.
- Evening free for leisure followed by the music with bonfire bonanza. (Unless by some twist of fate, it ends up raining; although we sure hope not.) Party till dinner time.

3rd day: SUNDAY  [ 24 Dec 2017] - Khaliya Trek (Munsiyari)

- Sorry :) we will bother you early morning 5:30 A.M (TIME FOR PHOTOGRAPHY with professional traveling along with) to panoramic sunrise and some breathtaking landscape bird watching around there. 
-After Breakfast time for Checkout and experience panorama of nature with snow "YES WE GOING TO MUNSIYARI" . We settle in and relax around after lunch for an hour.
- ICE CAP YEAH - time to say hello to SNOW LAP, enjoy snow sports activity. Latter in evening, back to base in Munsiyari.

4th day: MONDAY  Back to DELHI [ 25 Dec 2017]

In the morning after breakfast in the beautiful and peaceful surroundings at Munsiyari leave for photography (the majestic beauty of this place is more than a little overwhelming). Check out and return transfer to Delhi.

Time to say- WILL COME BACK AGAIN. After breakfast checkout from the hotel and board the bus back to Delhi. Arrive Delhi by 10:00 P:M or late night.


ABOUT MUNSIYARI.

Munsiari (Devanagari: मुनस्यारी ) is the name of the sub-division headquarters, a conglomeration of revenue villages and it also refers to the entire region as Munsiari Tehsil and Sub-Division in the Pithoragarh District in the hill-state of Uttarakhand, India.

It lies at the base of the great Himalayan mountain range, at an elevation of about 2,200 m (7,200 ft)[1] and is a starting point of various treks into the interior of the range.

description: Rajasthan Banjara trip- New year special- 23rd Dec to 1st Jan 2018****Please note: The dates of this trip are 23rd Dec to 1st Jan and you need to apply for only 4 leaves to join us on this trip****Banjaras originated centuries ago in the Jodhpur and Jaisalmer desert areas of Rajasthan. These are gypsies who wander from one place to another, leading a life on their own terms and conditions. This New year’s 2018 trip is about Banjaras. We will be the nomads, travelling from one destination to another, experiencing the rustic life, visiting centuries old forts, meeting other travellers. We will sing and dance around the bonfire, come up close and personal with original Banjara tribe, ride camels, sleep under the stars, in the camps, on desert, havelis, huts and backpackers hostels and hotels.This trip is not about luxury or comfort but it’s a unique experience. description:
Self Awareness through Movement and Music: Group Facilitation Training

Whether you are a meditation teacher, healing dance practitioner or other kind of body worker who works with groups and music, you will get a lot of knowledge in this training to enhance your classes.

The training is based on the methodology and know-how of Biodanza.

You will not become a Biodanza-Facilitator but you will learn to Facilitate your own teaching to a better style.You will have self experience Biodanza sessions for yourself development and to understand the theory better and there will be also theory classes as I mention before.

You will learn:

Organizing a organic class according to physiological body rhythms
Exercises to bring people in communication and expression
The effect of music on movements and emotions
Music check - there is a lot of music which is harmful to a human being - please bring your music, we will check it.

About Biodanza: It was founded in the 1960s by the Chilean educators, psychologists, anthropologists and artist Prof. Rolando Toro. He combined ancient knowledge about the curative and expressive power of the dance with new scientific insights.

Biodanza is the invitation to dance life! In all moods and life situations. It does not teach step-by-step or dance techniques. It is not the aesthetics of movement, but the experience in the here and now. In dances and exercises to the universal language of music - alone, in the couple or in the group - the aspects of human coexistence are explored and integrated. The figure music-emotion-expression is closed again and immediately available for everyday life. Biodanza analyzes and focuses not on the deficit aspects, but turns to the liberation of what generally strengthens humans and makes life more valuable. It activates body-specific substances, which increase the well-being.

BIO (S) Greek word stem βίος: Life

DANZA (spanish) originates from the old dance: the realization of inspiration in movement with feeling expression.

Biodanza therefore means living movement full of meaning. Through Biodanza, you will learn to give your movements back to content and meaning.

To describe biodanza is as hard as describing love or life. Only through experience can I grasp the entire meaning of Biodanza. Biodanza is oriented to abundance, not to lack. It opens the universe of your possibilities.

program:

day 1: Theoretical mode land 2 Biodanza sessions

day2: Building a organic class and 2 Biodanza sessions

day3: Alle about music to bring the theory in practice in your own classes.

day 4: To bring the theory in practice in your own classes.


Facilitator: Manju

Her spiritual Journey started 1986 with a intense Sufi practice and Shamanic work with JABRANE Sebant. 1990 she meet her Indian Master H.W.L Ponnja (PAPAJI) in Lucknow which named her MANJU and spend through three Years much time with him in Lucknow. 1992 she started her Biodanza training directly with the founder of BIODANZA Rolando TORO ARANEDA in Italy. She was his close colaborator in Austria from 1992 until his dead in 2010. She opend the Biodanza Community in Austria and is directing since 1994 the first Biodanza School of Austria.

She is trained in many Biodanza –Extensions directly by Rolando Toro Araneda and in many different body-psycho-therapeutic and spiritual techniques. Biodanza-Teacher, trainer and Spiritual Coach with 35 years of experience, based in Austria. She works in many countries around the globe and travels to India during winters.

Date & Time :

22nd - 25th December, 2017 (9:30 AM to 6 PM)

Contact : Shia
Phone : +91 9717469268

description:
BIR-BILLING
ITINERARY | Chapter 3.0

Bir, a small town in the Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh is well known for its majority Tibetan population, beautiful monasteries, educational institutions and NGO’s. Crowned in the lap of the majestic Dhauladhar Ranges in the background, this tiny town is set in one of the most picturesque setting.

For Bookings and Enquiries, Contact at 8851116714

Cost: ₹6499 per head

22 December:
We leave from Delhi at 10:00 PM.

23 December:
Reach Bir by 12 Noon.
Freshen up and have lunch.
After that we go for Activities like Rock Climbing, Repelling and River crossing.
We come back to Bir and start trek to reach Billing.
After Reaching billing, have dinner and Night stay at camps.

24 December:
We Wake up early and having breakfast, we start our trek to Rajgundha. 
Packed lunch will be provided.
After coming back to camps, have some rest and enjoy dinner with bonfire and good music.

25 December:
After Breakfast, We take off from World's second highest paragliding point and lands in Bir after a 30-40 minutes flight.
Some Sight seeing.
Then we leave for Delhi around Lunch.

26 December:
We reach Delhi around 6:00 AM.

Note: Paragliding is Excluded and will cost INR 2000 per person.

For Bookings and Enquiries, Contact at 8851116714
Things to carry:
1. T-shirts/Shirts 
2. Shorts 
3. Comfortable fit Jeans/Track Pants (mandatory for treks)
4. Floaters
5. Comfortable walking shoes/sneakers
6. Sunscreen Lotion
7. Cap
8. Flashlight
9. Sunglasses
10. Medicines, if requiring any specific Medic*tion
11. Camera (optional)
12. Wind Cheater and warm cloth
13. Raincoat/Poncho


Inclusions:
1. All meals starting from Day 1 Lunch to Day 3 Breakfast are included.
2. Charges are inclusive of all the transportational requirements as per the itinerary.
3. Bonfire on both the nights (depends on availability)


Exclusions:
Paragliding, chargeable at Rs. 2000 per person 
Soft drinks, bottled water, beverages, etc.
Mountain biking at Rs.500/1000 per person
Personal expenses like tips, telephone calls, etc.
Any services / meals not mentioned above
Insurance

Terms and Conditions:
1. The occurrence of all the above mentioned adventure activities is subject to weather conditions. 
2. AC in buses will be switched off at hilly region.
3. Any personal expenses are not included in the package.
4. Timings for paragliding are 7:00 AM to 11:00 AM, organisers will not be responsible for any loss because of delays.

description:
à partir de
890€
Héritage des Maharajas
16 jours/  15 nuits

Laissez-vous conter l’histoire des Maharajas !
Découvrez durant 16 jours et 15 nuits, toute la richesse et la beauté du Rajasthan : ses cités mythiques et ses forteresses majestueuses telles Bikaner ou Jodhpur, ses somptueux palais dignes des plus beaux contes des Mille et Une nuits d’Udaipur ou de Jaipur.
Au travers de paysages grandioses,vous ne pouvez qu’être séduit par cette aventure qui vous emmène à la rencontre de ces populations et de leurs traditions.

Jour 1


Delhi
Accueil à l'aéroport.
Transfert à l'hôtel, quelques instants de repos si souhaité.
Départ pour la visite de Old Delhi (mosquée Jama Masjid, Red Fort, India Gate, Qutub Minar).
Retour à l'hôtel.

Jour 2


Delhi - Mandawa (240 kilomètres, 5 heures de route)
Traversée de la région du Shekhawati, région semi-désertique célèbre pour ses magnifiques Havelis (grandes demeures nobiliaires).
Arrivée à Mandawa, visite de différents Havelis (Binsidhar Nawetiya, Murmuria, Goenka)
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 3


Mandawa - Bikaner (200 kilomètres, 4 heures de route)
Visite de Junagarh, Lal Garh Palace, Camel Research Farm .
Safari à dos de dromadaire pour contempler le coucher du soleil.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 4


Bikaner - Jaisalmer (330 kilomètres, 6 heures de route)
En chemin, arrêt à Desnoke pour visiter le Temple des Rats (Karni Mata Temple).
Début de la découverte de la "Golden City".
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 5


Jaisalmer 
Visite de la forteresse de Jaisalmer et du Patwon ki Haveli.
Escapade dans les dunes de sable de Khuri.
Temps libre pour profiter de l'atmosphère particulière de cette cité qui surplombe le désert du Thar.
Nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 6


Jaisalmer - Jodhpur (270 kilomètres, 5 heures de route)
Découverte de Jodhpur « la bleue ».
Visite du Fort de Mehrangarh et de Jaswant Thada.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 7


Jodhpur 
Visite du palais d’ Ummaid Bhawan.
Ballade dans les villages voisins et arrêt chez une famille BishnoÏ, pour découvrir leur mode de vie.
Nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 8


Jodhpur - Kumbhalgarh (270 kilomètres, 5 heures de route)
Sur la route, visite du temple Jaïn de Ranakpur.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 9


Khumbhalgarh - Udaipur (90 kilomètres, 2 heures de route)
Le matin, visite du magnifique fort de Kumbhalgarh et balade dans le Kumbhalgarh National Park.
Route vers Udaipur en traversant les superbes paysages verdoyants des Monts Aravelli. Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 10


Udaipur 
Journée consacrée à la découverte d'Udaipur, nommée «la Venise de l’Orient ».
Visite du City Palace, du temple Jagdish, Saheliyon ki Bari et du musée Bhartiya Lok Kala.
Nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 11


Udaipur - Pushkar (280 kilomètres, 5 à 6 heures de route)
Sur la route, visite du DevGarh Fort.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 12


Pushkar - Roopangarh (60 kilomètres, 1h30 de route)
Visite de Pushkar, de ses marchés colorés et de son temple hindou dédié à Brahma. situé sur les rives du lac sacré.
Arrivée à Roopangarh.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 13


Roopangarh - Jaipur (100 kilomètres, 2 heures de route)
Visite de Roopangarh.
Départ pour Jaipur. Visite du City Palace où le Maharajah a toujours ses appartements et de l'Observatoire Royal.
Visite des temples de Galta.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 14


Jaipur 
Le matin, arrêt au Palais des Vents (Hawa Mahal) pour bénéficier de la meilleure lumière.
Montée au Fort d'Amber à dos d'éléphant puis visite du Fort Jaigarh.
Temps libre pour flâner dans les rues et les bazars de la vieille ville.
Nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 15


Jaipur – Agra (240 kilomètres, 5 heures de route)
Sur la route, visite de la ville fantôme Fatehpur Sikri. magnifique site inscrit au patrimoine mondial de l’Unesco.
Arrivée à Agra. Visite du Taj Mahal dans les lumières de la fin d'après-midi.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 16


Agra - Delhi (200 kilomètres, 4 heures de route)
Le matin, visite du Fort d'Agra. Continuation vers Delhi.
Visite du tombeau d’Humayum et de ses jardins de style persan à New-Delhi.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel ou départ selon l'heure de votre vol.

- Accueil et assistance dès votre arrivée à l'aéroport de Delhi

Ce prix ne comprend pas :
- Vols internationaux
- Taxes d’aéroport

- Billets d’entrée des sites et monuments prévus au programme (cela vous permet d’être libre dans le choix de vos visites)

- Les boissons et dépenses personnelles
- Les pourboires

- Choisir de passer par une ville plutôt qu’une autre,
- Intégrer des activités ou orienter votre voyage sur la thématique de votre choix,
- Choisir une catégorie de voiture supérieure,
- Mixer les catégories d’hôtels pour optimiser confort et prix…

Nous sommes à votre écoute pour réaliser le voyage qui vous correspondra.

✔ Trip operated and sold by a verified travel partner 

☀ Trip Itinerary:
✔ Day 0 – 29th September: Friday (Departure):
Departure from Delhi at around 7:00pm by AC Volvo.

✔ Day 01 – 30th September: Saturday (Explore Kasol – Parvati Valley - Chalal):
En-route to Kasol have breakfast (own cost). On arrival at Kasol, check-in to the hotel, freshen up. Later explore different cafes in the Kasol marketplace and grab a delicious Israeli meal (own cost). Post lunch Kasol discovery, walk in Kasol town. Stroll through the local flea market to pick souvenirs. If you are interested in more adventure, explore Chalal and the Parvati Bridge on foot. Head back to your hotel in Kasol. In the evening, get all set to enjoy bonfire & some group activities. Followed by a delicious dinner (included). Overnight stay at hotel.

✔ Day 02 – 1st October: Sunday (Kheerganga):
Rise-up early & get ready for the trip to Kheerganga. Have breakfast (included). Once you reach Barshaini by local cabs, we start on the trek to Kheerganga. Reach the campsite in the evening and relax in the tents. Have dinner (included) and settle down for the night. Overnight stay in tents.

✔ Day 03 – 2nd October: Monday (Departure):
Wake up early and enjoy the sunrise and explore the nearby trails. Have breakfast (included) and pack your things, and get ready to trek back. Have lunch en-route (own cost), and reach Barshaini by afternoon. Proceed for Bhuntar via Manikaran, to board your return Volvo in time.

✔ Day 04 – 3rd October: Tuesday (Delhi):
Reach Delhi at morning between 5AM to 8AM.
***Trip ends***

"The mountains are calling, And I must go!" -John Muir (This Kasol experience truly justifies this statement). Experience Magic in Parvati Valley, The Land of Wanderlust!

description:
Event Website link -  http://eduexcellence.org/event/18/international-conference-educarnival-2017

Event Brochure download link -  http://bit.ly/brochureeducarnival

EDUCARNIVAL  - The Annual 3 day Conference and the biggest gathering of School Leaders from India is organized by IIT Delhi every year. This conference sees a participation of 1000+ school leaders representing more than 800+ Schools From CBSE, ICSE and IB boards across India.

LEGACY
The annual conference started in 2009 and has since then only grown to see school leaders come together every year to learn the Global and local best practices, implementable strategies, latest trends in school education that can be used to improve their schools.The school leaders learn from the many domain experts in the field of Academic Leadership, Curriculum development, classroom management, child psychology and neurosciences, parental management, school human resource management, school technology management, school legal & financial management and more.

ENGAGEMENT TOOLS
The engagement happens through different elements of the conference like  Plenary sessions, Detailed workshops, Group discussions, Cue card sessions, Round Table sessions, Q&A sessions, Paper presentations and Action Planning sessions for their individual schools.

The school leaders just don't learn from the domain experts but also from their peers since it is a 3 day confluence where school leaders meet and share the practices they follow at their own schools.

The Conference also sees an exhibition of latest products and services in the K12 segment available for the improvements of schools. This ensures that the school leaders are always updated with the latest tools that can be implemented back in their schools.

This platform has now grown to become an important and most attended platform by school leaders from India where they meet, learn and network with domain experts and fellow school leaders from India and abroad.

This conference is organized with the support of EduExcellence Educational Society.
event_name: Educarnival 2017 IIT Delhi- Biggest Gathering of school Leaders
address: IIT Delhi, Hauz Khas, New Delhi, India

description:
Introduction

‘Mag Fashion Factory’ is a fashion company based in India, which brings together international designs and high quality merchandise to Indian retail and e-commerce industry.

The customer is at the heart of our unique business model, which aims to provide high quality fashion at fare prices!

The company launches its brand ‘We The Stars’ with exclusive designs and styles in women-wear and kids-wear. 


Mission

Bringing high quality fashion with exclusive international designs to Indian Industry and customer

Vision

To be number 1 fashion company in India


Philosophy and Values

Our philosophy is to attain absolute client delight. We design and produce our collections, setting high standards. Quality control is significant in every stage of the production in order to obtain an end product that meets a high sense of satisfaction. 

We value quality as our main principal and aim to provide unique collections at fair prices.


 




Brief History 

	30 years of business excellence and core expertise in Fashion Industry

	Established and managed an export house of repute, which supplied high quality fashion products in women-wear and kids-wear to top international brands.


Key Clients

Through the years, we have gained a significant clientele by means of quality products, fair pricing, wide range of products and competitive advantages in the production process:

•	NEXT
•	MARKS & SPENCER
•	DOROTHY PERKINS
•	RIVER ISLAND
•	WALMART
•	EL-CORTE INGLES
•	PROMOD


Design & Style

	Vast knowledge and expertise in designing and manufacturing high quality products.
	The constant search and discovery of high quality fabric and material is most important for the company. It is also a competitive advantage as our designs and collections are based on international fairs. The fabric is from our own copyright prints and designs, which are totally in sync with the international trends and forecasting. 
	Our inspiration and styles change every season. Our focus is to produce high-quality fabric because our product is made for the woman of today!  
	Combining our design and manufacturing strength, we aim to bring an edgy fashion product with high standards of quality.
	Our style is inspired by the modern day woman who is trendy, stylish and elegant with simplicity as her greatest virtue!


 


Production

Our state-of-the art production facility in situated in Faridabad, near New Delhi.

Contact Us

आज आपलोगों को बहुत हीं हर्षोल्लास से मैं सूचित कर रहा हूँ की अन्य वर्षो के भाँती इस वर्ष भी *20 दिसम्बर बुधवार 2017 को संत सद्गुरु महर्षि मेंहीं परामहंस जी महाराज के मस्तिष्क स्वरूप शिष्य महर्षि संतसेवी परमहंस जी महाराज* की जन्मोत्सव के शुभअवसर पर इस वर्ष भी बहुत हर्षोल्लास धुम धाम से मना रहे हैं* ।
*इस परम पावन अवसर पर पूज्य सदगुरु महर्षि मेँहीँ के शिष्य, संतमत के वरिष्ठ साधु डॉक्टर स्वामी विवेकानन्द जी महाराज, दिल्ली आश्रम में पधार रहे हैं*
*कार्यक्रम*:- 
*प्रातः 8:30 बजे से स्तुति विनती ग्रंथपाठ तथा गुरुदेव की व्यक्तित्व एवं महिमा का गुणगान सत्संग प्रवचन*
*11 बजे पुष्पांजलि, 11.30 बजे से सामूहिक महाभण्डारा अपराह्णक़ालीन 2 बजे से भजन कीर्तन सत्संग व प्रवचन 4:30 बजे तक*
*सभी सत्संग प्रेमियों,धर्मावलंबियों से सादर निवेदन है कि आप सब सादर आमंत्रित हैं, इस पुण्य पावन अवसर पर अधिक से अधिक संख्या में सम्मिलित होकर दर्शन व प्रवचन का लाभ उठावें। एवं सभी सत्संगियों से आग्रह है कि आप अपने आस परोस के सभी सत्संगप्रेमियों एवं मित्रों को भी जानकारी दे ताकि बुधवार 20 दिसंबर को होने वाले महाज्ञान यज्ञ का भव्य आयोजन का दर्शन व प्रवचन का लाभ से वंचित न रह सके*।
*भण्डारा के बाद सभी कार्यकारिणी सदस्यों का मीटिंग भी हैं सभी कार्यकारिणी सदस्यों से विशेष आग्रह हैं की मीटिंग में अवस्य भाग लें।*

description:
Kedarkantha is easy to moderate four days trek from the sankri village. The trek goes through the beautiful forest of Govind national park which is known for its wildflowers and picturesque beauty.  One can see snow on the higher reaches of the mountains until April and later in summer the meadows will be full of flowers.
TRIP HIGHLIGHTS 
•	Flora and fauna with high diversity.
•	High Altitude Trekking & Kedarkantha Peak 12506 ft.
•	Navigation, Mountain manners, and wilderness survival skills.

COST:- Rs. 9,999

DAY 01:- ARRIVAL AT DEHRADUN AND DRIVE TO SANKRI.
DAY 02:- TREK SANKRI TO JUDA KA TALAB.
DAY 03:- TREK JUDA KA TALAB TO KEDARKANTHA BASE - 3-4 hours
DAY 04:- TREK KEDARKANTHA BASE TO KEDARKANTHA PEAK AND DOWN TO HARGAON – 4-5 hours
DAY 05:- TREK HARGAON TO SANKRI.
DAY 06:- DEPARTURE.

INCLUSION: 

•	 All veg meals from day 1st dinner to day 5th lunch.
•	3 Nights tented accommodation during the trek on sharing basis.
•	1 Night in Guest House / Hotel / Homestay on sharing basis in Sankri
•	All necessary fees and permits ( For Indian )
•	Basic First Aid Kit with Oxi Meter and Oxygen cylinder.
•	Morning - Evening Tea / Coffee with light snacks.
•	Surface Transfer from Dehradun – Sankri – Dehradun.

EXCLUSION:

•	Any expenses of personal nature and expenses incurred due to natural reasons.
•	Meals during transit.
•	Insurance of any kind.
•	Porter/mule charges to carry your personal bag.
•	Anything not mentioned explicitly in the above program.
•	Permit ( Non-Indian).

description:
A common myth about sustainable building development is that they cost more, especially while building affordable houses. Recent studies have shown that the incremental capital cost has decreased owing to the increase in market for green buildings. There is also a considerable scope to reduce both the embodied and the operational energy consumption of the building.

'Sustainable is Affordable' is the theme for the 9th GRIHA Summit being held in New Delhi from 18th-19th December, 2017. The summit will have several eminent speakers deliberating on the relationship between sustainability and affordability in the building sector. 

The 2-day Summit will also bring together over 1000 experts from the industry, financers, policy makers, decision makers, buyers and sellers in a bid to develop and drive new initiatives, provide insights, showcase sustainable product development and green business opportunities. It will facilitate interaction among entities from all over the world in order to elicit practical applications that are most relevant to India at this juncture.
address: India Habitat Centre, New Delhi, India

description:
--------------------------------------------
Shashank Vishwakarma (Singer-songwriter):
--------------------------------------------

Shashank Vishwakarma is a contemporary folk singer-songwriter from Lucknow. He began singing at the age of 5, which later helped him get a part in his school choir and winning some district music competitions. In early 2016, he studied contemporary vocal and guitar from the Swarnabhoomi Academy of Music, Chennai. Till now, he has associated himself with several Jazz and Blues ensembles, Swing quartets as well as Pop duos and groups. 

He draws inspiration from the likes of Damien Rice and Paul McCartney, and as a singer-songwriter, Shashank sometimes uses an acoustic percussive style to rearrange compositions. 

Throughout these years, he has played at various cultural festivals like IIT Mumbai's Mood Indigo, NIIT Allahabad's Culruv and has composed and arranged for a lot of solo projects. 

In Kolkata alone, he has played at venues like The Vault, 8th day Cafe and Bakery, The Doodle Room, Fabricca Della Pizza, Forever Poetry and Whistling Kettle.
address: The Piano Man Jazz Club, 7/22, Ground Floor, B-6, Safdarjung Enclave Market, New Delhi, India

description:
RoundGlass Rise, music for impact presents: Nirvana Live 2017 

An immersive Sufi evening with Bollywood and Sufi singer Kavita Seth Nirvana Live 2017 to fundraise to support education of underprivileged children and skill development for women

New Delhi: Music has great power to awaken your soul and take you on a journey within. Kavita Seth a name synonymous with Sufi singing in the country brings to your city a mystical Sufi evening. 
Nirvana Live 2017 will be an amalgamation of soul-stirring music, profound poetic lyrics in a mellifluous voice that transports you into a magical world. This year, the singer joins the Music for Impact series by RoundGlass RISE in order to support causes that are extremely close to her heart. All the money collected through the sale of tickets will fund for the education of underprivileged children and women empowerment in rural areas. 

Having performed across the globe at over 500 venues, Kavita of Iktara (Wake Up Sid) and Tum Hi ho Bandhu (Cocktail) fame will once again enthrall the audience with a few hours of bliss. The singer, in the memory of her beloved mentor, friend and husband Mr. K.K. Seth will be performing some classic sufi songs along with her renditions from her private albums at the concert.

“Mr. Seth was a strong believer in the power of education. He never missed an opportunity to support the education of children who could not afford it but had dreams to reach the sky. Nirvana Live is my musical dedication to him on his death anniversary. This time we bring this beautiful evening to New Delhi and it gives me immense happiness that we will be fund-raising to support education, healthcare and skill development of children and women”.
address: Siri Fort Auditorium, New Delhi, India
