description:
Makbara-e -Humayun located in Nizamuddin area of Delhi is one of the first grand dynastic garden-tombs built under the patronage of the Mughal Emperor Akbar, the third Mughal ruler and Humayun’s son. Humayun’s tomb is one of the best preserved Mughal monuments in India and was declared a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1993. Humayun’s garden-tomb was the starting point of the Mughal architecture in India, a style which is an amalgamation of the Persian, Turkish and Indian architectural influences. As was the belief that it is auspicious to be buried near a Saint’s grave, the tomb stands close to the shrine of the 14th century Sufi Saint, Hazrat Nizamuddin Auliya. In fact several members of the Mughal dynasty also lie buried here and that’s the reason complex is also called “dormitory of the Mughals”. Besides the main tomb enclosure of Humayun, several buildings, tombs, mosques and a lodging place dot the pathway leading up to Humayun’s Tomb, some belonging to the period prior to Mughal era.


Scheduled Date: 17th Dec 2017 (Sunday)
Time – 7:30 am to 10:00 am (This includes 30 minutes session of post processing tips)
Venue - Humayun Tomb Complex
Meeting Point-Ticket counter of the complex
Meeting Time - 7.15 am


Things to carry
Carry your DSLR
Carry your widest angle lens
Do not carry tripod-it’s not allowed


On-field learning from the experts is said to be one of the best methods of improving your skill-set. Our expert will hand hold you at every possible step for a better understanding of perspectives, camera controls and how to make use of the best opportunities to get better images. The training will focus on the following.
1. Framing and composition in the field
2. Exposure control in field under difficult light conditions
3. Mastering metering techniques (Spot, partial, center weighted, evaluative)
4. Framing and composition in the field
5. Post processing tips after the shoot

Mentor

 Anupama Simon Choudhary is a dynamic working professional with 16 years of experience in Travel and Hospitality industry. She firmly lives by the motto "Never say Never" and same attitude has led her to follow her heart and pursue her passion of Nature Photography. She loves capturing wonders of Nature in her images and her work behind the lens shows the hidden beauties of our Natural heritage. Her passion for discovering the rich cultural diversity and Natural History of India led her to pursue vocational course in Travel and Tourism after attaining her Graduation degree in Commerce. Anupama is associated with DCP as Group Leader-Team Delhi  

Puneet Ramani is a fanatic and passionate photographer. Ardently devoted to wildlife and nature who spends his weekends mostly in forests, rain forests, plains, grasslands, and other rural areas of India with camera and other gadgets mainly in search of winging buddies. By profession he is UX professional in a well known MNC, Hyderabad having years of expertise in user experience work, post production and other outstanding creative techniques to shape wild moments. He loves his profession by heart and on the flip side disburse his spare time photographing nature and wildlife. As a photographer, his main interest lies in birds, macro and landscapes. He has traveled widely across North India and Western Ghats rain forests in search of different bird species. He holds a graduate degree in commerce and post-graduate in design and multimedia. He is associated with the group as Group Leader - Team DCP Delhi. 



Workshop fee

Rs 1000 per head inclusive of all taxes.
Cancellation policy

All cancellations before 30 days of the event date - 100% refund
All cancellations between 20 - 30 days of the event date - 50% refund
All cancellations within 20 days of the event date - No refund possible

description:
Bid farewell to the daily routine and inject a dose of adventure into your life with an 8D/7N Magical Bhutan trip. 

Cost: INR 33800 Delhi to Delhi
Cost: INR 38800 Mumbai to Mumbai

Experience Bhutan like a local. 
 
Day 1: Delhi/Mumbai to Bagdogra Flight. Pick up & transfer to Phuentsholing
 
Meet & greet on arrival at Bagdogra airport and transfer to Phuentsholing, Bhutan. On the way enjoy the lush green Tea gardens of Dooars. Upon arrival transfer to hotel. Explore the beautiful Phuentsholing Monastery in the evening and enjoy the view of Dooars region. Take a stroll in Phuentsholing town. Overnight in Phuentsholing.
 
Day 2: Phuentsholing to Thimphu Night Halt (172 kms / 6 hrs)
 
After breakfast head to the Immigration office to complete the formalities & drive towards Thimphu (7,710 ft.) - the capital city of Bhutan. On arrival check into hotel. Evening at leisure & Overnight in Thimphu. Don’t miss experiencing the night life in the capital city.
 
Day 3: Thimphu Local S/Seeing & Night Halt
 
After Breakfast, we leave for Thimphu sightseeing tour.
•         The capital town of Bhutan is home of Royal family - we visit Tashichho dzong, the main secretariat building which houses the throne room of His Majesty. View of the Thimphu valley from BBS Tower is very captivating and it will be a perfect introduction to Thimphu.
•         Later visit National Memorial Chorten; it was built in 1974 in the memory of third King.
•         Next visit one of the oldest monasteries in the valley- Changgangkha Monastery.
•         The iconic Buddha point is also a must-see place in Thimphu. The nature and wildlife lovers should not miss a visit to National Zoo which also houses National Animal Takin.
•         Visit National Library (collections of holy scripts).
•         Spend the evening exploring the Authentic Bhutanese Crafts market.
•         Overnight in Thimphu.
 
Day 4: Thimphu to Punakha & Night Halt
 
After Breakfast drive from Thimphu to Punakha (4,300 ft.), via Dochu-La-Pass (10,170 ft.). 
•         visit Chimi Lhakhang- the Temple of Fertility which was built in 15th century.
•         Visit beautiful Punakha Dzong.
•         Evening free for leisure. Overnight stay in Punakha.
 
Day 5: Punakha to Paro Night Halt (1.5 hrs)
 
After Breakfast Morning Drive from Punakha to Paro.
•         Visit Ta Dzong, once a fortified lookout tower that is now the National Museum.
•         Visit the Rinpung Dzong & Kichu Lhakhang, the oldest temple in the country.
•         Visit Drugyal Dzong (Bhutan Victory Fort), which was built in 1646 to commemorate Bhutan's victory over Tibetan invaders during the 1600 AD.
•         Evening Free for Leisure & overnight stay in Paro.
 
Day 6: Paro Excursion - Taktsang monastery (Tiger's nest) hike night halt 
 
After Breakfast, we leave for the most epic monastery.
•         Taktsang hike (Tiger's Nest) - Bhutan's most famous monastery situated at the altitude of 3180 meters. Guru Rinpoche (the great spiritual master) is said to have flown on the back of a tigress to meditate in a cave where Taktsang Monastery now stands. The Monastery is perched on the edge of a steep cliff, about 900 meters above Paro Valley. Overnight at Paro.
 
Day 7: Paro to Phuentsholing night halt 
 
After breakfast start at a comfortable time for Madarihat/Phuentsholing. Madarihat is a quiet destination in Jaldapara National Park, Dooars where the population of the famous one horned Rhinoceros the SECOND highest in India. Overnight in Madarihat.
 
Day 8: Phuentsholing to Bagdogra. Fly back to Delhi/Mumbai
 
After breakfast transfer to Bagdogra airport.

Inclusions:
•         Delhi/Mumbai to Bagdogra Flights
•         All hotel & airport transfers
•         Sightseeing tours
•         Accommodation in double, triple or double with extra mattress sharing basis
•         Breakfast & dinner
•         Immigration formalities
•         Punakha permit
•         Driver cum guide
•         Driver allowance
•         Transportation road tax

Experienced and Hindi/English speaking dedicated tour guide cum photographer exclusively for you trip Phuentsholing to Phuentsholing

Exclusions:
•         Entry fees to various landmarks, monasteries
•         Parking fees
•         Extra mattress
•         Any personal nature of expenses such as telephone call, battery recharge, shopping, extra porters, beverages, laundry, etc.
•         Your travel insurance - any kind of insurance which covers medical or emergency evacuation, lost and theft expenses etc.
•         Additional cost for delay which is out of management’s control like landslide, bad weather condition, itinerary modification with a view to safety concern, illness, change of government policy, political instability, strike, road blockade or any other natural calamities, etc.
•         Tips for staff and driver. (Tipping is not mandatory. It’s up to your satisfaction.)
•         Anything that isn’t in the ‘inclusions’ list

Feel free to write back for any questions.

Abhishek Upmanyu:
Abhishek Upmanyu is a stand-up comedian, writer and a haiku enthusiast. He looks and sounds like a regular Delhi boy, except that he is harmless. He does K*ll though, mostly on stage, and has done so at the biggest of stages on the stand-up circuit. Upmanyu covers seemingly everyday topics with insightful and hilarious effects. With his Shatabdi-fast delivery and writing prowess, rap is an alternate career option for Abhishek but he refuses on principal. Having moved to Mumbai recently for 'better prospects' that may or may not materialize but is bound to make for some crazy material.

Aditi Mittal:
Aditi Mittal is one of the top ten comics in the country and the girl Alok Nath warned his daughters about. After all the features in print, web, radio and television including BBC World and BBC America, there are very adjectives left unused in describing Mittal's brand of stand-up. Her comedy like her career choices are very Kamikaze but people still line-up for her shows and later remark 'Did She Just Say That?' As a regular feature at the biggest venues and comedy festivals across the country and the first Indian comedian to have performed at The Laugh Facory in Los Angeles, Aditi is doing something right and has made us believe Bad Girls will one day save the world.

description:
Ultra Music Festival India is finally official. During the live stream of the festivities on Day 1 of Ultra Miami and fabled brand let viewers get a sneak peek of what is to come in 2017 for the world's largest dance music festival.

Not only is Ultra Music Festival India taking place in 2017, the festival is taking place IN TWO CITIES. While dates may be flexible, but this is gigantic news for the two (out of the three) most populous cities in the subcontinent.  

The two cities join a harrowed list of some of the most successful Ultra stops in the world. India is known for being a massive consumer of electronic dance music and culture so it is only right that the country gets not one, but two Ultra Music Festivals. This also means that Ultra is very serious about continuing to expand it's brand. Only a decade ago only one Ultra existed and now slowly over the course of many years there are 24 different Ultra Music Festivals all over the globe.

Ultra Music Festival India will no doubt be two entirely unique experiences that are an absolute must for any and all international dance music fan. We are not only excited to learn more about what the festival plans to do as they release details about the two new festivals, but are also incredibly excited to see the reaction of Indian fans. The local talent in India has been noted over the years as the country is a breeding ground for euphoric high energy trance. We can only hope that Ultra India gives proper credit to the genre during its initial events.
address: Delhi & Mumbai, New Delhi

description:
About Tell-A-Tale:
=============
Tell-A-Tale is an annual event, presented by Bucket List, that focuses on a theatre production and brings together underprivileged kids to be a part of a team, be on the stage, witness the limelight and tell their story to the world. 

Each year, a popular fairy-tale is adapted into a play which focuses on breaking stereotypes, and encouraging inclusivity while giving the children the chance to tick off their wish of “being on a stage” off their bucket lists.

About the play:
===========
The 2 hour event will include an hour long theatre adaptation of Cinderella. Unlike the cliche way, the presentation will make you laugh & poke the ancient ideas about beauty & kindness. 

Happening at a very accessible venue, Tell A Tale has absolutely no entry fee.

About the cast:
===========
The Tell A Tale cast is no one else but the children you see everyday at traffic lights, on the streets and rag-picking in your neighbourhood. With majority of them having never been a part of any educational institution, they do not get to explore their interests, passion, strengths, or creativity like regular children.

We urge you to be there to not only encourage and motivate the team, but also witness the magic of bridging the gap between the two sections of our community. 

See you all there!
address: Vishwa Yuvak Kendra, Pt. Uma Shanker Dikshit Marg, Chanakyapuri, New Delhi, India

description:
Did you know about a mobile temple from Rajasthan? Do you know who is Pabuji Rathore?

Join us for about 1:30 - 2 hours at Kunzum Travel Cafe to get to know more about Folk Phad Painting from the artisan itself. Listen to stories by Shankar Lal Bhopa and get enchanted into their world. 

Phad art is a style of religious-folk painting made on a piece of cloth that resembles a large scroll. Phad in local dialect means ‘fold’ and this is used as a canvas to depict various episodes from the life of local deities, mainly Pabuji and Devnarayan. Lord Devnarayan is believed to be the incarnation of Hindu god Vishnu and Pabuji, the incarnation of Laxman (brother of lord Rama).

This art form is more than seven hundred years old and this style of painting is mainly done by Joshi families of Bhilwara district in Rajasthan. Long time ago, Chochu Bhat, a profound devotee of Lord Devnarayan commissioned the ‘Joshi family’ to illustrate the entire life of the folk-deity on Phad. From then onwards, Joshi families have become the traditional torchbearers of this art form.

Conducted by: Nazariya
Duration: 1.30 - 2.00 hours
Cost: Rs.1050 + Taxes

An initiative by Kunzum Travel Cafe, Shankar Lal Bhopa and Nazariya

BOOK YOUR SLOTS! Limited seats available
event_name: Discover the Stories of Folk Phad Painting: Workshop
address: Kunzum Travel Café, T-49 Ground Floor, Hauz Khas Village, New Delhi, India

description:
Located in Akole block of District Ahmednagar, Village Purushwadi is situated 220 km from both Mumbai & Pune en route to Nasik. This tribal village is inhabited by the ‘Hindu Mahadeo Koli’ tribe, renowned as rice cultivators and skilled animal herdsmen. The village is surrounded by mountains and offers abundant opportunities for good landscape, villagescape and village portraiture photography. Purushwadi truly has something to offer for people of all ages.

Scheduled dates: 16th - 17th December 2017 (1 night, 2 days)

Itinerary

Day 1

We will meet at the predesignated meeting point at Thane at 6:30 am and board a mini bus for Purushwadi. We will depart for Purushwadi at exactly 7:00 am. On route, we will take a break for breakfast and refreshments and proceed to Purushwadi. We expect to reach Purushwadi at around 12:00 pm. 

12:00 pm - Arrival at Purushwadi and a traditional welcome. Settle down in your allocated tents.

1:00 pm – Organic vegetarian lunch at the villager’s homes in groups following which you may want to rest for sometime to shake off the tiredness of the journey or explore the village and the surrounding areas.

4:00 pm – Black Tea & biscuits (There is no milk tea available)

4:30 pm – Villagescape photography including village shots, landscapes and portraits.

8:00 pm – Vegetarian Dinner 

9:00 pm – Review of select images shot during the day

10:00 pm – Lights out

Day 2

6:00 am – Wakeup call and black tea/biscuits

6:30 am – Villagescape / Portraiture photography

8:00 am – Breakfast at the villager’s homes

8:30 am – Villagescape / Portraiture photography session

1:00 pm – Lunch

2:00 pm – Departure to Mumbai


The stay will be in a permanent campsite set up with simple canvas tents. The canvas tents have a raised platform inside on which cotton mattresses are laid with fresh linen and cotton pillows. The tents will be allocated on triple occupancy basis. Clean bathrooms with western style toilets in them can be found outside the tents. Mobile connectivity is almost non-existent.

Important notification

Please note that this is a rustic village experience and not a deluxe or luxury trip.
Tipping the villagers or local guides is strictly prohibited. Please adhere to this rule strictly.
Consuming alcohol is strictly prohibited in the village and at the campsite.

Things to carry
DSLR cameras with wide angle lenses and preferably flash.
Carry fully charged batteries for your camera / flash.
Carry extra pack of camera batteries as charging facilities may not be available in the village
Carry backup memory cards / HDD storage drives, Laptop.
Carrying a Tripod is a must for low light photography
Carry a big towel / cloth to protect your gear from dust.
Carry a big cloth / bandanna / scarf to protect you from dust.
Sun screens are very important.
It is advisable to carry basic first aid along with you.
Towels and items of personal nature.
Please carry suitable mosquito repellants to keep you protected from mosquito bites.
Carry a pair of good binoculars.

Ashish Chalapuram is an Information Technology professional based in Mumbai with a passion for photography. He is a member of the prestigious Royal Photographic Society of Great Britain and has won accolades in various international photography competitions. His work has also been published on various photography platforms. He likes to experiment with various genres of photography and is of the firm belief that mastering the art of photography is always in a state of ‘beta’ and there is always something more to learn to excel and reach the next level. In addition to photography, he is an avid traveler and loves to explore new places and cultures. He is associated with DCP as a Consultant, Strategy Team.

Rs 6000 per head inclusive of all taxes

Cost includes

1. Triple occupany accommodation for 1 night and 2 days.
2. Travel from Mumbai to Purushwadi and back to Mumbai
3. 2 veg breakfast, 2 veg lunches and 1 veg dinner during the stay.
4. All activities mentioned in the itinerary above.
5. DCP photography expert for 2 days.
6. All Taxes and service charges.

address: Purushwadi, Akola, Maharashtra, New Delhi, India

description:
Embassy of Hungary, Hungarian Information and Cultural Centre and Gallery Sree Arts presents a thought provoking exhibition by an Indian contemporary artist P.S. Sujeet  titled “100 Shades of Perspectives” curated by Jitendra Padam Jain on Thursday, 15th December 2017 at 6 pm at the Art Gallery of Hungarian Centre. The exhibition will be on view for public till 19th December from 10 am to 4pm. 
About the exhibition:
The exhibition, in acrylic on canvas and mix media on paper, is a stark yet geometric portrayal of the spiritual and modern life. It is a unique and insightful scrutiny of the way our lives are headed. The canvases invite the connoisseur to delve deep into the gauge of black and white within themselves and the world around them and at the same time accept the hues of grey and the stark colour drawing myriad interpretations of life, man and his humanness. 
The curator and the artist were working on this concept past three months. The canvases portray the artist Sujeet’s conflict and cares and his creative urge to present his besieged soul onto paper.
Sujeet is a creative spirit spewing his creativity into paintings. A graduate from The Delhi College of Arts in Applied Art, Sujeet spent several eventful years in the Television and Broadcast Industry. His creative urge took him to founding and running Grasshopper Media, a leading design house, besides juggling as a part time lecturer teaching MFA students at his Alma Mater.
Born in Hojai, a small town in Assam, Sujeet spent his childhood and a large part of his youth going to the government school Janakpuri and growing up playing cars with spare tyres in the by lanes of humble Delhi, where life was not easy but not too dull either.
Sujeet has now taken refuge in geometric shapes hidden in everyday life. A large part of Sujeet’s inspiration is drawn from his childhood impressions that left an indelible mark on his psyche.
The black and white paintings bring to life the ruthlessness of life whereas the contrasting colour and the indefinable shades of grey bring myriad interpretations to the surprises that come with everyday. The paintings depict the struggle, the joys and the reality of everyday modern life. In pen and ink, these canvases are an ode to man and his humanness.

He was born in 1972 and is settled in New Delhi aspiring to put more and more of his perspectives onto canvas.
address: Hungarian Information and Cultural Centre, New Delhi, India

description:
http://zorbathebuddha.org/events/oshointfestdec2017/?event

Osho – the master of masters, a modern day mystic whose wisdom, rebellious spirit and humor has transformed the lives of millions around the globe. His teachings liberated people from the shackles of religion and conformity. Osho coined the concept of a new man – Zorba the Buddha, one who celebrates and meditates.

Osho’s teaching are an amalgamation of the healing arts of the East and modern therapies of the West. This festival, a gratitude to the enlightened master, will give us a taste of his work: Tantra, Zen, Sufism, esoteric sciences, and centering techniques, breath-work, yoga, biodanza, heart dance, and many Osho active meditations. You will also have the opportunity to get one-on-one sessions with the healers and therapists. The evenings will be blessed by Osho’s discourse in the White Robe gathering. After dinner, there will be musical and dance performances, talent show, closing party or special night meditations.

Come let’s live Osho’s vision… And in spirit, meditate with the Buddha, dance with Krishna and celebrate with Rumi!

Here’s a look at some of the key offerings:

Osho’s Active Meditations

Osho’s scientifically-designed methods are active in nature and pave the way for inner transformation. We will explore power-packed practices like Dynamic, Nataraj, Gourishankar, Naadbrahma, and Mandala in this festival!

Sufi Meditations

Sufism’s whole concern is love—intense, passionate love, said Osho. We will connect with the beloved within through practices like Gibberish, No Dimension, Zikr, Gurdieff movements and whirling like Dervishes.

Biodanza

Biodanza means the dance of life. In this session, we will explore our body’s natural movements to music and learn to be playful again!

AUM

AUM - Awareness, Understanding, Meditation - is an Osho Humanversity practice that takes you through 14 aspects of the human experience using movement, role play and voice in a safe environment. Get ready to shake the stress and the distress away as you reclaim the joy of being alive!

Tibetan Pulsing

Pulse is the life force through which the spirit manifests itself. Based on the Six Yogas of enlightened Mystic, Naropa, Pulsing has been brought to the world under the guidance of Osho. This ancient method, often practiced in pairs, uses sound, colour, and touch to bring deep healing to our organs.

Rebirthing Breathwork

This guided breathing method supports the clearing away of old energies, conditioning, patterns, negative thoughts and emotions by taking us into the subconscious. Get ready to open the door to a new life!

Shakti Dance

Based on the ancient teaching of Kundalini Yoga, Shakti Dance combines fluently the art of different types of dance and the wisdom of the Classic Yoga’s science. In this beautiful session, we will alternate between movement and meditation.

Facilitators & Healers

Ashwin Bharti

Ashwin Bharti became a disciple of Osho in 1977 and is an ambassador of Osho’s vision. From being a successful businessman, he became a philanthropist and started helping himself & others in their spiritual journey. Being a channel for Osho’s energy, Ashwin created Zorba the Buddha, one of the world’s largest open faith spiritual centre and cultural hub. Over the years, he has received transmissions from various masters in Sufism, Tantra, Zen, Shamanism, Pulsing, Osho therapies & meditations, bodywork, biodanza, contact improvisation, art and music.

Mahima

Mahima carries an essence of the earthly deep feminine and the high masculine light energies. Weaving sacred sounds of her enchanting voice with Shaman Drums, Tibetan and Crystal singing bowls Mahima shares the ancient knowledge of the power of sound that she carries with deep reverence. She loves holding space in her intuitive surrendered leadership – guiding with her pureness – weaving depth and lightheartedness in the presence of unconditional love.

She has been traveling around sharing her circles and music for more than 16 years in Sweden and around the world. Bringing Earth and Heaven together into Unity in the Heart – to ignite the Star of David within ourselves is her sharing mainly about now – and Sound is her Medicine.

Ma Nidhi

Ma Nidhi embarked on her spiritual journey as a scholar. She holds a Ph.D. degree from Delhi University in Osho’s vision of Education for new man. Soon she realized that, what Osho expounded cannot be restricted to a thesis. She became a sanyasin and totally soaked herself into experiencing every aspect of Osho phenomenon. It soon started flowing through her.She has conducted numerous seminars and conferences on Osho’s vision. She has been facilitating many workshops all over India on subjects like emotional wellness, dance therapy, conscious parenting, couple meditation and life skills etc.

Parambodhi

Architect and painter, Parambodhi began his spiritual journey in the 70s after his encounter with his master Osho. He was introduced to Tibetan Pulsing by Shantam Sheeraj in the 80s. At the moment, he shuttles between Milan (Italy), Wangen (Germany) and Goa (India).

Manju Waltraud Pollmann

Her spiritual Journy started 1986 with a intense Sufi practice and Shamanic work with JABRANE Sebant. 1990 she meet her Indian Master H.W.L Ponnja (PAPAJI) in Lucknow which named her MANJU and spend through three Years much time with him in Lucknow. 1992 she started her Biodanza training directly with the founder of BIODANZA Rolando TORO ARANEDA in Italy. She was his close collaborator in Austria from 1992 until his dead
in 2010. She opened the Biodanza Community in Austria and is directing since 1994 the first Biodanza School of Austria.

She is trained in many Biodanza –Extensions directly by Rolando Toro Araneda and in many different body-psychotherapeutic and spiritual techniques. She is a Biodanza-Teachertrainer and Spiritual Coach with 35 years of experience.

Fakeera (Manju Verma)

Fakeera (manju) is a certified movement therapist and has a background in psychology and counselling. She is currently training in psychodrama, breath and voice work. Her approach is like provocative coaching. The major part of her work revolves around gaps in sexuality, gender, intimacy, authenticity, judgments and conditioning we grow up with. She offers individual, group and couples sessions. She is one of the co-founders of CMTAI. She has been teaching this work in India, Egypt and south east Asia.

Prem Ananda

Prem Ananda got introduced to Osho through an expressive art workshop at the age of 15 which marked the beginning of her spiritual journey with the Master. She moved to London for higher education and completed her PhD in Psychiatry. Through all these years, Ananda continued to learn and develop on various spiritual and healing modalities including Reiki, Osho meditation techniques and Sufi practices like Du’a, Whirling and Gibberish.

Having keen interest in music, dance, expressive art and poetry she wishes to encourage their use as therapeutic techniques. She sees beauty in the sacred as well as mundane and derives her bliss from spreading joy! Zorba the Buddha brought about a turning point in Ananda’s spiritual quest, such that she has now re-located back to India with the vision to amalgamate the Western education with Eastern spiritual practices.

Swami Kulbhushan

Over 45 years ago, Swami Anand Kulbhushan started on his spiritual safari with whirling. Since then, he has been into whirling as he learnt about the great Sufi masters from Osho. In his travels to over 50 countries, he visited Iran, Egypt, Turkey and the Sudan where he witnessed Sufism in action. He has conducted numerous Sufi meditation camps with enthusiastic response.

Tarisha

Tarisha is both a singer and songwriter of exceptional talent. She is everyone’s soul sister, calling us to come out of our shells and enter into a divine rapture of sound and silence. Her exquisite voice carries us to the heights of the soul and back again to our shamanic earth. Her range of expression is simply awesome. Tarisha will be composing a special Festival Song, and slowly, day by day this song will evolve into a several part harmony, including movements, connections and dance, creating a magic spell of enchantment.

Tarisha is also a Singing Medicine Woman who works magic through her voice. Her sessions are uniquely personal, deeply relaxing and full of spirit. You are bathed in beauty and sound.

Healers and Therapists :

Samya

Samya is yoga practitioner and certified yoga therapist, a reflexologist and naturopath. She practices Osho meditations, tibetan pulsing and tantra for couples. Samya has traveled across the world to learn different techniques of massage. Her expertise lies in body work, which is a deep tissue massage with body aligning stretches. The process includes other forms of energy work as per the need of the moment and person. Though the work is quite deep at the physical level, it also intensely relaxing on a mental level and balancing at an energetic level. Samya absolutely in love with her body yearns to share ways how to befriend our bodies.

description:
----------------------
Kartikeya Srivastava Trio :
----------------------

The Kartikeya Srivastava Trio is an experimental collaboration featuring Pranai Gurung on Guitar, Sonic Shori on Bass and Kartikeya Srivastava on Drums. The group was formed to serve as a space to explore creative ideas within original music and to reinterpret jazz standards with a modern aesthetic.

------------------
About the Musicians :
------------------

Kartikeya Srivastava : Drums

Kartikeya Srivastava is a rock drummer, improviser, and composer from Lucknow, India. His current interests involve exploring musical improvisation and folk music from around the world in an attempt to develop a creative musical language that is personal and representative of his experience as a human.

Pranai Gurung : Guitar

Pranai Gurung, one of the finest guitarists in Delhi, has been writing and collaborating with various musicians for over 15 years. His past musical collaborations include DRIFT The Trio, Silk Route, Bipul Chettri, J Hola, BollyJazz and international artists such as like Rainer Pusch, Gianni Denitto and Raphaelle Brochet. Pranai stays busy with international tours to top music venues in Australia, Hong kong, London, Dubai, Nepal and India.

Sonic Shori : Bass

Sonic Shori is a professional bassist in the city of Delhi. He is a student of Grammy-nominated Greek-American musician Panagiotis Andreou. He has comprehensive stage experience, and has collaborated with musicians from several different genres including classical, fusion, funk and metal. His playing combines complexity with cohesion, and playing melodies with dexterity, musicality and tenacity. Over the last few years, Sonic has collaborated with several bands in Delhi and across India, such as Kaash, Antariksh, Trizya, and Adil and Vasundhara.
address: The Piano Man Jazz Club, 7/22, Ground Floor, B-6, Safdarjung Enclave Market, New Delhi, India

description:
The Origin : Founded in 2006, ET ACETECH was conceptualized to bring all the architects, designers, developers, engineers, contracting companies, material suppliers and technology providers under one roof for displaying and sourcing products expediently. But the concept has evolved over time and has become a premier platform for hosting and promoting innovations in the industry and creating better business networking opportunities among decision makers of procurement companies and suppliers.

Expanding Footprints : The exhibition was conceptualized and organized in Mumbai for the very first time and now it has expanded its presence across major cities such as Delhi, Bengaluru and Ahmedabad. An indisputable leader in the Indian trade fair domain, ACETECH is also deemed the largest exhibition in Asia and the third largest in the world. 

Exclusive Conferences and Allied Events: The show format enables exhibitors from around the world to showcase their potential by providing detailed demonstrations of latest products and services within industry-segmented pavilions. The Allied Events and Conferences formulated by ACETECH aims to bring the industry leaders and government bodies together to network, exchange ideas and invest in a progressive nation-building activity. Design Wall brings latest products and innovations to the fore for review by industry experts whereas CONNECT offers the opportunity for procurement teams of companies to directly meet and source from material suppliers and technology providers on project requirement basis. The Global Green Summit was instituted to focus on green initiatives while Indian Paints & Coating Forum (IPCF) provides a platform to all the stakeholders in the Indian Paint and Coating industry to discuss the trends and challenges faced. ACETECH Alpha Awards acknowledges the alpha leaders and innovators who have changed the face of the industry through their intuitive insights, leadership skills and perceptive designs whereas Walk the Talk with your Mentor gives an opportunity to the young minds of architecture and design to interact and learn from the stalwarts of the profession.

Government Support: Over the years, top government authorities have extended their support to the exhibition. Last year, Shri Nitin Gadkari, Honourable Union Minister of Road Transport, Highways and Shipping inaugurated the Delhi 2015 edition while Shri. Devendra Fadnavis, Chief Minister of Maharashtra inaugurated the Mumbai 2014 edition and Shri. Venkaiah Naidu, Union Minister of Urban Development inaugurated the Delhi 2014 edition and Shri. Prakash Jawadekar, Hon'ble Minister of Environment & Forests and Climate Change was part of the Global Green Summit 2014 in Delhi.
address: New Delhi, India

Winner of numerous awards including the Commander of the British Empire for his Services to Dance, Wayne McGregor is quite a renowned figure in his 20+ year career, creating cutting-edge dance work. 

His latest production FAR, a visual spectacle of powerful and dynamic contemporary choreography is coming to India this December on a three-city tour of Mumbai, Bengaluru & New Delhi.

Inspired by the controversial Age of Enlightenment, FAR mines an era that first placed ‘a body in question’. 

Ten incredible dancers confront the distortions, sensuality and feeling of the 18th Century’s searing contemporary sensibility to a haunting score by the critically-acclaimed composer Ben Frost. 

The performance is part of the UK/India Year of Culture events.

Soham Mallick, the vocalist, songwriter and guitarist, is trained in Hindustani Classical vocals from a very young age. His obsession with Rock n’ Roll, Blues, Funk and Western Pop is evident in his compositions and arrangements. With a powerful and dynamic range of octaves, he can churn out the likes of Led Zeppelin, Deep Purple, Rabbi Shergill and Rahat Fateh Ali Khan with equal ease and finesse. His compositions can bring out feelings of longing, self introspection or even post apocalyptic love with equal simplicity and relatability.

description:
LYRIC ENSEMBLE OF DELHI presents

AMAHL AND THE NIGHT VISITORS
A Christmas Musical for the Family

by Menotti

Amahl, a poor, disabled shepherd boy, lives with his widowed mother in a small hut. Amahl, who often has a wild imagination, tells his mother about what he has seen in the night sky: an enormous star with a long tail! His mother, tired of his tall tales, doesn't believe him. But there are visitors coming who are following that very star, and soon the mother will have to believe in the star and other wonderful things. 

The opera is the story of a small miracle that was part of one of the most momentous times in history, and based on composer Gian-Carlo Menotti's childhood Christmas tradition where Christmas gifts were brought to children not by Santa Claus but by the Three Kings.


Duration:  1 hour

Age to enter:  5 years and above 

Founder & Voice Coach: Situ Singh Buehler
Conductor and Choreographer: Clayton Duggan
Stage Director: Ravi Raj Sagar

Flute: Michail Ushinin

description:
THE PURPOSE

On December 12, 2017, join us for a very special synchronized Global Meditation Event as we come together as one to ring in the holiday season. 
The world will come together for a “Live” Guided Global Meditation. For 22 minutes humanity will slow down to share in love and peace for the planet and each other. Anyone can participate. There’s no special discipline required nor is any specific religious belief or philosophy. All that is asked is that you be present. 

ABOUT THE EVENT 

This is our 5th "cause meditation." The Master Shift is writing "cause meditations" to bring about world peace and harmony. Our meditations will be a positive/peaceful experience for all participants. 
The Master Shift’s holiday-inspired Co-Exist Meditation features a sampling of religious traditions and wisdom from around the world. Featured in this meditation are Christmas (Christian), Kwanzaa (African American), Ramadan (Islamic), Chökhor Düchen (Tibetan Buddhist), Bodhi Day (Hindu Buddhist), Yule (Pagan, Wiccan), Navarathri (Hindu), Jashan of Spendarmad (Zoroastrian) and Hanukkah (Jewish).

Are you ready to go on a journey around the world!

The links to the FREE global meditation will be available both on www.themastershift.com and www.thousandthoughts.org the day before the meditation. It will also be widely distributed on our social media sites including Facebook.

TIMINGS: 

The meditation is synchronized according to Japanese Standard Time and Eastern Standard Time at 9:30 PM (JST/EST 9:30 PM) There are two meditation times to accommodate the various time differences around the world.
Please join in on your particular time (6:00 PM INDIA STANDARD TIME) or do both! We invite you to this LIVE Synchronized Meditation event, the entry of which is free; just register online to confirm your presence. 

DATE - December 12, 2017

TICKETS: Entry is FREE, all you need to do is register yourself to confirm your presence. This would help us to manage the seating arrangements. 

Where to Join?

1. The Hosteller - Saket, New Delhi
2. Save the Quest - Govindpuri Extn, New Delhi
3. You Can Foundation - Rishabh Vihar, New Delhi
4. The Nidaan Blessed By Panchtatwa - Sahibabad, Uttar Pradesh
5. Yoga@home - Suraj Kund, Faridabad
6. EMS Academy - Jaipur, Rajasthan 
, 
ABOUT THE ORGANIZATIONS:

THE MASTER SHIFT
The Master Shift provides meditations and other services to humanity, including international on the ground gatherings, financial assistance to charitable organizations around the world, educational conferences that facilitate spiritual growth, worldwide healing, and commitment to sustainability and green initiatives.

THOUSAND THOUGHTS 
Thousand Thoughts aims at empowering and educating people to achieve the goal of sustainability, which in turn requires fundamental changes to human attitudes and behavior. We believe in prioritizing the need for education and public awareness by means of mass gathering and educational conferences. We at Thousand Thoughts also provide inspirational seminars, and other services, to people, including but not limited to, mental health workshops and meditation which facilitates spiritual growth and worldwide healing.

description:
“Renaissance of the Culture of Sanitation: Indus Valley civilization to Gandhi, to Swachh Bharat and Beyond”

Sulabh International Centre for Action Sociology in collaboration with Sulabh International Social Service Organisation proposes to hold a three-day National Seminar on “Renaissance of the Culture of Sanitation: Indus Valley civilization to Gandhi, to Swachh Bharat and Beyond”, during December 10 – 12, 2016, at Mavalankar Auditorium, Rafi Marg, New Delhi.

What information You’ll get:
This National Seminar will be a platform for a wide range of deliberation on the Culture of Sanitation, tracing its roots in the Indus Valley Civilization, and taking it forward to Gandhi, to Swachh Bharat and beyond. Though sanitation was a part of human life since the ancient times, it gained importance with the development of human civilization. As civilization started to expand with its diversity, sanitation became one of the necessities of human society. The culture of sanitation refers to the ways in which different cultural groups developed attitudes, values and habits regarding sanitation. Sanitation has a long history at various levels of human civilisation.

Objectives of the Seminar:
The objective of this seminar is to hold a comprehensive dialogue to conceptualise the complex cultural, social and sanitation issues, and to develop an incisive perspective on the growth of a new culture of sanitation. The Seminar will try to set a roadmap for future strategy and interventions, and will add to the corpus of knowledge and research on the Culture of Sanitation.

India today under the dynamic leadership of Hon’ble Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has put sanitation in the centre of civilizational debate, underlining its fundamental importance and how important it is from development perspective. We will intensively debate it with a perspective to achieve the goal of a Clean India, which is a prerequisite for a developed India.

For more information about the seminar kindly visit :  http://seminar.sulabhinternational.org/
event_name: National Seminar on Renaissance of the Culture of Sanitation
address: Mavalankar Hall, New Delhi, India

Love Matters India and the Global Advisory Board (GAB) for Sexual Health and Wellbeing, established in 2016 by Durex, is organising a panel discussion on the theme of ‘Right to sexual pleasure”. 

This event is a part of a global event which will take place globally in multiple cities that include New Delhi, London, Beirut, Los Angeles, Johannesburg and Amsterdam on 11th December 2017. 

The objective of holding these series of events around the globe will be to promote positive sexuality in the context of human rights and sexual health, positive sexuality, non-discrimination and to be free from violence.These events will bring together human rights activists, academics, scientists and other experts to discuss issues around the right to sexual pleasure, in the context of positive sexuality, sexual and gender diversity, body diversity, disability, culture, religion, sex work, youth sexuality, non-discrimination and to free from violence in relation to sexuality, from a multidisciplinary perspective.

description:
As one of the most celebrated Urdu writers, Faiz Ahmad Faiz has raptured generations with his revolutionary writing. From 1951 to 1955, during his imprisonment in Pakistan, Faiz exchanged a series of letters with his British wife, Alys. These letters come alive with ‘Chand Roz Aur Meri Jaan’ performed by Salima Raza and Banwari Taneja. The words are laced with hope, and embody the desire of distant lovers. Reading them, one is convinced that cause endures, aspirations linger and that dreams shall not die. Weaving music with powerful words, this performance will take the audience on a magical ride of love and longing.

*Directed by Salima Raza.

Doors open at 6PM
Performance Starts at 7PM

Dear All
 
Few days before I uploaded an image comprising a list of high passes and roads in Indian Himalayas with the help of traveller friends for all who wish to ride in/to the hills.

I got good feedback and suggestions, as asked by so many group members and I have decided to take it to a another level by interactive session on it, so that they can raise their queries and they get the answer same time.

8. How to plan itinerary and how many kilometres to cover in a hills with the knowledge of stays before and on the final destination.

9. What to eat and drink to keep yourself composed and energetic while riding in the hills at higher altitudes.

Just borne your eatables' bill

Malgudi! Doesn’t the name take you in those childhood lanes where the flute still echoes in front of the TV set? Doesn’t the ‘Postman’ of Missing Mail, ‘Swami’ of a Hero, ‘Aaya’ of a Willing Slave come alive again and start dancing in front of the eyes with same anima? Vayam Performing Arts Society brings that lost fragrance of childhood again right from the streets of Malgudi!! The difference is that this time, the story is not of Swami but Radha; the difference is that this time, the characters will not be trapped in shackles of TV but will come to life on free stage! 
So, If you want to read those lost letters of the ‘Postman’ again, laugh over the idiocy of ’Ishwar’ again, swing in the cradle of the affection of ‘Aaya’ again or you want to relive those notorious days of past with ‘Radha’ again, then your destination is our fresh production: ‘Malgudi Ke Gaon Se’.

description:
Introduction

This workshop introduces simple techniques prescribed by the author: Louise L Hay. One of the best tools that help you overcome any difficulties in life. Louise puts it up in a 12 point program on ‘how to love oneself’. Similarly In 1956, psychologist and social philosopher ‘Erich Fromm’ proposed that loving oneself is different from being arrogant, conceited or egocentric. He proposed that loving oneself means caring about oneself, taking responsibility for oneself, respecting oneself, and knowing oneself (e.g. being realistic and honest about one’s strengths and weaknesses).

Outcome

To be able to be loved, you must love and respect yourself as much as you do others. This would be a wonderful opportunity to get your own definition of self love

Workshop focus

What is self love
How to distinguish between self love and vanity
What are the barriers of self love

Facilitator – Asmah D’souza

Asmah D’souza is a Life Coach and Corporate Mentor who conducts Workshops on ESQ (enhance the spiritual quotient), EIQ (Empower Integrity quotient), Positivity and Productivity Enhancement, Train-the-Trainer. She is also a Graphologist and public speaker on Power of subconscious Mind. She is renowned from last 9 years for her Heal Your Life Workshops. A Tarot Card Reader with a comprehensive expertise as a Clinical hypnotherapist, NLP Practitioner & Theta Healing Specialist.

Having worked with corporate such as ICICI Prudential Life Insurance she understands the dynamics of work-life balance and helps individuals as well as the organization to expedite the transformation as the simple process of “Change” changes its dimensions to “Transform Together.”

Her approachable outlook and customer centricity has given her an edge over the others in the respective field. She has been recipient of several awards for her work excellence. Notable amongst these are Excellence Par Trainer in Louise L Hay Philosophy Awards by International Spiritual & Hindu Mythology Awards in 2013. She has been felicitated in 2016 as the “Spiritual Diva” at the International Spiritual & Hindu Mythology (ISHMA) Awards

Date & Timings : 10th December, 2017 (5 PM – 8 PM)

Enroll now!

Un événement familial, à la fois festif et caritatif, ouvert à tous les francophones et francophiles !

14h : accueil et atelier caritatif d’emballage de cadeaux au profit d’ONG soutenues par Main Tendue
15h : spectacle « La belle histoire de Noël » par les enfants du primaire, et chorale de chants de Noël par les collégiens (faites participer vos enfants !)

Un cadeau à offrir à un enfant d'une ONG (d’occasion en bon état, ou neuf inférieur à 500 INR) ainsi qu'une gourmandise maison seront les bienvenus !

About Da-Bangg Tour:
Bollywood’s heartthrob, Salman Khan, gears up to come to New Delhi with his leading ladies for an enthralling night, you don’t want to miss! Spurred by the highly successful Da-Bangg shows in London, Hong Kong, Auckland, and Melbourne, it's time to take Delhi by storm.

description:
‘Life is poetry and poetry is life.’ 
If you wish to understand this line then either you have to be a poet or his muse. People have often been curious about a poet’s mind and questions like ‘How do you write such things?’ ‘How can you even think so?’ ‘Who is she?’ are very common for a poet. Thankfully, we have come up with the answers of the queries with our new Poetic Dance Theatre Production – Zikra!
Someone said that we live in moments – Zikra is the poetic interpretation of these moments. If you want to know how does it feel when emotion dances euphorically in front of your eyes, when memories makes you hurl like a hurricane, when your soul searches for nothing but words to knit an ecstatic reality, when unicorns & rainbows flow in front of your eyes, when you live in multiple parallel dimensions.. When you can see how a poet sees the world through the twist & turns of life.. Then Zikra is the place for you!

Warning – A poet’s mind is beautiful swamp and you can get stuck anywhere so put your steps carefully.

Catch us live at Akshara Theatre on 10th December at 6:30 PM.

Note: Viewers are requested to bring toys/stationary/utensils/bags/clothes/books etc. for the underprivileged.
address: Akshara Theater, 11/12-b, Connaught Place, Baba Kharak Singh Marg Next To Ram Manohar Lohia Hosp, New Delhi, India

description:
Chayan & Smiti:

Chayan & Smiti are an indie-acoustic duo from New Delhi, India. Their songs are a product of casual jam sessions, often unintentional and simply stumbled upon. They enjoy experimenting with harmony and writing about significant life experiences. Over the last 2 years, they've played several shows in and around the city, both as a duo and a four piece band. They have built an audience for themselves, which is ever-growing. 
They released their single - ‘This Night’ on Soundcloud in 2015, which now has over 26,000 plays. They subsequently released videos for their singles ‘Madeleine’ and ‘In this Waiting Place’ on YouTube. Their latest release is their live performance of the song ‘Wonder’ from the SoFar sessions in Bangalore. 

Chayan Adhikari - Voice and Acoustic Guitar / Electric Guitar 
Smiti Malik - Voice and Acoustic Guitar
address: Depot48, N 3, 2nd Floor, Greater Kailash 1, N block market, New Delhi, India

description:
Microgreens are nutrient-packed, flavor-rich mini versions of commonly eaten greens and vegetables like spinach, alfa alfa, mustard, radish and broccoli.

They’re the post-sprout, pre-adulthood stage of a plant that gourmet chefs like to use as edible jewelry for their dishes. But what’s more important is that they’re super easy to grow and packed with nutrients! For example, red cabbage micros contain 6x more Vitamin C and 40x more Vitamin E than full-grown leaves.

Best of all, growing microgreens requires minimal space, sunshine, time, and what’s more, you’ll have your first harvest in just 5-10 days. They add color, taste and freshness to salads, soups and sandwiches or you can whizz them into your smoothies.

In this workshop we’ll teach you everything you need to know to start growing microgreens at home and using them in your dishes.


What’s included:
- Detailed instructions on growing microgreens at home plus hands-on activities
- Take-home microgreens kit (includes a basket, soil mix, seeds and recipes)
- Kitchen demonstration on using microgreens
- Snacks and refreshments

Date: Sunday, 10 December
Time: 11 am- 1 pm
Cost: 750 INR (plus 18% GST)
Venue: Farm 8, Phase 5, Aya Nagar near Mother Mary School

To register, please follow this link:
 https://goo.gl/forms/wFhFXKHM5941OuN92

To book your seat, please follow this link:
 https://www.payumoney.com/events/#/buyTickets/Micro_Greens_Dec.10

Any queries? Contact us here:
 http://m.me/EdibleRoutes

AMOUNTS PAID TOWARDS ANY OF OUR WORKSHOPS ARE TRANSFERABLE TO ANY OTHER WORKSHOP WITHIN 6 MONTHS

description:
WHO IS IT FOR | Writers, editors, publishers

WHAT IS IT | A mixer for people in the writing and publishing industry, in association with German Book House, with the theme Indian Fiction, International Market. The aim is to connect with others in the industry and in effect propel your writing career forward.  

WHO’S WHO | 
*Anish Chandy, founder of Labyrinth Literary Agency, Head of Sales and Business Development at Juggernaut Books, winner of Frankfurt Book Fair fellowship
*Prashasti Rastogi, Director of German Book Office of the Frankfurt Book Fair in New Delhi
*Meenakshi Reddy Madhavan, author of The One Who Swam With the Fishes, You Are Here, Split, The Life and Times of Layla the Ordinary

WHEN| Sunday, 10th December, 11 am- 2 pm

WHERE | Workly, Plot no. 1, second floor, Lajpat Nagar IV, Ring Road,, Above Axis bank,, New Delhi, Delhi 110024

AGENDA|
11:00-11:30 Mixing activity

11:30-12: 30 Writer's Session: Author Meenakshi Reddy Madhavan
3 common struggles faced by writers- find the answers you’ve been from other writers and our Author in the House! The particular topics in discussion would be:
1.	Character Building
2.	Plotting
3.	Editing

12: 30- 14:00 Publishers Session: With years of international experience in the business of publishing and sales, Prashasti Rastogi and Anish Chandy are set to hold an engaging discussion on Indian Fiction, International Market, discussing issues like the market for Indian Fiction abroad, the role of literary agents, the Frankfurt Book Fair, currently the biggest book fair in the world, and the role of literary agents. 

What would you like addressed and discussed? Tell us here and it will be in the agenda! Write it in this link:  https://goo.gl/ijDZ7n

Pre-event activities |

Take Part in the Writers Mixers Contest and win a seat to the Young Professional's Program: Understand Intellectual property Rights and Commercialisation, a 2 day workshop by the German Book Office on 1st and 2nd December! Priced at Rs. 9500, this workshop is aimed at publishers and authors, and you can win a seat to it FREE by taking part in our contest! (6 seats for participants at Writers Mixer)

Apply here:  https://goo.gl/Rc1MgH

Read more about the program:  http://www.publisherstraining.com/programmes_courses_ptpyp.html

Contact: Sharan Gulati +91 9999060860 enoheneye | gmail ! com
Srishti Chaudhary +91 9818889031 srishti ! chaudhary2 | gmail ! com

description:
Wildlife photography as a career used to sound like a dream a couple of years back. Lucky had been those who could persuade their profession and passion simultaneously. For most, wildlife and wildlife photography remained as a childhood passion and one amongst the many lost dreams condemned by our professional pursuits. Today more and more people have started thinking differently; many have started taking serious interest in learning photography and adopting wildlife photography as a full time carrier. In this market driven economy, today, we can see endless opportunities for a wildlife photographer from print media to graphic designing, from exhibitions to stock photography, from travels and tours to organized wildlife camps, from organized field trips to sponsored projects – options are too many. However, building a career in wildlife photography definitely demands the photographs to stand amongst thousands and hand holding and personalized knowledge sharing helps one to improvise and excel – and hence Wildlife photography workshop.


Date - 10th December 2017 (Sunday)
Time - 10 am to 5 pm (with a lunch break)
Venue - Future Forward, Q-2, 1st Floor, Near Lal Sai Market, Lajpat Nagar - 2, New Delhi - 110024

This is a full day indoor workshop. There is no stay involved.

Who can attend?

1. Anyone who is enthusiastic to escalate his hobby of wildlife photography to the next level 2. No qualification criteria / no age limits / no skill sets mandatory to attend this basic course. 3. Amateurs and hobbyists who wish to improve their work can also get immensely benefited

What to carry?

You need to carry your digital SLR camera and the set of lenses that you posses.

Course details

Full day – 11:00 a.m.  – 5:00 p.m. with lunch and tea breaks

Basic Photography - Aperture, Shutter speed, ISO
White balance, Depth of field, Focal length, Histogram, Metering etc
Best camera settings for your Wildlife / Birds / Nature photography
Equipment tips
Understanding lighting
Exposure theory and exposure compensation
Composition Techniques - Learn the composition rules and learn when to break them
Wildlife Action Photography
Creative Wildlife Photography
Post Processing tips
Tips and tricks of wildlife photography
Field techniques and Ethics of wildlife photography

Mentor
 
Rathika Ramasamy is India’s one of the first few women Wildlife Photographers. She ventured into the field of wildlife photography more than a decade ago, when Wildlife photography was just shaping up in India. She has been passionate about birds and specializes in bird photography. Her knowledge about wildlife photography has been appreciated and respected globally. Her work is truly awe inspiring and we are privileged to have her with us to share her expertise. Having travelled to most of the National parks in India and also Africa, for her, wildlife photography is not only a passion but a medium to conserve nature. Her work has been showcased in national and international publications. She regularly conducts Wildlife Photography workshops all over India. "Every time I press the shutter, it takes me one step closer to Mother Nature” says Rathika Ramasamy. For a complete information – please refer  http://www.rathikaramasamy.com/

Workshop fee

Rs 4750 per head inclusive of all taxes

Cancellation policy

All cancellations before 30 days of the event date - 100% refund
All cancellations between 20 - 30 days of the event date - 50% refund or credit 
All cancellations within 20 days of the event date - No refund or credit possible
event_name: Rathika Ramasamy Wildlife Photography Workshop - Delhi, December
address: Future Forward, O2 1 floor lajpat nagar 2Jal Vihar Road, New Delhi, India

description:
How about a Sunday that you can spend indulging in different kind of art forms? Sounds interesting, isn’t it?

The Craftsutra and TravelTroovel have come together to give you this artsy and eventful Sunday in the form of DELHI ART CRAWL.

What it is?
At this one of its kind Art experience – ‘DELHI ART CRAWL’, you get to explore and express your creativity in three different ways at three separate settings one after the other – you get to chill both indoors and outdoors.  You’d definitely strike a chord with the artist within you.
Crawl Point 1 : Meditative Mandala Painting
Crawl Point 2 : Chai, Charcha aur Caricature
Crawl Point 3: Sip and Paint Party (Paint abstract art on canvas inspired by Yayoi Kusama)

Who is it for?
This ‘Art Crawl’ is for EVERYONE. You get to explore your artistic side all day through unique art styles. Meet new people, sketch and paint together, brew beautiful memories, bond over a common interest and just let your creative juices flow…AND OBVIOUSLY HAVE LOADS OF FUN!!

When is it?
Sunday, 10th December, in and around Green Park, the Art Crawl starts at 11:00 am and goes through the day till 7:30pm. More details will be shared on registration.

Cost – Rs.3500 per person (inclusive of all the art material (for the 3 art styles),food and beverages, bunch of amazing friends and lots of inspiration).

Brownie Points
As we crawl to these venues to experiment different art techniques, there is going to be some tasty food & refreshing drinks for your company. And oh, you don’t have to worry about the conveyance too.  

No prior arty experience required. Just come and have a fun-filled day!
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
About TravelTroovel
TravelTroovel offers hobby based experiences in the form of hobby trips and weekly hobby sessions. Each of the trip/weekly session has a hobby/interest as a theme that is inspired by music, reading, theatre, art and so on. Anyone coming for these experiences, gets a chance to explore their long sought hobby or interest with a touch of freshness by indulging in various activities and fun travels.

About Craftsutra
‘The Craftsutra’ aims at providing a platform to make people (artists/non-artists) to engage in Arts, discover things about themselves and awareness for increasing art appreciation through a wide range of mediums. It's not just a hobby class or workshop, we promote people to retain their hobbies and we believe when a bunch of people create art together, it creates a positive environment & bond of understanding. Indeed art is a very strong medium for peace that the world needs now.

For more details, call Arunima at 9999178668/ Nishi at 8368246311
address: Green Park, New Delhi, India

description:
OVERVIEW

SUPER SIKH FOUNDATION is delighted to present the 2nd edition of the much awaited SUPER SIKH RUN ~ Time Chipped, Professional Half Marathon, 10 K & 5 K run in the heart of Lutyen's Delhi 

Sunday, December 10, 2017 at 6 AM from the historical Gurudwara Rakabganj Sahib, New Delhi 

Super Sikh Foundation is a charitable Society registered under the Societies Registration Act 1860 in the N.C.T of Delhi

The mission of the SuperSikh Run is to perpetuate universal brotherhood boldly communicated through the tag line ONE RACE - HUMAN RACE. 

In our endeavours, we are inspired by the Sikh Philosophy, particularly– oneness of Mankind, the spirit of selfless ‘Sewa’ and personal everyday Heroism. The core team endeavours to live this philosophy in our lives and we strive to leverage this platform to spread this message and raise funds for charity. 

15% of Ticket Sales of the Super Sikh Run 2017 will be contributed towards the Global Humanitarian Organisation KHALSA AID 

Super Sikh Run is an inclusive event, open to runners of all races, faiths and backgrounds. 

The first edition of the Super Sikh Run took place on Dec 11, 2016 at the Historic Gurudwara Rakab Ganj Sahib behind the Parliament House in New Delhi. We are humbled by the huge success of the event with enthusiastic participation from the running community of NCR and all over North India. 

FESTIVAL OF HUMANITY:

It is only logical for SuperSikh Run to evolve into a festival celebrating Humanity. A fun filled run at heart SuperSikh Run is committed to serve humanity through a series of initiatives.

We will host year long additional events culminating at the SuperSikh Run Half Marathon event and FESTIVAL OF HUMANITY. We invite you to join us in making SuperSikh Run the world’s number 1 – if only for a day!

ALL races in the series are chip timed.

Chardi Kala 5 K– a fun run for all the family

Run or walk the 5 K distance with friends and family. From Seniors to Juniors, everyone is welcome to the CHARDI KALA 5K ! So round up everyone, jog  or walk our easy 5km loop, pose for fun pics and have a blast ! 

One Race - 10km 

If you’re looking for something a little more challenging, we invite you to run the ONE RACE 10K. The 10 K route is smooth and traffic-free. Whether you’re looking to set a new personal best, break the hour mark or you’re just running to get round, you’ll find a warm welcome at the One Race 10K. It is sure to become the most popular in the racing calendar.

SuperSikh Run 21.1 K Half Marathon 

The event made debut in 2016 and has become one of the most popular running events amongst club and non-club runners alike. Single Loop and fast, you’ll run with thousands of other half marathoners to help you on your way to a PB! Large enough to have that ‘BIG RACE’ feeling but warm and fuzzy enough for you to get underway and running at your pace, the SuperSikh Run is all set to steal your heart every year and establish itself as the most sought after run in the running calendar.

Organizer: Super Sikh Run
Email: run | supersikhrun ! com
Contact: 9953326596
Website:  http://indiarunning.com/event.html?id=3758

description:
The Piano Man and Lock & Key present GIANTS OF JAZZ- DELHI
------------------------------------
Featured artist for the evening : 
DEVIANA (ft. Hanim Hamzah)
------------------------------------
The Indonesian Music Professor & Concert Pianist Prof. Tjut Nyak Deviana Daudsjah has spent a great deal of her life abroad (36 years) particularly in Japan, Thailand, Germany & Switzerland, to embark on the Music world as an artist with several record albums, pianist, vocalist, arranger, composer, conductor and Music educator. Deviana is a German Music graduate and with a long list of skills, she returned to Indonesia in early 2000 and founded Institut Musik Daya Indonesia (IMDI), the first Music Academy with European Union standardized curriculum. IMDI is partner school of University of Arts, Design & Music (HKDM), Freiburg – Germany. 

As a classical concert pianist Deviana performed at various concerts in Germany & Switzerland and as a jazz pianist with her Trio, she performed at numerous International Jazz Festivals such as Montreux Jazz Festvial, Stuttgart Jazz Open, Grand Lancy Jazz Geneva, to name a few. She received prestigious awards such as “The Best Music Educator” by the Freiburg Mayor – Germany and honored with the title “the Lightness of Being”. 

1977 - 1979  
5 times 1st winner of the National Jazz & Pop Band competitions in Germany 

1982 – 1983  
2 times 1st winner of the National Swiss Vocal Competition 

1997  
1st winner of Jazz & RnB Contest in Switzerland with New Grace featuring Rhonda Dorsey (USA) & Sharon Harris (USA) and the German Professors Band 

Deviana is currently active as professor for arranging/orchestration, piano, history of performing arts and performing arts management in Jakarta and as the head of the Indonesian creative team working on Indonesia Performing Arts collaboration with Germany, Australia, USA and UK.  

Deviana considers the performance at The Piano Man with the Indian fellow musicians as the beginning of the future regular collaboration between India and Indonesia.
.......................................................................

This time Deviana will be playing pop-jazz repertoire with her Malaysian friend HANIM HAMZAH who’s a singing corporate lawyer and regional Asia Manager along with her Indonesian fellow musicians Arief Yuliandra, Double Bass and Wahyu Prastya, Drums.
event_name: Giants of Jazz - Delhi : Deviana ft. Hanim Hamzah
address: The Piano Man Jazz Club, 7/22, Ground Floor, B-6, Safdarjung Enclave Market, New Delhi, India

The Class Act has garnered a tremendous fan following in its 100 shows over the last 4 years.
A Silly Point Production presented by Maruti Suzuki Zee Theatre Driven by Ertiga

The play takes place in an acting class where the students come from different religious backgrounds and are pitted against each other in various acting exercises. It exposes the myth of ''unity in diversity amongst Indians'', where everybody is just out to get each other and be a 'class' apart.

Watch a Parsi, Hindu, Muslim, Goan-Christian and a woman come together to display and destruct the stereotypes that exist in our society - that caste is but a temporary fad, but class is permanent.

Cast: 
Written and Directed by Meherzad Patel

description:
Release Stored Emotions: Journey From acceptance to empowerment

Introduction

Thich Nhat Hanh says “Every time your fear is invited up, every time you recognize it and smile at it, your fear will lose some of its strength.”

In this workshop we address things you can do on your own to work with fear, anxiety, guilt and anger.

Anger sometimes feels provoked, sometimes it’s spontaneous combustion, sometimes it’s accumulated and stored in our bodies over a lifetime.Underneath anger there is always hurt. Let's have a letting go experience of emotions and surrender to see how can we transform in to something wonderful.

Outcome

Attend this workshop and release some of  your own stored emotions.  Even if you are healthy, or dealing with minor or major concerns, this workshop shall give you some coping techniques.

Includes

Guilty emotional patterns lead to diseases
Letting go exercise
Accepting & loving our own emotional authentic self
Developing a coping mechanism
Facilitator Bio:

Asmah D’souza is a Life Coach and Corporate Mentor who conducts Workshops on ESQ (enhance the spiritual quotient), EIQ (Empower Integrity quotient), Positivity and Productivity Enhancement, Train-the-Trainer. She is also a Graphologist and public speaker on Power of subconscious Mind. She is renowned from last 9 years for her Heal Your Life Workshops. A Tarot Card Reader with a comprehensive expertise as a Clinical hypnotherapist, NLP Practitioner & Theta Healing Specialist.

Having worked with corporate such as ICICI Prudential Life Insurance she understands the dynamics of work-life balance and helps individuals as well as the organization to expedite the transformation as the simple process of “Change” changes its dimensions to “Transform Together.”

Her approachable outlook and customer centricity has given her an edge over the others in the respective field. She has been recipient of several awards for her work excellence. Notable amongst these are Excellence Par Trainer in Louise L Hay Philosophy Awards by International Spiritual & Hindu Mythology Awards in 2013. She has been felicitated in 2016 as the “Spiritual Diva” at the International Spiritual & Hindu Mythology (ISHMA) Awards.

Date & Time: 9th December, 2017 (5 PM - 8 PM)

Contact : Tamanna
Phone : +91 9654322882 
Email : joy | zorbathebuddha ! org
event_name: Release Stored Emotions: Journey From acceptance to empowerment
address: Zorba the Buddha, 7, Tropical Drive road, Mehrauli-Gurgaon Rd, Ghitorni, New Delhi, India

description:
FASHION PHOTOGRAPHY COURSE
(Specialisation course)

Duration: 10 weeks (Weekday/Weekend)
Age limit: none
Location: Delhi

Spaces are limited and pre-paid reservation is required

Fashion Photography course allows study of fashion photography as both a practical and cultural discipline. The course is academically rigorous, with exploration of analytical and critical approaches to photographic imagery, together with study of the ideology, politics and context of fashion.

You will learn the technical skills of photography, whilst exploring images from haute couture to street style, from advertising campaigns to designer look-books, from art gallery to shop window and from fanzine to glossy magazine, and develop an analytical and critical view of global style and the cultural landscape of the fashion industry. You will experience location and studio shooting, using the excellent photography studios within the College, and you will explore digital image production and manipulation.

You will experience working in teams and building relationships with stylists, make-up artists, models & art directors. You will be encouraged to develop your own authentic take on fashion photography, and by the end of the course will be fully equipped to enter the industry as a professional and original image maker.

You can enroll by filling this form:  http://www.dcop.in/contact-us.html

Or give us a call: 011-45517450.
Visit us: www.dcop.in
address: Delhi College of Photography, 1st floor 57-58, Outram Lines, Kingsway Camp, New Delhi, India

description:
Delhi International Queer Theatre and Film Festival (DIQTFF) is a brave initiative by Harmless Hugs – one amongst the biggest youth oriented LGBTQ support group in India. The Film Festival is intended to connect with larger Diaspora of Indian LGBTQ struggle for equal human rights, and to reach out to masses via the omnipotence of Media and Cinema. We also have a strong line up of stirring theatre performances and more.

Movie screenings and plays are well complimented by a round of panel discussions and debates, including some of the biggest names from the Indian LGBTQ Movement. We would venture into the tumultuous territories of politics, gender disparity, coming out and involvement of families and more.

With this project, we aim to re-ignite the LGBTQ movement for equal human rights. Along with reclaiming our rights for equality and freedom of expression, with DIQTFF we intend to put the word out that LGBTQ Lives Matter!

Besides, the scope of the project gains further significance as we are planning a number of inclusive and outreach activities. Here, we shall also display the long-standing camaraderie with allies, and also touch on important chapters like coming out, emotional well-being, and most importantly, sensitizing and reaching out to the families and other untouched (perhaps homophobic) strata of the society.

HINDI TRANSLATION

Delhi International Queer Theatre and Film Festival, Harmless Hugs द्वारा‌ ‌LGBTQIA कम्यूनिटी के लिए लायी ‌गयी अपनी तरह की एक अनोखी पहल है। ये फिल्म फेस्टिवल LGBTQIA कम्यूनिटी के लिए समान नागरिक अधिकारों के लिए संघर्षरत लोगों के मनोबल को ऊंचा करने और समाज तक उनकी आवाज पहुंचाने का एक जरिया है।

एक बहुत मजबूत पैनल डिस्कशन और वोटिंग के द्वारा चुनी गई ये फिल्में और थियेटर परफॉर्मेंसेस लेकर आएंगे आपके सामने वो जलते हुए पहलू जो छुएंगे कम्यूनिटी से जुड़े राजनीतिक, लैंगिक असमानता‌, कमिंग आउट, परिवार की भूमिका जैसे मुद्दे और और भी बहुत कुछ।

इस फेस्टिवल के द्वारा हम ताकत देना चाहते हैं उस आंदोलन को जो सभी को बराबर सामाजिक दर्ज़ा दिलाने की मांग करता है। ना सिर्फ ये, हम इस फेस्टिवल के द्वारा LGBTQIA कम्यूनिटी की जिंदगी को रंगना चाहेंगे स्टेज और पर्दे पर और दिखाना चाहते हैं कि ये जिंदगीयां भी उतनी ही ज़रूरी हैं जितनी कि बाकी सब।

इस इवेंट का महत्व और भी ज्यादा इस बात से बढ़ जाता है कि इस इवेंट में कई तरह की इन्क्लूसिव और आउटरीच एक्टिविटीज पर जोर दिया जाएगा। इस इवेंट का मुख्य उद्देश्य अवेयरनेस क्रीएट करना और सभी को एक बेहतरीन समाज बनाने के लिए शिक्षित करना है। आइए हम सब मिलकर सक्सेसफुल बनाते हैं हार्मलेस हग्स के इस खूबसूरत इनीशिएटिव को।

description:
Paint Your Own Shoes is a DIY painting workshop where you get to learn how to customise your shoes with your own vibrant designs. You also get delicious refreshments to go along with your painting session. 

Do you usually go gaga over shoes? Are you someone who doesn’t have any more space on your shoe rack but you keep buying every pair you like? Oh, also, are you a person who actually has a shoe rack? Then you definitely need a pair you customised on your own. A good looking pair of shoes is a style statement in its own right, and what better way to colour a sleek pair in your own personality? We’ll answer that: None.


From an artsy pair with colourful fractals to comic-inspired Superman canvases, you get to learn the art of customising your own shoes with trippy and radiant designs, all from scratch. This DIY event is fun, productivity, and creativity all rolled into a sweet, skillful experience. Be it for your own collection or to surprise your BFF with a meaningful pair of shoes, you get to take home a flair for designing and painting {and of course, a custom pair of quirky shoes}.


What will you get?
• Learn the art of 'how to customize your own shoes' from an expert.
• Take home a pair of shoes made exclusively by you.
• An fun productive afternoon filled with inspiration, imagination and creativity.
• Skill to make unique gifts for your loved ones.

Participation: Prior painting experience is not a pre-requisite. 

Refreshments and all material (including good quality shoes) included in the ticket fees. 

For any query, WhatsApp/call us at +91 9644007760. 

About the Artist:
Garima Arya
Garima is a trained visual artist from College of Arts, Delhi and is currently a graphic design lead at a tech company. She is the founder of Poshampa, where she designs customized shoes using paints and other accessories to give them a funky and modern look.
Her Painted shoes can be viewed on her Instagram page. - instagram.com/poshampa/

description:
Swatantra Party, founded in 1959 by C. Rajagopalachari, was India’s first and only national political party to advance principles of social justice, free enterprise, personal liberty, secularism, and individual rights. Advocating a ‘politics of ethics’, the party featured the voices of prominent liberals such as Minoo Masani, N G Ranga, Piloo Mody, and offered the only substantive alternative to Nehruvian socialism and the monolithic ‘Congress Party system’ which had emerged post-Independence. 

After securing substantive electoral victories through 1960s—emerging as the single-larg- est opposition party in the fourth Lok Sabha (1967-71)—the Party disintegrated in the early seventies, following Rajagopalachari’s withdrawal from politics and demise. Through its brief but strong tenure of 15 years, the party exercised wide reach throughout India, and exerted significant pressures on issues ranging from industry to foreign policy.

Swatantra Party was a significant and unique intervention in the larger narrative of modern Indian politics, and merits sustained engagement from scholars and intellectuals today. Upon procurement of over 27,000 pages from the defunct Swatantra Party’s offices in Mumbai, Centre for Civil Society aims to store the archive at Nehru Memorial Museum and Library. The launch of the archive is marked with a day-long Conference on Saturday, 9 December, 2017 at the Auditorium, Nehru Memorial Museum and Library on the eve of C. Rajagopalachari’s birth anniversary.

Schedule for the Day: 

1030-1100 | Introduction to the Conference and Opening Remarks 1100-1300 | Panel 1: The Role of Swatatra Party in Indian Politics and Key Stats 
1300-1400 | Lunch 
1400-1530 | Panel 2: Envisioning State: An Alternative Vision 
1530-1600 | Break 
1600-1730 | Panel 3: Building a Liberal Political Party: Challenges and Opportunities 
1800-1900 | Dinner Talk 
1900-2100 | Dinner
address: Centre for Civil Society, A-69, Hauz Khas, New Delhi, India
