description:
Blood collected in camp will be deposited to the Blood Bank of Govt. Hospital and will be used for treatment of Thalassemia Patients who cannot afford lavish treatment of Private Hospital. 

Although many of us may be bad experience and heard stories about Blood bank Selling Money (which is not be case here) but do remember, 

 “If You're A Blood Donor, You're A Hero To Someone, Somewhere, Who Received Your Gracious Gift Of Life.”

Blood Donation Will Cost You Nothing But It Will Save A Life!”


Thalassemia is a blood disorder passed down through families (inherited) in which the body makes an abnormal form of hemoglobin. Hemoglobin is the protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen. The disorder results in large numbers of red blood cells being destroyed, which leads to anemia

description:
The Piano Man and Lock & Key present GIANTS OF JAZZ- DELHI
------------------------------------
Featured artist for the evening : 
GMI FACULTY
------------------------------------
GMI has a diverse international faculty coming from various stylistic and cultural backgrounds. Private lessons, music forums, ensemble workshops, and performances by faculty and visiting artists will broaden the student's perspective and foster the spirit of musical and personal growth. 

The Faculty: 

Tarun Balani - 

Tarun Balani's music and artistry has been described as "nothing short of remarkable" (AllAboutJazz, USA) and his debut album, Sacred World has said to "Point to the future of jazz in India" (Time Out, Magazine, India). With his much-anticipated record, Dharma, featuring a brand-new line up, Tarun is determined to deliver another fearless, imaginative and heartfelt set of music. While Tarun continues to feature his eclectic quintet across the globe, he also broadens his palette by a gripping new collaboration with vocalist Chayan Adhikari as Time Machine in India. Tarun’s music has been featured on WNYC, MTV, VH1, Coke Studio India, HIT95FM. He has played concerts in India, Italy, USA, Sri Lanka and Nepal. Tarun endorses Zildjian cymbals. 

Aditya Balani - 

Aditya Balani is a multi-faceted guitarist, singer-songwriter, music producer and educator from New Delhi, India. A professional musician since 2001 his work has transcended stylistic and international borders. He produces and performs electronic music as Gliding Arc and his various projects have been featured on BBC Asia Beats, MTV Coke Studio, Pepsi MTV Indies, and BBC Radio to name a few. Constants and Variables (EP) won him Best Pop Artist at the Radio City Freedom Awards ’15 and has been listed among the Top 10 EP’s of 2015 by Rolling Stone India. Aditya is an Ableton Certified Trainer and he constantly strives to bring innovate teaching methodologies for his songwriting and music production courses.

Antonio Molina Moya - 

Antonio Molina is a guitar player and teacher from Granada (Spain). He obtained a Bachelor’s Degree in jazz guitar as well as a Master’s Degree in film scoring at the Conservatory of Amsterdam (The Netherlands). Currently, he co-leads the Dutch modern rock trio Supertrawler and the Spanish blues/rock project Elemento Deserto. He also works as a sideman for several different bands in The Netherlands and Spain, including the projects of modern jazz pianist Julian Schneeman or the singer/songwriter Julia Oschewsky. In 2015, he won the Sena Young Talent Guitar Award, possibly the most prestigious distinction for electric guitar players in The Netherlands. 

Luiza Sales -  

Luiza Sales is a singer and songwriter from Rio de Janeiro, Brasil. She has already performed in Europe, Brazil, US and India and has three albums released: "Breve Leveza" (2012), produced by Dan Garcia of Radio Hill Records from Los Angeles, "Aventureira" (2015) and "Versos do Capitão" (2017) in duo with the pianist Pedro Carneiro Silva. Luiza was a member of the a cappella group Ordinarius with whom she recorded and released two albums: "Ordinarius" (2012) and "Rio de Choro" (2015). With Ordinarius, Luiza toured in Germany in 2013 and also won the Brazilian national competition of vocal groups promoted by Centro Cultural Banco do Brasil in 2015. In 2016, in India for the first time, Luiza performed at Sofar Sounds Delhi NCR, The Gig Week, DIY Day and also released a video as part of the Kintsugi Singles project. Her music is also featured in two compilations of Brazilian music released in Japan by Rambling Records: "Coffee & Novos Compositores" and "Outro Som". Luiza is the creator of the video series Meninas do Brasil, with music videos and interviews to promote the work of female singer-songwriters, fighting for more visibility of women in music. The project has featured 34 artists from different states of Brazil and it's now releasing videos shot in Berlin, presenting women from 6 different countries.

Aman Mahajan - 

Aman Mahajan is a pianist, composer and bandleader, who plays improvised music across a diversity of musical idioms. Having worked with musicians of a wide variety of nationalities, cultural backgrounds and musical styles, Mahajan is interested in improvisation as a medium of exploration and communication, in addition to its relevance in more traditional art forms. A graduate of Berklee College of Music (Boston), Mahajan is presently based in Bangalore, India, where he leads original improvised music ensemble Refuge. His music is influenced by traditional and contemporary music from around the world, and deeply inspired by a sense of unity and connection. Aman has been closely associated with GMI and we are proud to have him as part of our Fall’17 faculty!

Ayal Tsubery - 

Ayal Tsubery is an accomplished musician, whose distinctive and virtuosic style has been widely acknowledged. In 2007 Ayal was granted scholarship from the prestigious Berklee College of Music, he was selected to represent the Berklee Bass department in its annual concerts, as well as study with Hal Crook, Oscar Stagnaro (Bassist for Paquito D’rivera), Alain Mallet (pianist for Paul Simon). In addition to his role as a student in Berklee, Ayal was hired to be an accompanist for regular classes, and masterclasses. Ayal has been performing regularly in the most legendary NYC venues and music festivals. His compositions were featured in award winning short films, nationwide radio live broadcasts, and countless live performances.

description:
Witness the sultan of twerkistan, Su Real, join forces with the digital reggae and dancehall pioneer MC ZULU.

They make a stop at Raasta Green Park, Delhi on 2nd December, 2017.

ABOUT

MC Zulu:
MC ZULU does not make reggae in the traditional sense.
His unique blend of electro bass grooves and Caribbean style dancehall vocals creates a new form of dancehall reggae from the outer reaches of space. Trippy synths and huge bass kicks and claps make his music rhythmically frenetic and exotic. ZULU defines a new style of progressive electro-dancehall riddim.

Su Real:
In 2016, Su Real released his most meticulously crafted output to date – Twerkistan. The full-length album boasts 16 explosive dance tracks fusing the latest styles of Western dance music with Eastern motifs and melodies.

It took many years of tirelessly pushing the limits of India’s underground dance music and nightlife scene to attain his current status as the desi Trap Lord. Suhrid Manchanda returned to India in 2008 after a decade as a P.R. specialist between New York and Montreal, where he worked with a varied roster of artists including Dizzee Rascal and El-P (Run The Jewels), among others.
event_name: What's Brewing In Green Park ft. MC Zulu & Su Real

description:
Wo Lahore, a musical drama, is set in the middle of twentieth-century India, which has been extensively written, performed and talked about. This is a story of an ordinary woman, a mother of three sons, who tries to keep her family intact amongst everything that is happening around them. This play shows the internal conflicts and turmoil prevailing in an ordinary Indian family with the struggle for freedom, social beliefs of those times and the partition. Beleaguered in different convictions, values and aspirations of her sons and husband, Jamuna, the protagonist of the play, is a representative of quintessential Indian women and mothers. The play, which is full of Indian music, is a ride into various emotions and dramatic elements like love, betrayal, hope, patriotism, comedy and poetry.

Cast & Creatives–Writer & director –Atul Satya Koushik Artist – Avatar Gill.

Produced By : Coconut Theatre & The Film & Theatre Society
address: Kamani Auditorium, New Delhi, India

description:
MATI India in collaboration with Art Konsult Gallery are pleased to invite you to our lecture on 'Cultural Heritage and it's importance' on SATURDAY, 2nd DECEMBER, 2017
5:00 pm to 6:30 pm
Venue - ART KONSULT GALLERY ,
3, Ground Floor, Hauz Khas Village, New Delhi- 110016

  Heritage is anything that is considered important enough to be passed on to future generations.
Cultural Heritage is an expression of the ways of living developed by a community and passed on from generation to generation, including customs, practices, places, objects, artistic expressions and values. Cultural Heritage is often expressed as either Intangible or Tangible Cultural Heritage.
-	Intangible Heritage refers to those aspects of a country that cannot be touched or seen. For example traditional music, folklore, language etc.
-	Tangible Heritage refers to those significant places that advocate the country’s history and culture. For example monuments, mosques, shrines, monasteries etc. 

The objectives of this lecture are:-
1-	To discuss the need to preserve our cultural heritage
2-	To explain the types of cultural heritage
3-	Understanding the significance or importance of cultural heritage.
4-	Contribution of cultural heritage in tourism in India.
5-	Role of govt. Bodies in Conservation of Cultural Heritage in India.

Speaker
Vikramjit Singh Rooprai is a critically acclaimed Heritage Activist, promoting heritage and culture for the past 8 years. He has developed special programs for educators and students, which will help them to become inspired by incidents and developments in the past and prepare for a better future. Being a subject matter expert, he is associated with many government and non-government bodies. He started his career as a Software Engineer and reached the level of top management in less than a decade. He has designed solutions for brands like Samsung, Coke, Pepsi, HP, Apollo, Nestle, Airtel, Microsoft and many more. His work left him with 25+ awards, including two international mentions. His 14 years in the IT sector inspired him to develop techniques to study history through modern day technology. Vikramjit headed India and Asia-Pacific offices of different companies, managing their Digital Marketing and Software divisions.  
Since 2009, Vikramjit has been working to promote heritage through his initiatives. He established India’s largest Heritage-Hobby club, ‘The Heritage Photography Club’. He is also the founder of ‘Youth for Heritage Foundation’, which is dedicated to bringing culture closer to the next generation. 
The most recent initiative of Vikramjit is Heritageshaala, where his team, with a combined experience of over 50 years developed special programs for Corporate, Teachers and Students, that can empower them to learn various management, curriculum & co-curriculum topics through events from history. Architecture, Historic incidents, Language, Food and culture is closely observed to find patterns that match with modern day events. Heritage Labs are set up in schools & colleges to perform various research experiments, to teach Chemistry, Physics, Astronomy, Mathematics, Social Sciences and Art through history.
event_name: Cultural Heritage and it's Importance, Interactive Lecture.
address: Art Konsult, 3 Hauz Khas Village, New Delhi, India

description:
Dr Awdhesh Singh will be organizing a workshop on 2nd December 2017 from 4.00 PM to 7.00 PM in Connaught Place, New Delhi. 
The topic of the workshop is 'The Science and Art of Happiness'. 

************ Speaker - Dr Awdhesh Singh ********************

The investment for the workshop is only Rs 500/.

Please visit the event page for more updates.

 https://allevents.in/new%20delhi/the-science-and-art-of-happiness/80008919047353

Please book your ticket immediately as the total number of participants is limited to 30 (thirty) only.

Most people think that success is the key to happiness. They try to achieve success by working hard, becoming wealthy, achieving power or getting fame. Most people make their life miserable in the process since they never seem to achieve what they consider a success. However, even after they get everything they desire, they still feel miserable.

We shall be exploring the hidden secrets of happiness in this workshop and learn the practical methods to achieve happiness along with success in our profession. 

About Dr Awdhesh Singh:

Dr Awdhesh K Singh is an author, educator, speaker, a former IRS officer and a Top Quora Writer in the world. He holds his B. Tech. from IIT-BHU Varanasi and M. Tech. from IIT Delhi and his PhD from IIITM Gwalior. 

He is a Founding Member of the spiritual organization ‘The Aatmic Science Foundation’, which was set up in 2006 in Allahabad. He has published more than 500 articles on various topics including scientific interpretation of spirituality and religion, philosophy, happiness, leadership and development of life skills since 2006 on various forums. 

He had published four books viz. ‘Practising Spiritual Intelligence’, ‘The Secret Red Book of Leadership’, ‘Myths are Real, Reality is a Myth’ and ‘GST Made Simple’. His books had been on the bestseller list of Flipkart and Amazon. 

He is the SEVENTH MOST followed Writer on Quora.com with more than 1, 80,000 followers. His answers get monthly views of around 4 Million with total views of more than 70 Million. 

His articles have been published worldwide including ‘Time’, ‘Huffington Post’ and ‘The Independent’.
event_name: The Science and Art of Happiness by Dr Awdhesh Singh
address: G-36 G-Block Connaught Place, New Delhi, India Fans, India

description:
REProduce Listening Showcase at Akshara Theatre
Saturday, 2nd December 2017, 4-9 PM

**Donor Passes available at the door at INR300**

On Saturay, December 2nd, New Delhi based music collective REProduce Artists will bring their Listening Room back to Akshara Theatre.  Located in central Delhi, the complex dates back to the early seventies - a structure meticulously well preserved in wood and stone, and host to many events, but, rarely music.  With the gracious assistance of Red Bull, we are thrilled to produce this space in the way we do.

As always, the series aims to fill a gap in the ever iterating and increasingly varied community of live music in India by showcasing talent that might not get heard in the more mainstream oriented venues. REProduce Listening Room focuses purely on the music – in a space where an audience can absorb sound on their own terms.

For this event, we will focus on the indoors of the space, with a primary showcase of the indoor Katha Theatre - an acoustically treated arena fringed with balconies, wood, and history.


Komorebi (New Delhi, India)

Tarana and I met outside an LR session at Exhibit 320 just over a year ago when she was collaborating with Corridors.  Having expressed an interest to perform with us then, we soon saw her do just that - but over the course of three performances, I personally have experienced (at least as far as what memory serves) as three completely different performances, all of which were executed by her, and her alone.  For this performance - something we have been wanting to do for some time - we are very excited to continue this tradition.  She will present a body of work that involves her talent as a pianist, accompanied by a vocal choir arrangement.

Sahil Vasudeva (New Delhi, India)

Trained classically and now bringing an entirely different take on his pedigree, Sahil has made it his objective to merge the finesse of someone who can play Debussy and Ravel with a sort of exploration in character dynamics and dialogue that renders the vulnerability of a performer even more visceral.  Since last summer, he has been refining an execution he calls an un-recital” - an execution that merges photographic study, recorded dialogue, a series of props, and vintage Indian television commercials - woven together into a singular whole by his peerless talent as a pianist, and a past deeply involved in theatre and drama.

a maze (New Delhi, India)

Nishant makes synths. He goes to Old Delhi and finds what he needs and he just does it, and I don’t really understand what or how he does it, and I don’t have to. I’ve seen him deploy wind up rabbits, radios, and Ruhail, attack a piece of sheet metal with a bandsaw while putting mics on it, sustain an hour with Infnite Jar Space of complete synaesthesia, and set a PA on fire.  The latter was, of course, “unintentional”.

Dualist Inquiry (New Delhi, India)

In speaking to Sahej and coming to grips with just how deep the lineage of his focus on creating music can be traced, it should come as little surprise to look back his past seven years and what he’s been able to achieve.  Sahej may have gone to California to study the music business with a guitar in hand, but he’d soon bear witness to just how powerful electronic music can be to an audience.  Seeing what was brewing here in Delhi towards the end of the naughties forged a clear path for what he would do post his studies, and anyone who has paid some attention to live music here in India can recognise his contributions since.  For this performance, we are very excited to showcase him in a different context - a semi-improvised live set of unreleased material, studio experiments and works in progress - performed with hardware synthesiers and live instruments.

SISTER (Leh, India)

Ruhail’s first performance as SISTER was almost eighteen months ago to date.  Since then, he’s played LR sessions multiple times as well as the DISQUIET series curated by Hemant SK, and along the way he has generated disgust, repulsion, a physical seizure, and a complete and utter command of your attention.  His work draws upon black metal tropes but takes it to places rarely - if ever - visited, and his performances display a rare conviction of deploying his vision, as well as a healthy disregard for the consequences.

Disco Puppet (Bangalore, India)

With two releases out this year, a number of commissions to score theatrical productions in India and Singapore, and musical performances across both China and closer to home, Shoumik has clearly had a productive year.  As a live performer, his work deploys live drumming and software sequencing, but also a sort of disassociated take on vocals.  And sometimes a flute.  He rarely has the chance to perform in Delhi, so consider this a small taste of what the peerless Consolidate label roster has to offer.



For more information please visit: 

Akshara Theatre: aksharatheatre.com
REProduce Artists: instagram.com/reproduceartists
Listening Room: win.gs/2iqDjpX
address: Akshara Theater, Baba Kharak Singh Marg, New Delhi, India

description:
This is an opportunity to plunge into a rich pool of ideas, inspiration and practical learning that will give trainees tools for personal growth as interior designers. The program aims at opening up minds for the correct understanding of a material based on its intrinsic properties so that the trainees become capable of using these technologies in their own endeavors. The students shall understand how compression structures work and how waste can be utilized for building structures and sculptures that are environmentally friendly and structurally stable. The analytical approach is to achieve simpler solutions which differ from the conventional answers to a problem.

The program shall cover theory/practical training on the following alternative building technologies:

* Roofing System using waste – Curved/Flat Funicular Shell Roof (compression structures)

* Arches - understanding technical aspects of how compression structures work

* Walling System - Prefinished Blocks in varied sizes/ shapes and materials (Flyash, Papermache, Mud & Concrete) with Surface Engineering with varied finishes

*  Flooring System using waste – Flooring Panels

*  Built-in Furniture design made of stone and brick

*  Designing Sculptures

*  Forms in interior design - triangulation, geodesics etc

About the co-ordinator: Tanya Pahwa - 
Masters in Architecture, Co-author of "GREEN is RED" and upcoming book ‘UN-SMART CITIES for SMART PEOPLE’, Visiting faculty, Founder: Earth Worth Design Lab & Accord Architects

With works majorly in the field of sustainable architecture, planning, and development, Tanya has developed a passion for delivering high quality, detailed and sophisticated appropriate design and community based urban planning. She has an eclectic portfolio of projects and experience with expertise in a variety of residential, hospitality, recreational and urban development projects interfaced with ideation to design detailing and hands-on approach. She has been instrumental in organizing hands-on workshops on sustainable architecture and smart city development at Earth Worth Design Lab, Anangpur Building Centre/ASHRA for architecture and planning students, professionals, and faculty. She is currently working on her book ‘Un-smart Cities for Smart People’ (co-authored with Prof. Anil Laul). She has delivered numerous lectures as an invited guest/jury to several international and national events and competitions.
address: Academy Of Applied Arts, 60, Ring Road, Lajpat Nagar 3,, New Delhi, India

description:
Delhi QueerFest is a queer arts festival held across the city in the Fall-Winter. It brings together conversations, performances, visual arts, and publics to hold queer culture as a significant site for politics. We believe queer to be identity, form, narrative, verb, counternorms, relations, and oppositional practices that challenge dominant ways of seeing, reading, and being in the world that are exclusionary and enforced. QueerFest is in its third year as a community funded festival in the city. We look forward to your participation in shaping worlds in the present and struggles for the future.


On December 2nd, we invite you to a day of conversations, readings, and performances at the Goethe-Institut, Max Muller Bhawan.

Art by Prateeq
address: Goethe-Institut/Max Mueller Bhavan New Delhi

description:
Oz Haat Mela, the much awaited annual charity mela at the Australian High Commission, is back with its 17th edition on 2 December 2017. 

Oz Haat this year will feature a wide range of hand-made products made by NGO communities from across India for sale including tribal art, textiles, homewares, clothes, jewellery, accessories, Christmas decorations and much more. All proceeds from the sales will go directly to the charities represented.

Host of fun activities have been organised for the kids and young at heart – magic shows, art & craft, bouncing castle, tattoo artist and more. Gourmet snacks, a classic Aussie BBQ and bar with Australian wine will also be on offer. 
 
Oz Haat is organised by the Australian High Commission since 2000 as part of its #DirectAidProgram, which provides development grants to NGOs across India.

When: 11:00am – 5:00pm on Saturday, 02 December 2017. 
Where: Entry from Gate 5, Australian High Commission, 1/50G Shantipath, Chanakyapuri, New Delhi

Entry: Free Entry. Everyone is welcome.
(Please bring a photo-ID card, Parking is available at Nehru Park, Ashoka Hotel or Malcha Marg)

description: What: Mirchi Binge FestWhere: Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, Lodhi road, DelhiWhen:  Saturday- Sunday, 2nd & 3rd December 2017Timing: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm About: The Ultimate Family Carnival Is Here!After phenomenal success in Mumbai, the Mirchi Binge Fest will undoubtedly be the first of its kind in Delhi with the capital’s who’s who in attendance for a truly unforgettable festival ! It’s the year’s most awaited family festival which is going to held at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium.The 2-day fest that kicks off on 2nd December will see a fantastic line-up of food, fashion and entertainment with a dedicated kid-zone, live masterclasses, a farmer’s market and much more! The fest will have over 150 stalls in varied dimension.The first ever Delhi edition of the Mirchi Binge Fest have something for every member of the family.Fashion Bazaar- One of the key experiences at Mirchi Binge Fest will be the Fashion Bazaar, curated by Wear Is, New Delhi’s very own online hub for all things fashion and beauty. Inspired the gullies of Chandni Chowk, the Fashion Bazaar will be a vibrant and immersive space to shop the best of fashion and lifestyle that this city has to offer. The final flourish of the festive season, the Fashion Bazaar will be a celebration of heritage and traditional craft, as well as blossoming contemporary talent, with the aim to re imagine the depths and boundaries of fashion and redefine the experience of shopping.Farmers Market- Another one of the big attractions of the festival is the Farmer’s Market, displaying varieties of seeds, organic products, fruits and vegetables some of which are completely new to the audience in New Delhi.Food-  With Fashion Bazaar and farmers market food is also going to be one of the attraction.There will be the best and most delicious food and Desserts from all around Delhi courtesy of Anonymous Food Labs. The curation will be a showcase of the multi- cuisine environment that is emerging in the capital- with all sorts’ of cuisines available at the venue.There will be a defined focus on restaurants showcasing their bestselling items with a special Small Plates Menu that will be exclusive to the curators.Kid's Zone-The Mirchi Binge Fest has a range of fun-filled activities to interest parents and kids alike.Pet Zone: Pet lovers do bring your furry friends along, as it's a pet friendly fest.So what are you waiting for? Gear up for the biggest festival in town, on 2nd & 3rd of December at JLN Stadium!
address: Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, Lodhi road, Delhi, New Delhi, India

description:

Registration Link:  https://goo.gl/unWRaj
Age: 10 Years and Above
A Quick Vegetarian Lunch will be Provided for all Participants

In the field of Surveillance and Security, Drones are the next big thing, and flying them is fun too. Come join MakersBox Team with our Aerodynamics Expert, when we learn how to build a Drone of our own.

Suitable for anybody looking for a jumpstart on Aerodynamics and Drone Building.

What we will do:
Learn about the various components and how to assemble them together
Introduction to Aerodynamics
Difference between Brushed and Brushless DC Motors
Concept of analog, digital, PWM etc
Using all the materials available to assemble a drone
Complete challenge (completing the project on the task assigned)

Hardware Kits:
NAZE32 Flight Controller
F450 Quadcopter Frame
Screw Drivers, Sensors,
Propellers
Lipo Battery
Flight Transmitter and Receiver
Please note Hardware kits will be taken back after the training programme. In case you wish to purchase a Kit, they are available for sale at our Maker Space.

Eligibility: 
Anyone interested in learning about embedded systems, aerospace engineering or aerodynamics should attend this. Attendees need to be 10 Years and above in Age and should carry their own laptops (Preferably Windows, but Macintosh and Linux Computers are welcome too). The computer should have a USB Port for programming. Software used for Programming will be installed on your machines and you should have rights to install the software. All software products used by MakersBox are either Open Source or Licenced for re-use.
Limits: 12 People Only
 
Online Portal: MakersBox maintains a password only Online Portal and participants will get access to this portal to see what was taught in the class, access to code and circuit diagrams as well as basic test related information.

Certificate: A Certificate of Attendance will be given at the end of the Workshop 

Along with this, you also get a 3-day trial membership to our Maker Space which you can use anytime.

Call us at 011.3958.5454 to know more.
address: MakersBox, D-181, Okhla Industrial Area, Phase 1, New Delhi, India

description:
With the advent of the Internet of Things (IoT), daily objects that we see around us have received major tech-upgrades: mirrors are now smart mirrors, tables are now now interactive, and windows can now go from transparent to opaque at the touch of a button. However the perceived complexity of the process is exaggerated; applying the principles of the IoT to everyday items is a surprisingly easy task! All it requires is a keen interest in technology and the vigour to keep learning.

Maker's Asylum is hosting a 2 day workshop designed to educate attendees on the usage of versatile Arduino circuit boards and the various sensors that can be used with them to completely revamp the purpose of simple products. We will also cover the basics of PCB designing and etching. The taught skills will be tested at the end of the workshop when each participant will design and create an IoT-based light and motion sensing lamp which they can take home. 

Day 1:
- How to use motion sensors (hardware and Arduino coding)
- How to use light sensors (hardware and Arduino coding)
- How to use relays for switching AC loads (hardware and Arduino coding)
- Assembly (hardware and Arduino coding)
- A brief introduction on how to connect your system to the cloud

Day 2:
- Designing a PCB for your system using Fritzing
- PCB fabrication using Toner Transfer method
- How to design and build the enclosure
- Installation and testing

Sign-up now! Seats for this workshop are limited.
address: Maker's Asylum Delhi, 268G Hauz Rani, New Delhi, India

A culinary skill that solely depends on ingredients and timing, South Indian delicacies are the ones that make your mouth drool and body sweat! At CSDO we teach you the art of making perfectly composed south Indian premixes for delicacies like Idli, Dosa, Uttapam, Vada etc.

ANIMATIONS POUR LES ENFANTS (et une seule pour les adultes)
(English translation below)

TOUTE LA JOURNEE:
Chateaux gonflables et petit train, atelier art and crafts, maquillage, concours de pétanque, atelier massage, chorale du Lycée Français de Delhi - officiel, danse du Pendjab par Kamalini Workshops, tatouages au henné, etc. 

14h - ATELIER POTTERIE
Avec Omparkash les enfants apprendront à pétrir la terre et à utiliser une tour de potier. Ils repartiront avec leur création ! 

14h & 15h - PREMIERS PAS EN URBAN FARMING
Samedi, venez mettre les mains dans la terre à l’atelier organisé par Edible Routes. Vous apprendrez comment commencer votre jardin potager et repartirez avec votre pot de microgreens. 
ENFANTS - 14h
ADULTES - 15h
20 places  disponibles pour chaque atelier

15h30 - EXTRAITS D'OPERAS
Le Choeur d'Enfants de The Neemrana Music Foundation interprétera des extraits de l'Opera l’Enfant et les Sortilèges de Maurice Ravel sur lequel les enfants, et les chanteurs de la Fondation travaillent depuis plusieurs mois et qui sera donné le 28th Novembre au Lotus Temple Auditorium.

16h30 - DANSE BOLLYWOOD
Venez admirer les enfants de TARA Child Protection & Empowerment / Education & Protection de l'Enfance qui feront une demonstration de leurs plus beaux mouvements de danse Bollywood.

CHILDREN EVENTS

ALL DAY LONG:
Bouncy and little train, crafts activity for kids, face painting, pétanque contest, massages, Choir of the Lycée Français de Delhi - officiel, Penjabi dance song by Kamalini, henna tattoos and so much more… 

2PM - POTTERY WORKSHOP
With Omparkash’s help, children will learn how to knead the clay and use a potter’s lathe. They will come home with their creations. 

2PM & 3PM - FIRST STEPS INTO URBAN FARMING
On Saturday, come and get your hands muddy with the Edible Routes workshop on Urban Farming. You will learn how to start your own edible garden and leave with a basket sown with microgreens. 
Two workshops - 20 participants each only
KIDS - 2 pm
ADULTS - 3 pm 

3:30PM - OPERA EXTRACTS
Come and enjoy the Children Choir of The Neemrana Music Foundation. They will sing extracts of The Kid and the Spells from Maurice Ravel that kids and singers from the foundation have been working hard since a few months. They will perform the full opera on November 28th at Lotus Temple Auditorium. 

4:30 - BOLLYWOOD DANCE
TARA Child Protection & Empowerment / Education & Protection de l'Enfance boys and girls will show you their best Bollywood moves!

description:
Delhi BirdRace 2017 is our annual rendezvous with birds to celebrate the rich diversity of birdlife in Delhi/NCR. 

Delhi Bird Race will be held on Saturday, 02 December 2017. The awards function and birders celebratory lunch are planned next day, on Sunday, 03 December.

BIRD RACE DETAILS

At the crack of dawn, on Saturday, 02 Dec, participants will head out in small teams, led by an experienced birder and watch birds in multiple locations across Delhi & NCR, within approx. 50-60 km radius of the city. 

During the course of the day, till sunset, each team will strive to record as many species of birds as possible; learn about the finer points of bird-watching from the expert/captain in the team. 

While there are a few rules, which will be explained to participants by each team captain, there is a fun element to this exercise that will help stimulate enormous interest in bird-watching as a highly popular hobby. 

The event will give us a good idea of the nature of this region's birdlife, collect essential data on bird diversity of our region and help build up support for environment and nature conservation.

To ensure that the reported sightings are as infallible, there will be special adjudicators who will analyze the log books of each team and announce the winners at a special programme to be held on Sunday afternoon, next day. 

Participation in Delhi BirdRace 2017 is completely FREE. You may register for the Delhi BirdRace by sending an email at delhibirdrace | gmail ! com or by confirming at this event page. 

You are free to make your own team. The core of each team will preferably be about 4-6 members (not exceeding 02 carloads of birders) and should have one good birdwatcher with every team who can identify most of the species around the city. You may name your team with a bird's name. 

Birding enthusiasts, who may not be able to spare the whole day for this event may also join any team during the day as per their convenience to gain a flavour of the event.

A list of few team captains consisting of experienced birders of Delhi including their contact details will also be posted here. In case you are new to birdwatching, you may request to join any one of their teams as per your convenience and subject to availability.

In addition to the team seeing maximum species during the day, various other prizes are planned to be distributed during the awards function.

AWARDS FUNCTION & CONTRIBUTORY LUNCH

Sunday, 03 December (12.30 PM) - Delhi Bird Race award function and birdwatchers' contributory lunch is being organised at a central venue in Delhi. 

Details will be intimated to those confirming their attendance. Kindly also confirm your participation in this separately by an email to delhibirdrace | gmail ! com

So hurry up and block your calendars to enjoy the Delhi Bird Race 2017. 

Happy Birding.
address: Delhi - NCR, New Delhi, New Delhi, India

This is part of the One day travel series for those people who cannot spare two days to travel on our amazing DPC Photo Bus trips due to scarcity and unavailability of Time .

The Trip will give an opportunity to click places which are in close proximity to Delhi but they are worth Visiting .

Next in series is the Bhateshwar  (Dist Morena) , site of an archaeological site comprising about 200+ ancient shrines in Morena district, Madhya Pradesh. 

Bhateshwar: Truly Mystical! This is an archaeological site comprising about 200+ ancient shrines in Morena district, Madhya Pradesh. All out station riders can now plan their travels accordingly....Welcome to Delhi


We feel  proud announcing his epic Brevet Journey of 1000 Kilometers for the 6th time , starting from India Gate , New Delhi ,traversing through Kurukshetra, Ambala, Karnal, Golden Temple in Amritsar and going all the way to Wagha( Attari) border between India and Pakistan. 

The route is scenic with green belts on either side of the road all the way and the roads are absolutely well asphalted 
What’s more epic to the ride is that you would be riding all throughout the famous Grand Trunk road ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Trunk_Road


Along with the 1000K we have a 600K/300K /200 taking place simultaneously so choose any one and be a part of this Epic Brevet LOC.


Note -600 will NOT terminate in New Delhi but will go all the way to Wagah border and finish at Amritsar

This time the rides will start from 'India Gate, New Delhi.

Route map for 1000 kms -  http://www.mapmyride.com/routes/view/334780885



For 300 k and 200 k the route is almost same but with earlier turnback points. 

Start time for 1000k will be 0600hrs 2 nd December 2017



The rules of the Ride are same as before and in addition one can have a personal security vehicle which could be accessible only at time control points. Do register your vehicle with the organizers before the ride starts incase you have a personal security vehicle. We are posting this ride early as we are expecting a lot of riders from all over the country to be a part of this Epic Brevet and they need to plan their trip to Delhi. The links to the rides are as followes:- The rules are :- 

Rules and instructions for Delhi Randonneurs Brevets.

1. The 'Delhi Randonneurs Brevets' cycling event is being organized by Delhi Randonneurs and its authorized representatives, herewith referred as 'Delhi Randonneurs' or 'the Organizers'.

2. These brevets are open to any amateur cyclist, above 18 years in age, regardless of his or her cycling affiliations.

3. Any form of human-powered vehicle is acceptable. The only stipulation is that the vehicle must be powered solely by the rider.

4. To participate in a brevet a rider must complete a registration form and pay a registration fee set by Delhi Randonneurs along with signing a waiver of Liabilities.

5. During the event, each rider is considered to be on a personal ride. The rider must ride in accordance with all applicable traffic codes and obey all traffic signals.

6. The Delhi Randonneurs, organizers and its representatives cannot and do not accept responsibility for any accidents that may occur before, during and post event (result of event).

7. For night riding, vehicles must be equipped with front and rear lights attached firmly to the vehicle. Lights must be fully functional at all times (Spare lights are strongly recommended; spare bulbs are required). At least one of the rear lights must be in a steady (rather than flashing) mode. Riders not complying with all these requirements will not be permitted to start.

8. Lights must be on from dusk to dawn and at any other times when poor visibility conditions exist (rain, fog, etc.). Each rider, whether riding in a group or by himself, must fully comply with this requirement. Everyone must use their lights! All riders must wear a reflective vest, sash, Sam Browne belt, or some other device that clearly places reflective material on the front and back of the rider.

9. Any violation of these night riding rules will result in the immediate disqualification of the rider.

10. Each rider must be self sufficient. No follow cars or support of any kind are permitted on the course. Personal support is only allowed at checkpoints. Any violation of this requirement will result in immediate disqualification.

11. At the start, though the organizer may create groups, as everyone rides at his or her own pace, a rider could go out the group at any time. No rider can be considered as group leader. All distinctive signs (jersey,armband, etc…) or title (road captain) to indicate superiority are not allowed. All riders are required to conduct themselves in a civil manner and abide by all applicable vehicle codes, laws, and regulations. All riders are required to respect local customs with regards to decorum.

12. At the start, each rider will receive a DR Brevet Card and a cue sheet indicating the route and the location of the checkpoints. Riders must stay on the route. If a rider leaves the route, they must return to the route at the same point prior to continuing, ie. no shortcuts or detours from the route, unless specified by the organizer. Riders must stop at each checkpoint to have their card stamped. Organizers may also include unannounced checkpoints along the route. This assures that everyone will stay on the prescribed route.

13. The Organizers may have checkpoints with no member of the organizing staff present. At these checkpoints riders must get their DR Brevet Card stamped at a local establishment that the organizer specifies as a checkpoint, such as a grocery store or gas station. Checkpoint information to be noted on the DR Brevet Card includes the time and the date of passage (for brevets that extend beyond 24 hours).

14. Missing checkpoint stamps, missing checkpoint times, or loss of the DR Brevet Card (regardless of how far into the ride a rider is) will result in disqualification. Each rider is responsible for seeing that his DR Brevet Card is properly completed at each checkpoint.

15. Additionally, riders must arrive at each checkpoint between the opening and closing time for the checkpoint. These times are noted on the DR Brevet Card with the information for the checkpoints. Riders must arrive at each checkpoint between the start and the finish while the checkpoint is open. If a rider arrives at a checkpoint after it has closed and the ride organizer is satisfied that the rider's lateness is due to the occurrence of something unforeseen and beyond the control of the rider (such as stopping to help at a traffic accident or a road closure), then the ride organizer may waive the fact that the rider arrived at the control late and allow the rider to continue. Poor bicycle or equipment maintenance, fatigue, lack of fitness, hunger, etc. are not unforeseen and beyond the control of the rider and therefore will not serve as a valid reason for being late. Subject to the foregoing, failure to make all checkpoints, even if the brevet is done within the overall time limit, will result in disqualification.

16. Any fraud, cheating, or deliberate violation of these rules may result in the exclusion of the rider from all Delhi Randonneurs sponsored events.

17. At the finish, the rider must sign his DR Brevet Card and return it to the event organizer.

18. These rides are not competitive events, so no rider classifications are made.

19. While taking part in a Delhi Randonneurs Brevets, the riders accept the publication of their identity and the time achieved in the results published by the organizers. Their identity will never be used at commercial purposes or to be transmitted to a third party for this purpose.

20. Any rider who registers for and Joins the Delhi Randonneurs brevets agrees by these actions to the following: Any complaint or question concerning the event or its organization must be submitted to the organizer in writing, within 48 hours from the finish of the event.

So now get going, give a commitment to yourself and get registered

description:
The Piano Man and Lock & Key present GIANTS OF JAZZ- DELHI
------------------------------------
Featured artist for the evening : 
SAVA BOYADZHIEV TRIO (ft. Sonic & Paddy)
------------------------------------
Sava Boyadzhiev is a Bulgarian drummer, percussionist, timpanist, sessions musician and educator. During his 20 year long career as a successful sessions player, Sava has played the most prestigious venues and festivals in 25 countries and across 4 continents.  
  
While studying classical music in Bulgaria, Sava discovered Jazz and soon became the most sought after drummers there playing with the best in the country. During his tenure with the New Symphony Orchestra he accompanied Vanessa Mae, Joshua Bell, Stanimir Torodov, Electric Light Orchestra, Liviu Prunaru and performed under some world renowned conductors.   
 
He soon moved to the United States where, during his times as the house drummer in Tarpon Springs, Florida, he accompanied the likes of Chick Corea, Jeff Berlin, Roy Hargrove and Charlie Hunter.   
 
Now in India, Sava is a music educator, sessions player and band leader. He got nominated for the Best Drummer for his work on ‘Adil & Vasundhara’s album AMPERSAND at the Jack Daniel’s Rock Awards 2013. Sava continues his journey as a well loved sessions player in the country and a successful band leader as well.   

-------------------
About Sonic Shori : 
-------------------
 
Sonic Shori is a professional bassist in the city of Delhi. He is a student of Grammy-nominated Greek-American musician Panagiotis Andreou. He has comprehensive stage experience, and has collaborated with musicians from several different genres including classical, fusion, funk and metal. His playing combines complexity with cohesion, and playing melodies with dexterity, musicality and tenacity.  

Over the last few years, Sonic has collaborated with several bands in Delhi and across India, such as Kaash, Antariksh, Trizya, and Adil and Vasundhara. 

-----------------------------------------
About Pradyumna Singh Manot (Paddy) : 
-----------------------------------------

Paddy is one of India's most talented Jazzmen and the leading Latin Jazz Pianist in the country. He started his life in music on the piano at the age of six. Since that time he has been extensively studying Western Classical, Jazz (with Madhav Chari), Latin, Latin jazz and North Indian classical music.     
   
He has performed in many prestigious venues and festivals across India and has been a regular artist of the Congo Square Jazz Festival for past 8 years. Abroad he has also performed in Hong Kong, Indonesia, UAE, Singapore, Thailand, Philippines, Macau, Bangladesh and has performed in the World's biggest jazz festival, the Java Jazz Festival where he received accolades form great names of jazz including George Benson, Roy Hargrove and Joey de Franscesco.     
   
He has performed with many jazz artists such as American jazz singer Claire MIchaud, Canadian trombonist Alistair Kay (Ella Fitzgerald, Frank Sinatra, etc.), star bassist Steve Zerlin, Alex Stuart and Indian guitar legend Sumith Ramachandran, among others. Paddy is also a founder member of the Latin- jazz bands Los Amigos and Jazzeando.
event_name: Giants of Jazz - Delhi : Sava Boyadzhiev Trio ft. Sonic & Paddy
address: The Piano Man Jazz Club, 7/22, Ground Floor, B-6, Safdarjung Enclave Market, New Delhi, India

description:
Living Pictures, Wales & QTP India Present: Diary Of A Madman.

Considered by many to be Nikolai Gogol’s best work, Diary of a Madman, is set in St Petersburg, Poprishchin is in his 40’s - a low ranking civil servant for the Government, struggles to make his mark in life, but one day he makes an amazing discovery. Could he really be the next King of Spain?  This dark comedy focuses on how one man’s need for power throws him into surreal chaos – dogs talk, they write love letters, his bosses are mad and hell bent on destroying him. Driven insane by government bureaucracy and hierarchy, Gogol’s dark comedy exposes one man’s reality as he spirals deeper into a fantasy world.

Performed by Robert Bowman

Adapted from Nikolai Gogol's novel of the same name.

description:
All work and no play made Jack a dull boy!
Is the city life and the well-paid job starting to make you dull?
Then pull up your socks, gather your team, come out with us and play - The Village Olympics !

Participate in this year's most exciting weekend getaway. Revisit childhood memories and make some new ones. Get ready to sweat it out over a round or two of Kho-Kho, Cricket, Gilly Danda, Lagori and many more such games!

Where - Village Purushwadi, 220kms from Bombay.
Schedule - 
Trip Starts - Friday, 1 December 2017, 7 p.m. 
Event Dates - 2 - 3 December 2017 (6.30 a.m. onwards)
Event Ends - 3 December 2017, 2 p.m. (Estimate arrival back in Bombay - 9.00 p.m.)

What’s more?

You will be playing with village teams from Purushwadi. This is not about rural teams vs urban teams. Its all about better players, good teams and playing together.

Turf War Games

1. Cricket
2. Kho-Kho
3. Lagori

Friendly Games

1. Gilly Danda
2. Tug-of-War
3. Hop-scotch
4. Kanchey (Goti) aka marbles

What you need to do?

1. Find your team - register for the Village Olympics as a team of 3 or more people. (Individual registartion also possible)
2. While registering select atleast 2 out of the 3 Turf War Games.
3. The organising committee will create teams for all games by picking up lots. So each team will have people from the city and village playing together.

Charges - 

Team Ticket (3-4 people) - Rs.8000 per team
Extra Teammate Ticket - Rs. 1500 per person (additional to team ticket)
Individual Ticket - Rs. 2500 per person

The cost includes - 
1. Accommodation - on sharing basis in camping/canvas tents
2. Meals - Vegetarian (Breakfast on 2nd December to Lunch on 3rd December)
3. Games related gear such as cricket bat, balls, wickets etc.

The cost doesn't includes -
▪ Travel to and from Purushwadi (Bus pool is available at additional charges)
▪ Any personal expenses
▪ Anything not mentioned in the itinerary.

Prizes - 
All participants win - Fun Merchandise | Life-long Friends | Good Memories

Age Group - 15 years and above only

For queries call/whatsapp 9718043685

Limited Entry - 40 individuals only!
address: Purushwadi, Akola, Maharashtra, New Delhi, India

description:
In the December 2017 edition of FD Zone Delhi screenings, we bring to you " A Very Old Man With Enormous Wings" - directed by Prateek Vats.

Prateek will be present for a discussion after the screening.

'A Very Old Man With Enormous Wings'

Director: Prateek Vats
Producer: Films Division
Duration: 72min 31sec        
Language: Bengali/Hindi/English

Synopsis -
A film anchored in the twilight years of the life of legendary Indian bodybuilder and former Mr. Universe, Monohar Aich. As the body fades away, the film begins to take shape.

The film starts on the eve on Mr. Aich’s 101st birthday. Mr. Aich’s insistence on not remembering anything about his life is where the idea of the film germinates – to consciously move away from the evidential burden of a ‘biopic’ towards an intimate portrait - A story that transcends time to reveal the oddities that make human stories worth telling.

The film has been shot over a period two years. The complex interpersonal relationships formed during the filming become the lens through which we try to evoke the time that has passed and perhaps get a perspective of what an individual’ passionate obsession (or idiosyncrasy?) might mean.

About the director -
Prateek is an independent filmmaker and writer based out Mumbai/Goa. A graduate of the film direction course from Film & Television Institute of India, he has been working on both fiction as well as non-fiction films. This is his first feature length film. His films include After Dark, Kasbe Ka Cinema Manager, Kal, 15th August, Dukaan Bandh Rahegi, and Re- Tracing Freedom: Goa. He was also co-dialogue writer for the film – I D 

Crew
Cinematography – Mehul Bhanti
Editing – Tanushree Das Sahi, Paramita Ghosh
Audiography – Bigyna Bhushan Dahal
event_name: FDZ Delhi screening - "A Very Old Man With Enormous Wings"

description:
Embassy of Peru in Collabration with Delhi Photography Club presents The Portraits of Lima (1867 – 1925) A Photography Exhibtion  (All the photos are property of Archives of the National Library of Peru)


The Portraits of Lima (1867 – 1925) are a selection of photographs from the archives of Eugéne Courret, a remarkable photographer who was born in France in 1841, and decided to settle in Lima in 1860. 

At that time, Lima, the capital of Peru, was one of the busiest cities in the Americas thanks to the bonanza produced by the exploitation of guano (fertilizer). It was a magnet for business travellers, artists, explorers and people from Europe who wanted to be a part of the life of “The Pearl of the Pacific", a name given to the city, by the German naturalist Alexander Von Humboldt.

Courret, opened in 1863, his own photo studio named "Fotografia Central" in partnership with his brother Aquiles. Through the years, a big part of the Peruvian society was captured by the eyes of the Courret brothers, not only in the age of splendour but also during the dramatic years of the Pacific War (1879-1883). Entire families, babies, nannies, servants, immigrants, nuns, priest, authorities, army or navy officers and also Presidents of the Republic were portrayed by the lenses of Courret, accumulating an impressive  collection of 1,57,800 glass negatives. 

The photo studio Fotografia Central was awarded several prizes for its pictures and compositions not only in Peruvian contests but also in international competitions in Europe. For example in the year 1900 they were awarded with the Gold medal in the Universal Exposition held in Paris.

In 1887 Eugène Courret due to health issues left Lima and established a branch of this studio in Paris, where he continued to work until his death. Meanwhile his photo studio in Lima was managed by Adolphe Dubruil, an expert photographer and friend of Eugène Courret. 

The studio in Lima remained open until 1935, after which it was forced to close due to the world economic crisis and the popularity of the automatic cameras.

This exhibition highlights the multiculturalism and diversity of the Peruvian Society in the early years of the Republic.
event_name: Portraits of Lima (Photography Exhibition by Embassy of Peru )
address: Indo-Peruvian Friendship Association, Vasant Vihar, New Delhi, India

description:
Rajasthan & ville sacrée 20 jours / 19 nuits
à partir de
1 270€

Des majestueuses terres Rajasthanies aux lumineuses rives du Gange, plongez au cœur de l’Inde sacrée, entre histoire et religion.
Ce circuit, d’une durée de 20 jours, vous promet une rencontre inoubliable : celle d’une terre de contraste, à l’histoire tumultueuse, aux paysages aussi grandioses que variés, et à la spiritualité captivante…

Jour 1


Delhi
Accueil à l'aéroport ou à Delhi
Transfert à l'hôtel, quelques instants de repos si souhaité.
Départ pour la visite de Old Delhi (mosquée Jama Masjid, Red Fort, India Gate, Qutub Minar.
Nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 2


Delhi - Mandawa (240 kilomètres, 5 heures de route)
Traversée de la région du Shekhawati, région semi-désertique célèbre pour ses magnifiques Havelis (grandes demeures nobiliaires).
Arrivée à Mandawa, visite de différents Havelis (Binsidhar Nawetiya, Murmuria, Goenka)
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 3


Mandawa - Bikaner (200 kilomètres, 4 heures de route)
Visite de Junagarh, Lal Garh Palace, Camel Research Farm.
Safari à dos de dromadaire pour contempler le coucher du soleil.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 4


Bikaner - Jaisalmer (330 kilomètres, 6 heures de route)
En chemin, arrêt à Desnoke pour visiter le Temple des Rats (Karni Mata Temple).
Début de la découverte de la "Golden City".
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 5


Jaisalmer 
Visite de la forteresse de Jaisalmer et du Patwon ki Haveli.
Escapade dans les dunes de sable de Khuri.
Temps libre pour profiter de l'atmosphère particulière de cette cité qui surplombe le désert du Thar.
Nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 6


Jaisalmer - Jodhpur 
Découverte de Jodhpur « la bleue ».
Visite du Fort de Mehrangarh et de Jaswant Thada.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 7


Jodhpur 
Visite du palais d’ Ummaid Bhawan.
Ballade dans les villages voisins et arrêt chez une famille BishnoÏ, pour découvrir leur mode de vie.
Nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 8


Jodhpur - Kumbhalgarh (270 kilomètres, 5 heures de route)
Sur la route, visite du temple Jaïn de Ranakpur.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 9


Khumbhalgarh - Udaipur (90 kilomètres, 2 heures de route)
Le matin, visite du magnifique fort de Kumbhalgarh et balade dans le Kumbhalgarh National Park.
Route vers Udaipur en traversant les superbes paysages verdoyants des Monts Aravelli. Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 10


Udaipur 
Journée consacrée à la découverte d'Udaipur, nommée «la Venise de l’Orient ».
Visite du City Palace, du temple Jagdish, Saheliyon ki Bari et du musée Bhartiya Lok Kala.
Nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 11


Udaipur - Pushkar (280 kilomètres, 5 à 6 heures de route)
Sur la route, visite du DevGarh Fort.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 12


Pushkar - Jaipur (150kilomètres, 3h de route)
Visite de Pushkar, de ses marchés colorés et de son temple hindou dédié à Brahma. situé sur les rives du lac sacré.
Départ pour Jaipur.
Visite du City Palace et de l'Observatoire Royal.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 13


Jaipur 
Le matin, arrêt au Palais des Vents (Hawa Mahal) pour bénéficier de la meilleure lumière.
Montée au Fort d'Amber à dos d'éléphant puis visite du Fort Jaigarh.
Temps libre pour flâner dans les rues et les bazars de la vieille ville.
Nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 14


Jaipur - Agra (240 kilomètres, 5 heures de route)
Sur la route, visite de la ville fantôme Fatehpur Sikri. magnifique site inscrit au patrimoine mondial de l’Unesco.
Arrivée à Agra. Visite du Taj Mahal dans les lumières de la fin d'après-midi.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 15


Agra - Orchha (180 kilomètres, 4 heures de route)
Le matin, visite du Fort d'Agra.
Départ pour Orchha. Visite des monuments historiques d'Orchha.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 16


Orchha - Khajuraho (170 kilomètres, 3 heures de route)
Le matin, route pour Khajuraho.
Visite de différents temples et monuments.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 17


Khajuraho 
Visite libre du site archéologique, célèbre pour ses sculptures érotiques.
Nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 18


Khajuraho - Varanasi (1h de vol)
Découverte de Varanasi, la ville sainte dédiée au dieu Shiva. Située sur la rive gauche du Gange, le fleuve sacré de l’hindouisme, Varanasi est un lieu de pèlerinage incontournable pour tout Hindou.
Installation et nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 19


Varanasi 
Promenade en bateau, sur le Gange, au lever du soleil.
Ballade sur les Ghâts où se rassemblent les fidèles pour faire leurs ablutions et offrir des offrandes au fleuve.
Nuit à l'hôtel.

Jour 20


Varanasi - Delhi (2h de vol)
Le matin, vol pour Delhi.
Visite du mausolée d’Humayun et de New Delhi, ou départ selon l'heure de votre vol.





Prix à partir de 1 270€ par personne sur la base de 2 participants partageant la même chambre en catégorie "charme".
Ce prix comprend :
- Accueil et assistance dès votre arrivée à l'aéroport de Delhi
- Transports et transferts en véhicule privé type Toyota Innova avec climatisation (frais de parking, taxes de changement d’état, essence et péages compris)
- Chauffeur anglophone (incluant ses repas, ses hébergements, son salaire)
- Hébergement en chambre double avec petit déjeuner
- Taxes et services hôteliers
-Transferts en avion entre Khajuraho et Varanasi (1h de vol) et entre Varanasi et Delhi (2h de vol)


Ce prix ne comprend pas :
- Vols internationaux
- Taxes d’aéroport
- Frais de visa
- Assurances personnelles
- Billets d’entrée des sites et monuments prévus au programme (cela vous permet d’être libre dans le choix de vos visites)
- Taxes éventuelles sur vos appareils photos et vidéos
- Les repas non mentionnés (la restauration est vraiment très bon marché en Inde. Votre chauffeur pourra vous conseiller de bonnes adresses si vous le souhaitez)
- Les boissons et dépenses personnelles
- Les pourboires


Tous nos circuits sont personnalisables selon vos préférences.
Vous pouvez :
- Choisir de passer par une ville plutôt qu’une autre,
- Intégrer des activités ou orienter votre voyage sur la thématique de votre choix,
- Choisir une catégorie de voiture supérieure,
- Mixer les catégories d’hôtels pour optimiser confort et prix…

Nous sommes à votre écoute pour réaliser le voyage qui vous correspondra.

description: The talk will reflect on Japan-India ties strengthened through art exchanges. Both countries have an ancient and rich artistic and philosophical heritage. Buddhism formed the foundation, while in more recent times Okakura Kakuzo and Rabindranath Tagore created strong cultural bonds. Both Japanese and Indian aesthetics are based on deep profundity of philosophical expression  beyond the surface image. In modern times, many art events have been held in both countries, these will be discussed, as well as what the future holds.

description:
For our final Chez Kerby concert of 2017 we have a wonderful Christmas-themed concert with The Janes.

Brilliant, inspirational, funny, emotional, flawless, fabulous ….
	Focusing on the amazingly complex and wonderful sounds of the human voice (and the extraordinary things that can be created with five of them together!), The Janes cross a very wide range of genres in their music– jazz, folk, bluegrass, country, swing, contemporary – anything we can harmonize the heck out of!
	Hugely dedicated fans (Vinnie, Diana Rainbow)
	Whilst our original recordings have become little treasures that people cherish and hide away in dark recesses of kitchen cupboards, the real essence and energy comes from our live performances.
	Quirky, warm and funny there is a joyous interplay between the “Janes” on stage that is not scripted and very inclusive. People leave our shows feeling uplifted, entertained, inspired and like they have been held in a very warm embrace.

description:
Kathakar: International Storytellers Festival

1 to 3 December 2017

4.30 pm to 8.30 pm

Central Lawns, 11 Mansingh Road, New Delhi

Dear friends,

Here comes one of the most awaited events of the year, ‘Kathakar: International Storytellers Festival’.

IGNCA and Nivesh once again bring together vibrant storytellers from all parts of the world for you to listen and cherish wonderful stories.

Traditional, folk tales, epics and community history were communicated orally with gestures, expressions and voice modulations to leave a lasting impression on listener’s mind. 
IGNCA started this festival in 2013 to preserve and promote the traditional oral art form of storytelling. It has now become one of the most popular festivals of IGNCA and is also the only storytelling festival in India.

Leave behind all that mundane and come to witness the world of colourful stories.

The storytellers this year are:

National
Shri Vishal Bhardwaj (Mumbai, Maharashtra)
Shri Mohit Chauhan
Ms. PrarthnaGahilote (Dehradun, Uttarakhand)
Ms. RachnaBisht (New Delhi)
Ms. ShagunaGahilote (New Delhi)
Ms. Divya Pathak (Ranikhet, Uttarakhand)
Nautanki group from Mathura
Shadow puppeteers from Andhra Pradesh

International
Shri Bruno Leone (Italy)
Shri Joe Baele (Belgium)
Shri Peter Chand (UK)

description:
Dilliwala Khazana – Treasures of Delhi is about celebrating the myriad elements that make up the best of Delhi. It’s no secret that being a Dilliwala means being a person with a ‘dil’ for the finest in food, art, music and culture. Dilliwala Khazana aims to bring out a unique experience of the city’s heritage, magic and secrets to the world.
Food - The festival will bring together some of the best of the street foods not only from the Walled City - some known, some forgotten – but from newly developed tastes that Delhi has spawned. Expect Khan Mughlai from Daryaganj, Netaji ki Chaat from Chandni Chowk, Rajeev Bhai ke Special Omlette, Changezi Chicken from Ballimaran, Indo Kulfi from Karol Bagh, wide variety of momos from Momo.in, Pyar Mohabat Sharbat from Matia Mahal, Daulat ki Chaat and Taufeeq ki Biryani from Chitli Qabar in Puraani Dilli. 

Some of the other brands representing Delhi’s cosmopolitain culinary culture include Yeti – The Himalyan Kitchen, Dom Dom Biryani serving Kolkata specialities, Kathputli, Culinary Pitaara, Indian Catering Company doing a wide range of vegetarian fusion food.
Music/Art/Theatre/Dance/Poetry- Accompanying the vast spread of culinary delights will be performances of soulful yet energizing Sufi music performed by the best emerging, young talent from across India. Expect a mix of traditional Sufi and folk music with the likes of Nizami Brothers, Bally Sagoo, Copy Cats, Tritha and Dilli ki Billi Collective featuring Fouzia Dastango (Urdu storyteller), Parvati Tampi (improvised dancer), Reetu Jain (Kathak Dancer), Sergio Dinarte (Bass & Vox Effects), Ritika Singh (Rap, Vocals, Theatre) Madhusudan Baul (Baul Geet, Ananda Lahiri), Kartikey Vashisht (Flute & Wind Instruments) and Mohit Lal (Tabla & Percussions), Trippy Sama and many more.

Padmashri Awardee, Dadi Pudumjee’s The Ishara Puppet Theatre Trust will create special performances based on the theme of the festival.

Shopping - Adding even more texture to the festival will be a vast array of curated flea shops that will bring to life the spirit of Meena Bazaar, with many traditional attractions on offer, with ethnic designs being the focus, as well as some that will be especially there for the ladies visiting the festival, such as specialty hennas, ittars, authentic aromatic spices and the choicest bangles.

Dates : 1- 3 Dec. 2017
Venue : The Terrace, Ambience Mall, Vasant Kunj
address: Ambience Mall, Vasant Kunj, 2 Nelson Mandela Road, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi, India

description:
The Confectionery and Cake Decorating Diploma is one of the most in-depth programmes offered at CCDS. Blend your love for art and design with your passion for baking and creating high-quality pastries in this comprehensive programme, which will enhance your skills and fully prepare you for a career in the culinary industry.

As part of the Diploma programme, students will study theories of classic pastry and cake design, and explore current trends and modern practices emerging within the industry. Students will work in our state-of-the-art classrooms, learning how to use high-quality ingredients and materials to produce superior artisanal products that are both aesthetic and pleasing to the palate. Taught by industry professionals, each student will receive an educational experience unlike any of its kind, utilizing instructor demos, hands-on practical labs, and team tasks.

The Diploma covers Baking of not just cakes, but most confectionery too - tarts, pies, cheesecakes, cookies and breads! In addition, the students work practically with almost all icings - whipped cream, ganache, royal icing, fondant, gumpaste. Using these all latest cake decorating techniques are taught after developing strong foundational skills. Further, the course also includes a session on chocolates, science of baking, administration of a bakery, marketing and costing of products

At CCDS we are devoted to student success and are continually striving for excellence. We encourage individual creativity in a stimulating and supportive environment. Let us help you turn your dream into an exciting new career when you enroll in our most successful programme!

description:
SYNOPSIS 
Teachers are trained to be Teachers but Principals are not trained to be Principals. This has been the core reason of most of the schools in India that they despite having excellent infrastructure and all sought after amenities, are still waiting for an Educational Leader who can take them to the peak of progress they are worthy of. We at AKS, have structured an up-skilling program for School Principals to Educate & Train them on all the Job Related Tasks they are supposed to carry out with perfection so that they can do justice to all the stake holders of school education i.e. Students, Parents, 
Teachers, Management & Society on the whole.

Keeping in view the core skills of the principal as a head of the school including all his day to day fares, we have designed unique 3 – DAY NATIONAL RESIDENTIAL WORKSHOP to be held at New Delhi to empower him/her as performance oriented professional at par with global standards. We have covered A to Z of the responsibilities of a Principal Recommended by CBSE making it even more comprehensive as per the needs of international schools. Those who wish to Excel as a Principal, want to experience full professional satisfaction, interested in bringing out their own 100% POTENTIAL, Enjoy successful & fulfilling life of an Educational Leader; MUST NOT lose this ONCE IN LIFE-TIME OPPORTUNITY. Covered more than 1200 principals in earlier 26 batches at various locations PAN INDIA. GO FOR IT before anyone else occupies your seat, we have LIMITED SPACES!

And MIND it, it is not a Remedial Workshop, it is an ENRICHMENT PROGRAMME.

PROGRAM DETAILS

EVENT DATES: 01 – 03 DEC. '17 
LAST DATE OF REGN.: 16TH OCT. '17 
VENUE: THE OCEAN PEARL RETREAT, SOUTH DELHI

AREAS TO BE COVERED 
1. Human Resources – Recruitment Process, Staff Welfare, EPF/PF, Termination & Exit Formalities. 
2. Interviewing Skills: Art of Asking Questioning. 
3. Financial Management, Budgeting & Monitoring. 
4. Academic Leadership & Administration. 
5. Team Building & Collaborative Management. 
6. Fundamental Counselling Skills: Parents & Students. 
7. Mentoring Skills: Teacher & Students. 
8. First Impressions: Power Dressing, Professional Etiquette, Dining Etiquette & Body Language. 
9. Branding & Marketing Strategies for Increasing Students’ Strength. 
10. Documentation & Record Keeping. 
11. Problem Solving & Conflict Resolution Skills. 
12. Decision Making Skills. 
13. Time-management & Planning Skills. 
14. Use of ICT as a Major Support; Free E-Resources. 
15. Safety, Emergency & Transport Management. 
16. Relationship Building – Dealing with Students, Parents, Teachers, Management & Media. 
17. Legal Procedures: Legal Notices Served to School. 
18. Conducting Effective Meetings. 
19. Professional Communication: Letter & Email Drafting, Email, SMS & WhatsApp Etiquettes. 
20. Accreditation, Quality Assurance, Policies, Procedures, SOP’s, Handbooks & Manuals for a Quality School.

WHO WILL TRAIN 
Well Stuffed MASTERMINDS OF EDUCATION INDUSTRY including highly experienced Principals of well-known schools of the country. Experts from various fields furnishing their expertise from HR, LAW, IT & Finance for transforming you from being merely a PRINCIPAL to a happening CEO of the school. A MUST NOT MISS OPPORTUNITY to learn from GURUS of Education Industry, set to make YOU MOST SOUGHT-AFTER PRINCIPAL.

WHO SHOULD ATTEND 
* Working Principals, New Principals 
* Aspiring Principals, Vice Principals, 
* Headmasters/mistresses 
* Directors, Administrators, Managers 
* Exp. Coordinators, HOD’s, PGT’s, TGT's

COMMITMENT 
We commit to hold your hand through your journey of heading your school towards the peak of QUALITY BENCH-MARKING & making a NEXT GEN SCHOOL. We ASSURE your LIFE-LONG MENTORING to provide SOLUTIONS TO ANY PROBLEMS faced by you while running the school.

description: Rajasthan Banjara trip- New year special- 23rd Dec to 1st Jan 2018****Please note: The dates of this trip are 23rd Dec to 1st Jan and you need to apply for only 4 leaves to join us on this trip****Banjaras originated centuries ago in the Jodhpur and Jaisalmer desert areas of Rajasthan. These are gypsies who wander from one place to another, leading a life on their own terms and conditions. This New year’s 2018 trip is about Banjaras. We will be the nomads, travelling from one destination to another, experiencing the rustic life, visiting centuries old forts, meeting other travellers. We will sing and dance around the bonfire, come up close and personal with original Banjara tribe, ride camels, sleep under the stars, in the camps, on desert, havelis, huts and backpackers hostels and hotels.This trip is not about luxury or comfort but it’s a unique experience. A journey full of adventure, fun and wilderness.Start & End Location: Jaipur- Hotel Maya NiwasTravel Style: YOLODuration: 9 Nights / 10 DaysDates: 23rd Dec 2017 to 01st Jan 2018Group Size: 4 to 15Age Criteria: 18 - 45Price: 24500/- (Excluding Train/Flight costs)For more information: Email: funtrips | roamingclan ! com Call us at: +91 7073276500, +91 9820762026, +91 7073526520, +91 9731587004Whatsapp: +91 7073276500, +91 9820762026To Book:  http://roamingclan.com/rajasthanCheck into our Facebook event page:  https://www.facebook.com/events/135123547209564/Included:Shared AccommodationsLocal transportationAll Breakfasts4 Dinners + 2 Evening SnacksCamel Safari (Jaisalmer)Village and Rustic life experienceHuts, camps, desert, backpackers hostels, hotels, havelis stayVisit to haunted villagesCamping in sand dunesWild desert safariUnlimited FunExcludedFlights or other transportation to/from JaipurAirport/Train station pick-up and dropMeals not mentionedMonument Entrance FeesZip lining costAnything not mentioned in inclusionsBrief ItineraryDay 1: Jaipur - Explore the pink cityDay 2: Ajmer & Pushkar - Ajmer Sharif Dargah, Bhrama Temple and relax by the Holy lake of PushkarDay 3: Jodhpur - Welcome to the Blue CityDay 4: Jodhpur - Zipline through the Mehangarh fort in Jodhpur, Umed Bhavan palaceDay 5: Jaisalmer - Stay in village huts,  chill with gypsies, Eat finger licking daal bati churma (Rajasthan authentic food)Day 6:  Desert Safari - Kuldhara haunted village, Khaba fort, watch sunset on Camel safari, bonfire and camping in sand dunes, sleep under the starsDay 7: Jaisalmer city visit - Golden fort, Patwon ki Haveli, 12th century Jain temples, Gadisar talab adventure boating Day 8: Kuchaman- Stay in a Haveli, bonfire, music, games and some #roamertimeDay 9: Jaipur -  Amer fort, Nahar Garh Fort, New year’s party at the hostel rooftopDay 10: Until we meet again!!
