description:
Kartikeya Srivastava Trio feat. Shirish Malhotra

Shirish Malhotra merges his sounds with the Kartikeya Srivastava Trio, an experimental groove collaboration featuring Pranai Gurung on guitar, Sonic Shori on bass and Kartikeya Srivastava on drums. The group enjoys exploring creative ideas within original groove music and to reinterpret some of their favourite tunes with a modern aesthetic.

Shirish Malhotra - saxophone/flute
Pranai Gurung - Guitar
Sonic Shori - Bass
Kartikeya Srivastava - Drums

Shirish Malhotra
 
Multi-instrumentalist Shirish Malhotra is a performer, recording artist and teacher. Originally from Mumbai, Shirish’s musical experience has led him to explore a wide and eclectic range of musical styles, from western classical to jazz and African and Latin-American folk traditions. He has performed with some of India’s most respected musicians- Sanjay Divecha, Karan Joseph, Louiz Banks, Loy Mendonsa, Ustad Fazal Qureishi, etc. After a long time working as a session musician in Mumbai, he has spent the last two years studying the saxophone and flute at Trinity Laban Conservatoire in London, where he has been a member of Trinity's Contemporary Jazz Ensemble and the Trinity Alumni Big Band. Shirish counts Claude Debussy, Wayne Shorter, Milton Nascimento and Kenny Wheeler as some of his greatest inspirations, and is always listening out for new (and old!) musical influences. 

Kartikeya Srivastava

Kartikeya Srivastava is a drummer, improviser and composer from Lucknow, India. His current interests involve exploring musical improvisation and folk musics from around the world in an attempt to develop a creative musical language that is personal and representative of his experience as a human. In New Delhi, Kartikeya leads and co-leads several projects including Samadhi and Aman Kartikeya Pranai alongside an upcoming guitar quartet. 

Pranai Gurung

Pranai Gurung, one of the finest guitarists in Delhi, has been writing and collaborating with various musicians for over 15 years. His past musical collaborations include DRIFT The Trio, Silk Route, Bipul Chettri, J Hola, The Crossover Jazz Collective, BollyJazz and international artists such as like German saxophonist Rainer Pusch, Gianni Denitto and French singer Raphaelle Brochet. Pranai maintains a busy performance schedule which includes international tours to top music venues in Australia, Hong kong, London, Dubai, Nepal and India.

Sonic Shori 

Sonic Shori is a professional bassist from the city of New Delhi. He is a student of Grammy-nominated Greek-American musician Panagiotis Andreou. His playing combines complexity with cohesion, playing melodies with dexterity, musicality and tenacity. Over the last few years, Sonic has collaborated with several bands in Delhi and across India, such as Kaash, Antariksh, Trizya, and Adil and Vasundhara.
event_name: Depot48 Presents Kartikeya Srivastava Trio ft. Shirish Malhotra
address: Depot48, N 3, 2nd Floor, Greater Kailash 1, N block market, New Delhi, India

description:
KRUNK in Association with Jack Daniel's Tennessee Whiskey & Vh1 India Presents: BASS CAMP Festival 2017 - Delhi

VENUE: Auro Kitchen & Bar
DATE: THURSDAY, 30th Nov 2017
TIME: 9 PM on wards
Line Up: Om Unit, Kutmah, EZ Riser B2B Tarqeeb & Boxout Sound System
Tickets:  http://bit.ly/BassCamp17-Delhi (EARLY BIRDS)

India’s only festival dedicated to bass-heavy sounds, Krunk’s Bass Camp Festival 2017 is back with a 10-city festival in association with Jack Daniel's Tennessee Whiskey & Vh1 India.

Media Partners: Wild City, Loudest.in, Score It Magazine & Rock Street Journal

--------------------------------------
About BASS CAMP Festival
--------------------------------------

Founded in Feb 2010, Bass Camp is India’s first and only bass heavy electronic music festival, promoting cutting edge electronic music like drum n bass, dubstep, glitch hop, drumstep and more.

Bass Camp Festival is a KRUNK Property. You can find out more about KRUNK here: www.krunklive.com. KRUNK has pioneered the bass music movement in India for the last 7 years.

--------------------
About Om Unit
--------------------
As a producer and DJ, Om Unit (Jim Coles) has been a significant and pioneering presence in various dance music circles for the past five years. Following a formative decade in the global hip-hop underground, Coles took the name Om Unit in the late 2000s and began to travel across genres and scenes in search of sonic tropes to cross-breed and re-imagine. In the early 2010s, he came to pioneer the stylistic and rhythmic links between jungle and footwork via a series of acclaimed edits that brought him to the attention of the drum & bass scene. This personal approach has earned Coles praise as a refreshing voice in dance music from both peers and the media. His debut album was, 2013’s Threads, and he's worked with legendary drum & bass outfit Metalheadz, Machinedrum, Grammy-winning producer Om’Mas Keith, Plastician’s Terrorhythm, Sam Binga and more. In 2011, Coles set up a label, Cosmic Bridge Records, through which he has exercised an A&R sensibility that has created an exciting independent home for likeminded artists. Coles is also a sought after DJ, with over 300 appearances in clubs and festivals in more than 30 countries he has made the equivalent of over a dozen trips round the globe and counting. And in line with his desire to imagine new potentials for dance music has appeared on varied bills from the Montreux Jazz Festival to Bass Coast, Outlook to Mysteryland.

----------------------
About KUTMAH
----------------------
A mercurial creative, whether you’re talking art or music. As a DJ/curator, he has tirelessly searched for and championed new underground talent from across the globe. His passion, hunger and most importantly, his incredible ear for new music have made him Flying Lotus’ go-to warm-up DJ and also earned him the honour of compiling an album - “Kutmah presents Worldwide Family Vol.2” - for Gilles Peterson’s Brownswood Recordings in 2012. It brought to the fore Kutmah’s gift for A&R, cemented when he founded his own label IZWID in 2013. In August 2017, he released his debut album “The Revenge Of Black Belly Button!” (or TROBBB!), featuring an incredible cast of guests - Gonjasufi, Jonwayne, Natureboy Flako, Ta’Raach, Jeremiah Jae, Zeroh, Zackey Force Funk, N8NOFACE, Sach, Akello G Light and DJ Chris P Cuts - spanning experimental meditative, Zennist loops; crackly oddball beats and abstract raps; as far as outright punk/noise and even folk/blues.
event_name: Bass Camp Festival '17, New Delhi | Om Unit & Kutmah
address: Auro Kitchen & Bar, Aurbindo Market, Hauz Khas, New Delhi, India

description:
The Piano Man and Lock & Key present GIANTS OF JAZZ- DELHI
--------------------------------
Featured artist for the evening : 
THE SHONAI COLLECTIVE (ft. Rie Ona & Fabio Carlucci)
--------------------------------
The Shonai Collective is basically a trio based out of Kolkata. The band members are Premjit, Aakash and Shonai. The sound can be best described as a mix of funk, traditional jazz, blues and pop. They mostly perform their own compositions along with a few popular jazz tunes rearranged in their unique style.

 The journey of the collective began when they recorded two of their own compositions for a compilation album of improvised music in late 2016. This trio ties up with various artists and performs all over the country.  

This time Rie Ona and Fabio Carlucci, two beautiful horn players have collaborated with this collective. 

----------------
The Collective : 
----------------

- Drums - PREMJIT started his career learning Tabla. Over the years he had dabbled in various styles of music. He is known for his versatility. He is a music educator at Calcutta School of Music. Premjit is endorsed by Vic Firth, Sonor and Remo.  


- Bass - AAKASH, the youngest of the three, forms the backbone of the band. He possesses an effortless groove and is adept in various styles of music.  


- Piano/Keyboards - SHONAI, the trio is his brain child. He is a Contemporary Jazz Pianist. His experiences and knowledge in various genres of music is reflected in his compositions and arrangements. Besides working as a session’s musician, he is part of the Piano faculty at the Calcutta School of Music. 

----------------
About Rie Ona :
----------------

- Alto saxophone, tenor saxophone, clarinet – RIE ONA started taking Piano lessons in early childhood. Since then her life has been with music learning.  She played Clarinet in junior high school ensemble team and a brass band, Guitar at college folk song study club, then Saxophone in Jazz Big Band in Jakarta and Tokyo.  

Shifting to India in 2008, she has been actively collaborating with musicians and has had opportunities to play at music festivals throughout India with several bands. She has been playing as a soloist for various shows such as Cosmopolitan fashion show, designer brand launch, etc. 

----------------------
About Fabio Carlucci :
----------------------

- Trumpet - FABIO CARLUCCI, classical trumpeter, completed his musical studies in "Civic Music School" and in “Conservatorio G. Verdi”, both in Milan, and joined a few symphonic orchestras, among which are the Hans Swarowsky Symphonic Orchestra and the "UCSC" Symphonic Orchestra where he played as first trumpet for 5 years.

He worked with "Piccolo Teatro" in Milan playing incidental music and with various brass bands in north Italy. In 2006 he moved to Delhi, taking a break from his classical musical activity, and recently started collaborationswith a few artists in the Pop/Jazz scene here bringing his classical background into these new horizons.
event_name: Giants of Jazz - Delhi : The Shonai Collective ft. Rie & Fabio
address: The Piano Man Jazz Club, 7/22, Ground Floor, B-6, Safdarjung Enclave Market, New Delhi, India

description:
Open Circle of Women
30th November, Thursday | 7 pm till 9 pm

No fixed charge | All contributions voluntary

This full moon, we invite women of all ages to join us, share their experiences and heal around the female energy.

All the participants will sit in a circle to remember who they are and learn from other women. The session will include a combination of movement, music, reading and praying.

While sitting in a circle, you will visualize the power of the mothers, daughters, sisters, wives, grandmothers, lovers and friends. You will connect with the cycles of nature and the moon to remember our inner wisdom.

Listen to your body, your emotions, intuitions...respect your changing needs and desires according to the different archetypes you have inside.

About Nataly Salazar

Nataly Salazar is an Oida dance therapist from Colombia. She is trained in Movement Therapy, Yoga, Zumba and Ayurveda. She has worked with differently-abled children and elderly people for the last 11 years. She also works with expectant mothers to help them in the physical and emotional preparation towards motherhood. Nataly is also a trained Odissi Dancer.

TIRTHAN VALLEY
ITINERARY | Chapter 1.0

For Bookings and Enquiries, Contact at 8851116714

Cost: ₹6499 per head

30 November:
We leave from Delhi at 7:00 PM.

1 December:
After reaching Jibhi, visit waterfall with half an hour jungle walk.
After returning, day free for leisure activites at your own.
Dinner at hostel.

2 December:
After having your breakfast, we go to jalori pass for sight seeing of jalori view.
360 view of himalayas.
Then we trek to serolsar lake which is around 5-6 km trek.
Return back to hostel in evening and have your dinner.

3 December:
After Breakfast, we checkout and visit chaini fort.
Then start our journey back to Delhi.

We reach Delhi around 6:00 AM.

description:
Janakpuri Super Speciality Hospital (Designated Autonomous Post Graduate Institute ),Ministry of Health and Family Welfare,Government of NCT of Delhi , and kalpvraksha ngo are inviting participants  from public  to attend an Emergency  Management training workshop  to learn simple skills which could make all the difference if an emergency happened in front of them.


The training workshop , at the Janakpuri Superspeciality Hospital  will be conducted for  4 hours duration  and will give participants the knowledge and confidence to become lifesavers if a victim ,colleague, friend or family member falls ill or is injured, and they are called upon to help.

The workshop covers common first aid scenarios including what to do if someone is choking, unconscious or bleeding, and how to treat a burn or fracture. It will also help participants spot the warning signs of a heart attack or stroke, and give them the tools to step in and act.

The workshop is free to all the participants .Participants will get Trained Lifesaver certificate and registry number from the Janakpuri superspeciality hospital , Ministry of Health and Family welfare ,Government of NCT of Delhi.

The name ,age, and designation of the participants should be mailed  by 12 th July 2017 at Janakpurissh ! delhi | gov ! in. and cc to drnitinshakyamamc | gmail ! com , kalpvrakshango | gmail ! com .For any assistance contact mob Dr.Nitin shakya  at 9891666630 or Ms.Madhu Sobti at 011-25552024

These workshops will be regularly conducted on weekly basis and information for next schedule can be received by contacting above mentioned email and phone numbers .

Who is it for?
General public ,Police officers ,Reporters ,school/college teachers ,Disaster management etc .
This one day workshop is for anyone who wants to learn  emergency mangment and first aid . 

It covers a range of life-saving skills such as unresponsiveness, heart attack, choking and seizures.

The workshop attracts people looking to learn emergency managment and first aid for many different reasons, such as:

-wanting to be able to help their family, friends or neighbours
-preparing for university or working abroad during a gap year
-being involved with local community groups or sports clubs
-having experienced a real life emergency.
If you need first emegency/aid training as a requirement of your job, this workshop is a must for you.
address: Janakpuri Superspeciality Hospital, janakpuri superspeciality hospital C2b JANAKPURI, New Delhi, India

description:
4 Day Intensive Healing Retreat
Learn to Cure Any Ailment Through Psychoneurobics In Rishikesh
30 November - 3 December, 2017

Rishikesh, situated at the foothills of the Himalayas, is often referred to as the "Yoga Capital Of The World". The exquisite setting of the fast-flowing Ganges, surrounded by forested hills, is conducive to meditation and mind expansion. In the evening, an almost surreal breeze blows down the valley, setting temple bells ringing as sadhus, pilgrims and tourists prepare for the nightly Ganga Aarti.

The Ganga is the most holy river in the world. When you walk along her banks, it is easy to see why this river is so revered. Surrounded by mountains, it provides the perfect place to experience deeper detoxification and rejuvenation of the body and the mind. Add to it the classes on Psychoneurobics, meditation, many rejuvenating activities, pure satvik delicacies, multiple workshops for all age groups and you have an exhilarating experience.

Some of the major benefits of this self healing retreat:

1. In this Retreat Dr. Chandrashekhar will teach you the hands on technique of Psychoneurobics through which, you can heal various ailments like Diabetes, Blood Pressure, Arthritis, Depression, Anxiety, Stress and several other dieseases/ailments

2. PsychoNeurobicspa: Each day you quieten your mind and with PsychoNeurobicspa - a powerful meditation technique for restoring body-mind balance.

3. SIGFA Healing: Learn the secrets of achieving holistic health through the SIGFA healing technique developed by Dr. B.K. Chandrashekhar, to make you receptive to the flow of positive energy.

4. Mind & Anger Management: The recreational activities and practical spiritual discourse by Dr. B.K. Chandrashekhar help in releasing emotional toxins in the form of unprocessed anger, hurt or disappointment.

5. Pure satvik diet: One can enjoy delicious, healthy and pure satvik diet.

6. Sleep Management With Yoga Nidra: Get hands-on training in Yoga Nidra, a form of Yogic Meditation for ultimate relaxation of the body and mind.

7. Relationship Management: Cultivate loving relationships with fellow visitors and family members.

description:
The word "Qawwali" is derived from the Arabic word "Qaol" which means "axiom" or "dictum". Qawwali is a form of Sufi devotional music popular in the Indian subcontinent. It is a vibrant musical tradition that stretches back more than 750 years. The roots of Qawwali can be traced back from 8th century in Persia (today's Iran and Afghanistan). During the first major migration from Persia, in the 11th century, the musical tradition of Sema migrated to the Indian subcontinent, Turkey and Uzbekistan.

Amir Khusro Dehelvi of the Chisti order of Sufis is credited with fusing the Persian and South Asian musical traditions to create Qawwali as we know it today in the late 13th century in India (Hindustani classical music is also attributed to him). Hazarat Amir Khusro trained 12 (twelve) children for performing qawwalies ,these children are known as "Qawwal Bachche" and the families associated with these Qawwal Bachche are known as "Qawwal Bachchon Ka Gharana" (The house hold of Qawwal Bachche).

Mian Samad Bin Ibrahim was the first pupil of Hazrat Ameer Khusro and the Group Leader of the team, formed by Hazrat Ameer Khusro called "Qawwal Bachoon Ka Gharana".

Ustad Tan Ras Khan Sahab (founder of Delhi Gharana) who was a teacher of the last Mughal Emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar , is direct descendant of Amir Khusro’s principal disciple Mian Samad Bin Ibrahim.

Nizami Khusro Brothers ​are​ the most senior amongst the descendents (4th Generation) of Tan Ras Khan Sahib belongs to this well known Qawwal Bachchon Ka Gharana as well as "Delhi Gharana". His family has been singing Qawwalis for past eight centuries. Khusro's tradition has passed unbroken across seven centuries and thirty generations. 'Nizami Khusro Brothers ', current head of the Qawwal Bachche as well as Delhi Gharana, still sings in Delhi.
Nizami Khusro Brothers  is well versed and can perform in several languages such as Ar​a​bic, Persian, Hindi, Urdu, etc. Ustad Meraj Nizami has total mastery over various genres of classical music, such as Dhrupad, Khayal, Tarana, Thumri and Dadra, which he blends beautifully during his performances of Qawwali.

Nizami Khusro Brothers started ​their​ training in classical music at a​ very​ tender age under the rigorous and critical tutelage of ​their​ late father, Ustad Yaqub Ali Khan (Piarey Khan Sahib). Regula Burckhardt Qureshi wrote a book about sufi music "Sufi Music of India and Pakistan" ​ the s​ound, context and meaning in Qawwali. Although she had number of informants , Qureshi dedicates much of her presentation to the one ​m​usician : Nizami Khusro Brothers .

Ustad Meraj Ahmed Nizami sings the superb poetry of Sultan Quli Qtub Shah (d.1543 A.D.) , Roshnara begum (1617-1671) the daughter of Mughal Emperor Shahjahan . If any one want to listen true or pure form of qawwaali The Khusro Nizami Brothers headed by renowed qawwal Nizami Khusro Brothers is the right group . ​I​f any one want to know the soul of sufi music : Nizami Khusro Brothers the only name that can be trusted. If any one want to explor​e​ real Indian Sub Continant Culture or Ganga Jamuna Tahzeeb the beautiful voice of Ustad Nizami and his party is the only guide. If you want to listen and know the thoughts and kalaam of Maulana Jalaluddin Rumi , Hazrat Shams Tabrezi, Hazrat Amir Khusro , Shekh Sadi , Kabir, Meera, Surdaas, Mirza Ghalib, Meer Taqi meer, .......and many many more only Nizami Khusro Brothers can​ be the true guide........

description:
----------------
Cinco Dourados :
----------------

Cinco Dourados is a collaboration between five musicians that share a love for Brazilian songwriting and Latin-flavoured grooves. It comprises Sanjeeta Bhattacharya on vocals, Shirish Malhotra on saxophone/flute, Adhir Ghosh on guitar, Sonic Shorey on bass and Siddharth Jain on drums. 

The set will feature many lesser known but brilliant compositions by Toquinho, Caetano Veloso, Milton Nascimento, Sergio Mendes and more. 

------------------
About the Musicians : 
------------------

Shirish Malhotra : Saxophone 
 
Multi-instrumentalist Shirish Malhotra is a performer, recording artist and teacher. A die hard Mumbaikar, Shirish’s musical experience has led him to explore a wide and eclectic range of musical styles, from western classical to jazz and African and Latin-American folk traditions. He has performed with some of India’s most respected musicians- Sanjay Divecha, Karan Joseph, Louiz Banks, Loy Mendonsa, Ustad Fazal Qureishi, etc. as well as several orchestras and several scholarship projects in the US, China, Austria and Scotland. After a long time working as a session musician, he has spent the last two years studying the saxophone and flute at Trinity Laban Conservatoire in London, where he has been a member of Trinity's Contemporary Jazz Ensemble and the Trinity Alumni Big Band.  

Sanjeeta Bhattacharya : Voice 
 
Sanjeeta recently graduated from the prestigious Berklee College of Music, Boston. She began her musical journey with Hindustani Classical music for 8 years, simultaneously exploring the world of jazz, RnB, soul, bossa nova and flamenco. She won numerous state and national level inter school western music competitions as a solo performer. She has performed at various venues including Boston Symphony Hall alongside A.R. Rahman, Berklee Performance Center, Un Lago de Conciertos, Magnetic Fields Festival and Bengaluru Ganesh Utsava. Lately she has been working on her Balkan folk choral project, Voicestra and has been playing with various acts in the country as a session artist.

Adhir Ghosh : Guitar

Adhir Ghosh is a Delhi-based guitarist, composer and music teacher. He plays full-time with two bands - Five8 (Funk/Rock) and Kitchensink (Jazz/R&B); is one-half of a guitar-and-voice duo project with vocalist Smiti Malik playing Jazz and Blues standards, and has also performed as a session-artist with Artistes Unlimited, The Yellow Brick Project, Vasundhara Vee, Sentirenla Lucia, Manta Sidhu, Classic Collective and others, which has gained him the reputation of being one of the first-call guitarists in the city. He studied Contemporary Music at Swarnabhoomi Academy of Music (Chennai, India), where he was awarded the General Excellence Scholarship for pursuing a diploma in performance.  

Sonic Shori : Bass 

Sonic Shori is a professional bassist from the city of New Delhi. He is a student of Grammy-nominated Greek-American musician Panagiotis Andreou. His playing combines complexity with cohesion, playing melodies with dexterity, musicality and tenacity. Over the last few years, Sonic has collaborated with several bands in Delhi and across India, such as Kaash, Antariksh, Trizya, and Adil and Vasundhara.    

Siddharth Jain : Drums 
 
Born and brought up in New Delhi, Siddharth Jain has had an interest in Drums from a very early age. He began a serious study of Drums at the age of 18 and started focusing on the language of drumming and the various concepts of Rhythm. He went to study at the prestigious Swarnabhoomi Academy of Music, Chennai.  Besides playing as a Session Player he continues to play and record with various Bands and Artists like Kitchensink, The December Quartet, Mrs. Ippi, Vasundhara etc., covering different styles like Funk, Rock, Jazz, R&B, Pop etc.

description:
DOC FILM. No Problem! - Six Months with the Barefoot Grandmamas (English/52mins)
Director- Yasmin Kidwai 
Synopsis-This documentary is about the rural solar electrification project run by the Barefoot College in the village of Tilonia in Rajasthan. Here numerous illiterate rural women from all over the world, particularly Africa, are being trained as solar engineers. The film follows the story of the 2011 batch of African women as they live together in Tilonia, leaving their countries for the first time. The women live and learn together for six months without knowing each other's languages, but share a unifying goal - to become solar engineers and bring electricity to their villages. Through the stories of these women, a fascinating tale of sustainability, demystification of technology, and social inclusion unfolds.
event_name: Film Screening: No Problem! - Six Months with the Barefoot Grand
address: India Habitat Centre, India Habitat Center, Lodhi Road, New Delhi, India

description: Julio Galvez aka “The Whooligan” is the Director of Worldwide Bookings and Partnerships for Soulection. The Whooligan is also a DJ with over 10+ years of performance experience. A global citizen – with previous residencies in San Francisco and Los Angeles, now currently residing in Brooklyn, New York – this seasoned  artist, lover of music and event curator brings a unique perspective to the label through his passion, experience and inherent positivity.Since joining Soulection in the summer of 2013, Julio has executed and managed 15+ domestic and international tours, as well as countless one-off events, reaching over 100+ countries, managing bookings for over 15+ artists and DJ's. Julio’s relentless work ethic, insatiable curiosity for travel and undeniable love of bringing people together has added not only to the team’s increasing growth and visibility, but more importantly, fostered a community in celebration of progressive Soul music - The Sound Of Tomorrow™ (TSOT).  As a trusted source of insight and ground breaking music for venues, clothing brands, music platforms, and businesses across the globe, Julio’s zest for life, ability to identify new music and creative culture first, has led him to collaborations with brands including MTV, VICE, Def Jam, Brooklyn Circus, Daily Paper, PUMA and more. As a multifaceted and genre-bending DJ, he has also shared the stage with Mac Miller, DJ Jazzy Jeff, DJ Craze, J. Rocc, Rick Ross, Goldlink and more, as well as every member on the Soulection roster. Whether blending two records in a unique fashion or working closely to help develop next level music creators, the common thread is his ability to see beauty in all things.  DJ MoCityBorn in Baghdad, raised in New Delhi, and now based in Dubai, Mohammed Uraibi Abood (aka DJ MoCity) is a music entrepreneur and DJ with a passion for authentic music from all around the world.His dedication to his vision and unmatched effort towards realising it have made him a key figure in the development of the independent music scene in India and Dubai.Upon moving to Dubai in 2014, Mohammed established ‘Motellacast’, a podcast that features forward-thinking music that was created due to a lack of alternative music on the local radio. His efforts as a radio host were validated when he was invited for a guest spot on NTS-Radio London. He then co-founded ‘The 264 Cru’ a record label and diverse collective of DJs, artists and creative individuals whose shared goal is to help Dubai’s nascent art and music scene find it’s footing.Mohammed’s musical identity is derived from his own personal heritage and multicultural experiences living all around the world.
address: Summer house cafe, New Delhi, India

What is a  template- an effective, measurable, sustainable and scalable solution towards many problems women face in India. It is, ‘No Problem!’- a film, which captures the inspiring story of women who embark on such a journey, becoming flag bearers of change and pioneers in their community.  The journey of these women tells a much bigger tale of sustainability, demystification of technology, and social inclusion. 

You are invited to join us for the screening of No Problem- Six Months with Barefoot Grandmama- the journey of a group of African women who travel to Barefoot College, in Tilonia Rajasthan to participate in an exceptional and empowering programme.

description:
#boxoutwednesdays' final November date sees international guest The Whooligan along with boxout.fm main man DJ MoCity pair up for a night of the freshest beats and illest vibes.

Based in Brooklyn with over 15 years of dj experience, The Whooligan is a main-stay of the Soulection label, collective and family. He wears many hats including head of bookings, event curator and seasoned artist and has shared the stage with De La Soul, DJ Jazzy Jeff, Mac Mliller and more. His musically diverse and open approach sees him moving effortlessly from smooth r'n'b across genres. We're stoked to have him back in India and playing for our mid-week dance party. 

DJ MoCity is the founding and driving force behind everything boxout.fm as well as host of the award-winning and acclaimed Motellacast show. He takes a short hiatus from making things run smoothly behind the scenes to making sure the dance-floor is getting what it needs. His sets are a forward-thinking combination of established artists and upcoming talents.

The only weekly residency in the country for underground sounds and culture, Budweiser x #boxoutwednesdays is more than just a night, it is an on-going movement that helps build and serve a community that remains neglected by the mainstream.

Past Life Regression - Individual Sessions

Find answers to life's unresolved questions and repetitive patterns. Heal unexplained, irrational fears or phobias, self-beliefs or habits, or recurring ailments or those with no medical cure or reason.

Past Life Regression Therapy (PLRT) is much like a deep guided meditation, wherein you relax and allow your consciousness to access the memories from the subconscious mind, which holds the answers to life questions. Once we release the residual energy and unhealthy beliefs from those lifetimes, we feel lighter here, in this lifetime.

It can be an excellent tool for self-discovery, to clarify life-purpose, relationship conflicts, career goals etc. Know the growth trajectory your soul is on across lifetimes. The wisdom you gain from those lifetimes can be then incorporated into your present choices. Come, experience it for yourself.

Age Regression can help in healing the traumas, triggers and unhealthy belief systems of this life time. Emotional healing can help you come out of the bad memories of the past an live a happy life.

Healing session is guided and carefully monitored by the facilitator where you can connect with your soul, aura and chakras, So that the negative energies and foreign bodies can be cleansed and cleared.

You may be asked to get information about your pre-natal and birthing history, early childhood, and any other traumas or important events in life. Please have only a light meal before session and be fully rested.

- Healing and understanding ailments and pains.
- Healing relationship conflicts.
- Clearing work or career blocks.

- Freedom from Vows and Curses.

ENERGY HEALING for:

FUTURE PROGRESSION for Future clarity

description:
As the country progresses towards the goals of an Urban India the dynamics of economic growth, urbanisation, quality of life and environmental conservation have become more and more enmeshed. 

Sustainability becomes even more difficult as cities grow bigger and bigger over time and more and more difficult to run and manage. While policies and programs on urbanisation have gained strength in the last decade or so and focus is also shifting to the smaller cities and towns of India, it is important to get back to the basics of who we are planning for. The human angle would need to be deeply re-examined and brought back into the core of the planning debate. While technology solutions and tools would enable us to plan and manage better it would be critical to ensure the cross sectoral integration and the effectiveness of planning. This  talk by Mr. Thapar would look into the overall challenges and the possible options and directions to take.

Click here to register:  http://bit.ly/2mqxXhK
event_name: Challenges of Urbanisation in India - Smart & Healthy Cities
address: University of Chicago Delhi Office, Connaught Place, New Delhi, India

description:
----------
Worry Later :
----------

This jazz formation brings together the most active musicians of the Austrian and European Jazz-scene: WORRY LATER with Oliver Kent (piano), Uli Langthaler (bass), Dusan Novakov (drums), Daniel Nosig (trumpet) and Thomas Kugi (tenor saxophone) unites the best soloists. 

In June 2013 Uli Langthaler and Oliver Kent got the chance to play a regular session opener at the charming little Jazz-Club called `Zwe` in the City center of Vienna. Drummer Dusan Novakov and two of Austria’s best horn players, Thomas Kugi on tenor saxophone and Daniel Nösig on trumpet joined in. The quintet (named after the Thelonius Monk composition Worry Later ) took advantage of the opportunity and was able to develop their music by performing in front of a great audience of jazz enthusiasts and other musicians. 

Club owner Helmut `Zwe´ Rainer states: 

"Musical friendships develop out of a conglomerate collective of musicians. Because of their common notion of Jazz dialectic these gentlemen create a feeling of harmony in the audience. Having played together for years they have found a name that not only has some relevance in Jazz history, but also an appealing message. In countless sessions these five gentlemen have proven, that they do not only measure up, but often exceed our expectations. Look forward to: Jazz, Jazz, Jazz." 

The repertory of this ensemble is mostly compiled by original compositions of themselves, which provide the basis for their outstanding personal statements and unique expressions in contemporary European Jazz music. 

All together, these musicians, present a unique program and impress not only with their soloistic highlights but also with the distinctive sound in this Jazz-formation. 

After long term engagements in all Viennese Jazz clubs, WORRY LATER is one of the most well-rehearsed groups and present themselves as a euphonic ensemble. They have played at jazz festivals throughout Europe as well as at International Jazz Festivals in the USA, Cuba, Israel, China, Vietnam, Thailand, Indonesia, Russia, Mongolia, Mexico, Tunesia, Ukraine, India, Nepal and South-Africa. 

Everybody, who is into Jazz will love this band!
address: The Piano Man Jazz Club, 7/22, Ground Floor, B-6, Safdarjung Enclave Market, New Delhi, India

description:
The Child and the Spells (1925) sounds like a variation on Toy Story, but it was written decades earlier. A young boy, who has always mistreated his toys, pets, even the plants and animals outside the house, finds himself the object of their revenge! 

Written by the French composer, Maurice Ravel, with the libretto by French novelist Sidonie-Gabrielle Colette, the 45-minutes long opera has beautiful music and a very funny collection of characters, including a singing duet of meowing cats, arias for a teacup, a sofa, and even an interpolation of jazz.

Music Director: Jean-Yves Aizic
Stage Director: Patrick Beck
Voice Coach: Jasmin Martorell
Adult Choir Conductor: Nadya Balyan
Child Choir Conductor: Lindsay Boyd

Workshops will also be conducting prior to the shows by the French music experts - Mr. Jasmin Martorell, Mr. Jean Yves Aizic and Ms. Louise Pingeot. These workshops will allow 500 to 700 children to discover French Opera and be initiated to musical & vocal expression.

Passes available at
The Neemrana Shop, Khan Market or The Neemrana Music Foundation Office, Lajpat Nagar2 (very close to metro station)
Information / Reservation: 011 4054 8211 (from November, 13th)

French Embassy in India / Ambassade de France en Inde & @Institutfrancaisindia in the framework of Bonjour India 2017-2018
Neemrana Hotels
Godrej Properties Limited
Furtados Music
Wilderness Films India Ltd.

description:
Queen Mary, University of London is the third largest college of the University of London, with the main based in the east of the city. It is a member of the Russell Group of research universities and has roots dating back to 1785. Queen Mary has a strong international reputation, with over 7,000 of its 20,000 enrolled students coming from over 150 countries.

Queen Mary has the world’s largest academic health science centre, and is well known for medical teaching and research at Barts and the London School of Medicine and Dentistry. The Medical School at Queen Mary includes special departments in cardiology, infectious diseases, surgery and dentistry. The School of Dentistry recently moved into brand new state-of-the-art facilities.

In sync with the month long special exhibition 'Amruta Kalasha' of South Indian paintings focused on Thanjavur, Mysore and Andhra, KNMA Saket brings to you 'Thanjavur Painting Workshop'. Learn to make beautiful Thanjavur paintings from our friendly instructors. Thanjavur paintings are characterised by rich, flat and vivid colors, simple iconic composition, glittering gold foils overlaid on delicate but extensive gesso work and inlay of glass beads and pieces or very rarely precious and semi-precious gems. Essentially serving as devotional icons, the subjects of most paintings are gods, goddesses, and saints.

description:
Dear friends of the IGNCA

We are happy to inform that the IGNCA is organizing major events in the month of November 2017. We take this opportunity to invite you very warmly to 'Lok Gatha Utsav'.

IGNCA in Collaboration with the Deendayal Research Institute (DRI), New Delhi is organizing a festival of cultural heritage of India 'Lok Gatha Utsav' on the Birth Centenary of Rashtrishi Nana Ji Deshmukh at Mati Ghar Lawns, C. V. Mess, Janpath, New Delhi from 28th November to 3rd December 2017.

The focus of the festival is on oral epics, ballads, and legends in performance, arts & crafts traditions of folk and tribal communities of India. Around 500 traditional folk artists from all over the country will be invited to present the rich traditional cultural heritage of India built around their narrative traditions. This festival will offer a rich
variety of traditional crafts, textiles, martial arts, processional theatre, rituals and stage performances. Besides, there will be special arts and crafts workshops for school children to learn from the Artisans. The inaugural performance is the internationally acclaimed 'Manganiyar Seduction' from Rajasthan, choreographed by the famous art director and composer Roysten Abel. Shri Manoj Tiwari, Shri Hans Raj Hans, and Shri Mohit Chauhan will regale the audience with their performances every evening.

We look forward to your participation in this event.

With Warm Regards
Dr. Molly Kaushal
Professor and Head of Department
Janapada Sampada Division
Indira Gandhi National Centre for the Arts
New Delhi
address: Indira Gandhi National Centre for the Arts, 11 Mansingh Road, New Delhi, India

description:
Around 800 million women are expected to enter the global economy over 2012-2022. This third billion –as significant as that of the billion-plus populations of India and China – will play a considerable role in countries around the world. However, data in India and across the world shows that women are significantly under-represented in leadership positions.  

In 2017, India ranked third lowest for the third year consecutively in the leadership roles held by women . Only 17% of senior roles were held by women in India and 41% of the Indian businesses surveyed had no women in leadership roles. 

Even in the not profit sector, which is often perceived as a domain for women, women constituted close to 53% of employees across designations and only 34% in managerial positions . The percentage of women in managerial or higher-ranked positions varied based on which gender heads the NGO. In women-led organizations, 75% of female employees had managerial roles, whereas only 15% of female employees had managerial roles in men-led organizations. Similarly, an international study of 1,000 non-profit organizations showed that only 43% of non-profit organizations had women CEOs, which reduced to 18% in the largest non-profits . 

In this context, a critical question becomes: What can organizations do to ensure that the third billion realizes its potential? This moderated discussion aims to share the experiences of eminent women in leadership positions to provide insights on:
- What were the challenges faced by them as young and mid-career academics, professionals, advocates/ campaigners and how these were navigated?
- What challenges do they face in achieving organizational goals and how are they navigating these?  
- How are they trying to create gender balanced environments?
event_name: Women in Leadership: Challenges and Way Forward
address: India Habitat Centre, Lodhi Road, New Delhi, India

Tara Goswami is an artist, yoga teacher and cook. With over eight years of teaching experience, following her nomadic nature, Tara travels and teaches between Europe, India and Sri Lanka. Through all the three disciplines of art, yoga and food, Tara’s work is based on an enquiery of the self, of walking the road to clarity, of connecting to the subtle. description: Most people think that success is the key to happiness. They try to achieve success by working hard, becoming wealthy, achieving power or getting fame. However, even after they get everything they desire, they still feel miserable.We shall be exploring the hidden secrets of happiness in this workshop and learn the practical methods to achieve happiness along with success in our profession.  Each participant shall get a free signed copy of the book of his choice authored by Dr Awdhesh Singh (up to the value of Rs 295/-)About Dr. Awdhesh SinghDr Awdhesh K Singh is an author, educator, speaker, a former IRS officer and a Top Quora Writer in the world. He holds his B. Tech. from IIT-BHU Varanasi and M. Tech. from IIT Delhi and his PhD from IIITM Gwalior. He is a Founding Member of the spiritual organization ‘The Aatmic Science Foundation’, which was set up in 2006 in Allahabad. He has published more than 500 articles on various topics including scientific interpretation of spirituality and religion, philosophy, happiness, leadership and development of life skills since 2006 on various forums. He had published four books viz. ‘Practising Spiritual Intelligence’, ‘The Secret Red Book of Leadership’, ‘Myths are Real, Reality is a Myth’ and ‘GST Made Simple’. His books had been on the bestseller list of Flipkart and Amazon. He is the SEVENTH MOST followed Writer on Quora.com with more than 1, 80,000 followers. His answers get monthly views of around 4 Million with total views of more than 70 Million. His articles have been published worldwide including ‘Time’, ‘Huffington Post’ and ‘The Independent’.
